Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: erwinandann
Reviews.Content: We always stay here, 4 times a year at least. Good staff, great service and the restaurant there is also very good. Rooms have space and up to date TV's ! Downside ? internet service is bad and costs money, and parking is not cheap either. But anywhere in LA is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, What you Would Expect of a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: FatherOfEight
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Westin at LAX. It is a beautiful hotel with large lobby and equally large rooms. The staff is polite and efficient.The pool is warm and the Grill is good. The beds are great and the pillows are even better. Only complaint is that the bedding is beautiful but the only blanket is the comforter and it is too warm. Take it off and the sheet isn't enough and put it back on and it's hot. Otherwise, it is a good place to stay. It is a little pricey but what isn't these days. They charge $13 - 16 for internet but the self parking is free (I should say included). You can get 45 min of free internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant room, good location, lacking in service, and too little for too much price.”
Reviews.Author: Brendangallier
Reviews.Content: I think this is a beautiful hotel, very close to main thoroughfares and Santa Monica, and of course the airport. No question, it was convenient for me in that respect. But I did not get cleaning service everyday, room service was way overpriced, as was the restaurant - the Daily Grill - though their food was quite good. The reality is that, despite the elegance, I will opt for the Crowne Plaza next time, or spend my money on something deeper in town. Everyone was very nice, but for the money, they could offer far more amenities. And don't expect beautiful views.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: KML1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on 9 April and we were happy with the hotel. Didn't take long to check in / check out, the rooms were nice and the Concierge was really helpful when we were trying to decide what to do (ended up getting the Trolley to Manhatten Beach for a couple of hours). The only negative was there was a thin layer of dust on the furniture in the bedroom but it wasnt anything major.

Reviews.Title: “If your not a premier member, don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: Linda P
Reviews.Content: I fly from Hawaii to various mainland destinations often, usually by red eye. Upon deciding to start doing a day flight with a stop over on the West Coast, decided to stay at the Westin LAX upon my husband's recommendation (of course, he's a premier member!) Arrived at the hotel at 10:30 at night tired and ready to get to bed as I had an 8am flight, stood in line with 10 other people for 20 minutes as premier and platinum Westin members came strolling in the door, through their line and directly to the counter. 3 front desk agents and all were helping only the premier members. Upon questioning the agent when I finally got up to the desk (we practically had a mutiny to get their attention) she said their policy is to always serve Premier/Platinum first. So the rest of us don't count at all? We could have stood their all night if a few of the people in our line didn't start getting quite vocal. In addition, for those of you who choose vegetarian/vegan lifestyle, this hotel has absolutely no vegetarian/vegan options - not even a baked potato! Upon calling room service to ask about vegetarian options, she was quite indifferent and said "there's a green salad". I travel a lot and am willing to be quite flexible in putting together a vegetarian meal with sides, etc, but their room service had absolutely no interest in working with me. Lastly, they gave me a room on near a road and their was quite a bit of road noise all night. Thank goodness for Ambien. Needless, to say. I will never stay their again, and I am quite vocal about these things so I will be spreading the word. It at least rates a 1 for the bed. Great bed. But not enough to get me back to a hotel that doesn't care about adding more Premier members.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Amanda H
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel. All the reviews online were so nice and positive. The lobby is nice and welcoming with access to a gift shop (which I used to buy a tshirt and snacks for the plane), meeting space and the Daily Grille. The front desk gave me my keys and I asked if there complimentary internet with the hotel room. He looks on the computer and says no. I asked are there any complimentary amenities available at the hotel? He said no. My colleague was checking in with a gal next to me and she asked the agent if internet was included in her room and the agent said normally its not but I will push it through.... I went to my room on the 5th floor facing the airport. The room smelled funny and you can hear dogs barking consisently. I called down to the front desk to see if I can get a new room. The nice gentleman on the phone said not to go anywhere he'd be right up with the keys. So, after waiting 10-15 minutes I called down to the desk again. A lady answered this time and I asked if they were bringing up my keys. She said she wasn't sure were the keys were. So I said I would come down and pick them up. Come to find out there is a Kennel outside the hotel right next to the airport. Which explains the barking. On a positive note the Daily Grille is AMAZING. My colleague and I sat at the bar and had dinner. The bartender was entertaining and had us laughing all night. Overall- Okay stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good layover hotel”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed overnight at Westin LAX before an early flight. Pros: -Large room, clean and quiet. -Good shuttle service - didn't have to wait long. -Large comfortable beds. Cons: -Internet is $13 per day. -Decor is a little outdated and is perhaps one of the older properties among the Westin hotels. However it's a perfect layover hotel because of the location and free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Daily Grille is the Highlight”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoDesperado
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 days at the Westin attending an in-house conference. Rooms are very clean and the beds are excellent. But the highlight is the Daily Grille restaurant. Dinner was impressive in both food and service. Katrina was our server and she was simply delightful. The salmon was outstanding and the meatloaf was so good that I want the recipe,Gaspatcho was great and veggies were perfectly cooked. One note...watch out for the caesar salad dressing which is too heavy with anchovie for my taste. We were so happy with Daily Grille that we did not even venture outside the hotel for meals and returned for dinner the next night and breakfast befor departure. Try the delicious hash benedict. The Grille runs like a Swiss watch. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: miss_observant
Reviews.Content: I actually have not stayed at this hotel. My husband and I just stopped by to have dinner because we were very early at the airport and we did not want to sit by the gate for 3 hours. The people at the Westin were so accommodating, gladly storing our bags for a few hours and let us on the terminal shuttle even if we were not hotel guests. The food in the restaurant was definitely acceptable both in terms of quality and price. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for break from Hawaii to Sioux Falls”
Reviews.Author: Datravelguy
Reviews.Content: We had to spend a night at the Westin at LAX because we couldn't connect from Hawaii to Sioux Falls without a night in LA. The Westin was a nice treat and much better than most airport hotels. The room had a view of the airport and in the morning we could watch airplanes landing. It was a nice morning activity killing time before our flight. The bed was comfortable and the staff was great. If you are caught killing time between flights stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: msfunk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property before an early flight. I usualy stay at the Marriott but thought I'd give this a try. Big Mistake! While he property is nice. It was clean and the staff was friendly. The doorman was very helpful. My big problem came up when I was in the shower trying to get to my early flight on time. I wash my hair and it feels horrible. I wash it again thinking I had too much hairspray in it. I squueeze on the entire bottle of conditioner trying to make it possible to put my fingers through my hair. It was just getting worse. So I look at the bottles the housekeepr had put on the shelf in the shower - well guess what...It was a bottle of shower gel and a bottle of body lotion!! The products on the vanity were shower gel and lotion also so I know they didn't get mixed up (honest mistake) that was all she had to stock the room. My suggestion - go restock your supply. I barely made my flight with a tangled pony tail and dark sunglasses! Ugh!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Night”
Reviews.Author: HolidayNomad2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night between flights and had a very comfortable stay. Check in was quick and efficient, the room was very nice and had the best bed ever. The night we were there, there was some kids dance competition or so going on, so it was very busy but it did not trouble us. Free airport shuttles. We Will be for sure staying here again between flights.

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient”
Reviews.Author: sstephens4
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is very standard - but super convenient when it comes to early morning flights and parking the car (plus we use our points there!). We like to arrive the night before our flight, park in the structure, spend the night at the hotel then catch the shuttle first thing. Always use cheapairportparking.org to pay for the first night and make the parking resos for the rest of the trip (usually $9-$10 per night). You pay the balance to the valet guys upon return. The shuttles come very frequently, usually not packed full, and if you call the valet when you get your luggage, they pull the car up and it's waiting for you when the shuttle drops you back at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very comfy bed. Short trip to airport.”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: like most a had a brief stay here for overnight purposes, found it well located about 6-7 Kms from airport, very comfortable bed, and basic but nice enough rooms. Good front desk service. Good value. Would stay here again, no problems

Reviews.Title: “Needs repair/update”
Reviews.Author: TcyW
Reviews.Content: This is another one-night trip. We only picked here for the convenience. It is an airport hotel so honestly I was not expecting much to start with but...... When we got to our room, I already sense something is very wrong. The AC/HEAT system was totally shut off - the room smells pretty bad but I thought it might be caused by someone accidentally shut down the ventilation. We entered the room and turned on the AC - out come this terrible sewage smell air!!!! We let it run for 30 minutes and the smell just wouldn't go away. Finally I had enough and call the front desk - they were not even surprised by what we told them, just told us someone will be up to give us keycard for another room. This time I made sure the air quality is ok before we open our luggage again! However...... after we settled down, there was this rattling that just won't stop - it is the rattling panel cover that right under the thermostat! The frame for the panel was always falling off therefore when the AC kicks in it continuously made this rapid banning noise. At this time we were all very tired and wanted nothing but sleep and so the only reasonable solution for us was stacking our 3 luggage pieces against the panel to stop and banning! Oh, btw, I almost forgot to mention the moldy tile grout around the bathtub. Will I stay here again? Absolutely not, even though it is only minutes away from LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Good food, OK room”
Reviews.Author: nls97103
Reviews.Content: Was there for one night prior to a cruise. Long slow line to check in. Room was not in the best shape. No book describing amenities or info on LA in the room. Food and service in the restaurant was surprisingly good. Ate dinner and breakfast there and was impressed with both meals.

Reviews.Title: “another solid stay”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: For $83 on Priceline we got a clean an comfortable room, with excellent service at the front desk. Hotel shuttle bus works well to and from airport, and the adjacent Daily Grill's happy hour (4 - 7 pm) is well worth attending if you want great food and drink at a reasonable price. There's a bit of plane noise outside, but nothing that kept me awake at night. We continue to be very happy when we get a four star bid accepted by the Westin Los Angeles Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good for airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: nimy
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night before flying out. I wouldn't say it's a Westin standard property for the room but the lobby was nice enough. Staffs were nice. I got a great rate through priceline so can't complain here. In fact I got it again for my coming trip so it's all good in general. Free shuttle but have to wait awhile from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The good with the bad”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan F
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly nice property...I just think we picked a bad time to visit. We got this room on Hotwire at a competitive price...so no complaints there. The hotel is conveniently located about 5 minutes from the airport which is a nice feature. After a long day of flying...we arrived at the hotel around 1130 PM. One would think this is a somewhat quiet and worry-free time to check into a room. Nothing could have been further from the truth on this occasion.I went in the hotel to check in and there was a line of three other folks. Not bad...problem was the line was not moving. I was told there was an issue with the computer system...wanting to check people into rooms that were already occupied. Not good...but just a minor problem that could be easily remedied by human interactions. Well that wasn't exactly what transpired...because even the human element was failing. Long story short...I had to wait at least another hour before being sent to a room. Meanwhile the kids were very tired...it was 1230am after all. Finally we were sent to a room...but alas our problem wasn't over because the room was being cleaned by housekeeping...and they just started. Well I wasn't about to wait another 30 minutes...so I called the front desk and they sent us to another room...where we were forced to wait another 5-10 minutes so somebody could give us new keys. By this time it was after 100am...and to say the kids were well past tired would be understated. On a good note at least the hotel compensated us by offering free parking (which is good since it will run you ~$20 per night). We were also offered free Wi-Fi access...but unfortunately this didn't work. That was OK, since we were too tired to enjoy much web surfing anyway. Another positive is the fitness facilities were top notch. Easily the best fitness equipment I have ever utilized in any hotel. On par with equipment found in my local gym. Overall this is a very nice looking facility and well worth the Hotwire price. Think we just caught them on a bad night...or so I would like to believe. Strangely, the only other time I stayed in this hotel (several years previous) was the only time I have been evacuated from a property due to a fire alarm...at 3am in the morning. So maybe this hotel just has it out for me. :)

Reviews.Title: “Accidentally Stay - Now Big Fan”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeB408
Reviews.Content: We were placed by an airline at the Westin LAX after our flight was cancelled. In all honesty, we had fairly low expectations given that we were staying on the airline's dime and given that the hotel is just minutes away from the airport. We could not have been more wrong. We were exhausted and grudingly visited the hotel restaurant. Much to our surprise, the hotel restaurant bar and eating area was packed, and not by convention visitors staying at the hotel I might add. Indeed, we learned that the restaurant is frequented by locals and based on our experience, I can see why. The food quality was exceptional as was the service. I especially liked the healthy choices on the menu. Our room was also terrific. Clean, incredibly quiet which is amazing considering the the hotel is located on a strip between two LAX runways, and very comfortable. We loved watching planes land one after another from our hotel window. We arrived following an international flight and didn't have a dime of American currency to tip the bell staff. Still, they could not have been more gracious. The service was of such a high quality that we made an effort to find an ATM so we could tip accordingly before departing. This is a place where service with a smile still means something. Everything worked like clockwork, from the high quality restaurant meal to the efficient check in. I will make a point of seeking out this hotel on our next trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelette
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old, and that is pretty obvious in the rooms. However, the prepaid price is unbeatable, and the bed and bedding is fantastic. It was easy to walk from the Thrifty Car Rental drop off to the hotel with my luggage, and then take the shuttle to LAX the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive But Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: Pros: EASY AND FAST CHECK IN, GREAT GYM , HEATED POOL, OK TV'S, NICE BATHROOM (WELL STOCKED), ATM IN LOBBY, NICE VIEW, CLEAN, COMFTY BEDS, A LOT OF ELEVATORS. FREE HADPHONES IN GYM, Cons: CUSTOMER SERVICE, NO FRIDGE, NO MICROWAVE, SMALL BARELY HOT SPA, OVERLY PRICED MINIBAR, $25 parking and also charge your guest for parking, VERY EXPENSIVE RESTRAUNT, EXPENSIVE GIFT SHOP, NO FREE FULL BREAKFAST. I reserved a room through Expedia for a one night stay with my family. Executive double for a total of $160.00 ((including tax) which is not too bad for a Westin but a little overpriced if you ask me. When I made the reservationit said free wifi, breakfast included, and mini bar. Wifi was FREE and FAST. Breakfast IS NOT FREE OR INCLUDED. What they give you is a voucher that you take to Starbucks cart, in the lobby and they give you your choice of pastry,13oz small juice, and a fruit. Their pastry selection is small, and juice are baby size. I was very dissapointed by this because FREE BREAKFASt was an important factor in my stay since my family and I had to be somewhere at 10 a.m. it would have been convenient to just have breakfast before we headed out. So instead we had to stop by the Mc DOnalds around the corner which was incredibly pack, and very incovenient. Usually breakfast at other hotel like in all La Quintas consist of unlimited waffles, eggs, cereal, orange juice, pastries, bagels,milk, cofee and apple juice ! They had a fridge that was packed with overpriced items but there was no free space to put in our own items. When I called and asked for a fridge they rudely asked me what I needed one for? and to use the ice bucket because they ran out of fridges.The whole mini bar was VERY OVERPRICED but did have good selecction everything from water to chardonay to hard liqour minis.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Lax is a reliable bet for a comfortable nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: atarnove
Reviews.Content: I have visited the Lax Westin many times and have yet to be disappointed. The bed is still the most comfortable hands down. We love the rooms with the airport view....great fun to watch the airplanes land or take off.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: GregStella
Reviews.Content: The best thing that I can say about this hotel is the "happy hour" menu in the bar. Checking in was a nightmare. A special rate was available but the front desk couldn't book it so we had to sit in the lobby and call their reservations number. Their reservation people couldn't book it because they were having problems with their "system." We went back to trying it online and their website would only book the more expensive rooms. I went back to the front desk and they put us in an "upgraded" room that faced the runways at LAX. We got to listen to the jets taking off all night. If you stay here, don't stay in any of the rooms on the SW side of the hotel unless you enjoy the roar of jet engines. Also their swimming pool is small and uninviting. Have a "happy hour" meal at the bar and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here to avoid morning traffic”
Reviews.Author: The4Monkeys
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night with my wife and two kids to avoid the drive to LAX from the Inland Empire in the morning. Got a great Hotwire rate of under $100 and so the $30 daily valet parking fee, still made it worth it. Nice valet parking people. Only downside was that there seemed to be a little road noise in the background all night long. No biggie. Great location close to the airport. We didn't eat here, just popped in and out so it was a rather quick visit and it served our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel for a Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Publius28
Reviews.Content: Had a quick one night stay at the property last month and overall, it was average, nothing to complain but nothing to praise either. Since I had a rented car, I made my own way from the airport to the hotel but for those without transport, there is a shuttle that runs from the airport to the hotel. The room itself was basic, with a coffee maker and basic bathroom amenities (i.e. shampoo, shower gel, conditioner). Being a Westin, there was of course the heavenly bed which was one of the reasons I booked this hotel. Valet service was pretty efficient. I didn't call ahead for my car before going to the lobby but it still came in 2-3 minutes, despite the large number of guests that day. I would certainly choose this hotel again on my next stopover at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly impressive”
Reviews.Author: Zizza55
Reviews.Content: We spent in The Westin our last night of staying in California. Since our plane was in the morning, we wanted to be close to the airport. We decided to book the hotel through a site which offer several deals, therefore the price we paid was very low. We expected to get to a simple hotel, average quality, but we were totally wrong! When we arrived to the hotel we were very (and happily) surprised! The lobby is huge, the staff is lovely. They gave us a room on the 10th floor which is dedicated to preferred guests and gave us also access to the lounge. The room was very big, on top of that we had 2 Queen size beds! Everything was very clean, but the best part were the pillow and the bed itself: the best I have ever tried. Even though the hotel is very close to the LAX, we barely heard any plane. Since we were at the end of our honeymoon, they offered us the american breakfast served in the lounge. It is a very simple breakfast but offers everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable overnighter.”
Reviews.Author: rookie3437
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short drive from LAX. It's serviced every 15 -20 mins by a free shuttle. It has one restaurant - the daily grill - where the food is great and service excellent. Bathrooms are a bit dated/tired but very clean, with new towels and good quality soap, etc. Beds and pillows are outstanding. Over the road is the pickup point for the $5 shuttle to Manhattan Beach etc. it leaves on the hour and is well worth it if you have a couple of hours to kill. Very good gym On level three, with lots of the latests Lifecycle equipment.

Reviews.Title: “They charge for EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: Nomolos
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. As decent as you would expect from Westin. Food at the bar was pretty good, but the portions were not generous and the prices were a little steep. Charged me nearly $10 for printing 4 pages at the business center, which is rediculous.

Reviews.Title: “I expected so much more!”
Reviews.Author: CityHiker73
Reviews.Content: As a treat, we chose this hotel instead of our usual habit of staying at a cheaper chain. The room itself was okay, but nothing special. On the desk was a display of snacks. Fortunately we read the small sign before touching any of them. If we had, we would have been charged outrageous prices. Also annoying was an added tax on the parking. Unlike the other hotels in the area, no breakfast was included. Wireless internet was available only at a price. While it was free to print boarding passes, it was a treasure hunt to find the room. Staff was not helpful. I don't know if our experience at this Westin is typical for the chain, but we won't try again anywhere. At least we got a relatively good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great at a discount”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid E
Reviews.Content: Westins are usually top notch but this one is getting a little rundown. Room doors are showing wear and tear and the bathroom grout had plenty of mold. Other than that....not bad. Just average.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rd7478
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 2 nights when arriving in LA. The hotel is large and rooms are well appointed. The staff are very helpful and accommodating. We did several day trips and didn't have a chance to eat / have a a drink at the hotel. We had a view of the airport and thought it would be noisy but it wasn't. Great price for it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience leaves bad taste...”
Reviews.Author: audilim
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times with no complaints. Overall, the staff is polite and helpful, the rooms are clean and, generally, quiet. This last stay, however, was unusual. I'd left my hotel room to have dinner with friends and upon my return, my bathroom was smoky and smelled STRONGLY of marijuana. Right away, I called the front desk who sent up security to verify my claims. I was told by security that I wasn't the only one to complain (the smoke had been coming through the shared vent in the bathrooms) and that I could have my room changed. When I called to change rooms, it took nearly 15 minutes to get through to the front desk, and another 10 before someone showed up to give me a new room key. The gentleman who gave me the new room key was extremely kind, very friendly and apologetic, but admitted that this was not the first incident (say what now?!) Although I anticipated the airplane noise, being in such close proximity to the airport, what actually kept me awake was the noise from the street that I could hear from my room. Also, if you're staying for longer periods of time, there isn't a lot within walking distance to eat/do. Overall, slightly disappointed in this particular stay although I don't hold it against this hotel, or the chain... but perhaps improvements to be made?

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: PrincetonBelle
Reviews.Content: Great hotel w friendly staff - concierge arrange for a driver to take us to in and out burger after our week in China!

Reviews.Title: “Ok airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happydayy
Reviews.Content: A number of facilities and services reminded you that this is a Westin. 24h room service, swimming pool is heated, hot whirlpool, good 24h gym...food at hotel restaurant was good, not great. The hotel building is not overly attractive and not new. It is cheap for a Westin...

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: AdgieLB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin LAX for one night in March. I was surprised that the hotel was as nice as it was. Typically hotels near airports aren't the best, but this was a pleasant surprise. Not only is the lobby lovely, the service was good, the rooms were clean, and the concierge was helpful. We even found a good Mexican food spot within 5 minutes. I would definitely stay there again, for work or for play.

Reviews.Title: “consistent and good value”
Reviews.Author: phdgracie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel twice, six years apart. The cleaness, decor and comfort remain great and haven't changed much. Both times were booked through discount website and I think it's great value. The service (waiting time at check in and for housekeeping to send a shower cap) needs improvement though.

Reviews.Title: “Brutal Management - a tired traveler's night to forget”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Agent_Wannabe
Reviews.Content: Picked the Westin because there ain't a lot in the 4* category at LAX, but should have stayed at the cheap and cheerful 2*. Arrived March 7th at 11:30 pm at LAX and waited 25 minutes at the terminal for the crowded shuttle to arrive. Unloaded at the hotel lobby with no bellman in sight to help with all the bags for my family with 2 little kids. Got inside to find a line up of 30+ people waiting to check-in and there was no one at the desk to help. After a few minutes, a single front desk rep showed up, and didn't dare make eye contact with the angry mob waiting in line. While I waited in line, my wife tried calling the hotel operator to send more staff to the front and to their credit, a second staff member appeared about 5 minutes later. Needless to say, the tired family who just crossed the country had to wait another hour for this joke of a hotel to check in its guests. No kiosks in site, no manager brave enough to attend to the problem. Once I finally arrived at the front, waiting for the excuse, I got it...the systems were down during the day so they were having trouble understanding their inventory of empty rooms. You'd think that if the problem was known, that they would have ample staff to compensate, but no, free-wifi and continental breakfast was the best they could do. Fortunately, the trip improved with some nice stays at Hyatt and Hilton properties. Sorry Westin, your first impression means my last stay at any of your hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.”
Reviews.Author: izari
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel due to it's proximity to the airport. COmpared to other WEstin hotels I have been this one is far behind. The rooms have been renovated, but still the building looks old. Bathroom is small. Service just ok. It's a good option for a one night if getting an early flight. Price is high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Waited 2 hours for check-in”
Reviews.Author: Steve752
Reviews.Content: On Wednesday night, March 14th, I got in the long line to check in to this hotel. There were about 15 other people in line, and at the time only one person working the desk. I did not get up to the front desk for an hour and 45 minutes, and it took another 20 minutes to get a clean room - so it took over 2 HOURS to check in. I shared this experience with 14 other people in line. The only thing we heard was that there was a shortage of clean rooms, and this was not from the manager. The GM would not even come out and talk to everyone in line. We made numerous calls to the hotel while we were in line, and we all made requests to the people at the front desk as well as security, but the manager hid in the back room and would not come out. It was very childish and cowardly of him/her. The next morning, there was no hot water in my room. And, this is one thing that the hotel has not been able to work out, there is a dog kennel behind the hotel and the dogs bark all day long. I would like a complete refund. I travel frequently and this was one of the worst experiences I have ever had, and the first time I have ever complained to this site.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: january24_s
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and expensive. The restaurant prices were out of control high like $11 for a bowl of oatmeal! The happy hour was limited but the only time it was affordable to eat. The pool wasn't open either. I ended up staying at the Best Western half a mile down the road which had a suite for half the price, a pool that was open, continental breakfast and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice near LAX.”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: "Maybe it's just me, but..." I have had a couple of very comfortable and blissfully Q U I E T stays at this hotel which is practically a miracle near LAX. It's on the basic end of a Westin in terms of room size and quality, but I had no complaints, and the free shuttle is a major bonus. Note to LA business travelers! If you stay here and use their shuttle, they'll drop you off at Terminal 1 of LAX where you can take the FlyAway bus to downtown, which is a very time- and cost-efficient way to get into town during rush hour seeing as they use those nifty HOV lanes and all. So if you fly in late and just want to collapse, but have in-town meetings, this hotel works, like, fer sure!

Reviews.Title: “$$$ Parking + Nickle & Diming = Very Average...”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningInSF
Reviews.Content: If you can get a screaming low $100s at most price on this hotel, go for it. It is well done, recently upgraded, very nice restaurant in lobby, etc. However, be prepared for $22 overnight parking, $13 internet, and gotcha $4.50 motion activated bottled water in the room (with that oh sooo welcome admonishment of "items removed from this tray will be automatically billed to your account"). On top of this, I asked at check in for a quiet room, and was told "oh, I'm not sure I have that". I thought she was joking, until I realized all the odd numbered rooms face the landing strip of LAX. Double paned windows help, but it's still annoying. If you HAVE to stay blocks from the airport and can get this for the very low $100's (remember, you have to add $22 for parking!), go ahead and consider it. Otherwise, stay a little further from the hotel in a neighborhood that might have some character and not charge you an arm and a leg for airport-proximate parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wrestle Reunion Stay in January 2012!!!”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm W
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice experience for this event I attended. Hotel staff knowledgeable & very friendly. Room was very nice to stay in. Hotel was very clean everywhere. I did however have a little problem with the Water temperature in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: travelforsnow
Reviews.Content: I was checked in here as a result on a flight cancellation. The room was good, clean and quiet. The breakfast and lunch there was good and resonanbly priced. Accomodations for young children was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jinesh J
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very good. The staff excellent. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMRDAR5
Reviews.Content: If you need someplace reasonable and lose to lax, I suggest the westin. The front desk gets you in and out quickly. The food is good, and the location can't be beat. The staff are friendly and accomadating. As airport hotels go, this one is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: slorettao
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel twice in the last 2 years the night before departing on a cruise. Both times our experience was very pleasant. The concierge found us a limo to the cruise terminal during our first stay, and the second time, helped us arrange a city tour of LA. LOVE the "Heavenly Bed" at the Westin! Restaurant on site was good for supper and lunch, but the breakfast buffet was nothing special. We brought some pastries while we were on our tour to have for breakfast the next day as we had experience with the buffet during our first stay. Check in was efficient.Room was very clean with a nice view of the pool and airport. Not noisy at all from the planes which surprised us.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend if you need to stay near LAX”
Reviews.Author: markbs
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful. Facilities and room were up to standard. A pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice Near LAX”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of the three and four star hotels near LAX and the Westin seems to be the best choice in the area. Room was quiet and clean, bed was comfortable, lobby and amenities were good as well. If you need to overnight near LAX this is a solid choice for an airport property.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: livesinhotels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a large monolith with a caverness lobby done in marble and very sparse décor. Not the most inviting atmosphere but nice enough. That said the hotel is priced really well for the area and the room was large for this price point. I would choose it over 4 points or Hilton because it is less crowded and has plenty of staff. I did not find plane noise to be a problem. If you like to watch airplanes take the South side for a runway view. On the other hand if you are noise sensitive take the side facing the parking structure which will buffer the sound. They do have dual glazed windows but there is still some minimal noise. I have to say the bar food was good and the even the restaurant was decent much to my surprise. Things to note parking is $25.00 per day but if you have a longer stay consider the airport parking lot deals. The bad there is no WIRELESS internet in the rooms. You can‘t work or surf the net in bed. For guest looking for free internet or wireless in the lobby, or bar forget it. You will not find free internet on this property. Another issue is the water pressure is quite low and there was not enough hot water between 7a..m.-8 a.m. During the night there was a constant water noise coming from the heater which was really annoying and disrupted our sleep. I called down to the desk and they said they were aware of the problem but there was nothing they could do about it. They did offer to move us but who wants to pack up at midnight and move……..

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: TokyoRocker
Reviews.Content: I was here for a few nights at the end of my holiday trying to get home (stand-by ticket). Whilst not happy to be stuck in LA this hotel made it a bit more pleasant. Had a room overlooking the runways the first couple of nights and loved watching the planes land. Yes you will get aircraft noise but I like that. It never kept me awake.The room service was good and we had many meals downstairs at the Daily Grill - the food was always good. The pool was great except one of the days some guests decided to come and hijack the pool - they were unruly and more of them and bigger than me, so I left. The shuttle to the airport is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for 2 night business trip”
Reviews.Author: Belvederian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in February 2012. Overall excellent facility for the business traveler. Room was fine (was concerned what room I'd get since I booked through Priceline). Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Mjackson74
Reviews.Content: I recommend the westin to family and friends and anyone who is staying in L.A. The service, facilities, staff and total experience is equal to none. There is a great service that operates from the front of the hotel where a tour bus Can take you to Santa Monica and other great areas in L.A. I have stayed here three times and I will not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Airport Layover”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelRod
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel probably 20 times or more over the years. Its a convenient location for the airport. Rates are usually very reasonable and you get the awesome Westin beds. Some of the reviews accurately point to the fact that it has been awhile since this hotel had been renovated, which is true. Rooms face either busy Century Blvd or the runways, both sides are quiet due to the soundproof windows so no worry. Rooms are large if you need to spread out/repack your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: rodneythecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night - late check in - but the bar is open till mid night and can get food - the bar staff were great and the food was pretty good too. Room was OK - over looking the runway but we didn't have a problem with noise - it did the trick - so if you are wanting a one night stopover with free shuttle 10 minutes from LAX this ticks the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Location to LAX”
Reviews.Author: TravelLotsHaines_OR
Reviews.Content: February 10th spent the night at the hotel before our flight departure the following afternoon, room had a direct view of approaching airplanes to the runway. Definitely hear the airplanes coming in for landings but didn't disturb our evening's sleep nor did I feel the need to wear ear plugs, room well insulated from general noise, besides it was fun watching all the flights coming in at night, brought back many memories for us. My husband & I are former flight crew employees of airlines. Staff all very accommodating and helpful at the hotel, lovely spacious room. They have a park and fly program here but, we used Starwood points for room and paid an adjusted rate for parking for 10 days. Worked well for us to be in a secured parking structure. Taking shuttle to the airport provided by the hotel. Dining facilities available in hotel however we choose to leave and we dined at the "Proud Bird" restaurant just south down on Aviation Avenue, actually could see it from our room. Very interesting place with old vintage airplanes as far back as WWI. Excellent food and staff serving us, and they have a happy hour. Take time to wander around the restaurant and see all the old airplane photos, read the stories and see the planes outdoors on the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “One Night”
Reviews.Author: HAPPY1948
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin LAX for one night between flights. Overall a very pleasant experience; good restaurant, comfortable bed, easy transport to & from the airport. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJWW4764
Reviews.Content: ticks all the boxes, large rooms, good restaurants, coffee shop, bus to airport, clean. a good base for us to get around Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, and wonderful atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Jordan N
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the Westin in Los Angeles for a small weekend getaway with my significant other. The hotel was nice - It felt very loungy, and welcoming. It had a very modern and updated feel to it. The check-in was very fast, and the service was wonderful. The view could have been a little better, but given the location and its proximity to the LAX airport, it wasn't too bad. The bar in the lobby area is great. They serve wonderful appetizer food, desserts, and drinks. Although a little pricey, I wouldnt say it is too bad. The only negative aspect I would have to say would be parking, and wireless internet. Parking is quite expensive, at around $20 a day for self-park in their structure. And wireless internet was around $7-10 a day. However if it is your first time staying with the Westin, you get complimentary internet for your stay. (You have to pay for it, and then it is credited to your room at check-out). The Westin was a wonderful hotel that offered exactly what I was looking for. Its design was great, service excellent, and location superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karl024
Reviews.Content: We stoped here for a night and a day on route from UK to New Zealand. The hotel had everything we needed to relax and recharge our batteries after a long flight. The rooms were a nice size and well equiped. The bed and bedding were good quality and very comfortable. The hotel facilities were good with a nice bar and good pool area. The staff were all very friendly and went out of their way to help. The only negative i found was the internet was slow and problematic. i

Reviews.Title: “Very good but they nickel & dime you”
Reviews.Author: mkarias1
Reviews.Content: This was a tough one to note between good and very good but I will lean towards very good. This hotel was recommended by a coworker because of the free airport shuttle although this hotel is located on a street with many hotels. This trip was my first to LA so I took the advice of my coworker plus this hotel is a "preferred" chain with my company. I was told the neighborhood was not good but it is OK. I wouldn't walk around at night but in the daytime, it seems OK as there is a lot of office buildings. There is a Taco Bell located across the street and further down the street is a McDonald's if you are interested. The hotel is nice overall. The rooms are OK. the bed was comfortable. Also no bedbugs that I could find. (I always check the beds for bedbugs. I lift the sheets and check all corners of the mattress.) The room was good enough for my purpose. I was suprised that the hotel was quiet. Being next to LAX, I was expecting the airplanes to keep me up but I did not heard anything. This is a plus. I have read about long lines and rude employees. I did check in around 10:00pm so no long lines. The employees were not rude at all. However, this hotel nickel and dimes you like crazy. If you are driving, parking is NOT free. WiFi is not free. If you want to use the computers in their business center, they are NOT free. I was shocked by this as most hotels do not charge you to use the computers in the business centers. This one does. I know WiFi is usually not free. For breakfast, they have a makeshift Starbucks. Most but not all coffees are available. NO caramel mocchiatto. But they had muffins, bagels, etc. Enough for a quick breakfast. I did eat at their restuarant/bar. Service was horrible. Food was OK but pricey. Overall, not a bad experience especially since my company paid for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Day Rate--Huge Room for $99”
Reviews.Author: unchindeliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the day before departing on a long overnight flight to Europe. Check in was a breeze, and they upgraded us to a King Room that was huge. As is typical with this hotel chain, the room was clean, spacious and very quiet. I really appreciated their accommodation, and would return anytime if we need to do a day rate again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dreamer8313
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night on my way to Anaheim. I was upgraded to a Suite that had a master bedroom and a separate living room. The room looked a little dated but it was OK otherwise. I found the location convenient and the hotel staff was very helpful and gave me information about the close by attractions, that way I was able to go to Manhattan Beach using the cute shuttle that you can take right up the street from the Westin LAX. Overall a very good experience. Nice restaurant, good food and they have a band that plays live some nights a week. The check in was fast and the service was what I expected from this property.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient to airport, no soul”
Reviews.Author: arleneNewYork
Reviews.Content: We paid about $125 plus tax for a double and there was a coffee maker but absolutely nothing offered for breakfast. The people at the front desk were on automatic (the place is huge). Shuttle to airport comes every 15-20 minutes. Our window looked out to the airport runway and it was fascinating to watch the planes land and take off (but not noisy). There are inexpensive eateries nearby, like Denny's and Taco Bell, and of course the Westin has its own restaurant. Hotel is perfectly fine for a stay before heading to airport. The room windows open a small amount.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: Ksaymansky
Reviews.Content: Staff is OK not overly friendly. Upon check in no one looks you in the eye, we asked for a king, reserved a king received a double. Place needs updated its old, dated, Bartender AMAZING it was close to closing time she was friendly even though we overheard her boss telling her she could close she made sure we had our food AND drinks

Reviews.Title: “Would rate a 5 if extras were not so expenssive”
Reviews.Author: mojave
Reviews.Content: I have known this hotel under various names over the years. Thankfully, it is back to its former glory. Perfect but unobtrusive service, spacious room, very nice public areas. Parking and WiFi are too expensive. Especially the WiFi, that is now taken for granted like hot water or television.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: ctchung4
Reviews.Content: I gave great reviews on my first stay and was greatly disappointed with my recent stay. There were numerous issues, but I'll just focus on the main ones here. 1) The check-in staff was efficient but not friendly or smiling and also failed to look into my inquiry when she said she would take care of it after checking us in. 2) We reserved and pre-paid for a room with a King-sized bed and got a surprise when we entered the room and found that it was a double bed. After calling, we were then told that there were no rooms with a King or Queen-sized bed available due to a pipe-bursting problem. If the check-in staff had been more professional, we should have been notified of the hotel's problem and given options right away instead of having to discover it for ourselves. 3) One phone was broken, and Line 1 on the other phone was broken. The ethernet cable was missing. The room did not look well-kept. 4) Upon our request, we finally were moved to a different room with a double bed that looked more decent, although there was a seemingly open and used soap at the sink and the phone handset was not working the next morning. Why I gave a rating of 3 instead of 2: On the positive side, I would like to commend Salvador for being upbeat and helpful when moving us to a different room and Gerald for handling our issues promptly and professionally. We did receive the hotel credit as told. The staff had been polite at all times. I am hopeful that these issues will be resolved or prevented for the future.

Reviews.Title: “clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: michaelderer
Reviews.Content: westin lax was a great value with good service and ammenities would definetely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short business stay or layover hotel”
Reviews.Author: americantravelers5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short distance away from the LAX airport. I use this hotel frequently when I conduct business in the greater Los Angeles area as it practically eliminates the layer of complexity of southern California traffic when staying in the area. Subsequently, my home airport is SFO, I find greater international direct flights out of LAX. Should your travels require a layover this hotel is a great place to spend the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good meeting facilities, good services, convenient to airport with free shuttle.”
Reviews.Author: Cglewis
Reviews.Content: Near airport with free shuttle. Very comfy bed. Room needed dusting. Nice meeting facilities with pretty good food. I must have had the same room shown in the pic with the torn chair, or they have lots of torn chairs. Service was friendly and efficient. More than I'm used to paying per night ( for what it was). I'm told it is a very dangerous part of town, but I never left the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Evening at the Westin LAX”
Reviews.Author: HotelCalifornia77
Reviews.Content: My wife, kids and I recently had a wonderful, relaxing stay at the Westin LAX. The service was outstanding and the accommodations were exceptional. We had a very comfortable evening before we headed off the next morning to Africa. We are already looking forward to the next opportunity to stay at the West LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality and value”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: The Westin LAX was a superior experience for me. I found the customer service to be superior, both at curbside with valets and clear directions, as well as the concierge/front reception area. They were knowledgeable and clear in communication. They also seemed to enjoy their jobs. My room was excellent -- roomy, with a lovely view and a magnificent bed. The room was modern and clean. My girlfriend and I felt very comfortable with our stay. The last aspect for me was the parking package. Both in value and convenience, this was excellent. The access to the parking garage is very easy through the hotel lobby, and the gated self-service aspect was appreciated. All in all, a wonderful stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice at LAX Airport”
Reviews.Author: eTurboNews
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin LAX many times. It's the logical choice for an overnight at LAX airport. if you rent a Thrifty or Fox rental car- it's next to the hotel and convenient. The heavenly beds will guarantee an excellent and relaxing sleep. The rooms are large, there is a charge for internet. You may have a hard time locating a plug for your electricity. Get ready to crawl on the floor to find it. The hotel facilities are ok. The pool is heated, the jacuzzi is great after a long day of travel. The restaurants are average - service is good.

Reviews.Title: “poor hotel cant believe it is a westin”
Reviews.Author: davidandjenny1
Reviews.Content: checked in mid evening, efficient staff, room small view terrible, sheets not properly washed, blood stains on a pillow case, room desparately needs a renovation, but they still overcharge with no breakfast or internet, westin glamour sorely needed or make a NAME CHANGE, my starwood card counted for nothing in choosing the rooom, isolated position, overpriced restaurant grill but very nice staff, staff poorly informed re surroundings the mall was a very basic for food options and types of stores, cant say much positive there are enough other options to give this a big miss

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable for airport layovers”
Reviews.Author: workingjapan
Reviews.Content: Very cheap alternative for layover at LAX. Beds were good but bathrooms were tired and old. Did not have very safe feeling but I think that was because of location to LAX, size of hotel and price point. Would not stay there with a young family again. However, it was better than sleeping on floor at airport.

Reviews.Title: “nice shindig”
Reviews.Author: raychael84
Reviews.Content: stayed in a suite really enjoyed the extra room and set up everything was like new with flat screen tv and what not I was upset with the price for the food in combination with the amount of food I did enjoy the service and as most places in lax you have to bay like 18 bucks for self parking which makes no sense to me and its far

Reviews.Title: “Great Public Area; Average rooms”
Reviews.Author: United858
Reviews.Content: While the common areas are beautiful, the guest rooms are very average and not up to normal Westin quality.  We stayed the night to catch an early departure and advantage the stay one night park for a week rate.  This worked out fine.  They share a shuttle with the 4 points and it runs "about every 20 minutes".  That is fine except that you cannot plan ahead as they do not stick to a defined time.  You can call down to Bell captain and find when last one left but that only helps a bit - you have to plan to have just missed and leave the 20 minutes...  The route is such that it leaves Westin first and then to 4 points so we got to sit while the 4 pointers stood.  It took 27 min to get to United terminal.  The good news is that on return, you are less than 10 min to Westin which comes first.  For the room, the bed was nice but the pillows odd. Not too sure why they were different than most Westin's but they were not too comfortable.  The bed was good and comfortable.  This is also odd but the toilet seat was one of those cheap plastic ones and the toilet paper was very thin and rough.  Poor form for a Westin - really now.  The WiFi in the room was poor.  It took several times to get it to connect and then it dropped out three more times causing me to go through a whole sign up procedure again.  It was a good thing it was "free for platinum" so I did not have to deal with a problem at checkout.  For whatever reason, I did not get a bill under the door so had to go to front desk to get copy of my bill.  Odd.  All in all, the reason for the stay made it work well and the lobby / common areas were well appointed and looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Insanely loud”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night with DH before our flight. I expect an airport hotel to have some noise, but it sounded like the planes were landing in our room at this place. Otherwise it was surprisingly dingy and not spotless. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good if You Have a Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: San_Diego_Traveler5
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times and would agree that the experience can be hit or miss. I recently went up for a one-night trip with my children over the Christmas holiday to do some sight-seeing in L.A. We found a good rate on Hotwire ($78 plus tax was around $96 total). Parking (with in-and-out privileges) is $22.50/day. The first room we went into was filled with smoke, so we trekked back downstairs and were put in a room on one of the "Starwood Preferred Guest" floors, which didn't seem to be any different from the others. The clerk was very friendly and apologetic and I would say the service was good at the front desk. At another time, when I had lost my parking pass and needed a new one, the clerk was very helpful and then took a look at my kids and came back with two Westin Adventure Kids backpacks plus goodies inside. I felt they were trying to make our stay nice. The downside is that, while the hotel is close to LAX, it's in the neighborhood close to LAX. It's not someplace you'd want to walk around outside. Walking out front would be like walking on the side of a freeway. Also, the housekeeping was pretty poor. Our room had a noticeable layer of dust along the entire desk/dresser/minibar area and the bathrooms were very average, especially for something rated as a four-star hotel in Hotwire. The beds were comfortable, like other Westin beds, and the room was fairly quiet, but that may have been different if the hotel were more full. The hotel has a heated pool on the third floor. It's an average-sized pool and the water temperature is heated but not terribly warm. We went in in the evening, when it was in the 50s outside, and the pool felt pretty cool. The jacuzzi was much better, though you can't sit in the jacuzzi and watch your kids in the pool because there are steps and a wall between the two. So if your kids want to swim, be prepared to stay by the pool and save the jacuzzi time for later. The gym is currently being remodeled (as of December 2011). I didn't check out the temporary gym that they had in place. As far as location is concerned, as I mentioned it is minutes from LAX on Century Blvd. We used the hotel as a home base to do activities in Santa Monica. With L.A. traffic going either on the 405 or up the Pacific Coast Highway, it's about 30 minutes to Santa Monica. Having said all of this, my kids thought this was a WONDERFUL hotel. They say it's definitely a four-star hotel and one of the nicest they've been in. Don't they remember the stay at the Hyatt Regency in Maui? So, evidently, it made a great impression on them and hopefully that accounts for something. My tip would be to check Hotwire and try to get a good rate. At less that $100 a night, you'll feel it's a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine, but don't go in expecting "Westin"”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoToTheWorld
Reviews.Content: I find that airport hotels are always a crapshoot - and quite frankly, this particular Westin does nothing to enhance the Westin image (is that image still excellent? - not really sure). I was only there one night (and this is where United Airlines put the people on my flight missing connections, including me). But while I was initially thrilled to be put in the Westin, I left thinking it was fine, but not up to Westin's name. Issues: The cold water faucet in the bathroom was loose and very difficult to turn off. An outlet on a lamp was mostly pulled out and not usable. Wallpaper pulling apart from the wall (and torn) in at least two locations in the room. Curtain was stained. The room was generally tired, dated, in bad need of an overhaul and the bathroom looked no better than one you'd find at most 3* airport hotels. But there were some positives: Service at the front desk and restaurant was very friendly. A nice, big flat screen tv in the room. Typical Westin "Heavenly" bed. The hotel room was clean (although there was some garbage in hallway, I arrived late in the evening, so I don't know that anyone had a chance to notice). In sum, I wouldn't discourage anyone from staying at this hotel. It's perfectly fine really. I would simply tell you that if you are spending more money to stay here (based upon the Westin name) versus another airport hotel, you might want to rethink the decision, particularly if you're just staying one night.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice Close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: cal8888
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Westin LAX more than a dozen times with varying experiences. This hotel can be hit and miss with service, and some of the rooms are in dire need of refurbishing, but regardless the rooms and hotel are always clean and very few hotels offer beds and bedding that are more comfortable. We like the location because it is a quick drive to Santa Monica, Beverly Hills, Hollywood, the Convention Centre or the farmer's market on Fairfax. Access to the 405, 15 or 10 is fast and easy. And dropping off a rental car is no more than a 10 minute drive away. Self parking is also fast and easy - and not that costly being that this is a major city. Our last two stays in December 2011 were quite good. The club floor rooms we stayed at appeared to be recently refurbished and were immaculately clean, as were the hallways. The executive lounge was well stocked with a large selection of delicious snacks and was another pleasant surprise. Although the fitness room was being redone, the equipment that was available was good and the temporary location was adequate. The service at the front desk was good on both stays, and our in-hotel Brazilian bellman was top notch. He was friendly and professional and provided us with some excellent suggestions. The outside car bellmen were attentive on our first stay, but not so much on our second stay. As I mentioned - hit and miss. While this is not as nice a Westin as is usual for the chain, the value is exceptional - where can you get a hotel like this (in a major city) for around $120 a night (incl. taxes)? If you adjust your expectations and know upon arrival that this is more of a 3 1/2 star hotel, your stay will be fine. We will stay here again - can't beat the cleanliness, value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRSeattle
Reviews.Content: Staying at the airport on business, I was greeted by easy parking, a room upgrade, help with a late night snack and a perfect martini. 206 nights with Starwood last year this was one of the best. Going back next week.

Reviews.Title: “Would have had a better stay at a 2 star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: calgarian98
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? we booked this hotel through hotwire and once we found out it was the Westin, we were so excited. We arrived at 12 midnight after a long drive from San Diego to Desert Hill Premium outlet and then to LA.Since we arrived late, we were given a room on the 12th floor. This is considered the executive club level, again very excited. the excitement lasted only a few minutes. We were staying at this hotel for 5 nights, so we unpacked everything( we had also, done lots of shopping at the outlet mall and had bags and bags of stuff, un-packed all those). We entered the room and it was so old looking an the floor was so dirty. By 12:45 I go downstairs to ask if there is a place to get a coffee and the front desk told me that unfortunately there isn't any place available at this time! I go back to the room and start reading the booklets in the room, to my surprise , it says the bar downstair is open till 1:30 and has variety of speciality coffees!!! So i attempted to make coffee in the room, well, the coffee machine had water in it from the previous person, and it would shut off every 30 seconds, so it took me 4-5 attempts to make a cup of coffee. the top of coffee maker was so filthy and disgusting that I had to take a picture of! anyways, i could not get a decent coffee. Then, I went to brush my teeth and noticed the sink is clogged and there is a horrible smell coming from it.( remember, this room was supposed to be cleaned before we got there, not sure how the cleaning staff cleaned there and did not open the water in sink!!). I called the service express and they sent their engineer to check on it. it is already 1:30 in the morning!!! Sonny the engineer comes up( such a great guy) and spent another almost 2 hours in our bathroom. I had to stay up for this whole time, at the end he said it is not fixable and we have to switch rooms,by this time the horrible smell is all over our room, you could hardly breath!b He asked us not to use the sink either, My husband had already fallen asleep so I called the front desk and made them aware of the situation. I told them that we will be changing our room in the morning since my husband is asleep. She said she will call me in the morning to tell me which room is assigned to us.I set the alarm at 7:30 so I can pack everything again and be ready for our 8:30 room change. I got up, packed and went to take a shower , believe it pr not, my body touched the shower curtain and there is a huge nose mucus( BOOGIE!). I almost threw up! anyways, got out of shower as soon as I could, since the water was so cold too! anyways, no one calls until a little pass 8:30 I call the front desk to ask about the room number, well, they had no idea what I was talking about! finally, they said after 12 pm they will have a room on the 12th floor, we packed everything and left for universal. Came back at 11 pm and they had given us a room on the 11th floor. By then I am furious at everything with the hotel. To compensate for all these, they had given us a suite with a terrace but to get to the room, it took you a while to get from the elevator to your room as the room was at the end of a connecting hallway. also, what am I gonna do with a terrace by the airport in December? So I go downstairs and wait in the preferred line to be served! with no one in front of me, it took them 20 minutes to serve me,actually they didn't. I just walked in front of the other line waiting to be checked in. The guy was so rude an arrogant that I had to ask for the night manager, I explained to her what had happened and she was very nice and understanding. At the end, we were given free internet and free valet parking for our whole stay( we had already started using both accepting the charges). Also, there is a coffee stand in the lobby, the only place that serves Starbucks coffee. you go there at 10 am and she says she is closed!!! Also, in the booklet in the room was a list for complimentary things you could ask. I asked for hair spray and a sewing kit and they didn't have either one. also , the cleaning lady did not clean the bathroom floor or any other floor for that matter. I guess they don't vacuum everyday. Just make your bed and put new soap and shampoo! In this trip I stayed at 2 other hotels and they both were amazing( hilton La Jolla San Diego and Hotel Nikko San Francisco union square). This by far was the worst hotel I had every stayed at. Except Jennifer the night manager, Sonny the engineer and another lady/girl at the front desk in the morning, everyone else demonstrate a less than satisfactory service. I Will never ever go back to this place. ever! and make sure no one I know would not go there either.

Reviews.Title: “Wesin LAX surpasses the other airport hotels~ Lovely property!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSiren
Reviews.Content: After being bumped from my Delta flight to Maui, I was shuttled to Westin LAX. I passed on their first offer of Hilton, and was delighted at the enormous, elegant lobby, decor, and speedy Starwood Preferred Guest check in. The room was very nice, had a mini-bar, snacks (way overpriced but we all know that is par for the course!), and comfortable bed, and was surprisingly quiet being so close to the LAX. The best part of my unplanned Westin stay was my dinner at the onsite, fabulous Daily Grille. The chain is upscale, well staffed, popular, and always delicious, and fun. We have one where I reside in Palm Desert, on El Paseo and we do dine there frequently. Overall, the Westin has a younger, well dressed, energetic crowd, and is clean, and gorgeous. I would stay here if you are flying out of LAX... you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: EduTravelerMidwest
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by stating how wonderful the staff is. Everyone I encountered from the front desk staff to room service staff was wonderful, polite, and eager to help. Us Midwesterners often expect the worst when we travel to the coasts but I was pleasantly surprised by the staff. The rooms are well designed and have wonderful views of Los Angeles (and of course the gigantic car rental company lots by LAX). The only thing that holds me back from giving a 5* rating is the fact the hotel charges so much for parking. I could understand that rate were it a downtown hotel but perhaps in a car obsessed city like LA, everyone charges for parking. Regardless, this is a wonderful hotel with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: eweinz22
Reviews.Content: very clean, very good front desk staff. parking cost was a little high but standard for a major city hotel. great beds and nice bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MissDivaD
Reviews.Content: Great location in proximity to LAX airport! Double room, beds were comfortable, and as always made w/crisp linens that Westin hotels are know for. Lots of hot, hot water with great water pressure, which is sometimes a problem in L.A. My room faced the LAX runway but I did not hear planes landing or taking, nor any traffic from Century Blvd. Only downside is that the hotel restaurant is VERY expensive and menu is limited. Being an early riser, I was going to walk to Denny's which is across the street on next block, but then I checked online and saw there was a 24hr Subway location almost next door to hotel.Enjoyed a hot breakfast, and got some early a.m. exercise from the short walk.There is also Taco Bell, McDonald's, & Carl's Jr across from hotel.Since I was only there for less 24hrs, I found other restaurants were a less expensive option that the hotel. Shuttle runs every 20 mins to LAX, but it does make a stop at the Four Point Sheraton, so plan your trip to the airport to allow enough time for the extra stop.Would definitely stay again! Only exception to otherwise great stay was the reception desk staff which I spoke to the hotel manager about, whom was apologetic, but I doubted if any action was taken.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: juju-anne
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one night before our early morning night to New York. It was a spacious room but it was slightly under my expectations for Westin hotels but may be due to the fact we were staying at an airport hotel. The hotel rooms did have signs of age and definite wear and tear. The rooms were fairly quiet and wasn't too much noise coming from the airports. The hotel staff were very friendly and check in was very easy. The airport shuttle bus was also very convenient for us travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge level worth it”
Reviews.Author: howieeg
Reviews.Content: I used minimal Starwood points for a great deal at the Westin Los Angeles Airport, one of the few genuine Westin properties with point requirements on the level of Starwood’s Four Points economy brand hotel. Despite mixed reviews on this site, this is a definite Westin hotel, with a grand, stylish lobby and all the requisite professionalism and all the trimmings, plus surprising friendliness. I am aware of several comments about nicked furniture, cramped bathrooms, worn carpets, etc., but am also aware that most of those comments came from people who used budget websites, which result in less desirable rooms on lower when the hotel is crowded. I hedged my bet by taking advantage of Westin’s offer to upgrade to concierge level, even though I am regular SPG member. The offer (not available for reservations on alternate websites) cost $25 per night, a bit steep for a stay that would have been otherwise free -- until I considered the cost of Internet use ($15- plus for the deluxe, fastest service) and breakfast ($30). For concierge level, a decent breakfast is offered weekdays in the plush club-level lounge and weekends at the Starbucks Kiosk. Also, those costly bottles of water people always complain about are free; you can even ask for more. That also may be one reason my room was plush, stylish and pristine. I can only imagine some over-entitled guests expecting haute retro-70s trendiness or some Queen Anne movie set, but this was a solid, contemporary four-star accommodation, replete with a 42-inch flat screen TV (with hi-def reception and movies), three phones, a safe, nice-sized bath, a comfortable fold-out couch, comfy bathrobes (regularly replaced) and a super-king bed and plush linens usually found in five-star hotels (and turned down at evenings with chocolate mints on the pillows). The Internet worked like a charm, faster than at my home. The breakfast and evening appetizers at the club lounge were top quality, too. Ample, well displayed fruit, vegetables, pastries, breads, succulent wings and fluffy scrambled eggs, plus top-line coffees, teas, juices and full cash bar services. The dining tables were always cleaned, and even the club computers were top line. The weather seemed to be in the low 70s and cloudless on the three early December days of my stay, sot it was great to savor the pool scene on the third floor, decked out with big palm trees and luxurious lounge chairs. The jacuzzi never worked, which I hear is a common problem, and the workout room is temporarily on the lobby level, which can be inconvenient, but for an airport hotel, this pool scene was a nice surprise. Also a surprise is the hotel restaurant, part of a respected local chain of brasseries with succulent specialities. Even the hotel gift shop seemed more like a resort style emporium than the basic snack-and-toiletry huts in many airport hotels. Of course the best attribute of the Westin Los Angeles Airport is the shuttle. Yes, it’s shared with one or two other hotels, but that insures prompt regular service -- which seem to be the entire theme of my all too brief stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: CT_Alison
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night because we had to catch a 7:45 AM flight. Enjoyed the room and the view of airplanes landing. Got a great deal from Hotwire.com. Avoid the $4.50 Reese's Peanut Butter Cups and other overpriced snacks in the room! The parking is overpriced - we avoided it by returning our Alamo rental car nearby and walking back to the hotel and took the convenient shuttle to LAX the next morning. While waiting for the shuttle at 6 AM, we saw Mythbuster Adam Savage in the lobby. He skipped the shuttle and took a convenient limo to the airport. Nice to have a celebrity sighting on our final day in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Good amenities near LAX”
Reviews.Author: Marcus O
Reviews.Content: Very nice and well located hotel at less than 2 miles from LAX. For business travellers is an excelent choice. The rooms are wide and the service is very friendly. The price is average and the outside amenities can satisfy most of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to LAX!”
Reviews.Author: LilPiggyQT
Reviews.Content: I had a stay at the Westin near LAX recently on the evening of Tuesday, December 12th for one night. The reason I had decided to stay at the Westin as opposed to the many other airport hotels was because of the Heavenly Bed. I had heard about it numerous times and I wanted to experience this bed that I had read so much about. The bed itself wasn’t the absolutely most amazing bed I had slept in but the sheets, the pillows, and the comforter were FANTASTIC. It made the bed so comfortable and I would definitely like to stay in another Westin to just experience the Heavenly Bed again. The hotel is not far from the airport and you can hear airplanes taking off but it’s not extremely noticeable. I was able to fall asleep without thinking about the air traffic noise from the airport. I chose a king size bed room and the room was equipped with a large LCD TV and a small couch/loveseat. The couch was surprising comfortable as most hotel couches I sit on are usually not. The room also had a weighted mini-fridge and a weighted tray with products for purchase. There is a single-serve coffee maker with Starbucks coffee on the counter also. I did not use the hotel’s facilities at all. I know there was a gym and a restaurant on site but I did not visit either. The hotel also has a parking structure attached and it was easy to drive in and out of to get to the airport and other places near the hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly when I checked in and also when I checked out. Although the hotel itself does not look new or fresh, it was clean. It does need a little bit of remodeling but it was nicer than a lot of airport hotels I had stayed at around LAX. Bottom line: A good hotel with a great bed near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “A great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sucheslife
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel was as good as advertised. The room was spacious and well appointed the bed was great and, amazingly, there was not much noise from the airport and my room faced the LAX runway. It is clear the staff makes an effort to be pleasant and they make you feel welcome. Every employee iI encountered made me feel welcome. The only thing I noticed that could use improvement woudl be the addition of a carpet pad in the rooms and hallways. It would improve the feel of the floor and reduce hallway noise.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable overnighter courtesy of airline”
Reviews.Author: skippyLuzern
Reviews.Content: American Airlines provided 2 nights’ accommodation and meal vouchers as compensation for the delayed arrival from Chicago and my missing the late night connection to Sydney. I was greeted by an impressive lobby and efficient, albeit robotic front desk staff. The room with all the wear and tear of an airport hotel showed signs of age, including the polished dark wood decor, but had comfortable facilities and the North facing view from the seventh floor from Century City, with the Hollywood Hills behind, to downtown in the distance is great. Housekeeping was very efficient and I had a bathrobe within 3 minutes of request. An excellent breakfast in the Daily Grill and take out meal in the evening was marred only by a slight memory/attention problem by the kitchen staff who responded promptly when reminded.
