As on a previous LAX stays I opted to go to Manhattan Beach Village on the $5 return trolley bus that stops across the road rather than other options of venturing to Marina del Rey, Westwood, Santa Monica or Beverly Hills or downtown. That is much less stressful than renting a car and has all the shopping, including department and Apple stores and quality shops and even a movie theatre if people want to pass more hours, there is not much more needed for a lay over. Rather than purchasing a bottle of water for $4 from the mini-bar I threw $1.50 into the vending machine next to the ice maker and had several beverage choices. I thought the lobby shop closed a little early and with the Daily Grill the only in-house food outlet the services are limited for late night arrivals. For my LAX over nighter I don’t think I would choose Westin over Hilton, Sheraton or Marriott but if it is the airline paying I’ll take it again with pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Cacestbon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin LAX two years running for an annual music convention. My room has been comfortable and quiet both times. The faciltities are perfect for convention grand and breakout sessions. The bar is a great place to network, as is the grill. Access to and from LAX is effortless. Although the Westin is physically some distance from some attractions in the LA area, the hotel offers shuttles for joggers, one of which goes to the beautiful beach areas to the north. The gym and pool are low key, just the ticket for undisturbed workouts and relaxation. Best of all, the staff is friendly and helpful. I look forward to my annual stays.

Reviews.Title: “One night in LA”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-gramps
Reviews.Content: An average hotel, with above average bar and bar food. We had good service, but the hotel is a bit old and dated. Rooms are a little noisy, with long halls and big windows. The area is not the greatest for sight seeing, and the selection of nearby restaurants is rather limited. However, the rate was good and it is near the airport...so good for a short stop over if your just on a layover between conections in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Two hotels in one-one great and one to avoid”
Reviews.Author: londoncal
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a moderately priced hotel near the airport to break up am east coast to Hawaii trip - we stayed one midweek night in successive weeks. The first night was perfect - easy check in, great service, well appointed room The second night we waited in a long line to check in, did not receive the type of room we paid for in advance, the furnishings were tired on the 5th floor which clearly had not been renovated in many years

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LOVED LOVED The Westin ! A bed from HEAVEN !”
Reviews.Author: Seren96
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night using our Starwood Preferred Guest points and what a deal that turned out to be. The room was spacious and the bed was to die for. I crawled into bed and didnt want to ever get out. Loved the mini bar though i wouldnt spend $5 for a can of soda or a candy bar. Parking was $22 per night but since the night was free it wasnt a bother. I loved staying here. I felt relaxed and would stay here again if i could afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly up to "Westin" standards, but great for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: David St. Hubbins
Reviews.Content: So what do you want if you're staying at an airport hotel for an early morning flight? Comfy bed? Check. Clean, good-sized room? Check. Hotel bar that serves Sierra Nevada on tap? Check. Clean room and bathroom? Check. Reliable, free transport to the airport? Check. A very, very affordable room? Check. Bottom line, the room isn't quite up to Westin standards--everything's a little dated--but it's just what you need in an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing business trip”
Reviews.Author: R P
Reviews.Content: The room was quiet and immaculate. Room service food was delicious, if a little expensive. It was a comfortable and convenient place to stay for my business trip and the bed was heavenly - as promised.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want from a fly-in-fly-out airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: dolanspringsazlol
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 9th floor in a southward facing room for one night. Check-in is efficient and seamless. Public areas are attractive, fragrant and very clean. There are two bars and a fantastic restaurant. The quality of the food at The Daily Grill is excellent, the food is reasonably priced and the staff have an excellent knowledge of the food and wine menus. The staterooms are spacious, very clean, quiet and comfortable. The Westin Heavenly Bed is very pleasant indeed. Bathrooms are large and in very good condition. The Westin is conveniently located next to rental car companies and provies a complimentary 24 hour shuttle to all LAX terminals departing every 10-15 minutes. My only criticism is that some of the furnishings in the staterooms are aged and scuffed. This hotel offers very good value.

Reviews.Title: “What else can you want?”
Reviews.Author: lmpiv
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times when catching a flight out of LAX- there is not much else you could want. The restaurant is tremendous, and very reasonably priced, and offers a very easy place to get a wonderful meal. The rooms are quiet and very comfortable, staff is very helpful, and shuttle service is prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Best LAX Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff S
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent guest at this hotel, as it is the best that I have found at LAX. The check in procedure is quick, but friendly. I am able to get from the front desk to my room within 5 minutes of my arrival. Likewise, departure is also expedited as I can select to have my bill placed under the door, emailed to me, or both. Selecting the emailed option ensures that I automatically receive any updates to my bill without having to stop by the front desk (for the breakfast, etc. charged to the room). The restaurant is run by a third party, and though pricey for an airport hotel, offers a high quality product. For those of you who have not tried the heavenly bed, it is the best in the industry.

Reviews.Title: “An experience that I am used to”
Reviews.Author: Eddie C
Reviews.Content: I permanently reside on the Pacific island of Guam. Where I come from, people are willing to serve guests with a pleasant smile. On my many trips to busy mainland cities, the smiles are often rare to come by, But my stay at the Westin LAX happened to be one that I enjoyed. Their staff was very pleasant and courteous. Their accommodations were definitely up with the best in international destinations. And the convenience of being next door to car rental companies, the freeway, and food establishments made my trip that much better. I will be a repeat customer for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for an Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: camachomarie
Reviews.Content: We came home from a trip to Phoenix around 10pm to a flooded apartment. The mold smell was absolutely horrendous and since I am pregnant we needed to stay at a hotel. The best deal I could find was near the airport, but it was a Westin so I figured it wouldn't be that bad. Parking was $22.50 a night. Room Rate was $109. I was excited to see they actually had a line for SPG Gold and Platinum members because there was a somewhat long line to check in and we were able to bypass the line. I don't see this very often. There is usually a sign with no attendant. Being tired I was really happy to not have to wait. The man that checked us in was very pleasant and attentive. When we got to our room we were overwhelmed with this foul smell of mold. How could it be? We left our home to avoid a mold smell. Mr. C called down to get a new room. They were very apologetic and came but fairly quickly to the new room luckily we didn't have a lot of luggage to take down. The new room wasn't as smelly. There was some convention going on in the hotel with kids literally running around the halls screaming. They were pulling pranks all around the hotel. Putting random chairs in the elevators. Please keep in mind it is after 11pm. I am sure the hotel was aware of the problems and were working on them, but it was quite annoying especially when the ice machine on the 7th Floor wasn't working and I had to go to another floor only to get into the elevator and all the buttons were pushed. Luckily I was only going one floor, but I feel bad for the person after me. The rooms were decent for a airport hotel. The best part was the bed. It was like any other Westin bed..clean and comfortable. You could tell the hotel was very well worn. There was holes in a lot of the furniture and the entire place needed a deep clean. Luckily I won't be having to stay by LAX again, but if you need to this isn't a bad option. Most of the hotels over there are horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at LAX”
Reviews.Author: South_Pacific_Seas
Reviews.Content: We selected the Westin at LAX since we had an early flight on the Friday after Thanksgiving. The value for the rooms were very good as we had a nice package from the Westin website that included breakfast. Check-in was hassle free and quick. Unfortunately, they had a large conference that weekend which I think overwhelmed the staffing for a holiday weekend. We called the front desk to replace a TV remote that was not working but it never was replaced. They were understaffed for check out and failed to provide copies of the receipt without several calls back. No newspapers available either in the lobby or in the gift shop for purchase on Thanksgiving day. The level of service and amenities were below that of other Westin hotels. I have stayed here before and think they were understaffed for a holiday weekend when they also scheduled a large convention. It has been a year since I have stayed here so I am not sure if these problems were related to this particular visit or whether they have cut back on staffing in general.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, due to on-going structural renovation work.”
Reviews.Author: 575traveller47
Reviews.Content: I am thinking it could be better after the renovation, but at the time, it was noisy, dusty, and confusing to navigate through..

Reviews.AuthorLocation: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
Reviews.Title: “Stayed for the Taxi Convention”
Reviews.Author: Launnie G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for the Taxi convention. The hotel was nice, very accommodating for all the musicians and songwriters wandering around. It was busy but the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel, dusty, somewhat dingy, not up to Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: sarapalms
Reviews.Content: I often use the statement "Your viewpoint depends on your point of view". A long time ago, there was a hit song called "How're you gonna keep 'em down on the farm after they've seen Paris?". These two memories take me to my Westin LAX experiences. Paris? No way. It's closer to a Perris, CA experience. I started staying at this hotel about 12-15 years ago. Then it was pretty darn good, especially when compared to the other iffy choices in the LAX area. Prior to the Westin, I stayed at the Marriott LAX, but it slid downhill in the late 90s. From the worn drapes to the scratches on the walls, this is one tired puppy. The electric plugs are dusty - waaaay dusty, as if they haven't been cleaned in a long time. Old, low quality carpet. Motel 6-type plastic cups complete the downscale experience. This is a Westin? In name only. Mattresses ARE comfortable, and the AC worked well. The dining room food is "eh". Some guests are charged $12.99 a night for the rather slow Internet Overall, on a scale of 1 to 10, this limps in as a rather weak 4. Bottom line, I wouldn't stay ANYWHERE in the LAX area unless I was dead tired, and/or needed a close-to-LAX location to grab a flight. It's a sad area without decent restaurants or any tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “What I expected and very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Planelivin
Reviews.Content: Excellent location but then it's an airport hotel so hard to mess that up. But at least when it says near airport it is! Rooms very comfortable with nice bed. Nice TV with good channel selection. Not sure of the price as the airline covers that as I am a pilot but I'm sure it is competitive with what's around here. Above average airport hotel. You can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mealmantime
Reviews.Content: The Taxi convention was here and it was all accommodating for us. However he restuarant was on a bit on the high side bit nice. Watch for the happy hour specials to save a little. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joscelyn0320
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Westin LAX! The interior of the lobby was beautiful and the room was clean, upscale and very inviting. I usually don't have any problems at the Westin hotels, and this trip was the same. Everything was beyond my expectations and I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: Daniel W
Reviews.Content: Took the free shuttle from LAX Airport and from the moment I arrived, I was welcomed by the many staff, at the door, in the Lobby and at the check-in desk. They remember their frequent quests and I was again Welcomed back and thanked for using the Westin LAX! My room was nice and clean! The young lady working the Westin Club Floor was so kind and friendly, she even went out of her way to get me some cranberry juice one evening. Thanks for making it my home away from home.....D.Wheaton

Reviews.Title: “Westin Lax Best overall”
Reviews.Author: BRAD E
Reviews.Content: It had been a while since I had stayed at the Westin LAX so when business brought me back to L.A it was a great opportunity to revisit my favorite Hotel in the area. As always, there were no disappointments. The staff was great. The room was large and work friendly with a fantastic bed. The restaurant was excellent, not just a place that would suffice but a place to have a real meal. Top to bottom the whole experience reinforced my opinion that this is the only place to stay in the LAX area.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised and pleased with Westin LAX”
Reviews.Author: SoozieGK
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute on the Starwood website. The front desk check in was welcoming, quick, & professional. My room was nice. Clean and quiet. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “If You Haven't Stayed At Westin You Should!”
Reviews.Author: Mary E
Reviews.Content: My very recent business trip to LA was a great success, largely due to my stay at Westin LAX... Beautiful, clean, great staff, the food ever!

Reviews.Title: “My first choice for the airport area!”
Reviews.Author: Steaminstan
Reviews.Content: As it turns out, this is where TAXI has held their Road Rally the two years I have gone to it. My stay at the Westin was made special by the fact that the staff was nice, everything was clean and fresh, and I got a quiet night's rest four nights in a row! You do kind of expect those things, but it is so nice when you actually get them! I will return to the Westin anytime I need to stay close to LAX!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CherylandBrett
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at the Westin LAX. Beautiful hotel with large, lovely rooms complete with large flat screen TVs. Super comfy bed, large bathroom. Good food in the restaurant, very friendly staff. Lots of lounging areas downstairs in the huge lobby, perfect for people watching! Will be staying here often!

Reviews.Title: “"Mini-Moon"”
Reviews.Author: Artist719
Reviews.Content: My husband was returning from a long trip so we decided to spend the night at the Westin LA Airport. It was our first stay there. We were greeted by friendly staff and provided with a very lovely room with a comfortable king bed. The restaurant staff were so helpful and quickly prepared some delicious food to take to our room. The stay was better that we ever expected. We will return for sure. Thank you for the great customer service and accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding conference staff & facilities”
Reviews.Author: Starfish2u
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin for a 4-day conference. The rooms are well appointed (comfortable beds & linens, fast internet, nice bath), there were plenty of comfortable places to sit in the open lobby space, and the parking is safe and easy. What stood out was the hotel's customer service. Check-in/out, conference catering and service, room service, and concierge service were all top-notch. This work trip was quite enjoyable thanks, in no small part, to the Westin hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stress-free surprise layover”
Reviews.Author: 7sunset
Reviews.Content: I missed my connecting flight at LAX due to our flight being delayed by 5 hours... And of course the airline, which shall remain unnamed, did not put us up for the night. I got a last minute room at the Westin and was very pleases. Pluses: - free airport shuttle which I waited for no more than 1 minute to catch - super comfortable beds - less airplane noise than I was expecting Cons: - mainly the limited/expensive dining options if you get in late at night

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: jhaleyusa
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at LAX and this hotel is great. Clean rooms with plenty of space. Very nice clean beds. Bathrooms were very clean and neat. Hall ways were clean, well lit, and quiet. Room service was quick and fantastic and did not "stick it to you" with the prices. The lobby bar is amazing! The staff was friendly and happy to make any kind of drink you may order. You can also eat at the bar. Service there is fast too. Shuttle to and from the airport is free and runs 24/7. All and all this was a great hotel. The only negative thing I can even think of is that you hear the planes taking off and landing all the time......but you ARE at the airport after all !!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights, because the location happened to be convenient for me. I got a good deal online: buy one night, get the second for 40% off. Here are some observations about the hotel: PARKING: Expensive at ~$25/day with tax -- but this is fairly typical of hotels around here. SIZE: The hotel is huge. Be prepared for a bit of a walk to your room. NEIGHBORHOOD: Not much here, although there is some sort of a cafe with internet access on the same block. Hotel is about a 3-minute drive from LAX. ROOM: The furniture was clearly a few years old. However, it was in good enough shape, and everything felt clean. The "Heavenly Bed" featured at Westin properties is truly amazing. The flat-screen HDTV is huge. I stayed on the fifth floor, and didn't notice too much noise coming from outside the room (but I am admittedly a heavy sleeper). This hotel does have a lot of extra charges, so be careful. The bottled water in the room costs $4.50. If you move items in the minibar to make room for your own things, they charge a $25 restocking fee. Internet access is around $13 per day. In-room movies can cost upwards of $16 each. One nice thing is that they have computers in the lobby from which you can print an airline boarding pass for free. This is a good bonus for an airport hotel, and is especially important if you're flying on an airline where early check-ins are beneficial (e.g., Southwest).

Reviews.Title: “Do not honor third party reservations”
Reviews.Author: Audry B
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation through hotels.com for a music conference for my son. I called the Westin the morning he left and confirmed his reservation with the hotel. When he arrived they told him hotels.com cancelled his reservation. We called hotels.com and they did not cancel it. After several phone calls back and forth we were told by the Westin that they were sold out and they did not have to honor our reservation through hotels.com (expedia). The person from the Westin was very rude and told me that is states on hotels.com (expedia) website that they don't guarantee the reservation (although they charged my credit card for it the day it was booked) . I tried several times to talk to the manager at the Westin. I got his voicemail and he never returned my call. After 2.5 hours on the phone hotels.com found him a place to stay. In hotels.com defense they gave me a $100 credit to use in the future. Like I want to go through that again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One night only”
Reviews.Author: Brisboy77
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in this hotel before heading on to San Francisco. As our flight from Australia arrived at 6am, I had emailed ahead regarding checking in early. I exchanged several email with a guy called Terry, who was super helpful. Buses from all LAX terminals to this hotel leave every 10 mins or so. Upon arrival around 7am only one of the two booked rooms was ready, but this was ok as we only planned on showering and heading off sightseeing anyway. The rooms were very comfortable. The beds up to the usual level of comfort you get at the Westin. Concierge was very helpful at giving us directions and how information on how to navigate the LA buses. Dinner in 'The Daily Grilll' restaurant was quite pleasant,, but nothing to rave about. This is an airport hotel, so most stays would be one or two night, but for this purpose this hotel is just fine and I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like a VIP”
Reviews.Author: BMG4ME
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum member of the Starwood Preferred Guest Program, and I recently stayed in this lovely hotel. There were so many good things about this hotel that I hardly know where to start. The first was the amazing upgrade I received, to the Chairman's Suite. Their upgrade policy doesn't usually give such a generous upgrade (so don't complain if you don't get one like this!) so I was especially pleased to become Chairman for a day! I also liked the parking convenience (if not a little expensive) where you could park right at the back of the hotel in covered parking, and be in your room in a couple of minutes. What a great hotel, I recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep deprivation and uncaring staff - not going back”
Reviews.Author: Sightseeing_Cynic
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, the Westin LAX for many years used to be one of our favorites at LAX. Sadly, it has suffered a steep decline in customer service. I would not recommend this hotel for people wanting uninterrupted sleep, or for visitors to LA looking for humane treatment after a long flight. Stay somewhere else. Starwood Preferred? I wouldn't recommend it for you, dear member, either. I arrived at midnight, tired, after a long-delayed flight. As a member, I automatically just lined up in that line, only to be completely ignored by the desk clerk. The desk clerk kept taking guests from the other line, presumably because the "Preferred" clerk was off having a tea-break. Eventually, the Preferred clerk arrived back, and motioned me forward. No "hello", no "nice to see you, just a bored, unfriendly "name?". Then he couldn't find my reservation. He sighed, went and got the night manager, and both of them stood there for the next several minutes slowly scrolling their way through the system - at midnight. Hello... person needing to sleep here... Eventually they found half of my booking, but had trouble reconciling the two nights, presumably because they were prepaid using points. After a dozen more minutes they got that sorted out - then put me in a room with two single beds. So we started over. After a half hour more delay, they finally sent me to an incredibly noisy room that faced the runway - exactly the type of room I had requested that they not put me in. By then, even I was too tired to care, so I turned in. Then around one a.m., a party started in the room next door (warning to guests: the Westin has very thin walls). I called down but no one called or came up or did anything to stop the noise, so after fifteen minutes, I knocked on the door myself and the guests were kind enough to stop. Roll on to this morning - despite my placing a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door, a Westin day manager with a clipboard knocked on my door and woke me up to tell me that it was "time for me to check out." I told him I was booked for two nights and was desperately trying to get some sleep. Sorry, but you need to check out, he said. No, I don't, I replied. Please check. After a little more prodding, he checked. Oh, you're right. He then apologized (the only manager that apologized for anything during this entire stay) - but by that time I was awake. Roll on to the evening. I'm dead tired by now and have just fallen asleep when the Duty Manager (a man who would perhaps be better suited to working at a morgue than in live customer service) wakes me up to tell me that my credit card has been declined and he needs another card. I told him that is not possible because it is a Gold Amex, and completely up to date, and asked him to retry it, but he refused to. So I offered to give him another card over the phone. He said no, you can't do this over the phone, we need to have the physical card to swipe. I said, look, the rooms are prepaid, the card you have is fine, I'm sleeping, if you need another card for the incidentals, I'll give it to you in the morning. He gets testy and responds by saying if you don't provide me with the card, you can't continue to stay in the hotel. Say what? I remind him that I've prepaid for my two nights (the card is being used for incidentals only.) He says it doesn't matter - he needs to swipe the card, or I can't stay - even though I've pre-paid for the room! At this point, I'm getting annoyed. I've paid for the room with points earned from hundreds of stays at Starwood properties. And this is the third time I've been deprived of sleep in less than 24 hours at the Westin LAX, and I'm exhausted. I call Amex. They confirm my card is 100% fine - the hotel made an error while entering the credit card date - they entered 11 instead of 14. I ask them to hold, get dressed, go down to the lobby and ask for the manager. I put him on the phone with Amex. Amex confirms to him that the hotel made a mistake. The rooms are fully paid for (and had been all along). The incidentals will be covered, if he just enters the date correctly. We hang up. I ask the manager for an apology. He refuses. He says instead that if I don't like the service, I can leave. At this point, I'm stunned. And beyond tired, and really frustrated. I can't believe the level of tone-deafness on display. The guy shows no understanding of the concept that the primary reason that anyone needs a hotel room is because they want to sleep. I don't know who to feel more sorry for - myself, future weary travelers, or Starwood shareholders. Anyway, sorry for the long rant, but that's what these reviews are for - sharing. Speaking of which, I am now writing this from the Hilton LAX, where the people were nice on check in and treated me like a fellow human being (thank you!) I'd forgotten how nice the Hilton LAX is. Now that I'm back, I would strongly suggest that visitors to the LA Airport area stay here instead of the Westin - it's usually around the same price, but closer to the airport, the amenities are similar, the food is better, but most importantly, it appears to be staffed by caring humans. As for the Westin LAX, unless you enjoy being treated like the meat in a sausage machine by uncaring duty managers, and constantly deprived of sleep, you may want to avoid it. Life's too short, and "Preferred" clearly isn't what it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: SusiePCalx
Reviews.Content: The room size is very nice but the furniture is old looking. The lobby is beautiful but the room doesn't match the feel of the lobby. The walls are very thin and if your room is facing the road, you'll hear everything. We were attending a convection and we got a very good deal for 5 nights, otherwise I wouldn't pay full price for this hotel. The hotel gives you the choice of declining housekeeping in exchange for vouchers or award points. LOCATION: There is nothing around the hotel apart for a "Subway" so you'd need a taxi or rent a car. I suggest renting a car cause the taxi ride are super expensive. A 5 min ride (no traffic) is about 10-15 Dollars. The restaurant on site is fairly good, both the food and service is nice. The reception staff was wonderful and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite sure about the hype here”
Reviews.Author: LQGuy
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel prior to our trip overseas. Having stayed at many an LAX hotel location (use to live in So. California), I've now stayed at about half of the larger hotels in the area. The Westin LAX is not a bad hotel. But if like me, you are loyal to Starwood hotels, then this one might be slightly under-whelming. It's clean, fairly well maintained, and contains typical Westin amenities, decor, and bedding. I can't say that the welcome was anything to get excited about. Nor were there staff jumping to provide help with our luggage, or much of anything else (they seemed to be slightly under-staffed, particularly at the front desk). On our return journey, we stayed at the Sheraton. I will say that the Westin is the nicer choice between the two. Again, it's not a horrible hotel. Isn't infested with bed-bugs. Or anything of that nature. Perhaps we just hit it at the wrong time. But we also never encountered anything that made it stand out as anything other than "just a hotel".

Reviews.Title: “Location and service win out”
Reviews.Author: JayW913
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times and, if you have business in various areas of the LA metro area, you can do a lot worse. Face it: LAX is the only thing in LA that is relatively near every other point in the city. I often have meetings downtown and in Santa Monica... and often the Inland Empire on one end of those. This location offers the ability to never have more than an hour drive "home"afterward if you know your freeways. Easy to get to 405, 110, 10 and 105 within a few mins. The service is fantastic. Every time, the staff is top-notch. Two restaurant options in the hotel is nice. The fitness center is one of the better ones I've seen. Try to get a room on the north side. Better view and less noise from departing aircraft. If you have young kids that love airplanes, you can likely keep them entertained for hours... BIG planes endlessly fly within sight. Kinda cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: nix47_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night after flight from Australia. Staff excellent and room large but unfortunately it overlooked the airport. Good shuttle to Manhatten beach and its worth a visit and somewhere to eat other than in hotel. Last shuttle back at night is 8.30 so no late partying on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Holidays in Westin (Los Angeles Airport)”
Reviews.Author: Konstantin K
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location near the airport and city center, at the same time the rooms are very quiet. Friendly staff. I advise to visit the restaurant at the hotel - very tast. AND !!! of course :) order a cappuccino with croissants in the lobby:)

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the place”
Reviews.Author: dorisplum
Reviews.Content: the westin has friendly staff and the concierge even got me a little fridge for my room as I was going to be there for 4 nights. It was great to have it to keep food and drinks in. The room was kept fairly clean. the sheets and bathroom were clean but the desk always seemed to have dust on it. My wakeup call never occured which was a downer.. Otherwise I think it was good. Parking was reduced to $10 per night because I was on a course so that was fantastic as opposed to $24 per night. The lobby is nice and big and the pool is outside but was ok as was the spa. Noone was in the pool or spa either and was nice to have it to ourselves. I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great old airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coleman M
Reviews.Content: If you want traditional style business hotel service go with The Westin Lax. Great staff, facilities and good (but old) rooms. Bedding is exceptional. Easy parking and great concierge.Has a spa and pool too.Local shops are not bad and easy shittle to all terminals but get there early as luggage space is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel especially for weekend/short-term trips”
Reviews.Author: Wayne R
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really clean, staff exceptionally nice and location premium to freeway access and airport. Westin's have some of the greatest beds in the world - they're heavenly! Also love Starwood hotels and the ease of utilizing their website and points programs to book hotels like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Am I a celebrity”
Reviews.Author: Connie K
Reviews.Content: The Westin Los Angeles Airport do their best to treat me like a valued customer. The courtesy of the front desk, the sparkling clean room, and the comfort of the beds make this the place to stay. I am happy to stay for business and pleasure. Wish they included wifi. Good location and quiet! Love it and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “overnighting at lax”
Reviews.Author: esarisky2
Reviews.Content: this is a good hotel near the airport, nice updated rooms, good value, and nice happy hour at the bar in the restaurant. Easy check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel near the LAX Airport”
Reviews.Author: sunman1999
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA and stay near the airport for business and conferences between 3-6 times per year. I enjoy the professional staff and furnishings at the Westin LAX. I don't like paying the internet fees, they are complimentary at other hotels in the area. The rooms are meticulously maintained since I have stayed over the last 15 years.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good value and very convenient if need to be in and out of LAX”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedBusTrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice this week, had stayed here several times before. It continues to be very well run, and extremely good value. Seems that it is priced much lower than several other major hotels which are just slightly closer to the LAX terminals. It is well with the extra few minutes on the shuttle or in your rental car, since it is comfortable and very good value. I will continue to stat here whenever I am in LA and need to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A little old but nice updated rooms”
Reviews.Author: colonialhk
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for a short stay to be close to the airport. The bathrooms are old, but the rooms have most of all the new bells and whistles, new flat screen tv, alarm clock, fridge, and air system. The lobby is also good. Also the restaurant in the lobby the Daily Grill is a very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the Bad & the UGLY”
Reviews.Author: Rush2112Equality
Reviews.Content: Friendly check-in = good Found out next day I was charge for parking even though I came in with others on the shuttle and was never asked if I had a car = Bad After check-in ordered room service around 10 p.m. and got call around 10:30 saying they was a problem with 'the machine' but my order would be right up = Bad Got a call around 10 minutes later saying they were out of the item I wanted, would I like something else = Bad I said since I had waited 40 minutes already and it was 20 minutes before 11 p.m. could I order a sandwich from the 'late night' menu (which started at 11 p.m.). She said 'let me check' and then said "No". I asked if I really had to call back in 20 minutes after all I had been through and she laughed and said yes, I had to call back = UGLY When I finally did get some food the server (Walter) was very professional and apologized and said he would talk to the manager and try to get me a credit = good Never got a credit = Bad The next day housekeeping did not service my room so I called 'service express' and was told my group must have opted into the 'green option'. They did not and the one person I talked to in my group who asked not to have housekeeping was given a $5 a day credit. I got nothing plus no housekeeping = Bad I asked to be transferred to a manager and was connected to valet = Bad I asked again to be transferred to a manager and got voicemail, left a message, and the manager never called me back = UGLY I have asked our meeting planners to take this hotel off our our list. We spent a couple of hundred thousand dollars for our weekend meeting and management does not seem to care about customer service. The noise from the airport was really loud too.

Reviews.Title: “short stay”
Reviews.Author: Timp9434
Reviews.Content: Ideal for airport and really super service and comfort compared to many airport hotels. highly recommended - good pool and poolside beds, restaurant and gym.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place....”
Reviews.Author: Michael E
Reviews.Content: I travel out of LAX several times a month...when i have an "early" flt i always stay here so i can sleep longer and take a 5 min shuttle ride to the terminal.... hotel suite is awesome...food is great (try thre french dip)...Mgmt is very accomidating ...the SG check in is quik and effencient... BTW the Valets "rock" i hva every expensive cars and exotics as well...usually i wouldnt bring a rare exotic and valet at a Westin but i do here because they go OUT OF THIER WAY...to look out after your property...no damage...not even a smudge from someone leaning on it... Thx so much...i will always be back... Mike

Reviews.Title: “Stay away....very far away.”
Reviews.Author: Zingo44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disaster. It is old. It is run down. The air system is musty and probably much worse if you were able to truly sample the air quality. The room was moderately clean. The restaurant was horrible. We checked in due to getting bumped on a flight from Vancouver to Hawaii. When we received our room the air system produced a horrible odour. Very musty. We immediately asked for a change of room. The front desk complied, however, the second room was almost as bad as the first. The Los Angeles Airport Marriott is a much better choice. We stayed there on our return and were very pleased with all aspects of the hotel. Great rooms. Very good restaurant. Fantastic service. The price of the two hotels are comparable.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and go to the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: DCAdvisor
Reviews.Content: This was the worst Starwood property that I have ever stayed at. The rooms were dated and not clean, I had to change rooms more than once. The first room had burn marks on the sofa and the room was not clean. After 45 min, I got a new room and it had a heavy cigar smell. I turned on the AC and cigar smell came through the vents. I asked for another room and after another 35 min I received another room. I set my bags down and then go into the bathroom to find short curly hairs on the robe and towels. I was more than frustrated. The management did not seem to give me the respect that I deserve. Starwood Preferred customer service was very apologetic and would have given me a full refund on the spot, but could not reverse the charges, because it was purchased through a travel site. The night manager did not want to reverse the changes when the travel site called. This was the dirtiest hotel I have stayed at and the worst management response I have ever received. I pre-paid for 2 nights and stayed at Sheraton the second night, which was a superior property. I will say the loby and entrance were apealing and the resturant seemed to be up to the Westin standards. My issues were the rooms and the customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome”
Reviews.Author: RuediAbtwil_Schweiz
Reviews.Content: From the check-in to the check-out the best SPG-Hotel experience of this West Coast trip. Staff was friendly, efficient and caring. The Bar / Restaurant on the ground floor served up one of the best cheeseburgers I've ever has and trust me, there have been a few! An added extra is of course the balcony with great views of approaching aircraft. Will spend a night there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Delta260
Reviews.Content: We only spent a night here recently on a stop-over from Melb to NYC, but would highly recommend as a well priced, quiet & comfortable hotel conveniently located near LAX. A free shuttle bus runs every 15 to 20 mins & we spent little time waiting for one at either end of our trip. Early check-in was made possible upon request with friendly & attentive staff who went out of their way to assist us following a very long & sleepless flight - so appreciated!! We requested a room on the street side of the hotel after reading reviews concerning disturbances from barking dogs (this was confirmed by staff - a pound is situated next door to the hotel!).....double glazed windows & a peaceful night's sleep won hands down over dogs, planes & airport views!! We spent a fun afternoon in Santa Monica (approx 20 mins drive away) & a taxi ride cost us $46 with tips.....HOWEVER....we managed to catch a bus back to the hotel after dinner running direct to the airport & stopping opposite the hotel ....and the trip (whilst slower) cost us $1 each!!! We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment except to say we elected to buy breaky at the airport as menu options appeared high end (of course we found all airport options just as high!!). Would definitely recommend this hotel to those seeking a really convenient place to stay close to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: aussiecocky
Reviews.Content: We stayed early October in a traditional double bed room and saw the planes take off and were surprised at the lack of noise !! I liked everything about this hotel, excellent rooms, meals and shuttle service. However, as a tea drinker I would have like some teabags provided. The hotel met our needs and we are glad we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & super close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: dconnau
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before a flight from LAX. Very nice looking hotel, pictures on Trip Advisor look just like the room we had. Big hotel, so lots of walking. Room was older but in overall good shape. Would stay here again. Even though it's close to airport, room was quiet, and comfortable. Only down side was parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The WiFi Problem - It's very real”
Reviews.Author: TravisP
Reviews.Content: If you need to do business or any kind of online interaction during your stay at the Westin, better be able to do it on your phone because your speeds via your cell data plan will be far superior to even the $16 "high speed" package the Westin provides. I spent an entire evening cursing and refreshing to get even the simplest task done (like writing this review). If you don't plan to use the WiFi, there's nothing objectionable at the Westin. And you get to watch jets fly by your window for hours, which is either fun or annoying depending on how you feel about aviation. But don't buy the WiFi. Just don't. In an ideal world, the Westin would be honest and simple not offer it at all!

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: robertcut
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters to those who are flying out of the airport and only need a place to stay for the night. They have a dedicated line for airline flight crews. The line to check in when we arrived in the evening was very long and they didn't have enough front desk presonnel to cover it. We only stayed one night and didn't see much of the hotel. The rooms were average for a Westin. Nothing too special, somewhat older bathroom that looked like it had been remodeled, but was starting to show some age. The rest of the room was fine, but nothing better than average.

Reviews.Title: “ss11@lisco.com”
Reviews.Author: irene345
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference recently. The staff was wonderful, especially the housekeepers, who kept the room immaculate. And - lovely surprise - the hotel seems to use unscented detergent. Usually I suffer from the highly scented cleaning chemicals used in hotels but there was none at the Westin. The hotel itself is well designed - the air conditioning is quiet and effective, kept the room at the desired temp without blowing cold air directly on you. There is a small window in each room that opens. My room was quiet and well-insulated from corridor noises, but the hotel is located on a busy street near the airport and there was traffic noise. The bed was really comfy but was so high it was hard for me to get into it! I have only 3 complaints about my stay: 1) The water pressure in the shower was so low it took minutes to get wet. It was more like a mist. 2) The wifi - for $12.95/day no less - is slow to non-existent in the rooms and possibly even the lobby. I'm talking minutes to download a simple email, and lots of timeouts. This is just not acceptable for an LA hotel. (The staff did remove it from my bill when I asked them to.) 3) My bill showed bogus charges - for the in-room food, which I didn't use; and 2 extra charges for wifi. The desk clerk removed the charges but they shouldn't have been there. Check your bill. Also check the 'offers' page of the hotel's website - not the main Westin site, but the Westin LAX site. I was able to get an executive double for under $100 night based on one of the offers I found there. They also offered parking for $5/day (vs. $25/day standard), and coupons for free dessert at the hotel's restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: pakaxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days between flights ok overall certainly not westin brand quality more 3 1/2 star but extremely well priced just don't expect too much

Reviews.Title: “Smells Good For The Price!”
Reviews.Author: Cetinst
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a conference and it was comfortable and the staff was very helpful. I especially loved the cleaning crew grade A. The room service food was very good and quiet timely in delivery..The first thing you realize as you enter the hotel was the heavenly smell...I so loved the bar area a cute bar fly location.. The bed was huge I kept rolling and rolling in my California King bed...It was comfy..Only bad thing was the lack of a view I was smack dead insight of the Hotel parking lot...but overall great bang for my buck...keep in mind transportation is expensive so factor that into your trip if you want to sightsee or club hoop..:)

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel Located Near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: JCD
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night on my Starwood points, so the price was right. For those of you who are members, it was only 4,000 points, which I felt was a bargain, considering the convenience. Normally, I would have rated this hotel a four because of the amentities (health club, heated pool, restaurant onsite, general appearance), but it's not in the best neighborhood, so you need to drive to a restaurant if you don't want to eat at the hotel, and it was noisy (ask for a higher floor). in addition, there was a parking fee and I was unable to swim laps in the pool because it was being cleaned and they said it would be unaccessible for three hours, by which time we had to check out. Overall though, the room was clean and the check-in was efficient, so it met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Should not be called a Westin”
Reviews.Author: Alissa C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights Sept 27 to 29th, 2011. Check in was fine, I booked for a traditional double bed and when I arrived they said I got upgraded to a deluxe double bed room. Since I'm a gold SPG I think I'm supposed to get one upgrade if there is availability. So I asked what the difference was between the two (traditional and deluxe). The guy who checked me in said basically it's called a deluxe since it's on a higher floor and supposedly less noise. But here is my biggest complaint, it was SOOOOOOOOOOOOO loud I couldn't sleep both nights. He said that since my room faced the street and not the airport side that it should be quieter, but I can hear all the street noise. This hotel needs to better sound proof their rooms. Also as others mentioned, it doesn't have the heavenly shower that most people look forward to in a Westin! The hotel is the last hotel on the row going to the airport so I felt like I didn't hear much plane noise. Also the location is great because it's right next to the 405. I did feel like the rooms were pretty clean for the most part and I like the fact the parking garage is attached to the hotel. I've stayed at the Sheraton down the street before and their parking is across the street which I find a little annoying. However, I will NOT ever come back to this hotel. It's too loud to get good rest. I also don't like the fact that they have a stocked refrigerator where if you move something they'll charge you. I like to have cold waters without paying a leg and an arm for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to LAX and great service.”
Reviews.Author: Kerry A
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to USA and we finished off a month of touring at The Westin and found it to be surprisingly quiet considering how close it is to the airport. The staff were all friendly and happy to help in any way. Sergio our waiter in the restaurant was outstanding and was a genuinely nice guy!! A little tip for us Aussies and UK travellers...more tea bags please!! The hotel was our last link on our tour not somewhere we had selected ourselves so we were pleasantly surprised and would definitely recommend it..especially for short stopovers as there is a shuttle bus to the airport every 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a conference”
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: I attended a four-day conference here, from 8AM until 7PM each day, sleeping only one night in the hotel since I live within 1 1/2 hours. The hotel was comfortable and the prices very reasonable, especially considering that it is a stone's throw from the airport. (Note that you LAX isn't pedestrian friendly, take the shuttle.) I really enjoyed the layout of the atrium/dining/bar area. It was a great place to network after the event or hang out with a couple of friends. The food at the Daily Grill ranged from good to excellent and the prices were reasonable. The breakfast buffet was a little pricey, but that's my only complaint. All in all, for a hotel close to a major airport this is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT place to be at!!!”
Reviews.Author: hbsurfer1
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel! Rooms are so nice to be in! and the executive lunge is great! Even for being so close to LAX you are NOT bothered at all! If you want a bit of "luxury" at a nice price...this is your place! We enjoy staying here when we are near! Make it yours and you won't regret it! They could go a bit cheaper on the parking but...it's LA after all...right?!

Reviews.Title: “Below average from other Westins”
Reviews.Author: Spiritnsoul1
Reviews.Content: For my business travelers, this hotel is ok for a very quick stay but not for a long comfortable stay as most Westins. I am a platinum member and was upgraded but to a very outdated room. Beds are the standard fluffy beds at this hotel, furniture in rooms a little ran down, showers do not have the dual shower head that I absolutely love and look forward to at every Westin stay. Staff friendly but did not provide all hotel amenities until being asked (executive lounge, fitness area, etc). If I am in LA for more than a day I would not recommend this hotel. It is very good for a day layover that has a great location by the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Best Business Hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: SlaveyTolev
Reviews.Content: I am a sales executive and i travel to Los Angeles about once or twice every two/three months. I always stay at the Westin Los Angeles Airport as it is convenient, very well priced, clean and the service is outstanding. The Executive Assistant, Ms. Lakeithia Terry and her colleagues make my stay comformtable and pleasant. They have all my preferences memorized down to the kind of pillows I like (not too soft), my in and out parking ticket and floor and elevator distance preference. While the Westin LAX is not home, it comes pretty close to it ;) Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a not so great area”
Reviews.Author: Mike V
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a LAX area hotel the past three years while attending an annual conference. This year the host hotel was the Westin, and it was a wonderful move by the conference staff. Great sevice, convenient to the airport, good dining on site, and close to rental car outlets. With no rental car available, dining in the area is a struggle, and the walking unpleasant. We used the hotel as a base to see SC sites and found it very convenient to dining while driving only a short distance. Pleasant and helpful staff and a great happy hour. What more could you want!!

Reviews.Title: “Good standard of hotel near airport.”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveller16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before our long haul plane trip home and it was very comfortable and well set up. It is not super deluxe but it is clean and very comfortable. Service was very good and the steak house is well set up (massive meals though). Bar in restaurant area was friendly and service was quick and efficient. Staff were very friendly and approachable and we asked for scales to weigh our luggage and they were brought up promptly. For what most people would use this hotel for - stopover and/or being close to the airport we found it met all our needs. Hallway decor is a bit tired, but the rooms were fine. Neutral tones and unfussy decor. We are fussy about our lodgings and we really could not complain about this hotel. The red trolley bus that takes you to Manhattan Beach and some shopping precincts is just across the road and only costs $5 per ticket which you can purchase on bus. Airport shuttles come every 15-20 mins and are free. If you are looking for a character filled hotel with special touches, then this probably will not be for you, but for good value overnight or weekend stays close to the airport we have stayed in far worse. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service AND Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas37
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect location if you are coming in and going out of LAX. It is located only blocks away from major freeways that take you anywhere in the greater LA area. For an older hotel the rooms are in very good condition and the self park level is close to the back entrance with security cameras. While the rates are comparable to other large hotels in the area, it is the customer service that brings me back each time. Every employee I have encountered has gone above and beyond helpful from changing rooms ( party across the hall) to providing turn by turn driving directions when asked.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: we stay here every time we visit family in LA .. great rooms... great staff... clean... no complaints at all.... nice bar. if you're looking to be pampered and blah blah this isnt the place... but if you just want a good nights sleep and good service in a really nice place this is it. perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wesitn will price gouge you.”
Reviews.Author: Qiitxx
Reviews.Content: Be careful the wesitn might just charge for standing in the lobby. Why not, they charge you for everthinvg else. I almost payed more in fees than I did for the hotel room. Here are just a few of the fees: $22 to self park, about $30 for valet, $ 12 for the Internet . Now to be fair all of the hotels along that strip proably charge you for parking and Internet, but the hotel staff seem to be so callus and indifferent that it made you angry to pay the fees. The shereton is a much better deal, it has a Starbucks right in the hotel and they don't price gouge you. And not to mention the drinks at the bar are way too expensive. So if you can get past all the fees then the hotel is pretty nice, clean, and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Spend as little time here as possible”
Reviews.Author: smox62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and stinky. They advertise a "breathe" campaign because its now smoke free. However you'd have to rip this place down and rebuild it to rid it of the disgusting ashtray smell in the rooms. Aside from that its close to the airport. If you must layover here then spend as little time as possible in your room. The Daily Grill restaurant attached to the lobby serves a decent burger and brew. If you're an SPG member, this hotel will not qualify for a 'stay' unless you book it through the website or directly with SPG which will cost you 25-50% more than expedia or hotel.com When booking through hotwire, the four-star hotel is almost always this one at about $80.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for an airport stay”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: The Westin is one of those big hotels along Century Blvd, the main road leading to LAX. The hotel has obviously been there for a long time as you can tell by the building but everything is well maintained. The furniture and fixtures in the guest rooms look a bit dated but it's clean and comfortable. There is a 42" flat screen TV. Wifi is $12.95, parking with in and out privileges is $22.50 a day. There is a Daily Grill restaurant in the lobby serving steaks, fish, burgers, etc. My room overlooked Century Blvd. but I was on the 10th floor and couldn't hear the traffic at all. The windows are thick. The room rate was very competitive compared to other airport hotels nearby and even cheaper than some of the budget chains like Hilton Garden Inn, Courtyard, etc. Guess they make it up on the parking, wifi and food and beverage. I had a strange experience with the room rate: I knew from checking Westin's website beforehand that rooms were available and what the rate should be, but my trip was last minute so I didn't bother to make a reservation, figuring I could just walk in. To my surprise, the front desk quoted me a price much higher than what I saw on Westin's website earlier that day. I told them their own website quoted a lower rate and they told me walk-in rates are always higher and they couldn't give me the website rate. So I stood at the front desk and called Westin's 800 number, made a reservation at the lower rate, then checked in. The whole things was ridiculous but the desk clerk was polite and apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in the middle of the night”
Reviews.Author: MrTed
Reviews.Content: We booked rooms using points for the night before and the night after our Hawaii flights. On the last night, our flight arrived late and we didn't make it to the hotel until almost 1am. Even at that hour, the front desk staff was friendly and welcoming. We ordered room service and it was delivered quickly, by a wonderful gentleman by the name of Walter, and they even brought us a full pitcher of water and two glasses when I asked for ice water. The towels in the bathroom appeared to have been used, so I called down to ask for clean towels and a huge stack of towels and wash cloths was brought up immediately. We asked for a feather-free room as we are both allergic to down and this request was accommodated with no problem. The hotel is very close to the airport and the shuttle runs the hotel-airport loop every 15 minutes or so. The first night we had a room on the side of the hotel facing the runway, so we could hear planes taking off and landing until about 1am, but the second night we were on the other side of the building and it was very quiet. There are signs at the ends of the hallways asking guests to be please be quiet as others are resting and I found this to be a nice touch. Overall, this was a wonderful place for us to rest, eat, and shower before and after our flights and we will definitely stay here again should the need arise.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Relaxed and definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherAlan
Reviews.Content: We landed in LAX, collected our car and headed straight to the hotel to drop off our bags! Arrived at 11am, they already had a room available for us so we didn't hesitate in taking it and having a moment of relaxation. The minute we walked in to the room and saw the bed we knew that sight-seeing would have to wait while we relaxed after our 14 hour flight! Great ammenities. Awesome Location. Great Staff and wonderful relaxing environment. Handy pool for a hot afternoon and great customer service. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: I left another airport hotel in total disgust and accidentally landed at The Westin. Wow, what a pleasant surprise. From the front desk staff at check-in to the housekeeping staff, to the bellmen who got my shuttle to the airport after I checked out, everyone was friendly, knowledgable, and so customer service-oriented! I was thoroughly impressed and can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way.”
Reviews.Author: GoCAT591
Reviews.Content: After a hellish flight that included our four year old being violently ill, the last thing we needed was hassles at the other end. Fortunately, the Westin LAX represents all that is good about the service culture in the US. Check-in was quick and pleasant and we were offered an upgraded room. The beds were amazing and the room was huge. Concierge could not have been more helpful in the morning, helping to arrange a limo (amazingly cheap!) to Anaheim when we couldn't face taking the shuttle with a sick child. We would highly recommend the Westin LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: I use an airport hotel because of it's location(close to airport) and we have an early morning flight. We have utilized the Westin several times and have always had a good experience. The key hotel attributes we look for are good beds, good restaurant and a frequent and reliable 24 hour hotel bus service to and from airport. The Westin has all of these attributes. Since we don't require the other services, I can't really rate them.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, helpful and easy.”
Reviews.Author: RICHSHAR
Reviews.Content: We had a long flight from NZ and arrived around 10.00am. We were given a nice room on the higher floors straight away. This was great after a long 14 hour flight. We used the shuttle bus service from the Hotel o visit two Malls and go to the beach. This an amazingly easy and cheap way to have a quick look around as we were flying out to Vegas the next morning. Overall it was the service experience that made it for us. Would recommend and stay again

Reviews.Title: “a reasonable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jamesons_drinker
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night after an evening flight to LAX. Shuttle to the hotel was fairly regular (about a 10 min wait). Bit of a queue checking in, but we finally got our room. Room and en-suite were reasonably spacious and quiet but had a musty smell. No doubt, we could have asked for another room, but we decided to live with it. Staff at the bar were friendly and efficient that evening. The following morning I had a quick work out in the well equippped gym (it was nearly full at 5.30 a.m. -these west coast people take their health seriously). After the work out, we were served a great breakfast by staff who were just a good as the previous evening. On leaving, the concierge quickly called up a taxi to take us on our way.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel close to LAX with a great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: JimGCarmel
Reviews.Content: I went to LAX for a quick 2 night trip for a Convention. The Hotel was built many years ago and it has changed hands at least one time that I am aware of. I think it use to be a Doubletree Hotel. The room was a standard King very large and in good shape. The airport is like a block away but air traffic noise was not bad I must say. The workout room was medium size it seemed a little worn in the seats of the wightlifting machines. The pool and hot tub are large and in good conditon. The price for the rooms where reasonable. The "Heavenly Beds" lived up to their reputation of very comfortable feel. The room came with block out drapes so you can get a good nights sleep. The restaurant was great it had a nice appearance and the food was excellant with large portions. The fresh baked bread was fanastic. They have their own covered parking garage. On the second floor one of the meeting rooms has its own movie theater. It was used for the convention. I don't know that it is used for anything else. If they would run movies there for guest I think they would have a real crowd pleaser. The movie room was large it could hold I would guess about 200 people. They have a large ballroom to handle large conventions if need be. My convention had about 1,000 people. They had airport shuttles available. All and all the hotel was a great experience and for the money they charge it was worth the price of the stay. I would go back to the hotel if the need arised again no question.

Reviews.Title: “Nice One”
Reviews.Author: Sophia_CN
Reviews.Content: Good location. Decent room. Wonderful facility. Only the wifi is too slow ... and costed nearly $12. Normally the lobby's wifi should be free , but it costs as well.

Reviews.Title: “Insanely comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: kandzhawk
Reviews.Content: Mom had a Dr. Appt in L.A. and I accompanied her, we stayed and extra night and saw the Ghetty(s). The price was reasonable (under a 90 bucks) and the location great w/o a car...parking lot shares the driveway with rental car lot. We got one cheap last minute, but could have easily taken the city transport... one night took the free trolly that picked up at the hotel and went to Manhatten beach. Warning if you have a vehicle, daily parking is pricy ($20) and varies by season (we overheard) something to consider. The hotel pool is average-small. The hot tub (something we were looking forward to after walking all day) was TINY, only fits 4 people w/o touching knees with strangers...not really a problem for us as this is a VERY business friendly hotel and both nights we were the only people using it, no one at the pool either). The well stocked gym however was packed in the evenings. The room over looked the airport and was surprisingly quiet. I am a light sleeper and bring headphones at times to cancel out noise, but did not need them, windows are well insulated. Did notice lots of flight attendants and stewardesses coming and going all night (I stay up late...) The food in the restaurant is very delicious and you pay for it, but its really good. I highly recommend the Bacon Mac n Cheese... sounds tacky right? Wrong, award winning stuff with applewood smoked bacon and sauteed mushrooms. Note: bar menu has a nicely priced happy hour with food and drink specials. The room is a little tight, but well appointed with modern decor (be mindful of the fridge, just moving an item to put in my personal water bottle incured a charge, however they did remove it when I complained... there were additional charges the next day when I stored some medicine in there...again removed, glad I checked the bill). Lastly (the reason for writing this review) the beds. Fantastic. The duvet is washed as is the linen (pima cotton) between guests, and is spotless white. Looks, feels and smells fresh. But the comfort is beyond compare. They sell all their bedding and even the insanely dreamy matress & pillows at outrageous prices, (there is a website dedicated for this) and it's probably worth every penny, I just don't have a lot of pennies these days.. But if at all possible I will try to stay at a Westin again as the beds were so heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Fun spur of the moment trip”
Reviews.Author: sumgirl5
Reviews.Content: We had so much fun on our spur of them moment vacation. We got this off of priceline and were so scared to try a new hotel. This one is very nice and we noticed a lot of pilots and stewards/stewardess stay here. The location was a little off at first but it was super close to the freeways. We ended up having a ball at Universal Studios as well. The only down side is the parking fee everyday but you do get in and out priv's.

Reviews.Title: “Very good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack_Islington
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times, and it is a very good option for LAX. Close to the airport, and decent restaurant for an airport hotel. Not the most modern rooms but very functional for short stays. Only negative is long lines at check in. Very good value, cheap for LA. Highly recommend for LAX.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are dirty and old and have a foul odor”
Reviews.Author: Thomas B
Reviews.Content: I was given a suite and once I opened my door, the room smelled like urine. Never stayed in a room that smelled that bad. And to top it off, my room was facing the airport runway and all I heard was planes taking off and landing. I would avoid staying at this hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Making Improvements. Solid 3 star property.”
Reviews.Author: FilmDave
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sheraton, Hilton and Westin at LAX. The Westin is the cleanest and most comfortable of the three. That said, LAX doesn't have a luxury hotel so if you are looking to stay at a 4 star (or higher) property you will need to stay at the Ritz Carlton in Marina Del Rey or in other parts of Los Angeles. Check in was fast. The lobby is undergoing a remodel right now, but it didn't seem to be a big issue for any of the services. Parking is convenient and attached to the elevators. My room was dated but clean. The shower had good pressure and the towels were new. I wouldn't want to stay in the area for more than 1 or 2 nights. It lacks charm. But, if you need to be on an early departure or you arrive late, as I did, it's a solid 3 star bet. This is a hotel heavily used by airline crews and business people. It's not ideal for leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Green Hotel With Good Service, Heavenly Beds”
Reviews.Author: BigTravelr
Reviews.Content: I had problems with the front desk and housekeeping when I stayed there five years ago and raised them with the hotel, which was responsive. This time round, I had no problems at all. The front desk was friendly, I got the room I wanted (facing Century Blvd), and had a great stay. This is a really nice hotel even though it's an airport location. Decent gym, nice pool that is actually used by its guests. What I think is a nice improvement is the effort to go green. There's a recycling bin in my room and the hotel gives you a $5 food and beverage voucher if you turn down housekeeping services for the day. The breakfast was really good too. Beds are heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms in a lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kwatts1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a long way from the Downtown LA and Hollywood so you do need a car. I used public transport; all 63 stops. Service was very good as was the quality of the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy N
Reviews.Content: The other reviews about the long check in lines are true. However, once you have checked in everything else is great. The parking is expensive but everywhere you go in LA you have to pay to park, except TARGET! The hotel is realtive close to a Target and a grocery store so you don't have to drink the beverages nor eat their snack in the hotel room. They charge for that also. The customer service is the best I have seen in a long time. Do the breakfast at the hotel Daily Grill, it is great. The staff inside the Daily Grill was nice as well. Everyone had a smile on their faces and it seemed genuine. You could tell they really wanted to be there. I would stay here again, I think they could do better on the parking. Also, there is a parking garage less than 10 yards away that you can use for about 8 bucks a day. Also, they do not provide a shuttle to the beach as claimed on the web site. Two car rental places are next door and California was extremely easy to navigate without getting on the highways.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: djanni11
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the 3 nights we stayed here. The rooms are clean, beds are great but the decor in the rooms needs updating. It is a non smoking hotel but the colour on the Walls looks like nicotine yellow! I can heartily recommend the room service burger which was the best burger I have ever eaten! The airport transit bus is great, runs frequently and is close. Recommend getting out to manhattan beach which is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: g4willy
Reviews.Content: Great airport hotel and value for price. I commonly stay here and at another Starwood property. They were updating the lounge area during my last stay and looking forward to the addition. Hot tub was not quite hot enough but hopefully easy to rectify.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for airport convenience.”
Reviews.Author: Alisonjenk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for convenience of airport and business appointments. Restaurant was exceptional with service and the food was great. Guest rooms really comfortable and clean. Everything was easy.. whether I needed a coffee, access to my rental car in the parking lot, to checkin and check out. Have stayed at the Airport Marriott in the past but this is a better, cleaner hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy outdated and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chupito
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night in August and i am sorry to say that if you are looking for a hotel near the airport then it is just what you need ...now if you are looking for a nice comfortable and modern place to stay just try a different one...foubd the furniture,carpet and bathroom outdated and that is just not what i waz expecting from a westin

Reviews.Title: “Gouge City”
Reviews.Author: htnyc
Reviews.Content: Other reviews accurately depict the poor quality of the rooms and service. I agree that this is a dumpy hotel with the Westin brand on it. What other reviewers have not mentioned is the exorbant prices for things like parking ($24), wifi ($12.96), etc. You are kind of stuck here without other options. I usually never spend on incidentals and I am SPG Gold. I picked the property due to the name and low rate but will never return. After reading the positive reviews it is clear that the management is somehow affecting those. No reasonable human being could look at this property and think it was good.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Airport Hotel - Marvelous Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: divinetraveller
Reviews.Content: I was delighted to discover a home-away-from home near LAX! The consistent remarkable service - from Executive Office to Front Desk and everything in between - made my short stay in LA a wonderful experience. The outdoor pool is an oasis; it provided a lovely spot of fresh air and sun. The location is wonderful, but the staff is truly exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a quick trip to LA”
Reviews.Author: winegirlSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I hate LA traffic, so I always just stay at the Westin LAX. The complimentary shuttle takes you quickly to the hotel and you can settle into a clean, big hotel room. I try to take a taxi from there, but if you have to get a car it is less than a mile to the rental car companies with Thrifty being right next door. I know this isn't feasible for some areas in LA, but it works well for those around the airport. The Daily Grill has a great happy hour and the service is excellent. The Westin WorkOut room is perfect for a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for women business travelors”
Reviews.Author: NancyA5
Reviews.Content: I drove my car this time and felt totally safe in and out of the self parking garage after dark. There was security watching who came in and out. Love to feel safe when I travel. Also loved the comfortable and super quiet room. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone but great for women business travelors.

Reviews.Title: “one of the worst Westin's I have stayed”
Reviews.Author: boozitraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 day, and probably reason i stayed put was because rest of the hotels were all booked all the way into orange county. I think Starwood should just pull the Westin name out and put something else ..like maybe Motel 6. It is nothing but a sleepover hotel for folks going in and out of LAX , crew. The rooms and carpets are old and worn out. The room crew does not even bother replacing the coffee packets. They give you 2 stirrers and that is it. I watched for 3 days if they would replace it and they never did. They nickel and dime for eveything. Parking is $25/day. There is almost nothing available on this street.

Reviews.Title: “Better Choices Available”
Reviews.Author: karenash24
Reviews.Content: Although this property is conveniently located, it is so far below the standards many of us are accustomed to at Westin hotels. The lobby is nice, but that is where it ends. Our club level room smelled like someone had been chain smoking in the room for several months. The lounge was nice, and the attendants very responsive. However, I really wanted to have a hot tub (well, a working hot tub), and it was out of order. The hotel said it was a scheduled maintenance, but other guests who stay there often said it's been out of service for quite some time. The pool smelled disgusting as well. My 12 year old refused to go in the water, saying it smelled like pee. We left after one night, vacations are too short to spend in places like this. Oh, and self parking was $25 per night for hotel guests. That is a little steep for my Midwestern standards.

Reviews.Title: “Solidly nice”
Reviews.Author: Xavier_McDonald
Reviews.Content: Whenever passing through Los Angeles, the Westin LAX fits the perfect niche of a quality establishment that isn't over priced. It's unpretentious, but nicely appointed. The staff is attentive. It's not the Peninsula, but it's also not $500 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Review Your Bill Closely”
Reviews.Author: VeganCaptioner
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and clean. The lobby was under renovation which was quite noisy at the time. Growing pains; I'm sure it's all finished now. The restaurant was terribly expensive, and the parking-garage machine was temperamental as sometime it would work correctly, and others, not, which meant one of us would have to get out and walk to the front desk and wait in line to get a new card. The biggest problem that I had with this hotel was upon checkout. There was no bill underneath my door in the morning, so I waited in line at the front desk to check out. When presented with the bill, I noticed that I had been charged for a rollaway bed for four days, totaling about $85, when in fact I did not have a rollaway in the room at all. It delayed my checkout for a few more minutes while the employee went to a back room to try to resolve the issue. Ultimately, they did remove that charge. My concern is that had I not taken the time to review the charges, they would have overcharged me by $85. Too often, people presume that hotels get everything right, when they don't. I was attending a conference that was being held at this hotel, which is the only reason I stayed here.
