If I were just visiting L.A. to see the sights, I would most likely stay elsewhere, as there's really not much close by to do here.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds!”
Reviews.Author: ravinon
Reviews.Content: stayed here one night after an 11 hour flight from New Zealand (and nearly as long through LAX immergration!) The shuttle drivers are extremly helpful and friendly (top marks to them!) check in was efficent and the rooms simple but comfortable and the beds excellent. (As a person with serious back issues this is of utmost importance to me) The rooms were also quiet......no noise from neighbouring rooms and that is such a pleasant change and no aircraft noise to speak of. We dined in the hotel resturant and were pleasantly surprised by that as well as hotel food is not our favorite....the Tuscan Chicken was very good. We are extensive travellers and though not posh it offered a very good nights sleep after a moderately long journey.

Reviews.Title: “Trust the reviews”
Reviews.Author: mrwheels
Reviews.Content: Not worthy of the Westin name. I should have listened to the warnings in the prior reviews. Don't make the mistake I made. Sheraton gateway down the road much much better

Reviews.Title: “It Was Fine... Not As Nice As The Photos”
Reviews.Author: Windcurrent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night-- after flying from Asia, and before flying home. It was fine. The rooms are not nearly as nice as they look in the photos. Walking into the room was almost a shock, because the photos were so much nicer. Still, the beds were comfortable, the room was pretty clean, and the room was quiet. Next time we fly through LA, I'll look at other hotels, but I may still end up at this one. The price was good. The restaurant was fine. The hotel and restaurant staff, and the shuttle drivers, were all very nice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicer airport hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: AlphaFlyer
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the nicer airport hotels I've stayed in. The room was very clean and the food at the Daily Grill was very good for an airport hotel restaurant. There were two problems I encountered, however. The first was at check-in. It was pretty easy but only because I made a beeline for the desk after getting off the shuttle. Behind me a huge line formed and the front desk seemed generally unequipped to deal with it. The other was that the minibar in my room was mysteriously locked even though I am older than 21 and had a credit card on the room for incidentals. The front desk was unable to unlock it remotely. I had to ask three times for someone to come up and fix it. The first time, no one came. The second time, they sent up two people from security who thought I'd locked myself out of the safe. The third time a maintenance guy came and had to pry the metal cover off the minibar in order to reset it. The whole process took at least an hour from my first call.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 1 night for biz, GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: yankee12
Reviews.Content: Right next to LAX, beds are Westin style - super comfy! Ate in the resturant and food was great. Lobby was clean, definately wood rec'd if you need to be in / near LAX, but if I had to stay in LA longer, I'd stay somewhere more central or on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Red_Dolphin-Media
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights in July 2011 (one Friday night, and one Weds night). I have stayed here many times before but this final stay was not up to par. My Friday stay was fine as I had gotten in late...thank goodness I was SPG Gold as the regular line had 20 people waiting at 10pm at night with only 2 agents to serve them all. The SPG line went fast and my SPG gold status was acknowledged and I was given a room on the top Exec floor. The parking garage is a little funky but overall it was convenient, and the beds are great. On my return Weds, I arrived at the hotel at 2pm (6am flight next day) and I was not feeling well. The lobby was nearly empty (except for construction going on) and I got a front-desk agent with no compassion. She said she had no rooms available and I would need to wait until check-in time. She called housekeeping and asked to push a room up in the priority list, but ultimately I had to go check back and keep checking before finally be given a room on the 9th floor 45 mins later. I was not happy at all by this point and had been put on a non-preferred floor without my normal 15th floor access. I called the desk and they told me I had access as a Gold member, but I didnt and they offered to send Security which I told them made no sense. Later that evening I decided to return the rental car and take the shuttle back from the airport (MISTAKE). I ended up waiting over an hour to get a shuttle that wasn't full and returned to the hotel at 10:30pm after dropping the car at 8:45. I called the desk and told the manager on duty I was highly disappointed with the service, the fact that anytime I called the desk the phone rang 25x before someone picked up, and with the lack of service overall. I also left a message for the GM who did not contact me back. Overall the Weds night stay was very subpar, I felt poor service and poor staffing in the hotel, and I will not return to this location again. Note as well the first night the front desk clerk didn't know where "in and out burger" was, a very popular LA fast food choice close to the hotel. He suggested I consider walking to McDonalds and ultimately sent me to the concierge to get more info. Overall very disappointed with this location as compared to other Westin's I have stayed in and I will not recommend or be back in this location. Next time I will absolutely choose the Hilton or even Four Points where they treat you so much better than this staff did. Loyalty means nothing here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: macguire
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed at this hotel for a couple of years, and as the Gateway was sold out, i thought that i would try it again. New carpets in the lobby, and the room looked refreshed. Great beds. The front desk was a bit slow, but the service was excellent. Convenient self park located on the premises. Friendly service at the bar and restaurant. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lislander
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend for a lay over or a conference as the neighborhood is devoid of interest other than other hotels, gas stations and rental car companies. We noticed a lot of airline personnel use the hotel. We waited for the free shuttle at the airport for about 20 minutes. I subsequently noticed that a lot of airline people use the Thrifty rent- a -car shuttle which comes by more frequently and drops off about half a block from the hotel. A good time saver if you don't have many bags. The hotel is what you would expect from an airport hotel-- high turnover requires the chamber maids to be in the halls night and day cleaning rooms. The rooms are a bit tired but we found them clean. We noticed it was pet friendly so that may be a factor is choosing it over a competitor.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby renovation right now but all was ok”
Reviews.Author: barcelonabrat
Reviews.Content: One night stay. Early flight out. For being so close to the airport I didn't smell any fuel. I would stay again. Shuttle bus comes eve 15. It was easy, clean...

Reviews.Title: “Average for an airport hotel, though I expect more from Westin”
Reviews.Author: mattypw
Reviews.Content: On this particular trip, I stayed at both the Westin LAX and the Sheraton LAX. Typically, when I compare a Westin and a Sheraton I expect the Westin to come out on top but in this case the Sheraton was the clear winner because of the gym and pool quality; plus the Sheraton has a Starbucks in the lobby while the Westin does not have a coffee shop. Rooms at the Westin are pleasingly decorated with seemingly new furniture. The gym is adequate for a quick workout, but could use an expansion/update. There are dumbells, a few weight machines, and a few cardio machines. The pool is adequate but unremarkable, and the hot tub definitely needs an update (missing tiles, rust, etc). The hotel has a Daily Grill restaurant in the lobby, which offers pricey high-calorie steakhouse fare, as well as the requisite astronomically-priced hotel breakfasts. This is another area where the Sheraton comes out on top, as that hotel has a Starbucks in the lobby which offers lighter breakfast alternatives. As of July 2011, the hotel is in the midst of renovations, so about half of the lobby is closed off; perhaps once renovations are complete, there will be more/better amenities here.

Reviews.Title: “We will NEVER Go back!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RFamily705
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 7pm and had 2 rooms assigned.... The rest of our party was delayed and therefore I spoke to the front desk staff and told them the second room would only be occupied at 11pm.... We had requested connecting rooms but this could not be sorted and therefore we agreed for rooms directly opposite from each other.....when the wrest of our party arrived at 11pm, we were told that their room had been given away and that we would be given a room on another floor!!!!! Needless to say I was not happy.....because it was so late and the kids were asleep we just took it. The next morning we were told that for the mess up the previous night they would give us a suite!!!! I was happy with that however.....there was more to come.... We packed up our things....and left it with the concierge....while we went for the day to universal studios.....on our return at 10.30pm the room was still NOT ready!!!!!! We had to wait for another 1.5 hr before we finally got our room!!!!! Not even ONE of the management staff came to offer an apology or explanation! We are regular traveller have had chosen to stay at a westin for the experiences that we have had at other properties.....but this experience has certainly changed my view completely!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: kritch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after being offloaded from a flight home and the staff were great. checkin in was a bit slow but that was due to the large amount of people checking in. The staff were very helpful. Unfortunately when we used the hotel laundry , it marked all our white clothes. less than impressed but when we let the manager know about this, she was very apologetic and comped our lunch for us, asking if there was anything more she could do. the gym was fine and we didn't use the pool. As we were fronting up to the airport each night to try and get on a plane home, the hotel was very helpful in holding our room in case we didn't get on. this went on for three nights so we really appreciated it. Great hotel if you are at the airport and the shuttle was very convenient and quick

Reviews.Title: “Bad Stay--not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: JNDTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling for the past two weekends and have not had a chance to write reviews for my past hotel stays, but upon arriving at the Westin LAX last night I was very disappointed with my reservation that I had to write about it. I had booked the Westin LAX for the 5 nights, but we could barely stay one night. Early this morn I had to search for another LAX hotel and get out of here. The hotel rooms need a lot of maintenance as they smell horrible, the furnishings are old, and by no means is the bathroom/shower "heavenly." As soon as we walked in our room, we were hit by the smell of an "old" rundown room full of dust. After a long flight, I expected a clean, fresh, well lighted room, but instead we got the opposite. I called the front desk and changed to a higher floor but it was the same. We had access to the Executive Area for breakfast and that was gross. The area looked dirty and the scrambled eggs were so watery and it had few breakfast item choices. This by no means compares to the Excellent Westin La Cantera in San Antonio, TX. I expected this location to be beyond excellent since its LA! I was fortunate to find another hotel, on such short notice, and wow, what a difference! I just checked in, and we are so happy to be at this location again! Most of our day was ruined because of all the morning spent looking for an available hotel room, checking out/checking in, and I lost all of my Starwood Points on that Westin LAX Reservation. I would not even stay there for free!

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here when I go to LA, best ever!”
Reviews.Author: KaRaeBlue
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I always feel like a VIP. You're met at your car, luggage taken care of and valet is great value. The lobby is beautiful and the concierge is always available to assist with ANYTHING. If you're a newby to LA they can assist you in finding tours that pick up at the door and return you after your tour. The pool area is beautiful and the jacuzzi needs some TLC but I dealt. The heavenly beds are truly heavenly and the free toiletries are good, soap was great (the simple things). I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in luxury for a fantastic price.

Reviews.Title: “Average Westin hotel (which is still better than many other chains)”
Reviews.Author: FFPointsRGreat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one quick night before flying home early in the morning. The staff I encountered (check-in and concierge) were indifferent. Room was average Westin but still overall good quality. Ate at the Daily Grill which was good but expensive. Overall a good experience if just for a short stay. Very convenient for returning a car rental and getting to the airport quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Subashni
Reviews.Content: We needed a nice place that was close to the airport. It has a good restaurant in the lobby but can be pricey, so nearby is Denny's, taco bell and Carl jrs. You can also catch the number 3 bus from Carl jrs to Santa Monica pier. The kids loved the pool. They also have a free airport shuttle to and from the airport. The rooms were clean and linen fresh. We liked our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Westin LAX rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: TahitianDreamsStudio
Reviews.Content: On every business trip to Los Angeles, I have booked my hotel stays here at the Westin LAX on 5400 West Century Blvd. For hotel guests with Platinum SPG status, there is a "clubhouse" on the 12th floor, hosted by the beautiful, kind and courteous Mrs. Isabel. She is the perfect hostess, hands down. Front desk manager Shavonna Cadle has gone out of her way to assist me, 24/7. Truly!!!! With a quick email to Shavonna @ the Westin LAX, I have set up my hotel bookings for the next 3 months without a hitch. And there's Roy Lawrence, who has brought a smile to my face at every visit. Roy brings a new and exciting story about the "music scene" at every one of my visits when I was fortunate to see him at the front desk; he's a busy man, assisting so many guests, with a genuine smile to show that he cares...and he does. Westin LAX rocks!!! 100%

Reviews.Title: “Great for travel”
Reviews.Author: bassplaya
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. About 5 minutes of lax in the free shuttle bus. Didnt even feel the airplanes! Personel was friendly and kept our luggage for some hours free. I wish they had some cheaper place to eat in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfort but disappointing isolation”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_maple_leaf
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was very welcoming and customer-oriented. The hotel offers comfortable beds and the building is correctly maintained. However, I was quite disappointed by the sound isolation (thin glass) and the proximity of one extremity of the runway (room with odd number and high floor getting direct and unobstructed exposure). I have also noticed works on one side of the lobby but this was not disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: YOWboys
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in June 2011 at the Westin LAX in a Terrace Suite (1083). The living room and bedroom were spacious and comfortable, and the terrace (accessed from the bedroom) was a decent size with two chairs. The décor was typical of Westins, and the bed was quite comfortable. The view was, predictably, of the airport itself as the hotel is situated not far from the end of a runway. This meant that take-offs could be heard from the bedroom, but this is to be expected at an airport hotel. I did not notice any noise from neighbouring rooms or the hallway, but my suite was at the end of the hall. I connected in Washington,and the flight arrived late. Based on the directions on the hotel’s website, I found the free airport shuttle (shared with the Four Points) that took me to the Westin. Arriving at the hotel around 2:00 in the morning, there was nobody at the front desk, but when I tapped a few times on the counter,someone came to the desk. The service was very good at check-in and check-out,as well as over the phone, and a minor billing issue was handled quickly and professionally. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever, dishonest.”
Reviews.Author: fashioncorn
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed with. We arrived on June 30 late night. The website states that looking for the hotel shuttle of Westin/Holiday Inn/La Quinta at LAX but actually the shuttle goes Holiday Inn and La Quinta won’t go Westin. We waited 40 minutes and one shuttle named Westin/Four Points LAX came. After arriving at the hotel (only 1-2 miles away from the airport) it’s already 11pm and just two hotel staffs to check in more than 20 guests. The hotel staff said that the shuttle runs every 10 – 15 minutes but that’s not true. Imaging that after a long trip you have to stand in the crowded shuttle (Because of too few shuttle running) holding the handle before arriving the hotel… This is not the worst. At 4:45 am someone accidentally pulled the fire alarm (or maybe it was a fire drill), the alarm sounds for more than ten minutes. Then it stopped and I was about to back to my sleep. Then a loud speaker in each room said sorry for the fake fire alarm. This scared me again. We saw the sign that there will be a charge for the in-room food if you consume (Especially $4 for a bottle of water). We didn’t touch any food and beverage in room but as expected (I know Westin always do this way since one time last year when I stayed at Westin San Antonio Riverwalk for business travel I have been charged over $70 for food in refrigerator. But actually the refrigerator was locked and I have never been given the key to the refrigerator. That Westin apologized and refunded my money only after I thrilled to charge back from the credit card company), Westin LAX charges me $4 for the water (we bring pack of bottled waters for each travel so there is no need to drink water from the hotel). I travel every month for either business or personal purposes and I have decided to avoid Westin forever. It’s not worst your time to deal with those people and don’t need to say that the worst ever hotel management will ruin your business and holiday.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycabc123
Reviews.Content: overall great stay. great spg platinum upgrade, great service, nice pool and gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great pkace”
Reviews.Author: Lazybu
Reviews.Content: The only downfall to this hotel was paying a different price each night for the room. The most being $129.00. If I have to make another trip to LA I will stay here the entire trip. I was at each destination(Hollywood, beaches) within 15-20 minutes. Service, good and gift shops were superior and parking garage was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trvlrches90
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights at the end of June, 2011. The hotel is close by the airport and rental car returns. The hotel is an older hotel, but tries to keep it updated. I enjoyed their "Heavenly sleep experience" bedding. The room was adequate and comfortable. The room did show signs of age in the bathroom as the light has some rust damage on it. The staff was very courteous and professional. Check-in was fast and easy. The check-out was just as pleasant. Pool was a little worn looking with grungy grout-lines throughout the bottom of it. The stains didn't bother me as it is simply a sign of the pool's age. Parking is $20 a night plus tax for a total of 23 per night. The hotel was our base camp for our three day excursion of LA. This hotel was centrally located for all of our excursions. Overall, I had an enjoyable stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGNYC78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the back end of our Asia trip. Our flight back to the east coast wasn't until 6:30 a.m., and we had arrived in LAX at 3:30 p.m. the day before. I booked this hotel via SPG points, and because our stay was part of an anniversary trip, the GM kindly upgraded us to a suite. The hotel lobby is probably what you'd expect from an airport Westin. Not as nice as say, the Westin in Bellevue, WA, but still plenty fine. The hotel itself is quite large, and it was a bit of a trek from the elevators to our room. Our room offered a nice view of planes descending into LAX, though I think the other side of the hotel offered an even better/closer view. My only complaint is that the free shuttle from the airport takes FOREVER. I swear the other hotel shuttles came by 4x before ours did. Still, the ride to/from isn't long, so it's convenient for an overnight stay. It's not SO convenient though to food or anything else, so beware of that. (A cab from the hotel to Dodger Stadium, by car service, would've cost us $70 EACH WAY.)

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravlingTexan
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Westin Los Angeles Airport in early June as we arrived into LAX on a late flight and our stay was excellent. The check-in process was easy and the staff was more than eager to help with all of our luggage and getting us into our room. The room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. This was my first time to travel out to LA with my young children and the staff at the Westin Hotel did a great job making my boys feel welcomed. Since I was traveling with two young boys, I thought it would be great to have a view of the planes taking off and landing outside of the hotel window. I specifically requested a high floor with a view of the airport and that is what I received. I will say that being so close to the airport and in line with the flight path, one would think that the jet engine noise would prevent a great night's rest, well I was wrong. The rooms are insulated very well from the noise, so you would see planes landing, but you could barely hear them, which was great for my wife and I. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Thank you Westin LAX for a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful hotel. Noisy in 2 ways”
Reviews.Author: Mimizhusband
Reviews.Content: Really liked my stay. Staff was very good, no attitude. Everything worked. The lobby is being redone/upgraded. Friends ate at the lobby restaurant ("Daily Grill") and gave it rave reviews. Noise #1- air traffic. Obviously comes with the territory. My room was on the north side and had only a hint if noise. I noticed more noise when on the south side that LAX was using for takeoffs . ( these runway pattern change, i assume, so don't bank on them.) Noise #2- the noise from the next roon was substantial coming under the floor gap in the adjoining door. Only an issue if the next room is noisy when you want to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant business trip”
Reviews.Author: jarmama23
Reviews.Content: It was very nice to get to the hotel at 8:30 pm PST and everything in order. No confusion with the reservation, very nice clean room and pleasant service. This is especially nice when you live on the East Coast and it is 11:30 pm in your hometown.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding night at the Westin LAX”
Reviews.Author: IG_from_Boston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the last night of our trip to LA, and were so pleasantly surprised by this very elegant airport hotel. The lobby is quite grand, the room was very quiet and comfortable, and the staff was extremely accomodating. We had access to the Club lounge, which provided a very comfortable environment to relax and have a continental breakfast, and I particularly enjoyed the gym and the hot tub. This is by far the best airport hotel I have been at, and rivals many city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value near LAX”
Reviews.Author: emorywasp
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service, great rooms and very convenient to LAX. The rooms are elegant and spacious with all the Westin extras. Very clean property with a very friendly staff. If you are a platinum traveller you have a very good chance of a nice upgrade. Restaurant and bar are great along with the club room. Excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel you can always depend on!”
Reviews.Author: londondd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Westin Los Angeles Airport and had the type of stay we all wish as travellers we can always expereience. The staff was friendly and prompt, the hotel lobby and overall appearance was warm and clean and finally the rooms were updated and quiet. Finally, if you need a reliable hotel close to Los Angelese Internatinal airport that will get you to the airport on time via a hotel shuttle - this is the hotel for you. I normally don't post tripadvisor reviews, but The Westin Los Angeles Airprot deserved my time!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: greenr97
Reviews.Content: I travel across the Country often and stay at many beautiful hotels and resorts. I live in the Los Angeles area and when I’m home sometimes I like to stay at a hotel just to relax and chill. Whenever I do this I try to stay at a Starwood member hotel such as Sheraton’s, Four Points, Le Meridien, Luxury Collection, St Regis and my favorite of all Westin Hotels. I try to stay at the Westin Los Angeles Airport as often as I can. The rooms are spacious, staff is courteous, and room rates are always completive. When I stay at the Westin Los Angeles Airport, it’s like being at home with family that you don’t get enough time to see. If you are in the area and looking for a beautiful hotel near the airport consider the Westin Los Angeles Airport. Who knows I might just be their as well.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: HIroamer
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful; the room clean, spacious and comfortable. Near to LAX, but quiet. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “This is our first choice when visiting family in Los Angeles!”
Reviews.Author: bizzybee005
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located by LAX airport, it is our first choice to stay. Class, comfort, convenience and affordability --this hotel has it all, including a professional and courteous staff. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A different Westin”
Reviews.Author: nportillo
Reviews.Content: I love Westin because the bed, convinient location and maintenance howerver this time I got really surprised with this one. As an example the hallways were not properly maintained and clean. I did my check-in at 3 Pm and when going to my room i saw glasses and bottles in the hallway in from of several doors. I left my stuff in the room and inmediately left tje hotel to attend a business meeting and came back 6 hrs later. I saw exactly the same (glasses, bottles, ice containers all over the place in th hall way. As a frequent Westin guest, this is the 1st time that I see the carpet of the hallways dirty and glasses and bottles everywhere. Dissapointing :(

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and subpar for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: tycl516
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew in very late (3am), and since we had a distance to drive to our destination, we decided to stay closer to the airport. We booked our stay through priceline, and scored a great deal (~$100 before taxes and fees). I understand how rooms are booked through priceline, but when we checked into our room, all we really wanted was a comfortable bed to sleep on and an inviting environment to relax in. We got the comfortable bed, but the room itself was dark and very outdated. There were wall pieces that were hanging crooked and the walls were cracked. It just looked way too small for the amount of furniture that was in there, so we felt claustrophobic. I don't usually have any sensitivity towards small spaces, as I've lived in Hong Kong and other parts of the world where space is a commodity, but this just felt off. Being tired didn't help I'm sure. The front desk was very helpful and friendly, in spite of the late hour, so I did appreciate that. However, having stayed at other Westins, this one was definitely one of my least favorites. I think the location is decent, but since it's on busy Century Blvd., you will inevitably pick up a lot of street noise. We were on the 7th floor, and could hear the noise pretty clearly, so I'm hoping the higher floors are better. If you need a good quality sleep, I would not suggest staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Comfortable Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scousemouse
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel, located on West Century blvd, one of many on the Los Angeles Airport (LAX) site with a regular free shuttle service to the various terminals which means that the traveller does not have to rely on taxis. The rooms are of good size, well equipped, have comfortable beds and a generous bathroom with ample towels and toiletries. Despite the proximity to the airport we found airplane noise was not a problem although there was a good view of them approaching. The staff were very professional and helpful during our stay and we would recommend this hotel. The only problem with hotels on the LAX site, is the lack of alternatives for eating and drinking – and as a result of this, lack of competition, which means prices are fairly high. With some searching, alternative bars and eating houses can be found which offer decent fare at reasonable prices – but they are not, at first, obvious without a bit of exploring. Manhattan Beach and two shopping centres (Manhattan Village and Plaza El Segundo) can be accessed in daytime via the Ocean Express trolley bus ($5 return ticket available in the hotel) which stops near all the main hotels. The bus runs every 30 minutes and the driver will tell you when they will be back at the same stop to pick you up as it runs in a loop. We thoroughly enjoyed out trip to the beach, it's a great place to have lunch and spend a few hours while waiting for a flight. http://www.gatewaytola.org/index.cfm/programs/ocean-express/

Reviews.Title: “great stop over”
Reviews.Author: fizic
Reviews.Content: comfortable and clean. Got a good nights sleep. Restaurant excellent. Evening meal very good and breakfast of limited choice but well presented. Service fast and good.

Reviews.Title: “Quite alright!”
Reviews.Author: UALsandiego
Reviews.Content: Checked in late after I had been rerouted to LAX for the night (United...) Staff was extremely friendly and understanding. The room was decent, but looked a bit older than the other Westins I had stayed at. I'd say late 90s looking. Bathroom was small, but sufficient, and shuttle service to airport was excellent, though shared with several other hotels. If you have a quick layover at LAX, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Changed my impression of LAX hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: milkythemouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 2 separate occasions on my recent trip and was extremely happy with the quality of the rooms. I was actually pleasantly surprised as it had been awhile since I had stay at an airport hotel at LAX and was not expecting something so luxurious. The beds were extremely comfortable, the rooms were quiet and clean. The bathrooms were very clean with no sight of mould. I used room service on my first stay and even though I had arrived after 11pm the lovely girl on the telephone organised for me to be able to order something of the "day menu" which had ended. I was very appreciative. The staff are incredibly polite and efficient. I will definitely be staying here again next time I'm in LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Dogs barking all night, could not sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Travelpro64
Reviews.Content: Yesterday my flight was cancelled and United Air booked me a room at the Westin Los Angeles Airport. I stayed in Room # 826. The room is ok, no slippers though but the problem happened when I turned the light off and I could not sleep because of the constant barking of several dogs. I am not sure where they were but the noise was constant. I was coming from a sleepless night with a flight originating out of JFK at 6am, on a 4 months long business trip and with 2 heavy bags+carry on. The idea of calling the Reception and change room was out of my reach so I pulled my ear plugs and rested.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE AND OUTSTANDING STAFF”
Reviews.Author: jspair
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May & June 2011 and will stay here anytime I am in LAX. The rooms are great, the beds are more than heavenly and the staff is outstanding! I have nothing bad to say about this hotel at all! Location is great and the $5 round trip trolley is a great bonus! Every single staff member I encountered was friendly and would do anything to make your stay pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “worth the money”
Reviews.Author: henryschoice
Reviews.Content: It is a very good airport hotel.free airport shuttle easy to find

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't ordinarily recommend an airport hotel as a destination, but...”
Reviews.Author: MissPattyT
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Westin LAX for a convention and was at first disappointed that the presenters had chosen an airport hotel. But the Westin LAX is surprisingly centrally located to great eating, sight-seeing, and the beaches, shopping, and fun of Manhattan Beach, Playa, and Santa Monica. It is also right next to LAX car rental agencies which was incredibly convenient. The Daily Grill (the only restaurant at the Westin) has a terrific bar, good food and friendly service. And of course there is the heavenly bed, which makes the stay at any Westin a great big pleasure. Like all of LA there is nothing in walking distance, but, really, who expects that in LA, anywhere?

Reviews.Title: “It was a great hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: StuBeee
Reviews.Content: It easy easy to spot coming off the 405 and driving up to the entrance was a breeze. We had a rental car and the return locations for all car rentals were just about 4blocks away. We gave our luggage to the bell captain and he directed us to the check in desk. We were given our room quickly and told the bellman the room number and went to our car and returned it, which took only a few minutes. The rental return clerk informed us that there was a complementary van to take us back to the Westin. We took it back to the hotel. At the Westin, just off the lobby, was a Daily Grill restaurant. We enjoyed some nice cocktails and wine, crab cakes and fresh angel hair pasta with fresh tomatoes, basil and garlic. The room was spacious and the windows were special so as to block out the airplane noise. Starbucks coffee was offered in the room. The bed was fantastic. We liked the hotel very much and would choose it again when if we were to return to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Easy & Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: skyeyed
Reviews.Content: Location: When planing for a central place to stay in LA to get to all the major attraction, airport hotels normally are a little far out. No so with the Westin Airport hotel. It was about 20 - 30 mins to all the sites by car and of course you need a car in LA to get around. Accommodation: Its a 3.5 star and pretty clean, good bed and amenities. Car park: Easy self parking at about $20 per day. Price: You can book this hotel for about $120 per night if you search around. We liked this hotel and give it 4 stars for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel from room to restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Exerciseexpert
Reviews.Content: Great for business travelers, the staff is divine. Food is wonderful and I even came back to stay when I flew out for a vacation. Perfect location for those needing a place to stay when going to LAX or returning.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay, great location close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: uscshannon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin LAX several years ago and had a great stay. This time after I walked in my room and set my luggage down I noticed there was dust on the dresser,tables etc. I don't usually complain but it just seemed like the room hadn't been used in a while. I called the front desk and they sent someone up right away to wipe things down. The hotel was a great location close to LAX and offered a shuttle to and from the airport. This Westin just isn't as nice as other properties I've stayed at but I did enjoy the heavenly bed, very comfortable. Also we used the pool which was ok. The workout facilities were really nice but I didn't get a chance to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for quick overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyNZ
Reviews.Content: Quick pick-up via the shuttle, Starwwod check-in and an upgrade to a Club room on the 12th floor made for a good stay here. Rooms are getting a bit outdated now and could do with a refresh. I had to call maintenance as a window was not closing properly but to give them credit he was up within 10 minutes and fixed it within 2. Bed was great, TV system (HD) was superb with a great 37" LCD. Room service was good and the food OK - the slice of cake brought up must have been at least half a kilo in weight. Room size was good. Had breakfast in the Club Lounge and was pretty adequate for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnaS1976
Reviews.Content: There are two reasons why I always choose this hotel when I'm on a short transit trip to Los Angeles: 1. It is conveniently located near airport and rental cars - you can take a free shuttle from airport and you literally walk to rental cars - the closest office (Fox, Payless and a few others) is just across the street. 2. You can stay here on a very cheap SPG points rate - just need 3K points. As all my business expenses are coming out of my own pocket, I have to sometimes stay on points and this is the perfect place to spend them. Other than that it is a consistent mid-range hotel geared towards business traveler and airline crews. The only inconsistent thing is parking charges - I still cannot figure out why sometimes they charge for parking and sometimes not. Some of the rooms can be noisy due to airport proximity, but overall sound isolation is quite good. If you have SPG status, there is an executive lounge that even serves some kind of breakfast, but I was leaving early so cannot comment on the quality or quantity.

Reviews.Title: “OK choice near the LA airport”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: This Westin was an OK choice near the LA Airport. It's farther from the Airport than some other airport hotels, and there isn't much around it, but it's clean and renovated, without any excess airport noise. We were not happy with the lack of food and coffee service options available, but it's fine if you want a Starwood hotel near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Property”
Reviews.Author: Greg_D_In_Cali
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this location for a number of years. It's my go to hotel in the LAX area. The property is always sparking clean, the gym is great and the staff is top flight. The hotel continues to deliver great value every time I'm there and I now stay there overnight when I have early LAX flights. Great jump on traffic and wonderful valet service for airport parking.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin is our hotel of choice.”
Reviews.Author: lharrison9
Reviews.Content: My husband was traveling back to Iraq after a 30 day R&R and the Westin was close to the LAX with shuttles running every 15 minutes. We had stayed at Westin's before and were in love with their Heavenly Bed, (it is, truly Heavenly) and the quality of the hotel. Before our arrival I received an e-mail from the Westin anticipating our arrival with some helpful information. Much to our surprise we saw that they allowed dogs. We have 2 Labs. We called and spoke to the manager (since our dogs were over the 40 lb. limit) and were told there would be no problem and she would make a note of it on our reservation. When we arrived we were greeted with a very friendly and helpful staff, from the Valet and Bellman to the Check-in Staff. We were all made to feel very Welcome and the dogs were a great hit with the staff and other guests. Our room was spacious with a great view and of course the bed was heavenly. We had great dinner in the Restaurant and ended our evening in the lounge. Our stay was delightful and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and fine facilities”
Reviews.Author: boblin8260
Reviews.Content: Was treated with respect did not have to wait more than 2 minutes. Check-in was a pleasure and parking was easy. The room that the conference was held had all of the latest ammenities. The food in the hotel was excellence as was the service. I would stay there again even on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Hotel Near LAX”
Reviews.Author: LindsayBee1
Reviews.Content: My Dad was traveling to SoCal on business, so I tagged along with my Mom for a mini-vacation. We spent three nights in Long Beach, followed by two nights in LA. The Westin LA Airport is a great choice for a hotel near LAX. The guest room was very clean and looked to have been updated within the past few years. Above average gym (by hotel standards) and the pool was nice; although you heard planes take off every few minutes they didn't fly directly overhead. The Daily Grill has diverse options, however being the only restaurant the menu got old quickly. Reco: They ground their own beef twice a day so if you're a cheeseburger fan be sure to have one before leaving!

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: rltr
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I had traveled Northern California with a stay in Palm Springs. On the return home trip we had stayed at the Westin in LAX.. This was our second visit to this Hotel. First of all, we found the staff to be of the outmost friendly and helpful. The rooms are exquisitely comfortable. The location is great for the airport and also to take a tram towards Manhattan Beach. We will certainly return to this hotel. They also have a great restaurant at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flying and staying with ease and comfort”
Reviews.Author: miz_peg
Reviews.Content: After a long international flight and going through customs in Los Angeles the first flight that would take us back home was the following day. My husband and I decided to spend the night at the Westin Los Angeles Airport. Tired from a long trip with another flight the next day it was a pleasure to first have a very short wait for the shuttle to take us to the hotel. The inviting lobby was was clean and welcoming. The staff was friendly and helpful and quickly checked us in. The room was large, quiet and the bed was extremelly comfortable. I recommend this hotel as a great stop over while in LA or a convenient location to some of the area's main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Easy to get all over LA from here”
Reviews.Author: Crt616
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I ahve stayed here times now for business and have never been disappointed. I am usually done with meetings early and I have always been able to check in before the scheduled check in time. The location is perfect for someone who needs to get out to different parts of the city everyday.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Westin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nooharmon
Reviews.Content: We were in transit to San Francisco and stayed only one night at The Westin near LAX airport. We didn't have to wait very long for the shuttle to take us back and forth. It was so convenient and the food and the service at the on site restaurant was excellent. The room and the staff were excellent. I highly recommended this Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Not usual Westin quality”
Reviews.Author: reesSydney
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on location (we had a 2 night stopover with early flight departure) and on the great reviews on this site. Our experience was underwhelming. The lobby may be imposing but the check-in service was offhand. I felt I was being a nuisance by making them do some work. The room was ok. Beds were comfy, it had a coffee maker with Starbucks coffee, the windows were completely soundproof so the kids could watch the planes land in complete silence! The bathroom was horrible. Perhaps we are spoiled by Westins in Australia but the beige wallpaper was peeling, the bath was so shallow only my 2 year old could use it, and they didn't even provide shower gel. It felt like a budget motel. On the plus side we had a good meal in the hotel restaurant and the pool was fine to burn off some energy, but on check out we missed 3 shuttle buses to the airport because no-one came to collect our bags for 30 mins although we called numerous times. A disappointing stay, will try somewhere else on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “I had a very relaxing and well needed stay.”
Reviews.Author: LagniappebyJ
Reviews.Content: I had a relaxing experience and I loved the room's decor. The location was right on, the amenities were top notched, but best of all, I thorough enjoyed the comfortable bed - it was 'just what the doctor ordered'. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jspair
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this location for a week while in LAX on business. The hotel is new and very clean. I really enjoyed my stay. The bed is amazing. If you don't want to rent a car and would like to get out and about, the trolley is a great option. It is $5 round trip and will take you to the Manhattan Beach Pier where there is a bunch of shops and ton's of places to eat. I will stay here again next time I am in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: gatototo
Reviews.Content: I moved to this hotel becasue ours was disgusting. I knew a Westin Hotel always asures you quality and a good sleep. And it did. The htoerl needs a little renovation, but as a whole I highly recommend it. It's a bit expensive for an airport hotel, but still, much better than others.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over hotel for LAX”
Reviews.Author: JandAL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in April 11,caught the fast & convenient shuttle bus from LAX and check in was smooth & efficient. Rooms were clean & bed comfortable. It must be said that there is aircraft noise as our room overlooked the runway & to add to this people were still in the pool at midnight so the 9pm curfew was not observed but all in all a very convenient place to stay especially with Thrifty car rental next door.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience which could have been better”
Reviews.Author: MelScotland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a ten night stay in this hotel. Its location for the airport is excellent and there is a very regular free shuttle to the airport. The positives - the rooms are well equipped and spacious with large bathrooms. The beds are very com fortable with high quality bedding and pillows. The foyer is nice and the pool though small is clean and very sheltered with nice sun loungers around it. Breakfast is fine though there is a limited selection of hot foods. Restaurant and bar staff are helpful and friendly. The restaurant manager was very good at sorting out a problem we had. The negatives - after day 2 we were part f a very large conference so sadly we were subjected to mass catering which was very limited. The waiting time at reception is far too long and I had the awful experience of being locked out of my room because the hotel has failed to ask for a credit car swipe at check in. I was only told this when I asked why my room key no longer worked. This is very poor customer care. The other area which needs improvement is the standard of room cleaning and service each day. Basically the beds were made but apart from that there was little or no evidence of staff having been in. I feel the hotel is pretty good but could be very much better with improved staff training and tighter overall management. The other thing I objected to was a charge of 16 dollars per day for internet access. For my ten days this would have been 160 dollars which is ridiculous. Overall its fine and if you just want an average hotel close to the airport go for it. If you are looking for a high class hotel with excellent service look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Good Location at LAX”
Reviews.Author: Magical99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin LAX during a business conference. The daily rate was very affordable for two ($50 each) and the room was very spacious and well equipped. There are affordable restaurants within walking distance for meals if you decide not to eat at the hotel restaurants (which seemed expensive to us since we are small eaters). The beds were EXTREMELY comfortable and my traveling companion who says she is never able to sleep at night peacefully was sleeping like a baby. We had a glitch with something we had pre-ordered to be put in our room, and the staff bent over backwards to find a solution for us until they could fix the problem. They were very concerned and took full responsibility for the mistake. The parking was convenient and very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Heavenly Bed's Friendly Faces That Give You Lot's Of Smiles And Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Starlet42
Reviews.Content: I Loved Staying Here Everytime I Come To This Hotel There Very Friendly ,Helpfull With My Bag's And Anything I Ask For I Got !!! They Are Great Maid's With Lot's Of Smile's ,So I Gave Them A Tip !!! This Hotel Is The Only One I'll Stay At There Also Descreet !!! They Didn't Ask To Have There Picture Taken With Me !!! And That Right There Say's Alot !!! Because So Many People Do Ask Me . Nobody Was There Banging On My Door They Were Really Good At Making Sure IWas Awake For The Wake-up Call That Was Fantastic !!! I Could Sleep Without Worrying About Will I Wake Up !!! TheyMade Sure Rang Till I Answered !!! Shuttles Are Alway's There To Drive You Wherever You Want To Go They Offered To Have A Driver Drive Me To NBC !!! And The Bed's Are Heavenly And Luxuriously Soft And Yet Just Firm Enough And There Room Service Fantastic !!! I Will Alway's Stay There Forever Everytime I Go To LA . There Is No Other At That Price Comfortable Or As Clean As This Hotel ,No Bug's Here !!! And This All Keep's Me Coming Back To This Hotel I'm A Actress And Model And I Live On A Budget Till I Am Famously Known , And This Is Perfect Hide Away For Me Now And When I Become Famously Known !!! When I Fly In To Go On Set Or To A Photo Shoot I Know I'll Get A Good Night Sleep When I Stay At This Beautiful Luxuryiuosly Clean , Peacfull, Hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigboofer
Reviews.Content: I spent the night between flights and found the Westin to be very comfortable. Room was spotless and beds where fabulous with a great nights sleep. Dining options worked well with lobby bar happy hour and restaurant. A very easy return to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, comfortable night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: ctchung4
Reviews.Content: Hotel Stay: Staff was friendly. Check-in was efficient, after a short wait in line. I'm usually not an early morning person and so appreciated the comfortable bed and a good night's sleep. Check-out was without a hassle - After picking up the bill/receipt slipped underneath our door, we just called down to the front desk to check out. Breakfast Conference: I was there for the Rotary District Breakfast and was happy with the breakfast variety from eggs to cereal, pastries, and fruits. Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “The place was first class all the way”
Reviews.Author: Jim-OnTheWayHome
Reviews.Content: They did ask when I checked in if I was going to be dining tonight, this is run like a big buck hotel (for as as I know about big buck hotels). Lots of help, addressing people by name when you call the front desk, high ceilings, glass and shiny stuff everywhere. The couple ahead of me looked as out of place as I did, a young couple in their early 20’s with just one small backpack between them. Anyone who has read my other reviews knows that I'm often staying in motels that are $30 or less if I don't fear for my safety. Cheapest online rate for this motel tonight was $185, but I'm here on an airline voucher. The place was first class all the way, my only issue was when they wanted to charge me $12.95 to use the internet, sorry, I can wait until I'm back to the airport. (Remember, I'm cheap) This is the kind of place you go for special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Even for an airport hotel this was bad”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugs99
Reviews.Content: We had a short overnight stay, and a 45 minute wait to check in is unacceptable for any major chain hotel. If you are getting charged a full nights stay for just a few hours rest, and a chunk of that time is spent in a queue in the cold lobby, you are better of staying at the airport. Rooms were clean but dated but the service and staff attitude was hard to look beyond. I left a comment card, no response thus far.

Reviews.Title: “Great LAX Hotel”
Reviews.Author: QuestYT
Reviews.Content: Only needed to stay a night, but would gladly have stayed for more. Wondeful staff, good restaurant and a fine room. A great way to recover from or prepare for the "cattle drive" that is LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Personable Service”
Reviews.Author: PamperedPrincess_8
Reviews.Content: From my initial contact when I called for reservations and questions about the proximity of this hotel to LAX, I knew I was in for a quality experience. John, reservations, gave me clear and concise directions on how to find the Westin's complimentary hotel shuttle van. John also realized I wanted the best room for the best price and found that for me. When I registered at the front desk, the professional service continued when Mathew checked me in. First impressions when I register, are important to me as a traveler. Mathew made sure I was familiar with all of the hotel's amenities and moved my room when I asked for one on a higher floor. Mathew was especially accommodating with any request or question I had. Walter, the room service attendant, made the late room service delivery of the glasses of wine for my sisters and me a unique experience. When I went down very early one morning to enjoy the lobby, the attendants who were cleaning the areas stopped, recognized me and gave me a huge smile. This quality of guest recognition and high expectations comes from top down leadership. Thank you for a wonderful stay. I will stay no where else whenever I return to LAX airport because of the friendliness, helpfulness, accessibility and quality of service at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Intlgal70
Reviews.Content: Missed my international connection at LAX and selected to stay at this convenient hotel. The airport shuttle was just for this hotel, Holiday Inn Express and Sheraton. It ran every 20 minutes. Hotel staff was really friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to ask what else they could do for me. Check in and check out was fast. Even though we were right next to the runways I could not hear the planes. Great overnight experience.

Reviews.Title: “Special Treatment”
Reviews.Author: lynettemcf
Reviews.Content: After an airline delay we spent 2 days at the Westin and found it to be extremely easy to checkin and the beds were very comfortable with plush linens. The location proved to be convenient for sightseeing on the trolley to Manhattan Beach where we enjoyed walking the promenade while watching the dolphins in the ocean and the boutiques in the area. The trolley also accessed two shopping areas. Our dining experience was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly, comfortable and a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Nan0301
Reviews.Content: It's hard traveling with our 30-pound dog. We knew we would be at airports and in the air for 8-10 hours, and we really wanted an airport hotel where the three of us could relax (or collapse!) after our ordeal. Checking online, the Westin LAX seemed to be a good deal, since they did not charge extra for the dog. Turned out even better than we expected, and the price was more than fair for the service we received. Everybody was nice to the dog, from the shuttle driver to the bell staff to the front desk. The restaurant was a pleasant surprise -- we chose comfort food and a glass of good California red wine, and were served by a very professional waitress. Our room and bed were so comfortable that we were actually ready to continue with our travels the next morning! We will return -- this is a great airport hotel for making a complicated trip less complicated!

Reviews.Title: “Service and accommodations were wonderful”
Reviews.Author: macinoregon
Reviews.Content: I had the privilege of arranging the hotel for my son's wedding night. They were leaving for Hawaii the next day and needed to be near LAX. He visited the Westin LAX and others and this is the one he chose. I had to make these arrangements from out of state and so called the hotel directly. From the first phone call to the night of their stay, everything was handled with efficiency and personal touch. Procedure for payment so that they wouldn't have to show a credit card was explained and handled perfectly. When they checked in they were treated personally and their breakfast the next day was excellent. I recommend this hotel highly and would stay or have my guests stay there without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Room quality left something to be desired”
Reviews.Author: relaxw/kids
Reviews.Content: Yes it is a westin but this hotel is dated to say the least. Carpets are well worn, bathrooms could definately use some updating and a good scrubbing. I found this hotel to be showing signs of age and well used. The lobby is beautiful but that is kind of where it ends. The room service and dining in the hotel were fantastic. Hotel staff was very accomodating, helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for business in the Los Angeles area.”
Reviews.Author: w2w2bsi2
Reviews.Content: This hotel readily met all of our needs. Great service from the desk and concierge personnel in taking care of car rentals and overnight mail deliveries. The restaurant was clean, offered a good menu, staff was friendly and accommodating. We will stay here on our next trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great nights rest at the best LAX location”
Reviews.Author: OrcasParrothead
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin LAX upon our return from Tahiti. Our Air France flight arrived late due to the tsunami warnings that kept closing Papeete airport on March 11, so that it was close to 11PM when we finally arrived at the Westin. The lobby is one of the nicest I've seen at LAX airport hotels (and I've seen plenty) and check in was quick, efficient and friendly. OK, I am a Gold SPG member and have come to expect such great service from Starwood Hotels, but that seemed to be the standard for everyone checking in that night. Since it was late, we went right to our room to get some rest before our early morning flight back to Seattle. Our room was large, very neat and well laid out. And the bed - the Westin Heavenly Bed - was perfect for the rest we needed. Although the hotel seemed to be close to full, our room was nice and quiet, which is not always the case at airport hotels. Our checkout the next, early, morning, was fast and efficient. Although we didn't have a chance to use any of the facilities, all the staff we met were very friendly and helpful. And I especially liked the computer faciliites in the lobby. I was able to check us in for our Seattle flight in a matter of minutes. I have stayed at numerous LAX airport hotels and the Westin is by far the nicest, both in quality and service. From now on, it will be my base for all LAX trips. And hopefully on my next trip, I'll have time to try their restaurant and bar.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: JohnMartin48
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Westin at LAX. The first time I brought my entire family and this time an associate. The rooms are very comfortable and the service is wonderful. I will stay there every time I go to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent LA Traveler”
Reviews.Author: JLAP_59
Reviews.Content: I travel to the LAX area quite frequently and almost always stay at the Westin. It's close to LAX, rooms are clean and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Where I will stay everytime”
Reviews.Author: Billjones2544
Reviews.Content: I thank the staff at the LAX Westin for making me feel so welcomed and looking forward to my next trip into LAX. I will never stay elsewhere when I travel to the Los Angeles area.

Reviews.Title: “Class and top service meet at Westin LAX”
Reviews.Author: mpduffy
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with top notch service. Whether you're a business professional looking to stay for one night close to the airport, or a family preferring one week away from the hustle and bustle, this is your place. The rooms are well sized with very comfortable beds. The bathrooms and showerheads are excellent. The gym allows you to keep your workout regimen. The people are helpful and gracious, the food is great, and the bar has top shelf liquor. The reception area is also beautiful. I highly recommend this hotel, as I stay here every time I make a trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, Not the greatest neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: njwestern
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in between international flights. Shuttle service was great. Room was fine. Service in the in-house restaurant was great. If you go for a walk, the neighborhood wasn't the greatest but don't let that stop you from staying here. If you park on the premises, it should be fine. Thrifty rent a car is next door if needed. Very quiet - I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: bbb2053
Reviews.Content: The customer service from all the staff was OUTSTANDING! ... Very friendly and accommodating. However, because I was absent minded- one employee stood out. The following is a letter I sent to the General Manager at the Westin: On April 1, 2011, my husband and I had the pleasure of meeting Dora in the Gift Shop. She was professional, friendly, and considerate. She approached us immediately when we came into the door to see if she could help us make a purchase. The next day, I went back to the gift shop to purchase a jacket that Dora had shown me. She was not there so I purchased it from the gentleman who was attending the gift shop. After learning that the jacket was too small, I took it back the next day. Dora helped me chose a jacket that was just a little larger. At that time I left my billfold at the register, but did not realize it was gone until many hours later. Since I remembered the last time I used my billfold was in the gift shop, I was certain it was safe with Dora. When I went to check on it, Dora told me that she had called my room and when she couldn’t get in touch with me she gave it to security. After my meeting that evening I contacted security, who met me at the front desk and gave it to me. You must be very proud of Dora and your security officer. From my conversations with Dora, I knew she was very trustworthy. This could have been a very unsettling circumstance and her actions caused me to have little concern. It is obvious that both Dora and the Security Guard have the highest standards when representing Westin and providing services to your customers. Employees like Dora make your customers feel safe and want to return. Please let her know how much I appreciated her. Karen Carleton

Reviews.Title: “Fine for what it is, a large airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jabezgreen
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is fine and exactly what it was advertised to be. The facilities are well kept but a little ragged around the edges, chipped paint, a slightly broken lampshade. It is close to the airport and in and out parking was pretty easy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Lonie52
Reviews.Content: From the very beginning of my stay here, the service was excellent. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. I had a slight issue with my room, and the front desk person made immediate amends and moved me to another room (someone had smoked in it!) The new room was clean and the beds were very comfortable -- even the pillows! I was at a conference and they had my conference materials delivered to my table, and then when the conference was over, they helped box them up and ship them out. The restaurant food was very good, and the staff in the restaurant was excellent. Oh, and I must mention the concierge folks; really amazing. Thanks for a great stay, and looking forward to next year's conference!

Reviews.Title: “More comforts than home!”
Reviews.Author: mustangsally60
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I found our stay at the Westin, LAX to be of outstanding value; service, friendliness and food. We had most of our meals in the hotel bar, not to be confused with the restaurant bar. The food and atmosphere were great. We took a day and rode the trolley to Manhattan beach and other areas. What started as work, ended with play. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The staff of the Westin served our group from CDE Migrant Ed with pride and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: tigerlilly2257
Reviews.Content: Our stay involved several parents of school age children who attended an educational conference at the Westin. The staff was so gracious to our parents, directing them in English and Spanish to the areas of the hotel they needed to go. It's a real plus that many staff members are bilingual. Our families were treated with great respect and and enjoyed a luxurious stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great LA Hotel-perfect location & staff”
Reviews.Author: taylorNy_ny
Reviews.Content: Great LA Hotel-perfect location & staff. Looking for a great hotel that you can rely on this is the hotel! When you walk in you are met by a beautiful plush lobby & a very helpful staff. Natasha was especially helpful during our checkouts. The warm pool along with the Westin Workout center was very nice. The rooms were quiet and comfortable. Best of all this location was not only near the airport but the 405 & Marina del Ray, etc. We liked this hotel so much we changed our plans & stayed here again the night before our departing flight home- no freeway traffic to fight!

Reviews.Title: “You have got to be kidding me...depressing and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Foxpup82
Reviews.Content: Summary: pros: new carpet, staff is great cons: dated, beat-up dated furniture, cleanliness issues I was looking forward to staying here, as I haven't stayed at a Westin hotel before, and had heard they were very nice. Frankly, after reading the recent good reviews, it's hard to believe we're talking about the same place! When I got to my room, it looked okay, but as I looked closer, I noticed the furniture was pretty dated (mid-80s?) and beat-up. The office chair was ripped , like a wolf had attacked it, there was a sizable gouge on the wall. and the veneer on the furniture was warped and peeling in areas. The desk lamp's finish was very worn, and there were big dents in the bedside lampshade. The worst was when I drew the curtains for privacy - they were terribly stained! I took pictures of this, but have refrained from posting them because frankly it would be beyond the limits of good taste. Yes, it is that bad - let your imagination wander on this one. If you really want to see, I can email the pictures to you. In that corner of the room, the wall lamp was hanging halfway off the wall, and the aforementioned gouge was also present. It seemed something had "happened" in this corner - I felt very creeped out. I called reception and requested another room - this was done quickly and pleasantly. The staff was very nice - no problems there. The new room was much better (the curtains were clean) but there were still chips on the furniture, and the bathtub had an old imprint of anti-slip adhesive (as did the bathtub in the previous room). This I would expect from a dumpy roadside motel, but from a Westin? There were also several black hairs in plain sight on the bathroom counter. As a previous housekeeper, I can't understand how this could be - a clean bathroom counter is a basic! The rest of the bathroom was clean, although the grout in most of the lower shower area was discoloured - a simple bleach treatment or scrub with Comet could solve this unsightly problem. Interestingly, there was a floor lamp in addition to the wall lamp in the corner of the new room, which furthered my suspicions that something had happened in the previous room - I wonder what happened to the floor lamp there? The only thing that seemed to be new was the carpet. The bed linens were nice - two fluffy duvets and thick cotton sheets. Another minus: I knew that internet access in the room would be $12.95, which I was willing to pay. However, $12.95 will only get you "internet lite", which is evidentially enough for emailing and web browsing. For anything above that (streaming video, online games etc.) it is a whopping $16.95. I went ahead and paid it, but only was able to view one email before the thing decided to stop working. Or rather, I was still connected, but the signal was too poor to do anything with! At this point, Iit was very late, and I had a crushing headache, and decided to just go to bed, and just ask for a refund for the internet in the morning. (and the signal was still was extremely weak in the morning) Plane noise is high if you are facing the pool (which also faces a corner of the airport). I could hear it even through my earplugs. The situation is probably better on the other side of the building - but there doesn't seem to be much soundproofing going on here. I stayed at the La Quinta across the street last time, and don't recall plane noise being a problem there. I don't expect complete silence at an airport location, but really it was loud. Also, a note on restaurant options: they do have a restaurant (Dailly Grill) on site, but it's the only one, and it's expensive - $19 for a hamburger, and $5.50 for a glass of orange juice. I walked down the street to the Subway - there's also a Taco Bell, Carl's Jr and McDonalds in that same area. So there's no other option that I could see - it's fast food or the pricey restaurant. My friend who is a local, says the restaurant is excellent, so I'm sure it's worth it. But just be forewarned if you don't want to spend a lot of money on food, it's limited in that area. Aside from the above dramas, the decor is very depressing - muted olive green, brown and grey. The guest lobby is especially bad - the lighting made me feel like I was in an inner-city bus station. Really depressing atmosphere in that lobby! Perhaps it's better during the daylight hours? I feel sorry for the nice staff, because they were great. It pains me to write a bad review, but I've got to tell it like it is!

Reviews.Title: “If you need to stay near the airport...”
Reviews.Author: OmsocX
Reviews.Content: ...this is the place. I was there for a yoga conference and everything was just as it needed to be. The parking, food and internet were expensive, but they had a free place to print boarding passes. Rent a car if you need to eat. Whole Foods is close. Watch out for traffic on La Ciennega. The highway is safer.

Reviews.Title: “LAX close!”
Reviews.Author: CaptBill64
Reviews.Content: HAve stayed many times and had a good experiance. This Weston is a little older but the rooms a good and the nights sleep is great and LAX is less than 5 minutes away. Great way to start our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Staff not so nice”
Reviews.Author: Globe77
Reviews.Content: The Westin LAX is a nice hotel, great lobby and convenient if you have an early flight out of LAX. My problem was with the frond desk staff, they weren't the brightest nor friendliest bunch I have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous service”
Reviews.Author: RJDUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very convenient for LAX, just a quick bus ride, and inside was well laid out and attractive. The lobby bar is a nice place to relax over a beer and a bite to eat. All in all a very pleasant hotel to stay at - good in all categories But the thing that tips my review into 5 stars is the service provided by the staff of the hotel. I left some property behind in the room that frankly I never expected to see again. But when I contacted the hotel a couple of days later they located the lost item and immediately shipped it FedEx to my house, saving my hundreds of dollars. Fantastic service from a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from beginning to end.”
Reviews.Author: TomIs74667
Reviews.Content: From the time I checked in the hotel staff gave excellent service in each and every category. The facility was neat and clean, room service as well as restaurant service and food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: mfindley
Reviews.Content: The Westin LAX is a terrific hotel. It was very close to the airport and the shuttle service was easy to use. Considering the number of people who were checking in at the same time as me, it was very efficient. It was surprisingly very quiet during the night considering the proximity to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bellhop service”
Reviews.Author: winecountrygirl805
Reviews.Content: Even though it is a big hotel, it was clean, spacious, and my room was very comfortable with all needed amemities were available if I need them What impressed me the most was the bellhop service. I am a sole traveler and I was struggling with my suitcase to check in and then get to my room. A very friendly bellhop came to my rescue and helped me take my luggage up the elevator to my room safely and efficiently. I was there for a business convention so all meals were in one of the banquet rooms. The food was delicious and the banquet employees were fast and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Sweetheart of a Deal!”
Reviews.Author: bjohnson80
Reviews.Content: The front desk personnel that checked me was totally wonderful as I drilled him with a "thousand" question about rooming options since I wanted to have a very special Valentine Day weekend but on a shoestring budget. He made me feel like a high roller or important VIP even though officially I am neither. However, it was a very good feeling to know that as a "regular" customer, the hotel cared so much about me and actually took the time to listen to me. I settled on a corner room which gave me windows on 2 walls and more square footage. The decor was very good and the bed of course was very comfortable. I was surprised by the quality of the food in the restaurant. It was really great and the staff was very attentive as well. The location of the hotel is far away enough from the airport to give you the feeling of not being in an airport hotel but close enough to get to the airport quick especially when you are running late.

Reviews.Title: “Trip from hell becomes a wonderful respite!”
Reviews.Author: Deral
Reviews.Content: We and another couple were escaping the snow for a week on the beach (Troncones, Mexico) when it seemed we were destine to fail. First we were late to the airport. We were already through security when the ticket agent told our friends they were too late to board. However a sympathetic gate clerk did let them board to join us. Then, our first layover was very short. We literally ran through two terminals and a train ride to make our connection. Finally, at LAX we had plenty of time, but when attempting to board, the gate clerk discovered that we had inadvertently brought our expired passports. We were disallowed boarding! Our friends continued on while we had 24 hours to kill while waiting for the correct passports from home. Not wanting to sleep on the floor at LAX we asked several employees of our airline where they recommended we stay. There are many hotels near the Los Angeles Airport but the clear consensus was the Westin. The agent for "first class" check in told us that when she didn't care to make the LA commute after a late shift, she went to the Westin "because of the beds". She even called the hotel and made our reservation. Catching the shuttle (very convenient) we were at the Westin in less than ten minutes. Check in was seamless in a lobby that is large enough for most people's houses to fit inside. This is definitely a "Grand Hotel". Taking what possibly are the quickest elevators in the industry, we were whisked to our eighth floor room overlooking the pool and fitness area. All the expected amenities were in place (a "real" hairdryer for instance) and the bed, the bed was perfect. The comforter was as soft and fluffy as I have seen and just the perfect weight. The mattress too, was perfect. Not too soft, not too hard. Even with the soft rumble of the jets departing LAX, we dropped of to restful slumber in moments. However before we retired, there were several interactions with the staff (at the Westin) that were extremely pleasant and cordial. The lady in the gift shop, when not having a small mirror, (I forgot mine) offered to give me hers from her purse "I never use it" she said. And the bar in the lobby is very, very nice. After the day we had had, a cocktail seemed in order. As fate would have it, we arrived at the beginning of "happy hour" and took immediate advantage of the offerings. We were intending to have dinner in the "Daily Grill" restaurant, just off the lobby (looks so inviting) however this night the "Oscars" were showing and since there were no TV's in the restaurant, the extremely pleasant bartender showed us a tempting "bar menu". As a consequence, we enjoyed a tasty, well prepared meal while watching the awards (they were occurring just 30 minutes away). We then toasted ourselves to a great evening, a great hotel and the misfortune that turned into a vacation within a vacation. Our hat's are off to the staff at the Westin and congratulate them on the fine job they do.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience!!! Thank you!!!”
Reviews.Author: SharonW2010
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed at the Westin and it gets better each time. The staff are wonderful and very attentive. In particular all the staff I encounter in the restaurant are helpful and accommodating especially when I am there for a conference and we have a short time to get in and out with such a big crowd. The food selection is great and every meal was delicious. I now know the names of the staff, and they remember me when I come in. I will be travelling back in May and then again in December, and look forward to staying again.
