I should say that I am a sales manager of a hotel (not the same chain) in Canada and a former meeting planner so I can be critical of services and staff, but have to say that everything has been flawless, and I am delighted to give this review.

Reviews.Title: “Natasha made the stay wonderful. She was a joy!”
Reviews.Author: debraengi
Reviews.Content: The bed was "heavenly". We were treated like royalty. Natasha was very attentive and was eager to assist in any way.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jhonandlisa
Reviews.Content: My wife is pregnant and we had to take a road trip from Nevada to California for my nephews birthday party. We could not fly in because my wife is in her last trimester of pregnancy. We could not be happier with our stay. We were greeted by Maria with a very big smile. Things started out rocky because we got in pretty late and found out that because we had booked through Priceline, we got "run of house". This meant a handicap with two double beds. Myself being 6 feet tall and my wife being pregnant, Maria understood this was not a good accommodation for us. She remembered being pregnant and understood that after a long road trip, at eight months of pregnancy, a king size bed with a full sized tub was absolutely necessary. It took her a while to find a king size bed, but she was persistent and did some magic on her computer, and she did it. She made us feel that if she had to personally go clean an empty room with a king bed, she would have done it. Even if she had not got us the king, we would have praised her for her trying so hard to make us a satisfied guest, for her beautiful smile and lovely attitude. We have stayed at many hotels before, and she could have just said it was not available, like the rest of them. The difference was she cared and we truly appreciate it. Long story short, if you want to stay at a hotel where you are not just and ID and credit card, and where the rooms are actually pretty nice for an airport property, with a nice lobby and great food in the restaurant, consider the Westin LAX. All the staff was exceptionally nice. Thank you Maria!

Reviews.Title: “An extra charge for everything”
Reviews.Author: kikaan
Reviews.Content: The first room we were assigned smelled of tobacco. Got another one . That had a worn office chair and traffic from the road below came through too loudly . They charge 12$ for internet, They charge 22$ for Parking and they even charged 5$ for a small package that was delivered prior to my arrival. That was withdrawn after my complaining. We had flown in from Europe. This international 4**** airport hotel did not have a plug adapter for european appliances. Room service meals have extraordinary many extra charges (+ at least 30 to 35%)

Reviews.Title: “Adequate LAX hotel; nothing special”
Reviews.Author: garfodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night at the Westin LAX. They've renovated the main common areas, which is quite nice, but there's nothing here that makes this a must-see hotel. The airport shuttle to and from LAX is quick and convenient. The Westin is at the end of the shuttle route, which is also served by a couple of other hotels such as an Holiday Inn and La Quinta. This makes it a bit more challenging if you're late for your flight, or if you have a lot of luggage, but is manageable. The rooms were unremarkable. The bed and bathroom were acceptable, but there is nothing that I can say about the rooms, good or bad. I think that they are getting around renovating their rooms fully to the Westin brand standard. There is still work to be done. My room faced away from Century Boulevard, which actually faces the runways, and is also near a dog pound, with a lot of barking. Parking in the LAX area is expensive. The Westin doesn't help here. If you're with Fox Car rental or Thrifty, you can slightly get around this by picking up your vehicle late and turning it in early in your trip, because their rental locations are just a 60-second walk away. (You can probably pull this off with all the agencies, but it means transferring bus shuttles at LAX. For daytime parking, Fox has a parking lot off Glasgow Place that is much cheaper than the Westin's. Irrespectively, you'll be paying notably for parking if you stay at the Westin LAX. All in all, there are dozens of hotels in the LAX area. The Westin is clean and acceptable, but if it costs more than other properties (and especially if it costs more than the other Starwoods, the Sheraton and the Four Points), then it's not that much worth it. Let your wallet decide among the Starwood properties in LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Always a nice stay..”
Reviews.Author: DaveandAmi
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA at least 5 times a year to visit family, I always stay here. Nice staff, clean place, and easy to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: AneeshN
Reviews.Content: Westin LAX was a very comfortable stay with all amenties nearby and proximity to the airport and southern beaches alike. It has a comfortable pool and spa with a good fitness center. The business center and lounge even though small is perfect for ones need. It is a very comfortable business-leisure hotel in LA.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: jwroc
Reviews.Content: convenient...they run a free shuttle every fifteen minutes...dinner/breakfast were both very nice and rationally priced used only as a stopover on way to desert resort

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: robotontoilet
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay here. The hotel was clean, no smells, and did I mention clean? Good starbucks coffee in the morning. Clean showers and good water pressure. Had an amazing sleep in their great comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a renovation and new management”
Reviews.Author: biz-travel-sf
Reviews.Content: The Westin LAX location offers convenient access to the airport. That's about it for its positives. It would be a reasonable choice for an unexpected stay in LA due to a cancelled flight or similar. As always with Westin's heavenly bed, the bed and linens are among the best of any 4/5 star hotel. My spouse and I stayed over at this Westin for Saturday and Sunday nights while traveling on business between San Francisco and Huntington Beach. In hindsight, we should have stayed at the Hilton Checkers downtown (which we love from a 3 night stay in 2010), or onto Huntington Beach where we had reservations at a wonderful boutique hotel. If you plan to do anything beyond an overnight layover at LAX, I would avoid this location. Starwood may have allowed this Westin operate past its shelf life. Most aspects of the hotel look worn and tired - a renovation would be a good idea. The bathroom details are noticeably dirty or corroded. The desk chair had seen better days. The outlets were a spider's web of surge protectors. One of the two phones in the room didn't work. A shower at 1am means having to wait 15+ minutes for hot water to flow. More importantly, the hotel management doesn't appear to have a handle on effective leadership of the staff. The front desk were perpetually understaffed both prior and during my stay. I had to phone the front desk three times just to get through. We gave up on visiting the desk at checkout. Even with SPG Gold status, checkout would have been 30+ minutes. And this location didn't offer a kiosk option for checkout. We returned home just before 1am to learn the hotel had scheduled a 2 hour power outage. We had fun stumbling through the room in the dark. The valet/bellhop staff are particularly lackluster. Bellhops will stand around while you unload the car yourself, then have the audacity to ask to help on the way to the elevator bank. You have to walk up to the valet desk to get help - don't expect them to walk over to you. One morning I visited the sundry shop to buy a container of whole milk for my toddler. We would have purchased milk the night prior, but, the hotel couldn't provide a refrigerator for the room. There is a stern warning not to store personal items in the minibar fridge. So, I figured I would get some in the morning. The sundry shop didn't sell milk, but, very kindly recommended the hotel's restaurant. The restaurant hostess was nice about helping out with this request. It was a little surprising to be charged $2.74 for 6oz of milk for a baby. This has always been my gripe with Westin's and W's - everything is for a fee. I'm a Diamond with Hilton and highly doubt a Hilton property would have taken the time to charge for something as small as 6oz of milk for a baby's bottle. Even a Starwood Aloft or Elements property would not have charged for this. I can appreciate that the hostess is probably compelled by policy to charge. The fault is really her management on failing to empower staff to make small gestures of hospitality. We had a great time in LA for two nights, but, that wasn't really to the credit of the Westin at LAX. I would not recommend this hotel until its renovated and staffed under new management.

Reviews.Title: “Slipped in Quality”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I had previously written a review of this hotel in which I described it as the best of the LAX options I'd tried. In that review, I noted that was probably more of a negative statement about the other LAX hotels than a positive statement about this hotel, although I noted some of the hotel's positive aspects. Unfortunately, I stayed at this hotel again on a LAX layover in 2011, and it appeared that the quality had really slipped; I don't think I'll be headed back. A few problems: Some major problems: 1. My room was dirty. Dirty carpet, a visibly dirt-laden showerhead, crumbs in the corner, etc. Gross. 2. My room was in serious need of renovation. The curtains were ripped, the pictures were hung astray, the bathroom was tired (yellowed light fixtures, etc.), the carpet was worn, the brochures (stacked in a corner area of the desk) were out-of-date and stained with room service food, etc., the lampshades were torn, etc. It just looked TIRED and, more than that, it also indicated poor maintenance. You shouldn't wait for the next major renovation to replace a torn lampshade or ripped curtain. Just fix it! This all, of course, didn't make the room look any cleaner. 3. Some irritating service issues. When I asked about late checkout at check-in, I got tons of attitude about it from the clerk. I understand that a busy airport hotel cannot always meet a late check-out request, but there is no need to give the guest a bunch of attitude for asking if it's possible. Later, after check-out (which I couldn't extend), I needed a land-line phone in order to set-up an international cell phone. Even though the call was toll-free and needed to be no longer than 2 minutes, the original front desk clerk refused to let me use a phone, sending me to a house phone placed in an abandoned bank of pay phones. The person who answered the house phone refused to give me an outside line. This required going back to the desk and then getting management approval to use a telephone (including waiting a few minutes for said manager to appear). Come on -- the front desk clerk can't just send me to a phone near the corner of the desk for 2 minutes?!? Ugh -- a clear sign of a hotel that hasn't empowered it's staff to help customers. Some minor frustrations: 1. I wasn't assigned to the room type I reserved. My confirmation clearly stated that I had reserved a room with one king bed; I was assigned a room with 2 double beds. 2. Despite having gold status with Starwood, my room preferences were not honored by the hotel. In addition to being assigned the wrong room, I was put in a room on a low floor directly by the elevators when my profile calls for exactly the opposite. 3. The shuttle situation is chaotic. The hotel shares a shuttle with two other properties, and by the time the shuttle reached my terminal, there wasn't room for additional passengers. Bags were everywhere, people were crammed into it, etc. -- hardly the situation you want to have to deal with after a very long flight. Note that many of the LAX hotels share shuttles to be friendlier to the environment, so perhaps this isn't a Westin-exclusive issue, but I've not had the overcrowding be an issue with other LAX properties to the extent it was with this one. Yuck. This place is in need of a serious overhaul -- bring on the renovation and some new customer-service training to go with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service from Natasha”
Reviews.Author: sdj229
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the cost. Stayed here to visit friends and the staff was very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great price, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MomInBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business but I had my toddler and mother with me. Traveling across the country with a baby isn't easy but the hotel was very responsive and immediately fulfilled our requests for a crib, refrigerator and microwave. And when the baby came down with a cold, they even had a humidifier! The room was clean and comfortable. The housekeeping staff was extremely friendly and readily supplied the extra tissues needed to nurse the cold. I was attending a conference in the hotel and we were given a very reasonable rate with the conference along with free internet access. The staff at the concierge was extremely helpful when I needed to store some items prior to checking in or when I needed to leave a package to be picked up by another conference attendee. Overall it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “My best night sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: dalton22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Westin Los Angeles Airport due to a business trip. After days of llong meetings all I wanted was a nice glass of wine and a comfortable bed. The hotel provide both. Both the hotel bar and the Daily Grill offered excellent wine and all I have to say is I wish I had a bed like the one at the hotel at home. The bed felt like sleeping on a cloud. If I had the opportunity I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Too perfumy”
Reviews.Author: all-in-balance
Reviews.Content: Actually a very pleasant place to stay, except for this one thing. From the time we stepped into the lobby, to the time we went into our room, my nose and eyes itched and my head hurt from the heavy air perfume. That was totally the only thing wrong with the place. But enough that I probably won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: aguinn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Westin LAX several times. It's close to LAX and yet quiet, with every amenity you need and with the conversion of their lobby restaurant to an excellent restaurant and bar concept, I think it's a true winner. Westin as a concept is excellent, and this property is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “After a long flight we felt at home”
Reviews.Author: 155191ga
Reviews.Content: After the long flight from Zurich to LA and after a very fast check in we felt at home in our beautiful and quiet room. Fantastic beds, everything just perfect. The Westin LAX is going to be our Hotel at LA Airport.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was a lifeline to my son & myself after my husband was taken seriously ill”
Reviews.Author: megisis
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise the hotel enough after the traumatic time we had when my husband was taken ill and into hospital. The 2 managers I particulaly want to mention are Shavonna and Gerald both of them work on the front desk and their help was very much appreciated and even such a busy place they made me fweel like I was very special and did all they could to make life easier for us

Reviews.Title: “great, pleasurable, affordable”
Reviews.Author: janiedeben
Reviews.Content: We certainly enoyed our visit.. the service was outstanding..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: MrOffside
Reviews.Content: As I walked in the hotel, it looks like a five-star hotel in the movies. The customer service was quick and very friendly. The rooms were nice and the bed were very comfortable! It was a quick overnight stay, as I was leaving first thing in the morning. It is very close to the airport and has a free shuttle ride. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Still a friendly and comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rsgtx
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin LAX for many years and it continues to never disappoint me. The staff there, especially Matthew Morgan, has made being a lifeline Starwood member always worth the trip. The rooms are quiet, even facing the airport, and the Daily Grill is a wonderful place to eat ( fantastic Happy Hour prices) or sit at the bar relaxing. The Club Floor is well managed and worth the extra charge. With the airport having so many choices for the traveling public, you can not go wrong with Westin.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms and staff at this hotel is great.”
Reviews.Author: kjrmidget
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel everytime I travel to Los Angeles. It has a great staff. The rooms are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to be stranded at LAX”
Reviews.Author: Eatingouttoomuch
Reviews.Content: I was stranded at LAX and decided to stay an extra night. Hotel was very helpful in providing essentials as I was without my bag. Westin Los Angeles Airport is not a bad place. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. Decor is somewhat dated. Restaurant managed to accommodate large number of other airline guests. Bar food is tasty at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay elsewhere near LAX?”
Reviews.Author: jmullins762
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Westin-Los Angeles Airport recently on a stopover from San Diego to the San Fernando Valley. I booked my room on Priceline.com, so my room was a real bargain! We enjoyed the room. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the large flat screen was nice! The room was very quiet with only occasional noise from planes landing at LAX just a short distance away. I hesitated to give the room an excellent rating because of a stain in the tub, which just seemed out of place for such a high quality hotel. Dinner at the daily grill was wonderful. Breakfast was good, but the service at breakfast was lacking because the server did not come back and ask my wife and I if we would like refills on our coffee until she was clearing plates and bringing us the bill. I was aware of the added cost of parking (about $23) overnight in the self-parking garage, but not everyone may be aware of that, so it is worth mentioning. I would hope to have the opportunity to stay here again if I was in a situation where I needed to stay close to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Westin”
Reviews.Author: msmegan227
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Westin LAX about every 6 weeks or so. I go to a training nearby and my first choice is the Westin to stay in. The staff is friendly and accomodating and the beds are so comfy. At my last stay the check-in staff was so kind and made sure I had an upgraded room on the corner. I sometimes wish I could live at the Westin LAX.

Reviews.Title: “SPLENDID COST BENEFIT”
Reviews.Author: KARALLA
Reviews.Content: The location, close to the LAX airport and Interstate 405 made my stay, easy to go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: SarahMar59
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with a Westin, but this Westin experience had to be a highlight. Employees were tripping over themselves to make ensure all our needs were met.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel w/airport convenience”
Reviews.Author: pedassenko
Reviews.Content: Stranded in LA for two days due to East Coast Weather. Have known this hotel for years and always considered it the best of the lot at LAX. The addition of the Daily Grill as the hotel restaurant is a BIG PLUS. Why would anyone stay anywhere else at LAX?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, very relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaSue13
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, I felt welcomed. My room was ready, and waiting for me. The coffee in the room was Starbucks, which I found as a bonus! My room was spacious, clean, and very quiet. Room service was prompt and professional. I would come back to this location again. It was convenient to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Excellance”
Reviews.Author: cheqisluv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the westin by lax and (not my 1st time) i must say that everytime i go there it's as wonderful and the 1st time. The staff is always on point with questions or whatever it is the you need. The food is superb. I was told that it would be 30-35 minutes but i got my food in like 20 minutes. The ambience is great at the westin. I like going to different hotels to see if theres a better quality place and i just can't seem to shake the westin. When i need a mental relaxation day i run to the westin hotel where i know i can get piece of mind and not be bothered unless i need assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and facilities - I was wow'ed.”
Reviews.Author: therugchick
Reviews.Content: The LAX Westin was a very pleasant surprise. It's not in the best part of city (actually most of LA is not the "best part" of that city) - but this property was an oasis in the middle of the bustle. The staff from the valet to the front desk to the housekeeping teams and everyone in between was exceptional. My only complaints were that this is NOT a part of town to walk around and get some air in, but hopefully the businesses will help renovate the area. My other is that the only restaurant - The Daily Grill - which has exceptional dinners... offered a very over-priced and underwhelming breakfast menu. No one should pay $20 a head for breakfast. Other than that, the Westin itself, is a fantastic option for any business functions and has a great open bar and seating area for socializing and networking.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin LAX provided superior service & great value for price!”
Reviews.Author: SGuariano
Reviews.Content: As a frequesnt traveler, it is always refreshing to receive great service and feel at home when staying at a hotel. The Westin LAX has very knowledgeable staff and willing to assist your travel needs. I would highly recommend this hotel if traveling to the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, spacious and GREAT service.”
Reviews.Author: Catherine1712
Reviews.Content: The Westin Los Angeles Airport is the ideal Hotel for business or leisure accommodation. Being located right next to the airport is a blessing, with shuttles to the airport going 24/7. The staff are friendly, helpful and at all times professional. The rooms are spacious and comfortable - the bed perfect. The restaurant has speedy service and delicious food at reasonable prices. I was suitably impressed with all aspects of my stay. They understand what I needed from my business stay - and attempted to make my time there thoroughly enjoyable. Overall, I had a great time. They had everything covered. If you need somewhere near the airport or just general travel, the Westin is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very average place that's overpriced at published rates”
Reviews.Author: Steffen P
Reviews.Content: Check in takes a long time when the Asia flights arrive in the evening. Rooms are very small and look tired. The area that the hotel is in is very depressing-looking (like most airport locales). Food in the Daily Grill is absurdly expensive...went to Denny's down the road instead. Thanks goodness I got the room for $79 on hotwire...even the cheapest rate I saw on Starwood's website would be poor value. This is not a terrible property, but it also doesn't qualify as a good one in my book. As I have noticed with most Starwood properties the reception area/foyer and restaurants look nice, but the rooms look like they are 30 years old and have been patched to look passable. If one has to stay at the airport for a night like we did, then this is OK. But that's as much as I can say.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with very good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Had a quick stay here before Christmas because Starwood was offering some enticements (to keep our points active). We also looked at the Starwood properties in Pasadena, but ultimately chose this Westin because of a good rate and, most importantly, the Daily Grill Restaurant outpost here. A lot of tour groups seem to stay here. During our last visit, it was Chinese tourists, this time it was Australians, all of whom seemed to have restaurant vouchers. A lot of airline crew members also stay here--they have a separate check-in line, as do Starwood Gold members. These separate lines were not always staffed--while our check-in was quick (but perfunctory), check-out was terribly slow because of this. The hotel is not the closest to the airport, but there is a free shuttle that takes about 15 minutes. For tourists, there is not much to do in the immediate vicinity, but the hotel is in a decent enough location to serve as a home base. The room was nice, large enough for a king bed and pull-out sofa. The bathroom was smaller than that on our last visit. We asked for and received a room facing Century Blvd. (the hotel's front) and heard no airplane noise. I think the runway is to the rear of the hotel. The console that houses the desk, dresser, minibar and TV is nicely designed. The hotel's lobby is spacious. There are many public function rooms and at least 2 ballrooms--there were 3 functions going on simultaneously while we were there. There is a business center with computers (for a fee), plus a few other computers in other locations. Starwood VIP's have a private lounge and computer that seemed to never be staffed. The pool area is small but nicely done, although the jacuzzi was in repair. There is no spa. The pre-arrival and post-stay/survey emails sent by Westin were a nice touch. And then there's the Daily Grill, a restaurant chain serving classic American chophouse fare of high quality that we have always been fond of. Apparently the restaurant here was not always a Daily Grill, and there is a vacant dining space adjacent to it. Besides the lounge that has a small food menu, the Daily Grill is it. Dining options within walking distance are all fast food. For our brief stay we had 3 meals here--late lunch, late supper and breakfast. The Grill also does the hotel's room service, although that menu is not as complete as the restaurant's, and the prices are higher. The restaurant does take-out, so if you want to eat in your room during restaurant hours, this is the more economical option, and what we did for supper. During high occupancy times, they do a breakfast buffet, which we did. It didn't have the widest selections, but was fine. While this hotel probably wouldn't be our first choice for a staycation, it is a fine stopover choice tourists or those with early or late flights. It would be our choice for an airport hotel, thanks to the Daily Grill.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret at great stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: drmarydavidson
Reviews.Content: I called this hotel after choosing a different site and got the the Assistant Manager, Gerald Dotson! I was fortunate, he listened to my needs for a quiet room, etc. I had a wonderful stay, quiet room, excellent room service, most important the most comfortable bed I have experienced in a hotel. I loved their Heavenly bed so much, I have bought one for my home! Also, I was impressed that they provide Starbucks in the room, unfortunately the pod they use is special for Westin and not available for purchase like their fantastic just fabulous beds!! Needless to say I am now going to always look for Westin hotels or other Starwoods hotels when I travel. The staff especially Mr. Dotson, front desk and others along with the overall facility made my stay at the LAX Westin very enjoyable in spite of my short stay in LA .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kara_T_Newark
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel near LAX and chose The Westin since it was close and the rate was good. I liked the Westin more than others near the airport right away because it's located on a slightly quieter strip of Century Blvd. The valet parking/bellmen were incredibly friendly, welcoming and kind. Robert brought my bags to my room and told me about all the various hotel amenties. He was genuine, warm, and friendly and made me feel so welcome. He printed out my boarding pass for me and also some local information I needed. I had a bit of a mix-up with my car rental company in dropping it off at the hotel, and Noe and Raul, especially Noe, went out of their way to help me out. They called the rental company, had my bill faxed over so I could see a copy, and provided me with information about LA. I didn't interact much with the front desk staff. They were fine but not the level of warmth of the front door staff. My room was pleasant enough, but nothing special. The best things about this Westin were the front door staff and it's location near LAX but not quite so busy and hard to get to as the other hotels (also on the free LAX shuttle, which is nice). The signage getting into the hotel needs improvement - I totall missed it and had to go around the block. A friend meeting me there at the same problem. Also cabs were blocking the cab wating area and wouldn't move so cars could not get by, but that was a cab and not a hotel issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome...helpful departure.”
Reviews.Author: Wes64
Reviews.Content: I had asked for early check-in but when I arrived found no rooms ready for occupancy. Natasha apologized and explained the hotel had been filled the night before and the rooms were still being cleaned. I was given a ten dollar voucher to the restaurant for my troubles and had the best burger in the world! Gotta try the peanut coleslaw also. They wouldn't budge off the coleslaw recipe...rats. It was stupid good! Sangeetha sent me on my way the next morning in the most friendly fashion. These young ladies are what's RIGHT with the service industry! Professional and courteous doesn't do them justice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Green, and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: IslandTraveler73
Reviews.Content: What an oasis this was! I have allergies and usually the sheets, air, soaps, conditioners, etc. all make me either itchy or just uncomfortable. But the Westin has made a real effort to make the rooms as clean as possible. The bed was so comfortable and the sheets were so soft. Also, I rarely use the toiletries. But the green tea/aloe products were better than the salon products I'd packed for the trip. Great staff, too. Very kind. The free log-on and printing of the boarding passes was also greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect bed near LAX”
Reviews.Author: RenaAbe
Reviews.Content: I love Westin hotel because they have the most comfortable bed, the heavenly bed. My friend and I chose to stay at Westin LAX to catch the next day flight to Cancun after staying in Las Vegas for our Christmas holiday. Since our plan was to come back to this hotel after our Cancun trip to catch our flight back to Tokyo, we had asked the bell desk manager to store our winter clothes from Las Vegas while we enjoyed our summer temperature in Cancun. Well, we had so much fun in Cancun and got back to Westin LAX once again to enjoy our cozy bed right before 11 hour flight back to Tokyo. As soon as we arrived at the hotel for the 2nd time, the bell desk quickly arranged our winter clothes to be deliver to our rooms. Because of the smooth transaction, our trip was stress-free in between the summer temperature and winter temperature across the ocean. Thank you so much for your hospitality. (Special thanks to the bell desk manager, Rob.)

Reviews.Title: “Not Starwood Friendly”
Reviews.Author: MacVenture
Reviews.Content: I didn't have such a great visit here. Prior to arrival I feared that this would be a typical "popcorn on the ceiling" type of place. Rather than rely on my platinum status I bumped up our room to an executive level. The room was old and the club room wasn't even open. Judging from the other reviews, some floors or wings must be better than others. Unfortunately my experience didn't live up to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great people”
Reviews.Author: cajudy47
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late on way to family Christmas. Shuttle from airport got me there efficiently. Easy checkin all as expected. Heavenly Bed is heavenly! Slept til wakeup call then easy checkout and on our way

Reviews.Title: “best part of our airline delay!”
Reviews.Author: Roberta_A_D
Reviews.Content: We were assigned the Westin after our flight to London was cancelled twice. We were tired, aggravated, and frustrated but the staff at the Westin could not have been more gracious and understanding. We were assigned a quiet corner room - standard double but very fresh and clean. It's true that like most hotels anymore, they don't give you freebies like shower caps with out asking, but we asked for and received shower caps, toothpaste, robes and slippers within a matter of minutes. We also dined in the Daily Grill, which is a GREAT step up from the hotel's former in-house restaurant. The prices are reasonable esp for hotel dining and there's a wide variety of food available in the bar. I really enjoyed our stay and next time may book a night before our departure to get to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great service from the valet to the front desk and beyond”
Reviews.Author: bmpinlongbeach
Reviews.Content: my sisters and i stayed at this westin while one sister was recovering from surgery. upon arrivial we were greeted by victor and ricardo at the valet stand and they really set the tone for our entire stay....they could not have been more helpful, and for such a large hotel the valet service was very fast. we were also very pleased with the front desk service provided by erica valentine. if you are coming to los angeles you wont find a better deal or service.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: dek61
Reviews.Content: I usually do not write reveiw although I travel often for business. This trip was different, one of my closest and dearest friend died unexpectedly in LA and I traveled to his funeral from Scranton, PA. My stay at the Westin was extremely peaceful. I arrived late Thursday 1/14 evening, once I informed the receptionist of reason for my visit she went out her way to accommodate me. The following day, after the funeral which was held at 10am, I returned to the hotel. My flight was not scheduled until 11pm that night rahter than book a room that I would not occupy that evening, I had lunch at the Daily Grill (awesome) and then worked on my laptop in the Preferred Customer lounge. I would highly recommend the Westin...not to mention the comfy bed!

Reviews.Title: “Any time is check in time.”
Reviews.Author: LTRTP
Reviews.Content: Twice I have arrived early in the day. (7am & 10am) They checked me in right away. The staff is friendly and helpful. (Last time - Saugeetha) Don't have to worry about traffic jams making you miss your plane. The Westin is only .4 mile from LAX. Airplane noise pollution has never been an issue. I'm on a budget. The price is right. The location is good for catching public transportation - either Metro buses and or Metro trains. Use Trip planner on the LAMetro.net site or call 323 go metro. (323-466-3876). Very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: ner320
Reviews.Content: Excellent Business Hotel Near Airport. Convenient location. Service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: Redbird31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin on our way back from Fiji. It was only one night. Noisy and the room was shabby. Not even a shower cap.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and fancy hotel I cannot forget.”
Reviews.Author: Small-Islander_34
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend coming from Japan. That was when my friend was about to leave for japan after seeing around San diego and LA using his one week vacation. He did not hesitate to pay a lot of accomodation fee for this hotel because the hotel looked great and also that was the last day for him to use his dollars in the US. The bed room was spacious enough and everything clean. Ive got impressed by a huge picture hanging on the wall at the lobby. I had a great time staying this hotel and I like to stay there one more time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Frequently Stay at the Westin LAX”
Reviews.Author: Woodbury15111
Reviews.Content: Was flying across country for a "mileage run." I always stay at this particular property even when traveling for business. For this quick run, I decided to once again stay at a hotel that I was familiar with; one that is clean, convenient, and welcoming. I have NEVER had a problem with this property and will continue to stay at the hotel as long as they continue keeping the property up and maintain hospitable staff. I think for the price and location, it's an extremely good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location.”
Reviews.Author: AusAm13
Reviews.Content: All hotel staff were helpful and exceptionally friendly. The room was comfortable and clean except needed to be vacuumed. We faced onto the airport which we liked. You can hear the planes but it did not keep us awake. We checked in early and they were very accommodating. We will definitely stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff made the stay excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: nowels1941
Reviews.Content: My husband had just been released from the hospital and we were staying at the hotel for follow up doctor visits. We arrived with loads of luggage we needed for the doctor visits and my husband was unable to help me. The valet stepped up and took care of everything immediately. We walked in and registered in less than 5 minutes and were situated in our quiet room immediately. We ordered dinner in our room and it was delicious. I could not have done everything without the staff's help. It truely was an oasis of comfort after months of hospitals and illness.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport and very clean”
Reviews.Author: dcburke
Reviews.Content: Very close to airport, only took about 10min to get from airport to hotel. traveled all day and was nice to get to hotel so fast. I was pleasantly surprised how clean and beautiful this hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet for business travel”
Reviews.Author: KMac_28
Reviews.Content: There are many hotel choices for business travel surrounding LAX. I have stayed here numerous times and have always found the staff to be accomodating to my needs. The hotel lobby is large, filled with hotel guests but I have always found the hotel to be a quiet place to sleep and work. The bar and restaurant have been recently renovated. The workout room provides state-of-the-art workout equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel for it's location”
Reviews.Author: Harriet62
Reviews.Content: I normally don't expect great hotels by airports, but I found that the Westin is convenient, nicely appointed and has friendly and helpful staff. When you need accessibility to the airport, it's close enough but not right on top of it so there's no noise. I would recommend it highly. On my last stay, I was in the lobby at the computer terminals, printing out my boarding pass. I didn't think anyone was around, but I sneezed; within 2 seconds, a staff member handed me a kleenex. Happenstance, probably. But impressive just the same.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend highly!”
Reviews.Author: trvlg_the_usa
Reviews.Content: I choose this property based upon the great value of room pricing. I was not disappointed at all.. Great Westin Customer Service and nice amenities along with convenient location and overall staff attention to detail and willingness to please will keep me coming back when traveling to LAX. Recommend highly for a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “CHIC!”
Reviews.Author: Angelle99
Reviews.Content: A Very Beautiful & Chic Hotel for an airport location! The Lobby is huge & inviting! Stayed during the Holidays & there was quite a festive mood. The Staff were very friendly! My corner room was absolutely beautiful & very spacious, w/a walk-on balcony w/lounge chair seating. The Heavenly Bed was heavenly! The airport shuttle was on-time.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Go Out of My Way to Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: theshef
Reviews.Content: The Westin LAX is one of the best hotels that I have ever had the pleasure of staying at. I travel quite a bit, and was blown away by the commitment to excellence that everyone at the Westin LAX displays. My check in was flawless, the concierge lounge is amazing, and the free shuttle makes it a "Must Stay" in my book. While many hotels have employees who enjoy what they do, it is clear to me that there is a culture of excellence that exists within every employee.

Reviews.Title: “Good LAX location: Reliable Westin experience”
Reviews.Author: RaiMondo27
Reviews.Content: Given some of the sour reviews, I was expecting a dismal experience, but my stay at Westin LAX was a good one. Reliable Westin comforts and luxuries combined with obliging front desk folks, speedy room service, and a convenient airport shuttle made for a soothing overnight in preparation for a next-day flight. Enjoyed a panoramic view of downtown, Hollywood sign, Century City, mountains, etc. The surrounding area is not exactly lovely (it's near an airport after all), but the property's easy access to / from the 405, could actually make it a good candidate for an on-the-go leisure stay. Would certainly consider returning, and when I do, I hope I don't have to run afoul of some of the haters and complainers who write unfair things about this (and probably every other) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: arthursiew
Reviews.Content: There are so many Westins in the world and the ones in the US are always no good. The only good ones in the US are the ones in New York. This hotel is pretty average as the windows are not really soundproof. You can hear the planes landing and taking off. The sound is pretty much the same if there was no window. I would request a room not facing the airport. The room was just a standard room. A flat screen TV with two comfortable double beds. The bathroom was tiny and service was just OK considering that they were pretty slow. Parking was not free and it's a Category 2 hotel! I would not stay here if we had to pay. 3000 points seems like a lot for a place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Meh. I've experienced better.”
Reviews.Author: mdditt2000
Reviews.Content: I had to check twice at the name of the hotel. I made a mistake booking this hotel and wished I had done more research or read a few more yelp reviews. I am very disappointed with Westin. This is worst Westin Hotel that I have stayed at. I have stayed at about twenty other locations. Now the only thing I cannot complain about was the price for the room per night. It was $89 plus tax. However I stayed here because it was a Westin. I have also stayed at the Hilton LAX one block down the road and it’s fantastic. The problem with this hotel is the service or lack of service. When checking in the girl behind the counter was more interested in ordering her dinner. She was complaining that she never got dinner etc. That is not my problem!! I asked her if the room was facing the airport runway. She didn’t know and had to look at a hotel map. She was rude and I got the sense that I was bothering her with my request. I also asked for a late checkout. She was unable to offer my request. Strange since this is my fourth Starwood stay this month. The rooms are really old. You can see this by the popcorn on the ceiling. I would have to say late 70’s or 80’s. Not Westin standard. I also noticed a lot of dust in the room. The best was clean and confortable. That is very important. I also got help to my room from the bellboy. Something at this hotel is working correctly. Then again I tipped him $5. He was excellent. I should of got his name. Looking at the room service menu it was boing and overpriced. Guess if you want a $20 burger it might work. I used yelp to find a restaurant. I found Ayara Thai. Based on the reviews and menu, Ayara Thai looked really good so I decided to give it a try. I wasn’t disappointed. The food took 15 minutes and by the time I arrived at the restaurant to pick up my food it was ready. There is plenty of parking outside and the staffs are friendly. I asked for extra napkins and plastic cutlery which they gladly provided. I ordered the yellow chicken curry and beef curry. Both came with rice. The yellow chicken curry was a little spicy which I love. This was a perfect meal. I was so happy with my choice and also happy I didn’t order room service or use the expensive hotel restaurant. I won’t stay here again. When checking out there was only one person working behind the counter. I dropped my card in the express checkout box and left. The Hilton does a better job for around the same price. My travel party where also disappointed with my pick. I looked like an Idiot. I wouldn’t recommend this hotel either.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing....much needed rest”
Reviews.Author: TimZOhio
Reviews.Content: Had a late flight into LA and decided to stay at the Westin. The free shuttle service was very handy and dropped us off at the front door. The check-in was very fast and the front desk person was very friendly. The room was very nice and the bed was extremely comfortable. I had a great night sleep which got our trip off to a great start. I'll be staying at the Westin the next time I'm in LA.

Reviews.Title: “All round Great!”
Reviews.Author: Curtis23682
Reviews.Content: the perfect place to stay if you want easy access to airport coupled with all star amenities. friendly service and oustanding standard! will stay next time without doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Roberto355
Reviews.Content: My recent stay the Westin LAX was in conjunction with a conference I attended. My experience at this particular Starwood property was most enjoyable. I was impressed with the cleanliness and friendliness of the staff as I entered the hotel. My check-in experience was very pleasant, helpful, and enjoyable. I was accomodated quickly and very professionally yet with a person touch. The room was very clean and well maintained. I am very fond of the Heavenly Bed and Bath and find them to be a very nice amenity while traveling. I even sleep on a Heavenly Bed at home. All of my contact with hotel staff was very pleasant and friendly. I thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would stay at this property again as well as recommend to friends and colleagues. A+++++++

Reviews.Title: “Great quality and easy location for trips to/from LAX”
Reviews.Author: missyophd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin after having a poor experience at Four Points LAX, and was delightfully surprised. The hotel has all the ammenities you need; just as good as other westin's I've visited. Same noise level as other hotels in the area, you have to expect some noise from flights in/out of the airport. Clean, recently updated, and of course amazingly comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “It was like being in a bad sitcom parody...”
Reviews.Author: klc818
Reviews.Content: Once upon a time, a busy salesperson and her colleagues descended upon the City of Angels. And that's where the fairy tale ends because that's when we arrived at ::The Westin Los Angeles Airport:: (cue menacing music). OK...I'm being overly dramatic. That's what Tinseltown does to you. While this wasn't the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, it definitely was the worst *Westin* I've ever stayed in. Starwood Properties really needs to take a closer look at this property to bring it up to the usual excellent standard I've come to know, love and EXPECT (yes, I broke your non-caps rule Tripadvisor...it was *necessary* to bust out the caps-lock). Westins are usually awesome. Great service, clean, fluffy beds, excellent showers...you get the idea. This so-called Westin - not so much. The bed was great and the food was too, but everything else just blew. (rhymes!) I'll start at the beginning, a couple weeks before my stay. I booked the room through the Starwood website (i.e., not via a discounted travel site) for the very excellent rate of $84.00 per night. Wow! For a Westin! I was stoked and told my colleagues, who would be joining me in L.A. on Sunday night (11/21) for a quota-making sales presentation early on Monday morning, about this fantastic rate at a !!Westin!!. They were stoked as well since they were also accustomed to better-than-average, but still economical business hotels and considered Westins to be a part of this shrinking demographic. That’s when the “if it sounds too good to be true, then it probably is” saying started circling in my brain like vultures targeting roadkill. So, off to tripadvisor.com I went. I did not like what I had to read. I stopped after the third page of “Crikeys, don’t ever stay at this hotel mate!” (or something similar in non-Aussie language). I was now quite dismayed that I had booked myself and my colleagues at a noisy, dirty, poorly serviced and shabby hotel so I wrote to their director of operations, Matthew Morgan, and relayed my concerns to him. He replied that my concerns were for naught since they were ranked #43 out of 289 hotels in the area and that they had a 68% rating on Tripadvisor. He also wrote, “I will personally oversee your accommodations as our VIP guests to ensure you have a great experience and are happy for choosing Westin for your trip!”. Well, that didn’t happen. I arrived at the hotel around 9 pm on Sunday night. Self-parking is very easy to start, but the ticket and pay system is a nightmare. If you are self-parking, ALWAYS bring your ticket to the front desk or you’ll pay $21 every time you take your car out (no attendant). Next, to the front desk and in to the Starwood Preferred Guest line. It wasn’t busy in the least and there were only a couple of gentlemen ahead of me and they were already talking with the desk clerk. After waiting about 5 minutes, it became clear that these guys weren’t checking in or out…they were discussing hot nightclubs to go to in downtown L.A. Isn’t that what a concierge is for? And couldn’t desk clerk see that I was waiting to check in and called one of his colleagues over to help me since they were just standing around anyway? Apparently not because I ended up waiting about 10 minutes for these guys to finish up. Finally got checked in and got to my room on the 11th floor which is the Starwood guest floor (which, other than a free bottle of water is just like every other floor in the hotel). The room was large and seemed clean on first glance (and for the most part was clean, but it’s just so shabby it does appear to be dirtier; take my advice, however, and don’t look behind the furniture unless you want to be grossed out…I dropped a cord back there and had to fish it out and clean it off. Gross.). The window faced a parking lot and a landing strip for LAX – not a pretty view. The bed was the famous Heavenly bed and one of two things that I liked about this hotel. The other thing I liked was the food from room service. It came from an onsite restaurant called The Daily Grill and was really tasty. Calling room service, however, was a little challenging the first time I ordered (I had lunch one day and dinner one night and dessert one night – the key lime pie is phenomenal, btw) since they put me on hold for about 7 or 8 minutes. On the first night I was there, I had just started getting ready for bed – PJs on, face washed, teeth brushed – when the room starting making small tweeting noises like a small bird coming to gently wish me good night. The gentle tweeting quickly progressed to ear-shattering shriek in just under a minute (quicker than the check-in or room service ordering!). It wasn’t an ongoing alarm, however. It came and went in erratic, one to fifteen second bursts of strident calls of imminent doom. Because I know that hotels have false alarms way more often than real alarms, I prudently called down to the front desk to see if all was well. I got a very soothing someone on the phone after about 20 rings who assured me that everything was in hand and there was no need for me to leave my room. OK. I accept that and in to bed I go. And then the alarm starts up again. And then stops. 1-5 minutes later, it starts again. This goes on for the next hour and by this time, it is 12:30 am on the night before my presentation. I tried to call down to the front desk again, but this time no one answered. I peeked out my front door and no one was around. This was about the time I decided to pack my stuff and get out. Yes, I know you’re supposed to leave your stuff when there is a fire. However, I wasn’t convinced there was a fire and if there wasn’t, I was prepared to leave the hotel entirely to get a decent night of sleep. Of course, the elevators have now shut down so I grabbed my suitcase, my briefcase and my purse (all while cursing my tremendous sense of style which disallows me to pack lightly) and started walking down the stairs to freedom (still in my PJs, but now with boots! Hot!). Do you remember when I wrote I was on the 11th floor? Yeah. Super. I made it down to the 5th floor before someone from the hotel FINALLY got on the intercom system and told everyone that the alarm system was malfunctioning, there was no fire and go back to your rooms please. At this point, it’s 1 am and I have a decision to make – go on downstairs, leave the hotel, find another, check in, etc. or trudge back upstairs and try to get whatever sleep remaining that I can. I went with option #2 and let me tell you, going up 6 flights of stairs with 1,000 lbs. of luggage at 1 am is unpleasant. Why didn’t the hotel post employees on each floor to assuage the fears of their guests and keep them from walking around in PJs and boots? Even one guy posting signs on the elevators would have done it. This is just shoddy management. Couple this with the incredibly loud, shake the windows jet engines that blast off all night long from the very close LAX (and yes, I realize I chose an airport hotel, but I would expect better soundproofing for a hotel that was meant to be next to an airport) and you get about 2 hours of sleep. At least I did. That was the worst night of my stay, but the morning greeted me with another surprise – hot water in 5 second bursts only and then ice cold water in between. Refreshing!! Is there anything in the world worse than wanting a hot shower, but only getting cold water? Yes, the alarms at midnight, but this is pretty close second. It took me 20 minutes just to take a shower because I had to turn on the water to get my 5 seconds of hot water then turn it off quickly before the ice water hit my shivering body. This. Was. Miserable. I called down to the front desk who apologized and said someone would come fix it. Still wasn’t fixed by the time I checked out. I ended up going the “sponge bath” route to stay clean. To be fair, Matthew Morgan did contact everyone in the hotel after the alarm incident to apologize. I reminded Mr. Morgan of our previous email conversation and told him how disappointed I was with this property. He did take off the cost of the room on the “alarm night” at my request (he didn’t make this offer unprompted). He offered free hotel nights for future stays at this property which I declined. Even if you’re offered a free [--] sandwich, you don’t take it because it’s still a [--] sandwich. Take my hard-earned advice since I didn’t heed the warnings of other trip advisors. Don’t stay here. There are many other hotels in L.A. that don’t suck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: NJD04
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Nice, comfortable rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel at such an affordable price!!”
Reviews.Author: SuzeeTO
Reviews.Content: My hubby and i were in Los Angeles for a few days on business. We had intended on staying at a beachfront hotel but much to our dismay...we were sadly disappointed at the room/hotel we stayed on our first night for $300/night! The next morning we searched online for other accomodations as we could not fatham spending another 3 days/nights there. Found a few places online to check out and registered for Starwood as they were affiliated with several excellent hotel companies (Sheraton, Westin, etc). The Westin Los Angeles Airport (along with all other Westin hotels) claimed they had "heavenly beds" which peaked our interest since we wanted to sleep in comfortable beds. We drove by a few of the hotels we'd seen on the list and the Westin was just outside the extremely busy area of the airport. We called and made a reservation thinking we could always try another hotel the next day. We weren't sure what to expect since it was almost 1/3rd the price of our original hotel. WOW....the hotel was very impressive inside....the rooms were extremely clean and fresh smelling...the service was excellent!!! The hotel had a great gym room (which was a criteria for us) and we felt safe parking in their parking lot. We ordered room service (food was excellent!!) and even rented movies that were playing in the theatres....what a great way to relax!!! Everything was close by.....highways, restaurants, shops....did a lot of sight-seeing. Would definitely go back again....amazing hotel at such an affordable price....more money to spend shopping!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: wotnots
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Westin because my seminar also took place at the same venue. The staff was ultra friendly. The room was quiet, clean -- with the exception of dust when I arrived. The bed was clean and ultra comfortable. The cost to use the internet was too much -about $12USD/day! A lot of hotels in the LA area give internet for free!

Reviews.Title: “Would definately return”
Reviews.Author: jim-in-alberta
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a good quality place to stay I would recommend the WESTIN at LAX. Free shuttle to and from the airport was a nice find as well. I had returned from a cruise and took the cruise shuttle to the airport and picked up the shuttle to the hotel. Having a full day with not much to do, the concierge referred me to a local shuttle to Manhattan Beach where I had a great day. Would definately return the next time I looking for an overnight layover.

Reviews.Title: “A Rose among the Daisy's at LAX”
Reviews.Author: Ted2727
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA often enough that I have my favorite places to stay and eat, and the LAX Westin is my favorite choice in hotels. The friendly staff, great location right off the 405, and excellent amenities and restaurant make this a very easy choice. Rooms are very business oriented, but also very comfortable, and just far enough off the main path to not hear the busy LAX aircraft traffic. The health spa is very well equipped for even the serious athlete, parking is attached to the hotel for easy 24 hour access, and the staff are very polite, well trained and attentive, helping with every need for the both the pleasure of business traveler. The newly renovated restaurant makes dining even more of a pleasure, and the “commons” meeting area make the quick meet and greet or the “let talk for an hour” easy and accessible. Try it on your next VISIT; it will quickly become your favorite too.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: 60795Citytocity
Reviews.Content: The Westin is so relaxing when you are fried from a busy day. They have a great bar, restaraunt, lounging areas and yes an exercise facility!!! I always use this Westin as the people are friendly and cabs are always there for you to take you anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel.”
Reviews.Author: johnkhoury
Reviews.Content: This is a very well managed hotel that is conveniently close to LAX. The rooms are well designed and comforable. The staff is knowledgeable and courteous. We had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent location, a definite winner”
Reviews.Author: taoarts
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The service was excellent and the hotel restaurant was a real treat. Be sure to take the free airport shuttle. Don't waste the time/money on a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expections”
Reviews.Author: SteffieK
Reviews.Content: I had a thirteen hour layover at LAX on my journey home after a long vacation. I was looking for a hotel that provided a day rate and had a reasonable gym and pool/sauna. Although not advertised, when I called to book in the girl I talked to was very helpful in finding out whether or not The Westin accomodates day rates. They do and at a very reasonable rate. The room was fantastic, clean and had everything you could ask for. The gym though was really unbelieveable as far as hotel gyms go. It has a variety of new equipment, ample space, and it's clean. It has everything you need to workout, without skimping. The pool is huge and beautiful. It was raining so I didn't swim, although I certainly could have as the pool is kept at a nice temperature. There is a hot pool and sauna as well, which were added bonuses. The staff were great right from the moment I walked in... not to mention the free shuttle to and from the airport which was icing on the cake. I didn't eat at the restaurant mostly due to timing, however the room service menu was tempting and included a variety of healthy options which was nice. I will definitely stay at the Westin LA Airport whenever I'm in the area and feel very comfortable recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: world73
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Had a car, so no problems to move about. No complaints. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff, great sleep”
Reviews.Author: whitefalcon1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Westin Los Angeles Airport I have stayed there before when I have been in LA and will do so again in the future. Everything from staff to the amazing beds gives me the perfect experience. I will be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is a Little Dated, but the Convenience and Beds are Worth the Stay”
Reviews.Author: bjspa
Reviews.Content: I purchased my room from Priceline.com for USD$85, USD$104 with taxes and fees and I stayed one night. I flew in from Australia at 6.30am and was very grateful that they let me book in at 7.30am after a 14 hour flight. The Westin offers a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport and it comes approximately every 15 minutes. Their beds are amazing and I had a fantastic sleep. The hotel is a little dated, but still very clean and nice. I cruised past the well-equipped gym and the outdoor pool area was nice. They had a decent size business center that is open 24-hours and can be accessed via your room key. There are computers in the lobby and they allow you to print your boarding passes for free. I didn’t eat in the restaurants. I simply walked across the road and had a taco salad at Taco Bell / Pizza Hut Express. McDonalds is just down the block and there are two gas stations on the corner for drinks and snacks. The Westin has vending machines that sell drinks and snacks for a fraction of the price of the items included in the mini-bar. Hint – become a Starwood member (membership is free) and get free Internet access and printing in the lobby. Otherwise, Internet is available in the room for USD$11.95 per 24 hours, I used the Wi-fi, for the same price, as I had my laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Kika2449
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the first weekend of September 2010 and the room was nice and everything overall was pleasant. The only thing we didn't like were the daily parking fees and the fact that if you even move anything in the fridge mini bar or snacks in the tray, they WILL charge you for it assuming that you ate/drank it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent 5 hour stay”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 hours when our red-eye flight out of LAX was canceled. Our airline directed inconvenienced travelers here or to the Marriott, which is closer to the airport, but for both hotels you need to take a shuttle. Our room and one meal was comped by the airline, and since we arrived at the hotel at 1am, our meal was breakfast. The hotel has a pleasant port-cochere and lobby. There is only one restaurant, but it's a name brand one--a Daily Grill outpost. They also do the room service menu. Our room was a decent size, with a nicely designed console that housed the desk, dresser, minibar and TV. The furnishings showed a bit of wear and tear. The beds were fine. The bathroom was large, single sink. Something was wrong with the water temperature in the sink and shower--it only came out hot and hotter. Similarly, the room thermostat was not too responsive--the room was warm. The hallway to our room passed the pool area, which looked small but pleasant. Breakfast at the Daily Grill was nice. They have a pretty elaborate buffet, plus a la carte. There were many tourists traveling in a group with breakfast vouchers when we were there. We had to eat and run to catch our rebooked flight. The free shuttle also stops at a nearby Holiday Inn and La Quinta. We had no experience with airplane noise, given the late hours of our stay. All in all not a bad place to be "stuck" for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, compassionate service”
Reviews.Author: mar091
Reviews.Content: Due to unforseen circs @ my house (skunk attack) had to stay at a hotel and the staff made my stay a pleasant event, from the front desk to the restaurant (and comp'd my parking). Of course, the dream beds are a major plus.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: OR2010
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel. And if you have to stay here, avoid Room No. 953 on the 9th floor. I stayed here for one night with my wife and 2 year old daughter. The room was filthy - it was obvious that the carpet had not been vacuumed after the last occupant , with dirt clumps and food(?) fragments on the floor. Further, the room was in a very badly maintained state. The front door handle seemed partially broken. There were gashes and cracks on the room and bathroom doors, and on the walls. The air-conditioner was barely working making it very difficult to sleep in a warm room. Finally, the soundproofing is terrible and the noise of departing/arriving airplanes is quite loud. It should be noted that the room was on a "Starwood" preferred floor. I was thankful that I had a flight connection the following day, and did not have to spend more than one night at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but noisy !!!!”
Reviews.Author: UncleDom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of my trip around California & was expecting a nice end to my trip staying in a fancy hotel but I was somewhat let down with what I got. The hotel itself is super, good location not far from the airport, near the freeways ( 15 minutes to Manhattan beach) & nice lobby. Check in was prompt & efficient when I checked in on the Monday afternoon. I was allocated a room on the 3rd floor facing the road. On arrival in the room it came apparent that you could hear the traffic from the road below so I asked the front desk to move rooms. This was done & I was allocated a room on the 8th floor facing the airport. Great I thought I can see the planes takeoff & land !!!!!!!!! Bathroom was perfectly okay, water pressure on the shower could be a bit stronger otherwise all okay. Room was a good size, big comfortable bed but beware of fridge & snack tray - they are both on sensors & you will be charged if you move something. Even if you ask them to empty the fridge there is a $25 charge. However there is a Starbucks coffeemaker in the room for fresh coffee. Good a/c & large flatscreen tv. The first 2 nights were good, there was aircraft noise until about midnight & then that was it but on the last night tha airport seemed to have changed the takeoff pattern & they started taking off from the hotel side of the runway & this was constant from 4.30/5 am in the morning so really bad nights sleep. Looking at earlier reviews, there never seems to be a mention of aircraft noise, I do not know whether the windows are not as soundproofed as they should be or if I am stupid for staying so near to the airport - the runway is right by the hotel, other airport hotels are not as near to the runway, so if you are thinking of staying here be aware. Otherwise I liked the hotel, it was big & classy - self parking was $20 a day but you could park in the housing estate behind the Travelodge for free- it certainly was safe the 3 nights we parked there & the area is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Practical”
Reviews.Author: amritsingh
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to stay at. Close to airport. Nice and clean place, but nothing special. They upgraded us for free, but still.... I would go back though as it was easy and practical for us. The breakfast was included as SPG member, but also very simple and sparse.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: chernomorez
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Westin LAX for 1 night during the Labor Day weekend. I used 3,000 SPG points for that stay, and the regular rates are under $100, thus making one of the best-valued Westins in the major US cities. Parking is on the hefty side, though - about $30 night. The room was clean, the bed was comfy. Watch out for the sign on the mini-fridge warning you of $25 fee if you remove the snacks from the fridge to store you own stuff. Getting to Hollywood is about 20-25 minutes. Manhattan Beach is about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay at the Westin Los Angeles, and would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: AndyK10
Reviews.Content: The Westin Los Angeles Airport is an amazing hotel. My husband and I stayed there for our honeymoon. We wanted a hotel by the airport so we could take advantage of the free shuttle, which was great! We had a flight very early in the morning, so it was great not having to worry about calling a cab. The shuttle comes around very often as well, which was nice. From the moment we arrived at the hotel we had prompt and EXCELLENT service. When they found out it was our honeymoon they upgraded us to the Executive Floor, and compensated us for some of our expenses during our stay when we left. We often spoke with the concierge desk for tips on where to go and how, and they were excellent at giving us a ton of great information on how to see the city. Aside from all of the great service, the hotel itself was beautiful! It was luxurious and a great place to stay on a honeymoon. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Room/Reservation System Failed... and that was the tip of the iceberg”
Reviews.Author: lindros2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in dire need of an overhaul. I was one of many travelers who suffered as the hotel's room reservation system failed, resulting in manual check-in's. Some travelers waited over four hours to check in, clogging up the lobby and making everyone very unhappy. This went on for days, and COULD have been prevented with better planning. Once in my room, the other reviews are accurate - the hotel is old, dirty, and generally undesirable. Final note - I'm still negative on money (having found another hotel for the first night of my stay). "Resolved" in their language is not "resolved" in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected. That's not a good thing.”
Reviews.Author: Notam
Reviews.Content: Sadly Westin LAX elected a trainee (poor guy) to work the "Gold/Preferred Starwood" check-in. My encounter at check-in was brutal (you know when the staff talk about you you as if you weren't there) and took about 10-15 minutes. The room we were assigned was not airport view (which I requested), but rather a boring "B aircraft approach" view (however, it was great for voyeurs to view into our suite). We weren't advised of the Starwood lounge access. As for the restaurant, the menu consisted of heavy North American dishes at an airport not catering to Asian / time changing stomaches, so we were obligated to eat away from the Westin. We wanted to swim but could not find bathrobes in the "executive suite" to go with some dignity to the pool. We sauntered down to the pool in our trunks and could not find a place to rinse prior to entering the pool other than at the locker through the gym. We apologized to the gym folks that we apperantly had to walk wet through the gym to the pool. Our suite was hot, so we attempted to turn down the air conditioning. All we got in return was a whole lotta whining, noisy air conditioning and no change to the room temp. At check-out, we were essentially ignored. Way too many choices at LAX to put up with this. This hotel is a no for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: lilaloTLV
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire, so we couldn’t read the reviews before our stay, otherwise I would never book it. The problem in this hotel is the very low service level. The location is great for LAX, the room was clean & the bed was very comfortable. But the air condition didn’t work, on the hottest day in LA for years. So we called., 3 times, waited 2.5 hours in an impossible atmosphere before the maintenance guy arrived, and said he fixed it. Well, he didn’t. And we had to wait another 1.5 hours before we were moved to another room. I spoke with the front desk’s manager, who apologize, but didn’t do much more. The next day, on our way to the terminal we called for baggage assistance. I specifically check the night before if I should call 30 minutes before. No they said. 5 minutes would be enough… Mistake! We had to wait in our room for 25 minutes, called 4 times, and eventually, I walked personally to ask them to come. I wouldn’t stay in this hotel again. There are much better choices in the area

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: toymum
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time we have stayed at The Westin in the past 2 years both times after long flights from Australia and both times we found the rooms to be clean and comfortable. Check in was quick and the shuttle fast and reliable. For the very reasonable prices that you can find on discount sites it's a great value stopover hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Regular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RachelCC
Reviews.Content: Was quite disappointed with my first interactions with this hotel. Besides bad service with some of the workers, they did try to make it better by upgrading me to a suite (which was nice- but your typical suite). Nothing special in the rooms- except it has a living room- their bed's are known to be "heavenly" it ain't all that. It's just a down pillowtop if that. Got a great deal for this hotel- and the price for the hotel was great- considering it was cheap. Probably wouldn't stay here if it was full-price. I do, however, love the Starwood Hotels- not sure why this once was so bad. We had to pay to use the internet- and you'd think being a Starwood Preferred Member- you wouldn't have to pay for free-wifi- you did! The room was clean, loud airplane noise- but that was because we were right by the LAX airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jtraveler0
Reviews.Content: Just booked this hotel via priceline and we thought we got a good deal for a 4 star hotel. When checkin in we found out that parking costs 20 dollars per day and it is not included in the hotel price. The original deal got now a little more expensive. When entering the lobby you expect your room to be as exclusive and nice as it. But surely it was not. The rooms are old. Our courtains were really dirty and had even holes in it. The internet was not for free and even the using the phone to call 1800 numbers costs 2 dollars per call. If you look at the regular price of such a room you pay uo to 350 a night. I would expect drfinetely more for the money and no hidden extra charges like for the internet access which is free even in the cheapest motel. Overall the rooms were clean, the bed was comfy but definetely not a 4 star hotel. So just be aware in case you book on priceline for a 4 star hotel in the LAX area that you could end up with the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an overnighter”
Reviews.Author: Mayoress
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Westin as we had to pick up one of our friends from an early flight into LAX. The area is fine, right by the airport so it was really handy for us. We got a special deal from a website so the rates were quite good for what we got. A king room (which was booked) was unavailable as we were quite late checking in, but they upgraded us to a room on the executive level with two doubles and a voucher for our parking (normally $20) It did take quite a while to check in, I imagine that it's always quite busy being so close to the airport, but check-in itself was pretty quick. The room was clean, comfortable and bathroom was fine. Ours had a pretty decent shower which I would have been happy with if I'd just stepped off a long-haul flight. We had a view of the runway and yes, the sound of planes taking off was a bit noisy, no complaints though, we were right by the airport so you can't really expect silence. That said, it doesn't go on all night. Probably stopped about 12 or 1am and started up again around 6am. Breakfast on the exec. level was complimentary but they do have room service (pretty pricey!) and a restaurant downstairs. Plus there are a few fast food places right nearby.

Reviews.Title: “High priced average”
Reviews.Author: JulieA14
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for three nights because the hotel was hosting ANTM tryouts. I received a better price because i am a teacher... they offered us a FREE breakfast every morning. Well, we have had many free breakfasts at lower-end hotels that had a satisfying variety, but our complimentary breakfast consisted of 1 pastry and one cup of coffee... Seriously, is that it? Well, the barista said we could also have a bannana..wow, i thought that was a little deceptive for a Westin. The hotel restaurant was about 50.00 for 2 for breakfast. We, as well as a couple pilots, walked 2 blocks to subway and the international internet cafe. Across the street was a Denny's. The rooms were fairly small but the beds are the most comfortable beds i have ever slept in...One problem we encountered was dogs barking continually ALL day long starting at 7:30am and continuing until 8:00pm (there must be a kennel nearby) They woke us up every morning. If you close the window you can't hear the planes but we could hear the dogs). The pool is small but nice and warm. It is extremely loud out at the pool but i did expect that since it is right by the airport and a busy traffic area. The staff was very friendly and the maids did an excellent job cleaning the rooms, same time every day. The lobby is beautiful and the elevators talk to you and tell you were you are... We didn't rent a car because the shuttle takes you to and from the airport, so we took the trolly for five dollars (all day pass) and visited the huge, fine sandy Manhatten and Memosa beaches, great shops and restaurants...volleyball tournaments, surfing, bicycle rentals and many beautiful people to watch...lol.

Reviews.Title: “Decent quality rooms for airport hotel--but shuttle service disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mommythek
