Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several different LAX hotels, and this is one of the nicest in terms of quality of hotel restaurant, room size, etc., but there were some real negatives. Whle the hotel is "non-smoking," the rooms still smell musty and were never really cleaned of their smoking smell. Most importantly: The shuttle is no longer just run by the Westin; it is shared with three or four other, lower-grade motels in the area. The shuttle was overcrowded and slow. If you're in a hurry to get to the airport you're better off taking a cab--which, of course, defeats the purpose of staying at an airport hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Still .. better than the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: MrsMcGonagall
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here, in transit to Hawaii. Last time we were at the Hilton and found it pretty insignificant. The Westin is a pretty good hotel, clean, good beds, they have a restaurant inside, airport shuttle, quiet area. Not spectacular, but pretty good for an airport hotel. We used the pool to cool off after 10 hours of airplanes, they have a small clean pool and a small hot tub - exactly what we needed and expected. However the greeting at check in was well below average, also the guy before us received the same treatment (the man at the desk whispered questions and seemed annoyed that nobody could understand what he was muttering, and gave me informations regarding the pool only upon specific question: is it outside? Yes (silence). Do you offer towels? Yes (silence). Where is the pool? Third floor (silence) - he seemed happy when we finally went away. Also, when we asked for a car/ prices to go downtown the concierge managed to get us the most expensive transportation mean he could - at his benefit I assume - we spent 70 dollars to the destination, and 35 on the way back (the restaurant called a taxi for us). Generally my reviews aren't filled with these silly details, but I wanted to explain what annoyed me about the hotel - there are many spectacular reviews I don't really agree with - but maybe we just found the wrong people. And it was a one night stay so take the info for what they are.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Solid Hotel with Convenient Location and Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Robolo64
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin LAX with my family when my sister graduated from UCLA. It was great to be able to catch a (free) shuttle from the airport right to the hotel, very conveneintly located to LAX. The hotel is nothing but Westin comfort. Since my Dad is an SPG Gold member, we got to chill in the lounge while he arrived in the expedidted Gold/Platinum line. The lounge was realxing and it was nice to have complimentary refreshments while we checked in. The room was great; again, Dad's Gold status got him what Starwood calls an "enhanced room", and while not an upgrade per se, it was a room away from the airport runway, on a high floor with a balcony. I know other reviewers complained about the noise, but it really isn't that bad, and honestly, what did you think you were going to hear when you booked an airport hotel? Airport noises didn't bother me at all. All in all, it was nice to see those SPG benefits in action. I slept soooo well, even on a rollaway! The rollaways have the same mattress as the normal beds, only smaller. Awesome comfort. We didn't interact with the staff much, but they were professional, very friendly and there were never any mishaps of lapses in service. Some of the bathroom hardware was on its' last leg; rusty bathroom fans in the shower, etc., but that was really the only negative thing I can think of about this hotel. Parking does cost money, but, welcome to LA, right? I didn't dine at the in-house restaurant so can't comment on it, but it looked fine. The lobby bar seemed to be a nice place to relax. Overall, great palce! Delivers on Westin's brand of sanctuary and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin brand at its finest - convenient location, an extraordinary team of people”
Reviews.Author: shoegirl777
Reviews.Content: Being on the road approximately eight months out of the year provides one the opportunity to see a variety of hotels. The Westin at LAX has become like a second home away from home for much of our team of road warriors. The Westin – LAX staff are by far some of the best I have had the opportunity to meet. They go above and beyond in assisting and anticipating guest needs. From the moment of arrival at valet to the bellmen to the check-in – they remember our names, our preferences, and strive to anticipate our needs and not only meet them, but surpass them. The hotel is situated right down the street from LAX airport. The one side of the hotel provides a cool view of the airport where you can see planes taking off and landing. The other side of the hotel is much quieter if so desired.  The pool is good size with the ability to actually swim. Hot tub, sauna, and fitness room are also available. Rooms are very comfortable – normally larger than the standard hotel room one would be used to, and they feature flat screen tvs. The Westin Heavenly bed is just that – heavenly. Convenient on site restaurant (The Daily Grill) and also the bar / lounge in the hotel all providing very good quality food. The value of the hotel is well worth your stay if in the area. And, if one has time – the beach is approximately three miles from the hotel. I would very much recommend this hotel as a preferred location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The beds truly are heavenly”
Reviews.Author: forensiclisa
Reviews.Content: Be sure to show your AAA membership at the front desk to get $9 parking instead of $20! Other reviews have complained about the location and neighborhood. I did not find either to be an issue. The highway was right there - less than 7 miles to Venice Beach! - and there is so much growth and activity particularly on the hotel block, we never felt uneasy. Of course, we weren't walking around but simply driving to McDonalds or the corner store which proved to be no big deal. The room and particularly the beds were wonderful. I'm looking into buying a heavenly bed for my mother for Christmas! The guests didn't seem to like that my young family was sharing their extremely nice surroundings but the staff was absolutely wonderful and accomodating in every way. Highly recommended. Didn't feel like we were staying at the airport at all.

Reviews.Title: “Best value ever”
Reviews.Author: Antstro
Reviews.Content: If you are a business traveler, I guess Westin has just what you expect. But for the budget minded vacation traveler, this is the perfect base for a L.A. vecation in high season. As the prices sour in the surrounding areas, we had one of our cheapest and best nights at this hotel. The deal we got through Hotwire was better than for the two stars hotels we had stayed at the previos nights. Those hotels had of course free continental breakfast, free parking and complimentary WIFI which this hotel has not. If you require this, your stay will be at least 50 percent more expensive. You even have to pay 7 dollars to use the internet terminals in the lobby for a couple of minutes. But the luxory you get, is all worth it. If you don´t want to pay for parking, there are a few free parking spots just around the corner from the hotel and more are to be found in the residential area on the other side of the road between W Arbor Vitae St and Century Blvd. Cheap fast food can be found just across the street. We also stayed one night at the Sheraton Gateway. Both were great but Westin seems less worn down, has a nicer pool area, bigger restrooms and a larger TV with much more HD channels. The only issue you could have with both these hotels is the noise from the airport, but it did not bother us. LAX is short drive from Venice and Santa Monica beaches. Westfield Culver City shopping mall is a five minutes drive away north on 405 and to Hollywood it is 30 minutes if there is no traffic.

Reviews.Title: “can't go wrong, but expect nothing special”
Reviews.Author: griswolds09
Reviews.Content: average airport hotel and below westin standards, but well worth the money. it's (safe) location is on the end of w.century blvd and, seen from the airport, beyond other hotels of this catagory such as radisson,sheraton,hilton and marriott. free airport shuttle runs about every 20min. next to the hotel one can find subways, open 24/7, and across the street a taco bell restaurant. a few steps further on are two gas stations e.g. for liquid supplies :-) outdoor pool ia rather small and can get crowded. after all a fine hotel with clean rooms and good beds. various car rental companies are within walking distance. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, Value and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: SteveK61
Reviews.Content: Needed a Starwood Hotel near LAX which was also close to car rental return. The Westin Hotel fit the bill. Easy parking at the hotel garage. Great front desk service. Clean, comfortable Westin room. Great night's sleep and then 5 minute drive to car rental drop-off, shuttle to LAX and no hassle trip home.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average”
Reviews.Author: annazam
Reviews.Content: We decided to check in at the Westin for one night in order to rest after our 16 hour flight from Asia before heading to Vancouver. We chose this hotel primarily for the ff reasons ... a.) we wanted to make sure we had a good night's rest in their heavenly beds, b.) hotel seemed relatively newer as it was renovated in the last couple of years, and c.) proximity to the airport and hotel shuttle The room was pretty average and starting to show wear and tear despite the renovation. Carpets looked faded, curtains looked slightly gray and the work desk had so many nicks and dents. We came in with 4 luggages, 2 handcarries and space was tight for a family of 3. We were staying overnight so it was bearable but if stayed longer it would have been an issue. Bathroom was clean enough but this is where you can see how old the hotel/building is. Smaller floor tiles, bathtub and old fixtures. Westin is known for their heavenly beds but it felt pretty regular. We remembered our first experience of the heavenly bed in Hawaii hence the reason we felt it we could never go wrong. I guess we were a little disappointed with the overall room quality. As for the vending machine in our floor, they should always replenish that. I had to go to 3 different vending machines in different floors in order to buy a small bottle of Dasani Water. We felt so irked that after a 16 hour flight this is what we have to deal with. The staff should atleast anticipate that water should readily be available. One thing we can rave about is the staff at The Daily Grill. They were very accommodating to us and our 6 year old son. And the steak recommendation that they gave was absolutely good! All in all, we've stayed at other better Westin establishments. Pretty average for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for airport travel”
Reviews.Author: WhitbyTerry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for airport travel, especially if you have a rental car. Alamo and Thrifty are right next door and the others are just down the street. The room was a nice size with a great view and the beds were very comfortable. There is an LCD TV and long desk. No concerns with the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Special Thanks to Hotel Associates”
Reviews.Author: drrenea
Reviews.Content: To the staff of The Westin Hotel at Los Angeles Airport. I have had an opportunity to stay at your hotel on several business trips and the staff has been very professional and supportive in accommodating our needs. I would like to personally thank Sangeetha, the associate who assisted with my check-in. Great job at anticipating the needs of your guest. You deserve an award for your customer care.

Reviews.Title: “Barking dogs, jet engines and dust”
Reviews.Author: flightops75
Reviews.Content: My room on the 10th floor overlooked a dog kennel where dogs have been barking since 10am now..it is now 8pm. The jet traffic is non stop which I understand it is LAX but they need to make their sound proofing better. The pool was not really that desirable and we watched 4 westin employees walk by a table with old food and trash everywhere and not one cleaned it up. This place needs some serious attention. I am an SPG platinum member and I was seriously disappointed. The rooms were ok...noticed the dust that prior posters had talked about. You think someone would read the prior comments and change this.

Reviews.Title: “very nice for planespotters”
Reviews.Author: cseixas
Reviews.Content: For a transit stage very good situated. Personel was more than helpful with us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bed, great rates but don't expect too much.”
Reviews.Author: AppleExec
Reviews.Content: Plus - Safe parking, comfy beds, HD TV, Starbucks coffee in room, good rate. Cons - $22 parking per night, Old hotel and parts of the hotel/room smells, needs dusting, gloomy hotel. Dpn't expect much if you booked thru hotwire. I booked this hotel thru Hotwire and got a great deal for $89/night x 3 nights. The hotel was built in 1986 but have been updated and renovated inside. I was greeted without a smile at the front desk and the first thing they told me is that my room was booked thru Hotwire. With that statement at the start, I was hesitant to ask about SPG benefits for this stay. They told me that I don't earn points for the stay since I booked thru Hotwire and only incidental charges are eligible. On the plus side their heavenly Bed was very comfy and sheets were nice. The bathroom didn't smell so good and the hallways just felt like an old gloomy hotel. (On a side note, I booked Sheraton gateway LAX back in May thru expedia and got SPG points and FREE HOT BREAKFAST for two, and free appetizers at the bar!!! I'm not even platinum SPG) Parking is safe and attached to hotel but cost $22 per night . I was offered Internet and continental breakfast for extra $30/night but I declined since there are a lot of places around to eat. Another plus side is the starbucks coffee pouches for free in the rooms. If you're looking to just crash for the night then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LAX Hotel....Excellent Servie”
Reviews.Author: Chatoling
Reviews.Content: Hello: I just flew in from a trip to Hong Kong and needed a quick quiet night at a hotel close to LAX. I picked the Westin as I love the heavenly bed and other amminities. Well everything was pefect from the check in to the check out I was delighted. I also had a quick drink and late night bite to eat and that was even very enjoyable and the food was excellent. I highly recommend this property for the proximatiy to the airport, cleanliness and very quiet. Thanks Westin, keep up the good work Mark

Reviews.Title: “It could have been more”
Reviews.Author: fluidtlm
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with The westin! Exceptional service and value. We usually book Westin through SPG however this time we won the room through Hotwire. I am not sure wether it was because Hotwire, I received harsh treatment on the phone and in-person. When I called to request for crib, the person on the phone was super rude and talked down to me and gave me a hard time about requesting for a crib because I booked the room through Hotwire. When we checked in, the room was dusty. However the room is spacious and you hardly hear the planes. The Grill in the lobby is fantastic and their pot pie is simly amazing. We were there for a night to catch an early morning flight so we didn't really care too much. They charge for wi-fi and for parking.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best run hotels ever - worldwide. Outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: K36Alber
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in hotels all over the world and this is one of the best. They make parking, check-in, check-out and everything in between a pure pleasure for their guests. They are consistently involved with guest comfort and nothing else. I was totally impressed. The rooms are up-scale basic but are all there. Great maid service, dining service, fantastic meals and every needed perk imaginable. I didn't mind rendering a few extra tips for the great service. Would stay here again in a New York minute. Which is our next stop.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: CaliTravels
Reviews.Content: When I stay in the Los Angeles area near the airport, I pretty much always choose this airport. Hands down, the best value and more for the money! I took my mother and grandmother to stay in this hotel with me and they were so amazed as were many of the other guests. You'll often find guests taking pictures in the beautiful lobby and and outside of the hotel. The room was amazing and we had a view of the runway which kept my grandmother occupied for hours. It's not loud at all. The beds are very comfortable and the linens and amenities are plentiful and luxurious. This is definitely one of my favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience.....Again.”
Reviews.Author: RKELLIOTT1
Reviews.Content: Third conference I've attended at the Westin Los Angeles Airport in three consecutive years - the first time was Outstanding, and each time since has actually been better. Awesome staff, overall facility, and guest rooms. What more could you ask for? If I have the opportunity to return, for any reason, I will.

Reviews.Title: “Leroy and Erica are two of the BEST front desk associates I have ever worked with!!!”
Reviews.Author: lifisgr8
Reviews.Content: Leroy and Erica (even in training) have continued to exceed our initial expectations and continue to go above and beyond. My wife's father recently passed and we have stayed at the Westin 4 times in the last 6 weeks and have never been disappointed. GREAT JOB!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: dontrini
Reviews.Content: Two months ago we stopped for one night at the Westin LAX after an extended, exhausting visit to the area. The young man at check-in, ANKUR, was exceptionally helpful in placing us in the room that best suited our needs. We commend his considerate, professional efforts on our behalf. Sincerely, C.H. Ott, Jr.

Reviews.Title: “the beds are excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Sweeetypie
Reviews.Content: The beds are great! Location next to the airport is good, but to see something of LA you'll have to drive a bit. Parking a car costs extra. The beds are excellent! We did not hear noise of LAX at all. The swimming pool is little but nice, the jacuzzi also.

Reviews.Title: “Gateway Sheraton Better Starwood Option”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: The Westin LAX is a tired hotel that has been "refreshed" with new carpet, bedding and TVs. The bathrooms are completely original. The building is inadequately insulated for an airport hotel and there is significant noise from the airport. On the plus side the recently opened "Daily Grill" has good food. The parking is $33. A better option if you are looking for a LAX hotel is to stay at the Sheraton. Better sound proofing, similar price, more extensive updating and you can park right behind it at "Easy Park" for only $15 a day (or less).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: thegonzo
Reviews.Content: I stayed once again at this property and really enjoyed it. The service was wonderful and it's a good value for the price. The rooms are recently renovated as is the public space. Daniela, with the front office was especially helpful and even recognized me upon my return! For a quick stay, this is a great hotel as it's close to everything and REALLY convenient to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “The Westin LAX always makes me feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: GailKingsbury
Reviews.Content: I call the Westin LAX my home away from home. The staff from the front door to the back office are always extrodinary. I always know that they will do whatever it takes to help me with an event, luggage, faxing, you name it. Daniela Hiles is exceptional to work with. I see her everywhere helping everyone and she is always the first to respond with a smile to any request. Thank you Westin for creating such an amazing team at the LAX property! Gail Kingsbury

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to stay in when visiting LA”
Reviews.Author: jonportnof
Reviews.Content: The Westin LAX is a beautiful hotel and is run by a professional friendly staff. We stayed for 6 days and found every aspect of the hotel to be within the superior range.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hospitality staff”
Reviews.Author: Phauz319
Reviews.Content: Was staying with a large group over a period of 3 months. Hospitality staff was amazingly attentive, catered to our every request (we are sometimes a demanding group), and went out of their way to exceed our expectations on many occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Luv08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. Upon check I was greeted with exceptional customer service from Shavonna. She was very accommodating to all my needs. She suggested i sign up for the rewards program to save $5 on parking. The parking fee is the only thing i disliked from the hotel, $20 a day! The coffee in the room was delicious, beds were comfortable, big flat screen tv was nice, and it was great to have a heated pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel for LAX.... except the shuttle......”
Reviews.Author: issek1973
Reviews.Content: My work requires frequent visits to the LAX area, and my company has a favorable rate with this property. But recently I was in a bind for a very last minute personal night and the reservations representative was great and helped me get a rate around $100. The quality of service in general for an airport hotel is great. From reservations to check-in to maids and servers in the bar.... the staff is friendly! Normal things you'd expect in a Westin are here: rooms clean and of course the heavenly beds are great. I love to watch the airplanes as they land from the chaise lounge available in some of the rooms. There are a few restaurant/bar options on the main level, I enjoy eating at the lobby bar in particular. The only issue I have is the shuttle van, which is a bit haphazard with the pick up from the terminals. They say it operates every 15-20 minutes but this last visit I waited about 45 minutes for the shuttle to arrive and that feels more like the norm rather than the exception with my stays. Particularly annoying since my arrivals are usually after a long travel day and I'm simply ready to be in my room! Once on the premises, overall a great airport property!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: riccoq
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 3 nights at this hotel. I love staying at Starwood Hotels. All in all, the service is excellent. The room is very spacious. We had 2 double beds for my wife and 2 boys. There's also a confortable sitting area and working area. The bathroom is big with all the amenities and great water pressure. I thought we were gonna have trouble with airplane noise since its right next to LAX, but you couldnt hear them at all. Anybody who has stayed at any Westin Hotel, knows about their beds. You DO NOT want to get out of bed in the morning. Checkin and Check out were a breeze and their staff is very professional. The only downside to this hotel was that Valet Parking was $30 a night. If you park it yourself, its $20 a night. I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay close to Los Angeles Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great treatment from hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: bustraveller93
Reviews.Content: For business travellers this is hard to beat, the mgmt staff there took care of all our needs and made sure things went smoothly. Any minor issues were handled at the mgmt level quickly and efficiently. A good place to be if you don't want to have to worry about your accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms with comfortable bed, new high quality restaurant, right near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: dln13
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a great location to stay at if you are working/staying near the LAX airport. The room and bed are both comfortable, and the facilities such as the gym and new restaurant are also quality. I stayed here off and on for about 4 months, and the staff was always extremely helpful in helping answer any questions or concerns I had.

Reviews.Title: “had a great overnight stay!”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviews06
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here one night to catch the 6am flight to Denver. We had a great experience. I read mixed reviews about this hotel, particularly the complimentary bus shuttle did not run frequently enough - so I was a bit worried. However, as it turned out, as soon as we got to the road kerb, the shuttle bus pulled up, and the next morning when we checked out at 4am, the bus was there! When we checked in (I forgot the name of the staff) he asked us if we would like a higher or lower floor. We said higher floor and he gave us a good room with 2 extremely comfortable beds. I was very grateful because just before I left on the trip to Omaha to the Berkshire shareholders meeting the he-devil told me (out of the blue) that he wanted to separate from me! I was feeling devastated - so being treated nicely by strangers had made me feel very blessed. I hope to stay at the Westin again when I am back in LA. My sister lives in the US so I go there at least once a year.

Reviews.Title: “Natasha at the front desk was...”
Reviews.Author: bjamiestevens
Reviews.Content: Natasha at the front desk was exceptionally friendly and helpful in organizing the multiple rooms I was booking and making certain the SPG points were assigned appropriately. Ophelia, housekeeping supervisor didn't hesitate to help me with a special request and she was professional, respectful and friendly with her staff. Generally I found the employees appeared to be happy to be working at their hotel. Our housekeeper Martha always had a smile and a kind greeting.

Reviews.Title: “Simply WONDERFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: RoseyinHawaii
Reviews.Content: My daughter goes to school in Orange so we're in California at least 2x per year - to help her pack up and store her belongings for the summer, then return to help un-store and unpack her stuff for the new school year. This is our second stay at the Westin LAX and the service, especially at the front desk, was just as great as the first time - excellent, pleasant and professional. After 3 days of hectic activity, it's just so nice to arrive at this hotel where I know we'll be treated well and where we'll be able to relax. The hotel has a warm, welcoming feel to it. The rooms are beautiful, beds are comfortable, the 24-hour room service, the coffee maker (Starbucks! yum!) and mini bar are great amenities for guests who don't want go out for food and drinks. The location is very convenient, located near LAX, the perfect place to stay for a few days before having to catch an early flight back home to Honolulu. The free shuttle always gets us there in time for our flight; the shuttle drivers are always pleasant. Shopping is nearby & food is nearby. What I like least about this hotel is having to leave! Mahalo so much for another wonderful stay. We are already looking forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: blout
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel several times over the last few years. It's very close to my company's office, so the location is very convenient. Bottom line: this is a pretty mediocre hotel. Rooms are generally clean, but the layout and furnishings are very "1994". Noise can be an issue if your room is facing the runways, but generally I have not had problem during past stays. I have usually had a good experience in the hotel's restaurant and lounge. I read several other reviews for this hotel. Some seem suspicious to me. There is an unusually high percentage of reviews from brand-new Trip Advisor members with just one contribution, and who praise specific staff members. Fishy....

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: travel-4452
Reviews.Content: -Location was close to the airport - About a 30min drive to Hollywood -Free shuttle service from the airport -Great service: front desk and doormen were friendly & helpful -Pizza Hut/Taco Bell across the street -Pool is outdoor

Reviews.Title: “When I was losing my cool Natasha kept hers”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBetterhalf
Reviews.Content: couldn't find my reservation, and was in a half panic, since I plan trips way ahead and I had address, phone etc but no confirmation number. She helped and helped while I had obviously screwed up, and she stayed calm and resolved the matter, getting me the original rate too. A dedicated staff member to what real service means, and so appreciated. Made for a relaxed stay, thank you

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the WORST of the LAX hotels”
Reviews.Author: JoetR7
Reviews.Content: I foolishly believed some of the Tripadvisor reviews and booked here for an overnight before an early morning flight. The trainee at the reception desk checked me into a "quiet" room that I requested. It turned out to be overlooking the LAX runway and you could hear every plane thundering by. When I called to ask if all rooms where this noisy, she sarcastically asked if I would like a room overlooking the dog kennels (where the dogs apparently bark all night). Finally, I had to appeal to a manager to get their quietest rooms, overlooking a busy, noisy street, which was the best of the three bad options between runway, kennel and street noise. Do NOT stay here if you want to sleep. The sound insulation is the WORST of any airport hotel I have stayed in. The rude and indifferent service by the front desk staff ranks equally at the bottom of any hotel in any city around the world. Shame on Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Westin is the BEST hotel at LAX”
Reviews.Author: abennani
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service and beautiful rooms especially Terrace or Ambassador suite. One area for improvement is the SPG lounge that needs a face lift (new door, fruits and some snaks) to distinguish Westin from any hotel at LAX. Westin has an unmatched view specially in Terrace suites where one can see take offs and landings and also see the image of LAX (80 million passenger a year) in full scale. No other hotel at LAX has that beautiful view in a nice and beautiful surrounding

Reviews.Title: “you must have nyour conferencen here!”
Reviews.Author: BriNkosimom
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel is very helpfuln and hospitable. Working with Natalie D. as the hotel liason was an excellent resource. No matter what we asked forn Natalie, Shavonna, and Daniela , Heidi, Trini in banquets we were well acommadated. We have held our conference at thisn hotelnforn the past three years! nothing but excellence is our motto and thisn hotel has truly exuberated this mentality!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Westin Ever”
Reviews.Author: markchu
Reviews.Content: I was initially surprised by its low rates for a Westin. I realized I got what I paid for after I checked into the room. The SPG Gold line was not open during my entire stay. In the room, the bath had dirty grout, busted picture frames, and dated tiles with holes in them. The room did not have a phone that worked, it did feature peeling wall paper, and crumbling ceiling. The sound insulation was poor and my neighbor was LOUD. Only one elevator was working, and the control panel almost fell off while I was in it. There were chipped marble everywhere in the lobby, and the convenience store was not open during posted hours. There was also a sign posted stating that the hotel has some known carcinogens. This is definitely not a hotel worthy of the Westin name, I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Westin I know...”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityGuy
Reviews.Content: I stay at Westins as much as possible, and am SPG Gold. This is by far the worst Westin I have been in for many reasons. First, very loud. I understand the airport is there, and that is probably my fault for staying there, but the Sheraton, closer to the runways, is better than this hotel. Check in was mediocre at best. I was not recognized for my Elite Status, which I don't really care about, but note because it is usually a sign of things to come. The room is average at best...Westin bed, but the room was pretty worn. I had a 8pm dinner at the restaurant, which goes down in my book as one of the worst restaurants I have ever eaten at. The buffet food looked as if it had been sitting there for hours. Once seated, the server did not greet me for 20 minutes for my drink order. 10 minutes later he showed up with my drink and I took that opportunity to order before he walked away. 40 minutes later---yes, 40--my food arrived. The woman at the table next to me, who ordered right after me, waited an additional 5-7 minutes. We were laughing amongst our tears. I finished and the server disappeared and I waited for 15 minutes. He never stopped by to see how things were, and the food was average at best (very small, poor menu). I planned on tipping him 10% due to the poor service, but when I asked for a duplicate receipt he told me to walk with him to the front cash register. I gave him 15, as he was staring at me as I signed the receipt. Never never again this hotel. I've switched to the Hyatt Summerfield Suites for my stays near the airport. I think folks who like this hotel have not a lot of experience with Starwood properties. If I was used to staying at Ramada, Holiday Inn or Comfort Inn--or even Courtyard, this would have been wonderful...you got to put it all in perspective. If you are a Westin traveler--forget this place and if you must stay at LAX, then possibly the Sheraton (although I had my last stay ever there too).

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Westin, but the best of the LAX options...”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel in two business trips in 2010, the latest being in April. Although I have stayed in nicer Westin properties, this one lived up to the brand standards and overall struck me as a pretty decent place. In fact, of all of the hotels I've stayed in around LAX (which includes a lot of the full-service chain properties), this one is my favorite -- as much a statement about the condition of the other hotels as it is a statement about the quality of this property. In both instances at this hotel, my room has been clean, well-lit, and spacious. The working area is nice. I'm not a huge fan of a chaise lounge instead of a chair and ottoman (sometimes you want to be able to sit in a chair without stretching out your legs), but that's a pretty minor detail. As is well-known, the Westin bed is great, and this property was no exception in that regard. You can occasionally hear an airplane landing or taking off...but, duh, it's next to an airport (and one that attacts a lot of big, noisy planes like 777s and 747s) so I don't fault the hotel for that. I have really appreciated the room-darkening curtains at this hotel -- after arriving at 3am one night and having the chance to blissfully sleep-in the next morning, it was great to not have to worry about the sunlight bursting into the room. The hotel's fitness center was great. A complete set of cardio and weight equipment, open 24 hours, and clean. Overall, after having sampled several of the LAX properties, this has emerged as my top pick and I will return when business requires a layover near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Embarrassed & Disrespected Business Owner shamed in front of customers & associates!”
Reviews.Author: Sqrl55
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disaster! I went to a 3 day seminar for business at this hotel and was on a very tight schedule 9am-11p each day with a 45 min lunch and 2 ten min breaks. I used my rewards points to book at this hotel and I stayed for 2 nights. I travel frequently for business and pleasure. On day two, on my limited lunch hour, I went up to my room and I couldn't get in! I went down to the front desk where 7 other potential customers and associates from the seminar were in line. After waiting 25 minutes and finally speaking to a front desk clerk, I find out I've been checked out of my room and need to check in again! The unprofessional agent tells me that she told me when she checked me in that I would need to recheck in the next day- WHAT?!! That doesn't even make sense...I told her she didn't tell me that, that I would definitely have remembered that and would have solved that issue when I was checking in the first time as I would not want to check in again. She continued to argue with me in front of business associates and potential customers telling me that she knows she told me and this was my fault. She also forgot to give me any parking pass upon check in so the previous day I had gone to my car in the parking lot and could not get out of the lot without the proper parking pass from the hotel. I had to re-park my car and go back upstairs to get a parking pass from another front desk clerk. She swears that she gave me the parking pass upon check in and thank goodness the other desk clerk was there to confirm that she got the parking pass for me much later that day after I checked in. I finally checked back into my room and had no time for lunch...10 minutes left to get back to my seminar. So, I decided to call the front desk manager, Daniela, to tell her what happened. After a couple minutes of telling my story, Daniela stopped me and said that I was not letting her get a word in edgewise and that she needed me to stop talking so she could try to resolve the issue!!!!! I've never been treated so disrespectfully at any hotel, EVER! Daniela continued on to tell me that the clerk had an impeccable record with all of their customers and was an exemplary employee...obviously not in this case! And, really, do I care about how she treated other people! I honestly have no words for this type of service or behavior...it's completely unprofessional. I previously worked in the travel industry for 10 years at high end resorts and I would have been fired for treating a customer this way! Is it really that hard to have good customer service and let go of trying to argue with customers so you can be right?? Daniela said on Saturday that she would award me starpoints for the inconvenience and pay for my dinner. I had to call the front desk again when I was leaving because they charged my credit card for the dinner which I was assured she would take care of! I'm still not sure if that's been credited as it's still on my credit card. I then had to send a personal email to Daniela on Monday to follow up on the Starwood Rewards points of which I received a form letter back saying I would have the credit. As of today, Friday, this still hasn't been done!!! She didn't even send me a personal email in return to confirm...honestly, she's the front desk manager and can't handle resolving a customer complaint personally with an email!! I've since written a letter to the General Manager of the hotel, Glenn Sampert. Let's hope he has better service training! Honestly folks, there are plenty of hotels in the area....your money would be better spent staying at one of the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be my favorite hotel near LAX”
Reviews.Author: BicoastalBunny
Reviews.Content: I previously wrote a review of the Westin on Century and couldn't say enough praise for the place. Now, they have opened their new restaurant. The food is so-so to crappy. They no longer have the pot stickers that I loved so much. Their fried calamari even sucks now. The prices have gone up unreasonably to the point I cannot expense the total cost of an average dinner....and that's without alcohol on the tab! Guess I will have to start looking for a new hotel to stay at when in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Very good attentive service”
Reviews.Author: shkhoo1
Reviews.Content: Front Desk service excellent and nice rooms plus great location in Lax for travellers

Reviews.Title: “Okay, that was LOUD!”
Reviews.Author: tinhead2
Reviews.Content: I shoulda known -- staying at an airport-based hotel would have hundreds of planes coming in through the night. And then in the day, the yapping of someone's pet in one of the rooms kept me up when I could have had a daytime siesta. Checking in what a bit of a nighmare as the person was a bit aloof, but checking out was great, Sangheeta was really nice and very helpful. She even inputted my SPG account when I was told that it doesn't matter when I was checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Westin the Best Inn”
Reviews.Author: antoinette7
Reviews.Content: What a refreshing stop at LAX to recover and compose.. I want to express my sincere thanks to several of the staff that really made a tremendous difference in a short stay. Isabelle in the Dailly Grill is awesome . Raul Galvan and Cliff Sumajo are the kind of employees any hotel would be jealous of. I congratulate Danielle, the front desk manager for her efficient staff also including Sanqeetha. I want all these people to know that we have decided to move our businss to the Westin/Starwood Hotels. They have all made a tremendous difference in the quality of travel. Thank you all so much!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: maxima97
Reviews.Content: let be tell you this is the best hotel i have stayed in the hotel were so friendly no problem what so ever staff was nice we were well taken cared of i would have to rate this hotel a 10 i will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean, modern, but local dogs barking at night clearly audible on the 8th floor.”
Reviews.Author: longtooth68
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, spacious and fairly modern with a large and comfortable King bed with goose-down pillows. There was a writing space with a classic roll-away chair as well as a divan style chair positioned in front of a large (42 inch?) flat-screen television. The service and food from the hotel restaurants were expensive, but good. The staff were friendly and accomodating. I needed a refrigerator for my room. I asked the gentleman who brought it up about the mini-bar and snack tray under and on the counter. He could not speak English, but knew that I was asking about the mini bar. Moments after he left, my phone rang and a very polite lady at the other end asked if I had any questions. My suspicion was confirmed that simply removing the items from the mini-bar or snack tray would immediately result in the cost being added to my hotel bill, regardless of whether they were replaced unopened. It seemed sort of like a trap to me. Internet service was miserable. Wireless was all but unusable. The wired connection was turned off or broken. Luckily I brought along a Verizon Air-card for much faster access. I would give the hotel a positive review even in light of the previously mentioned mini-bar trap and bad Internet service, except for the fact that at 3:30AM in the morning, I was awakened by the sound of a dog, outside, barking, 8-stories below. I looked outside and could only surmise that this dog was housed in or near one of the near-by warehouse yards. If I were traveling to LA again and was staying in this hotel, I would expect to hear this animal tuning it up again. It's his space. I'm just a visitor after all.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: bebedani
Reviews.Content: Having never been to los angeles, I wasnt sure what to expect. I was greatly disappointed with this hotel, for being a Westin, it was quite dirty. The bathroom had mold/mildew all over the tiles, and a nice spider greeted me in the tub. There was also rings from glasses and cups on the table. And the bed linens had pen markings all over them. Luckily I was too tired to let it upset me too much, but it looked worse in the daylight. The bed was comfortable, and pillows were soft. They do offer free contental breakfast, but we choose to eat a the restaurant. I ordered a Belgium waffle, which they overcooked. The prices were high too. There appeared to be a computer near the elevator, but I am not sure if there was wifi. The street this hotel was located on looked very seedy, I would not recommend walking anywhere. The shuttle took a long time to come, especially at night at the airport, we waited a long time. I am not sure if that is Westin's fault, as it appears all the hotels share one shuttle (to save the environment)

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel that didn't care”
Reviews.Author: DWTraveling
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful trip to Tahiti, we had a stopover in Los Angeles requiring an overnight stay to connect to our next flight. We booked the Westin LAX as we wanted to assure ourselves of a great night sleep after a long flight and early flight the next morning. Unfortunately we had some very unruly guests in the connecting room who decided to have an all night party. This is not the hotel's fault, but where they are at fault is how they handled the situation, basically nothing was done. After three calls to the front desk/customer service complaining about the party next door, it was 4am and time to checkout. The front desk attendant, Michael asked how are stay was and I said it was the worst night we have ever experienced at a hotel. He nonchalantly replied "I am sorry to hear that, Can I apply the charges to your visa on file?" in the same breath.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service Experience!”
Reviews.Author: MereRT
Reviews.Content: I attended a day long conference at The Westin and forgot my phone charger. I'm a director of social media and needed my phone to work the conference. The security staff (Noe, John and Daniel) went out of their way to find a charger that I could use. They made me feel so comfortable that I left my phone with them and was able to continue to enjoy the conference while my phone charged. It's these "little things" that I think truly defines customer service. Thank you again!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: art2glass
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business, so I'm quite familiar with different hotel brands and amenities. A four star hotel should have a level of quality and service head and shoulders above a three star. Unfortunately the Westin Los Angeles Airport hotel is closer to three stars. The lobby and rooms are adequate but not a cut above. Our room had the following problems. First there was a musty smell that seemed to be coming from the air conditioning vent. We are staying for a week, so that's a problem. Second was the hot water. For 15 minutes yesterday, the water never got warmer than lukewarm in both the shower and sink. I had no choice but to take a cold shower. Some four star hotel. Third is the smell of the water. My sense of smell is very good, sometimes too good, so some smells bother me that don't bother other people. The water in the shower smells of volatile organic compounds. Breathing in these contaminants can't be good for anyone taking a hot shower (when the water is hot). Fourth was a problem with an important package that arrived for me. I was never notified. I knew it was coming, so I called the front desk and asked them to check. They found it and delivered it to the room, but if I had never called, the package would still be in the mail room. Overall, it's not much better than a typical Holiday Inn hotel and it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: drkathleen
Reviews.Content: I got stranded at the airport and arrived at 11:00 pm. Fabulous associate KIN offered terrific service.

Reviews.Title: “Westin LAX was an oasis after airport hell!”
Reviews.Author: Jojonellie
Reviews.Content: After a very irritating airport snafu and missing our connecting flight at the fault of the airline (name starts with a U and ends with a NITED) we finally got the airline to agree to pay for our hotel for the layover. I figured it would be the basic motel type of property, so I was so surprised to find out we were staying at the Westin LAX. What a beautiful hotel! When we entered, we were greeted by a lovely smell and wonderful luxury. Our room was so comfortable. Upon checking in, Roy at the front desk was friendly and helpful. He asked us if the airline gave us food vouchers (no) so he gave us a coupon that paid for a late night room service meal for two (Thanks Roy!) I would highly recommend this hotel. Lovely, comfortable and smells wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “A+++++ customer service”
Reviews.Author: afronoletravel
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about booking a room here after reading some of the reviews but trusted the Westin brand so I figured how bad could it be. When I checked into my room, I was disappointed that the white down comforter had fine, black hair all over it as if a dog shed on it. I went back to the desk and was greeted with WONDERFUL customer service. I was quickly given another room. It was a nice room and I've been in better Westin hotels (just needs a little renovation which the pool is in the process of) but it was had the what I needed the most.... the signature Heavenly bed. Originally, I only booked 2 nights but every night for the next 3 nights I extended my stay. Thank you GABRIEL & MITCHEL for fantabulous customer service. Because of you, I will definitely be returning to this property!! - A Starwood Preferred Guest

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service!”
Reviews.Author: danielelabelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Los Angeles Airport for a business event and there was a mix up when we arrived. Our room was not resevered as a Garden Terrace - it was a basic. After a bit of resistance from the front desk a staff named Daniela came out and after that we were treated like gold. She sorted out our room mix up, gave us drink vouchers for all the trouble and made sure we were happy once we were settled. I don;t know if she said something else to other staff - but we were greeted and asked how we were every day from then on. The conceirge desk went above and beyond helping us with local business information and locating boxes with our company items that had arrived ahead of us. Patricia also did a great job helping us with extra bedding or whatever we needed. This hotel has a beautiful lobby and facilities. It is well kept and very clean - the very friendly cleaning staff do an excellent job. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: Fitch7600
Reviews.Content: I have noticed an unusually wide variety of opinions on this property and have a theory. It seems like many of the top reviews are elite SPG members, so I would guess this hotel does a great job of catering to them. On the other end of the spectrum, I needed a hotel for one day after my trip was extended and went to either Hotwire or Priceline, forget which, to get a deal on a nice hotel. As such I got a great rate but am convinced this is a hotel that has "special" rooms set aside for discount rates. I arrived about 4pm. I requested a King room but was told that they were sold out of the type and only had two doubles available. Since they were offering discount rooms that very day I was really skeptical that they were short of any rooms, but accepted the room I was given. I found it to be pretty marginal and definitely below par for a Westin. The carpet was dirty and the furniture was old. It was only one night and it was fine for that. But i wouldn't rush back there.

Reviews.Title: “HIT AND MISS”
Reviews.Author: Monamacy
Reviews.Content: I am a preferred member. I have stayed at the Westin - LAX numerous times over several years. THE HOTEL IS GREAT - the SERVICE SO MEDIOCRE. The front desk - sooooo seriuos, unwelcoming and unfriendly....unless you go to the PREFERRED CUSTOMER counter...it is a sparate area. I was talking to a staff person at the front desk about an error on my bill. He was so not friendly or interested in me as a customer. AND he did not resolve it. It was only 7.00 dollars,,,so I let it go. The Ritz Carlton is by far the BEST customer service in the world. But, the CEO of the RC encourages the staff/employees that they are the owners. He fosters ownership...thus the experience is RELIABLY great! The buck stops there...with each employee. The Westin needs to wake up...it is all about the customers!

Reviews.Title: “Service was exceptional!!”
Reviews.Author: holidayspark
Reviews.Content: A quick note to give my heartfelt thanks the following employees for making my stay at the Westin LAZ so extraordinary. NANCY, SERGIO, LEROY, and DANIELLA. My flight was cancelled at the last minute and my travel agent put me up at the Westin Lax overnight and all of the next day. I must have caught a bug on the flight because in the middle of the night i woke up not feeling well and barely able to move the next day. I called down to the desk, and The staff at the Westin organized for me to see a doctor only a few blocks from the hotel, the caring staff sent soup up to my room at no charge, organized a trip to the pharmacy so i could get vitamins and medications and made sure i was better in time for my flight. I stay at Westin's around the world as i travel a great deal. I have never experienced such a dedicated, friendly and caring individuals. Congratulations to whomever staffs for the hotel and for the management!! Warm Regards

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: ckkr
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at Westin LAX was most enjoyable. My room was ready exactly the way I requested. Shavonna Cadle greeted us with warmth and hospitality upon arrival. Her memory as to our likes was most appreciated. I look forwad to going back to this property.

Reviews.Title: “My stay started with one of the best...”
Reviews.Author: No7500
Reviews.Content: My stay started with one of the best service reps I have ever met--Natasha. She is truly top notch. I fly five days a week and stay in a LOT of hotels. Westin LAX has a great gym and free airport transportation (though it is not operated by the hotel) that got me to the airport in 15 min. There plenty of food options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Natasha the Gold & Platinum Members Service Manager made my stay phenomenal !!!”
Reviews.Author: Neimadsmothers
Reviews.Content: I must say that on this trip to Los Angeles, I was coming needing a hotel with utter comfort, excellent service and a place that I could feel home away from home. This particular time, I was staying in Los Angeles for four days (a bit of a long trip for me). Natasha, the service manager for the Gold & Platinum members, took excellent care of me and made my stay most enjoyable. She made sure that I had a wonderful suite, prompt service and more. I would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel to ANYONE staying in the greater Los Angeles area and it's right by the airport.

Reviews.Title: “ok stay”
Reviews.Author: rhody2007
Reviews.Content: I just read through the last few reviews, and I feel like I stayed at a different hotel. It is a clean, nice hotel to stay at if you need something near the airport. However, I think rooms at other Westin hotels are much nicer (no robe, older bathroom.) The lobby is beautiful and I'm guessing they are in the middle of major rehab so perhaps the rooms are up for renovation next. I did not meet Cliff wish I had as there did not appear to be a restaurant within walking distance except the Taco Bell across the street, so I just got room service (which was great.) That said, staff were helpful when I asked (my hotel key never worked for the gym and it was a hassle at 4:30am to have to go to the desk again - and it still didn't work) but they tried. I would warn people about the free shuttle to the airport if they have an early a.m. flight - I went down to take it and made extra time because they staff told me it could take 20 minutes to get to the airport since it stops at other hotels. There were a lot of people waiting in the lobby with no shuttle in sight for ten minutes, so I grabbed a cab. There is also traffic at LAX and long lines and if I had waited for the shuttle (1.75 hrs. before my flight) I would have missed it. Definitely plan for at least 2.5 hours if you are on a busy travel day - no one on the staff told me that, which would have been very helpful. I reiterate that the staff was helpful when solicited - MUCH more so than the Westin Bonaventure. And I would be remiss if I didn't mention the gym was top notch after I finally got in!

Reviews.Title: “Super location to visit attractions and beaches!”
Reviews.Author: deltacharlie965
Reviews.Content: The Westin at LAX was a great hotel for visitors on a short stay. Close to all attractions from city center north including Hollywood, Warner Bros [et al] and Santa Monica.

Reviews.Title: “It was the airlines fault!”
Reviews.Author: piazza321g
Reviews.Content: A 7 hour flight delay caused us to miss our connecting flight to Cabo San Lucas this week. We knew the airline would be paying for our hotel once we reached LA. The airline had mechanical problems and had to return to LA the night before,causing our flight to be delayed. It just so happened my husband's co-worker came in on the flight we were waiting for. He told us that once we got to LA we would have the option to choose our hotel and that he had just stayed at the Westin. So, we followed his advice to choose Westin. This was absolutely the best sleep in any hotel we have ever had. My husband is quirky about scents, but commented on how refreshing the room smelled as if his mom had freshly washed the bedding and made his bed for him. We have been planning to purchase a new bed, but we were fearful of what to buy. After staying at the Westin, we both fell inlove with "that" bed. We felt foolish, so we dare not ask about the type of bed it was. UNTIL, we got to the airport and realized we left our passports and tickets in our hotel room. The hotel staff was wonderful to help us get back into our room. While my husband was in the room, I was greeted by one of the managers. When I told her how much we loved the bed, she informed me that it is a Westin Heavenly Bed and can be purchased. BUT don't take my word for it! Go visit the nice people ar Westin LAX!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: 4REAL_10
Reviews.Content: I had wonderful stay in Los Angeles. The hotel was very comfortable and home like. I liked the new look of the rooms. The staff was friendly, especially Gerald.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: vacationingdan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location with friends in preparation for a cruise. Sometime in the course of the evening I had a large sum of cash fall out of my pocket. I realized this after I was just underway on the cruise. I decided to call the hotel in hopes someone found and turned this in. Of course, my group all commented not to waste my time. I called anyhow, and though there wasn't much hope, the hotel security unit investigated. As expected nothing was found and we continued out to sea. A half hour later, security called me to tell me an anonymous person turned in my money. Upon my return, the security group went to all means to accommodate me for return to the hotel to pick up my cash. They had to get a manager to open the safe and offered to arrange transportation to accommodate our tight time frames for an early flight. This was incredibly responsive and they were all extremely professional. There were so many reasons this should not have had such a positive end. The staff at this hotel was incredible. Besides this, I want to comment on the quality of the hotel. It was our first stay at this location and we were very pleased. Between my wife and I, we exceed 100 room nights yearly for travel. This hotel was exceptionally clean, easy to navigate, and had all our requirements on site. The staff truly practices great customer service and I would highly recommend this location to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LAX airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elo455
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay for your LAX travel needs. I have stayed here 3 times in the past few weeks. The rooms are newly remodeled with large LCD TV's. Gold starwood members are treated to a nice room on the executive floor with access to the lounge with free internet on new computers. Also, a nice continental breakfest in the lobby which is convieant when catching the shuttle. Great Stay!

Reviews.Title: “Confortable place to spend the night before our cruise”
Reviews.Author: cruise4fun
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a stop over to board our cruise. We found our room to be very clean and confortable. We had a room overlooking LAX landing strip. I really enjoyed watching the planes land. There was a little bit of extra noise, but after a while we didn't really notice it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Valet Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rayche2414
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin LAX for a business trip. I was very happy to see friendly valets. A valet manager (Jusol Torres) greated me with a great positive attitude. On my way out he was still smiling and very friendly. I asked what restaurants would be great to go to. He recommended a restaurant in Centuy City that was simply amazing. Not only will I return to the Westin for the hotel, but for the amazing Valet Service they supply.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating a birthday”
Reviews.Author: bobbie48
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was great.The meals were great, especially breakfast.This is our third stay at the hotel and we would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond the call of duty!”
Reviews.Author: Streakeagle
Reviews.Content: I've travelled around the world and stayed with many different hotel chains, but I have to say that Starwood has really out done itself with the Westin Hotels service standards. I was especially wowed by a Desk Manager (S.Cadle) who took immediate responsibility for a botched room service order and made amends so my party could enjoy our evening. Then she even recommended and help me book another Starwood property for a fabulous rate when I had no luck even finding a room!!! Starwood and Westin - you've got a customer for life!!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm friendly welcome to LA”
Reviews.Author: sonotheman1
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the warmth of the staff and the helpful spirit. Special thanks to Robin, he works the front desk and went above and beyond the call of duty. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone needing a clean, professional hotel near the airport. Brando Jessie

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for family with young children”
Reviews.Author: VarisaP
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel for a short period of time. The beds are comfy, my kids really loved it especially with extra pillows.

Reviews.Title: “A relief to stay at such a pleasent place”
Reviews.Author: VegasChopper
Reviews.Content: I loved the service from associate Robin and Cliff on arrival, they made it an easy check in and helpful in every way , I will defenently recomend and stay here agian, cant belive how polite everybody is.Gym was great, food was great, 100% in all ways. Regards Ranger Pat Quinn FDA, [-]

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Majia
Reviews.Content: I had just come from another Westin and had had the very best hotel experience ever so I was looking forward to staying at more Westins. The gentleman who checked me in was polite and accomodating. I was disappointed though when I came into the room. It felt stuffy and some of the lights didn't work and even though the bed and bedding were really comfortable and nice the rest of the room felt dated and kind of musty. My breakfast experience was disappointing. The server waited on someone else who came in after me and after asking for my beverage 3 times I finally received it by asking another. The breakfast I ordered tasted terrible...the eggs didn't taste like eggs and the potatoes were very greasy and not tasty at all. Also I was charged for something on the mini bar that I didn't take! (I had picked it up while standing there to look at the label and put it RIGHT back in it's place) I was told later that since I moved it I was charged for it. Needless to say I refused to pay for it. There were good parts to this hotel..that's why I said Just OK but I think I agree with the lady who said it is not up to the Westin name's caliber.

Reviews.Title: “The best customer service ever recieved”
Reviews.Author: aquia2610
Reviews.Content: I was checked in by a gentleman by the name of Robin, and he made sure that I was checked in with care. I explained that I was in a hurry, and he took care of all my needs without me being there. All the paperwork was done quickly, and he did everything with a smile on his face. They have the best staff ever, and I also recommended some of my other friends to stay there for business.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad - but not up to Westin Standards”
Reviews.Author: kbalthaser66
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was "nice" - definately needing some TLC in certain areas. Needs some updating in the rooms and halls to be brought up to true Westin standards. The hotel staff was excellent. The service in the restaurant was the worst service ever. Took extremely long to get food and then it was undercooked and had to be sent back (pink chicken is not good). This hotel is not in a good location for anyone wanting to get out and take in the sights. My son and daughter in law spent the evening there the night before their cruise out of Long Beach. They caught a cab to go to a convenience store to purchase some items that they had forgotten and to grab some soda and a couple bottles of wine for the cruise. They went 1 mile and were charged $10 - they thought no problem we will just walk back to the hotel it was nice outside and still light out. BIG MISTAKE - they somehow got turned around and ended up at dusk in Inglewood. They were starting to get concerned when they realized that they could see the Westin sign but could not find a way to get around the 25 ft concrete wall to get to the hotel. They are young 23 year old couple and definately looked out of place walking in this area. They were hoping to come across a taxi so that they could catch a taxi back once they realized they were not in a safe area. Luckily a "super shuttle" employee drove by them and stopped and ask them if they were from out of town - they said "yes" and the super shuttle driver told them that they were in a dangerous area and should not be walking around - he asked if he could give them a ride to the hotel so that they got home safely. Needless to say they were both beyond grateful that they gentleman stopped to inquire about where they were needing to go. What is scarey is that this location in Inglewood was within arms length of this hotel. Of course the Westin cannot control this but word to the wise - do not venture out and about at this hotel - just a bit too scarey. Please note that I would recommend this hotel for anyone that is traveling on business and needs a place to lay their head.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Staff”
Reviews.Author: dberk12
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant experience at the Westin Hotel. One staff member in particular, Raul Galvan, went out of his way on multiple occasions to make my stay at the hotel perfect. His effort was greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: duskglow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Westin for a Linux conference (SCALE). Pretty good all told. Beds were good, TV did not have a lot of channel offerings, everything was reasonably clean and nice. Doors were a little thin and could hear people talking through them, but everything else was reasonably soundproof. The Westin, however, really gouges you on the little things. You pay for parking every day, they put a little snack bar in your room and you have to be careful not even to SHAKE it or you'll get charged, and they charge a 20% restocking fee on TOP of the ridiculously overpriced snacks. Needless to say, I didn't bother. The breakfast buffet is $21 (When I stayed at another hotel in San Diego it was *free* and had just as good offerings too) and, you'll pretty much pay through the nose for all of the little things. It kind of soured me. They also charge about $10 or so a day for Internet that only just barely works (though to their credit they waived that charge when I told them). Basically, Westin wins on everything but the little things, and those they fail miserably at. If they have SCALE there next year, I'll probably stay there again, and be holding my nose the whole time as they very politely and with a smile drain my pocketbook.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels--the Westin LAX”
Reviews.Author: United1KHonolulu_HI
Reviews.Content: When you check in at the Westin LAX, I hope you have the pleasure of having Leroy check you in. It was like seeing an old friend after a difficult day of travel. It was nice to be greeted with a big smile and a genuine appreciation that I chose to stay at the Westin. Leroy totally gets it--that he has a job because of my staying at his hotel and it is refreshing to see that these days. Thanks Leroy for the great customer service and making a difficult day much better. The location is great and love watching flights come and go at LAX when I'm not working. The hotel is a great value for the money and an excellent choice for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “The front desk personell named Kin was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: crystalhalpin
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to give a kudos to Kin at the Westin Lax for his proffessional attitude and pleasant assistance during our stay! Thank you, and with employees like Kin we will always stay at Westin Properties while traveling and will keep reccomending them to others. Thanks again. Crystal and Edmond Baghumian-Halpin

Reviews.Title: “This was the best experience at a hotel I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: ndepaola2717
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, the room was comfortable, and the management was extremely considerate of our (sometimes difficult) company requests. I was very happy with my stay and recommend this conveniently located Westin to anyone that is heading to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: cvkandy
Reviews.Content: I am happily writing a glowing review of the Westin LAX, not only for the usual reasons (ie; clean, good food, nice gym) but also to commend the Westin on having such a great employee, Shavonna Cadle, Front Desk Manager on it's staff. I was originally booked into a room on a "busy" floor with some long term guests. After I brought this to Shavonna's attention, she immediately took care of the situation and even gave me a complimentary coupon to use at the hotel. She did everything with quiet competence and with a constant smile. I have stayed at the Westin LAX several times and it's personnel are always a pleasure to be around

Reviews.Title: “The good, bad, and ugly.”
Reviews.Author: RBear77
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Westin LAX was the first at a Westin. The check-in process was terrible,due to the hotel's computer and other snafu's... The only redeeming quality was an employee named "Shavonna"............who managed to correct the hotel's mistakes with her "take charge" attitude. Shavonna straightened out the hotel's mistakes in a timely, and courteous manner. The lousy part of the stay was that the hotel "gouged" you everywhere they could. The prices were not at all consistent with the products received. They charged to park (self-park).........and charged pretty much for EVERYTHING they could! The in-house restaurant charges a whopping $15.00 for a "Continental Breakfast". I had the "$14 omelet and was surprised to find egg shells in the omelet! The food prices were elevated far too high, as the hotel placed nice little descriptive words on the menu like "Cinnamon Scented" oatmeal to make it sound much more fancy. Seems a great practice when you charge so much for the food by calling it healthy and eclectic. If it hadn't been that the conference I attended was at the Westin..............I would not have chosen to continue my stay. The room was not as clean as it could have been, as there was dust all over the furniture, and the marble tables had water stains, and were not clean in general. The chairs in the room were adequate, and one of them (an attached Ottoman/Couch Chair) was absolutely delightful. Overall very disappointing for a 4star quality hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best valets in the business”
Reviews.Author: scipiokid
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I have stayed at least twice a month for years. The service has always been great, especially the valets. They always call me by name, welcome me back to the hotel, and do whatever they can to help. They are really the best. In fact, tonight I brought my keys back to my room on accident and they graciously called and asked if I had them and ran right up to my room to get them. Again, they are the best. This is a really great hotel. I would highly recommend it. I love the location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Shavonna Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: mommyofkk
Reviews.Content: The Westin LAX is my favorite place to layover during my travels through LAX. It is conveniently located close to the airport and has a complimentary shuttle. And of course it smells good as all Westins do. But the best thing about the Westin LAX is a wonderful lady by the name of Shavonna Cadle. It is rare that you come across someone as kind and caring as Shavonna in the business of customer service. She was above and beyond in taking care of my sick kids and I including special trips to the store for pullups and a thermometer. The Westin is a great place to stay because of people like her. Thank you Shavonna!

Reviews.Title: “Hurt a Blind man and refuse to help!”
Reviews.Author: DrRobinRushlo
Reviews.Content: The hotel may be nice but I got off the shuttle and fell in the driveway of the hotel. I am 100% blind and niether the Hotel nor the shuttle will help with medical bills and the two montsh I was laid up without work due to the three broken ribs and broken wrist. All they want to do is argue which one pays and right now neither one has. They do not follow the ADA laws like they said if they did I would not have had the problems and they would have resolved the issue. If tiy are blidnor handicapped I would think twice about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shadows72
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for Christmas weekend & found the Westin LAX. I have stayed here before & it is my favorite place to stay in L.A. because of the convenience of the airport, the quality of service & cleanliness, & the great staff that they employ there. I would especially like to thank Cliff Sunajo for his kindness & professionalism at doing his job. I will definitely stay here again, when I need a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The staff made my stay outstanding”
Reviews.Author: JonnBouvier
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Westin LAX often when i am back in town and it is my hotel of choice mainly because of the hotel staff. The hotel itself isn't quit up to par simply because i feel that the rooms need to be fully renovated. The hotel staff more than make up for it though. At my last stay, one of the front desk managers, Gerald Dotson (sp?) noticed that i had been having trouble with my room key so he personally took matters into his own hands. Not only did he personally bring me a new set of working keys, but he gave me a complimentary food voucher for the trouble that i had encountered as well as called and checked on me 30 minutes later. The rest of the staff is great as well but Mr. Dotson has helped me countless times throughout my stays. I recommend this hotel to all of my co workers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect customer service in every arena.”
Reviews.Author: thenewmrse
Reviews.Content: We had our 500 person wedding at the Westin LAX and from beginning to end, every staff member was a delight to work with. From the event manager, to the sales manager, even the vendors noted how considerate and helpful everyone was at Westin. This was not an easy event for me to coordinate, but I have to say that the hotel was never one of my concerns, they were always a breath of fresh air and went out of their way to make sure that we were satisfied with everything. I highly recommend for your next event, or meeting. The ballroom has recently been remodeled, so it has a very nice and modern look to it, allowing my decor to really stand out and not look dated. Five stars.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever-no where near four star.”
Reviews.Author: surfserpent
Reviews.Content: First of all, the shuttle bus for the Westin was very slow. We saw five shuttles to the hilton and raddison before ours came. This combined with the time we waited at the front desk, meant we waited for over an hour before we got into our room. When we got into our room, we first noticed the overall shabby and gross decor. Red velour drapes, dingy, stained carpet..etc. This would have been okay were it not for the overwhelming chemical smell coupled with an overhead light that would not stop flickering. When we pulled down the sheets, we noticed that each bed had one down pillow, and the rest were lumpy and gross. Furthermore, the down "blankets" were completely empty and full of holes! no kidding, these blankets litterally had no down in them! We asked to switch rooms and were told that we could upgrade for 30 dollars, which we did. they said our new keys would be sent up to us, but after waiting for thirty minutes, we went and got our own keys. The new keys were delivered to our NEW room an HOUR later. Our new room was exactly the same as the old one, except this time the sheets had stains on them as well. We called and complained, and asked that all the bedding be switched out, and I must admit that once they gave us actual down blankets and pillows, the beds were quite nice. Next, we noticed that they had never installed the double shower heads that they advertise. When asked, they explained this by claiming that the hotel had "gone green". The towels we were given were old, ratty and unraveling. The television was broken, and the heat did not work. They charge five dollars for a tiny bottle of water. i could go on, but frankly it would get old. At any rate, this place is not worth the money, and all the positive reviews previous to mine are obviously by the same people that they promote.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with amazing staff especially Patricia !”
Reviews.Author: slefko1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the staff was amazing. The rooms are impeccable and wedding hall was magnificent. Their greatest asset however was their customer service. A wonderful lady by the name of Patricia could not do enough for me. Anything I asked for was done immediately and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Best value/service for the price”
Reviews.Author: loloontheair
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying in the hotel. As a frequent traveler and Starwood Platinum Preferred Guest, I am used to travel. I like the Westin LAX because it's a modern hotel close to main locations. Ideally located between 405 and 105, it's very convenient to go to many places. The hotel is modern and comfortable. The rooms are decent size. The first night we had a regular room, as we couldn't be upgraded when we arrived. I was surprised to receive a call from the front desk manager Gerald Dodson who found a suite for us. a Suite with balcony.
