Useless to say that when you stay 2 weeks in the hotel, it makes your stay more comfortable. Thanks to M. Dodson for remembering us among hundreds guest. I also enjoy the parking. No need to Valet, the parking is attached to the hotel, so you can leave any time without any need to wait for your car to come. And you don't walk too much. I am also enjoying the pool and the jacuzzi. The jacuzzi is hot so you can jump into the pool and go back to hot after the pool. Very convenient to remove the stress of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay, GREAT service - Will be Back!”
Reviews.Author: GerryM
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Westin LAX late after an athletic event for my children. In addition, we were bringing 3 extra teenagers with us for my daughter's birthday. We booked 2 rooms with 2 double beds via Hotwire. When we arrived, I asked for connecting rooms as I couldn't make that request before our stay via Hotwire. Roy at the front desk was amazing! He searched but couldn't find any connecting rooms that were ready but had one made up for us within about 15 minutes. Because of this "inconvenience" (which was minor, in my opinion) he offered to buy the "winning ice skating team" a snack at the hotel's restaurant while we waited and gave us a voucher and promised to come and get us when the room was ready. Roy was very personable and obviously cared about the hotel patrons. He was concerned that the children might be hungry after a long day of competition and travelling....and totally took care of us. We went upstairs to put our luggage in the room that was ready and before we were ready to go down to the restaurant, the other room was readied by the housekeeper - what service! The reviews about the carpet being worn and dingey, the rooms being old and dark and the hotel being shabby ARE NOT NOW TRUE - at least, based on our stay. The carpet was new, the rooms were spotless, there was NO airplane noise. Roy did say that the hotel has been recently renovated so maybe that was very recently completed. Coupled with the fantastic service from Roy, the great price that we got on Hotwire, and the wonderful rooms, I would give this hotel the highest recommendation for others to stay. Thanks, Roy, for making our stay great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful union hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Robinpa102
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with great beds, excellent breakfast and attention to detail. Staff was exceptionally friendly and attentive. I would particularly like to commend Leroy who checked me in and Daniela who checked me out! The only downside was no free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Really needs a makeover - rooms smell and are dingy”
Reviews.Author: ConVivo
Reviews.Content: What can I say, even at my killer Priceline rate I would rather stay at just about any other hotel on Century Blvd than the Westin. Rooms are dark, dank, and well-used. Lights are broken and the last room I had - had water coming from the room ac that soaked the rug. Told managers about it, but nothing was done, not even an apology. Stay away from the convention only seminar-guru hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel- best value stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: EvelynSydney
Reviews.Content: After a tiring 13 hour flight from Australia and a LA Airport hire car company employee that had tried to 'pull a fast one' on me (i.e. charge me more than the quoted internet price) I was not in the best of moods but The Westin Los Angeles Airport both surprised me and cheered me up. Before travelling, I had read some negative reviews about this hotel in Tripadvisor but its price, location and facilities suited me so I took the risk and booked it anyway. I am very glad that I did. It was great! Don't believe the bad reviews!! I would be very happy to stay there again. The Westin Los Angeles Airport is very easy to find, has reasonably priced parking and internet access fees, a very impressive lobby and good gym and pool facilities. With two fast food outlets just a few steps down the road, a very comfortable bed and a quiet, good sized room with nice furnishings and terrific views towards the mountains from the ninth floor, I couldn't have been happier. It was real value for money. Next time I am back in Los Angeles, I will definitely book The Westin Los Angeles Airport again and I won't bother staying anywhere else. I stayed two nights in Anaheim for almost double the price and it was no where near as good in service or value.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay...... Again!! Highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: mac23m
Reviews.Content: To start the hotel is by far on my top2 placs in los angeles. The staff and atmosphere is very geniune.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience of all 3 Winter Conference locations!”
Reviews.Author: MultiEvents
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located to the airport which is a plus for our group! The guest service is the best by far. We host 9-12 events a year domestically and this was a wonderful place and we look forward to returning in 2011. The staff were very positive and seem to truly enjoy their job. They were constantly checking in on our group to make sure we had all that we needed. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The restaurant was very clean and the food was delicious. Honestly, I can't think of anything that did not go well during our stay. As an Event Planner, it makes my job easier when I have such wonderful support from the staff of the location. Hats off to the General Manager of this property!

Reviews.Title: “Is always nice to come back”
Reviews.Author: YsiK_10
Reviews.Content: I fly alot to LAX and I feel very happy to have this hotel every time because is comfortable, clean and very close to the airport, the staff is friendly and helpful, Gabriel is awesome doing the reservations in the counter and always with a smile is like being at home.

Reviews.Title: “What Customer Service?”
Reviews.Author: nanselmo
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the pros: *close to the airport *really comfortable bed Now to the cons...well, where do I begin? Our hotel room was fine upon first look, we settled in and started putting things away...and then we noticed that there was a pair of women's size 8 red pumps peeking from underneath the bed. I wear a size 6. My boyfriend also discovered that there were used coffee grinds in the coffee pot when he tried to use it. Ew. I called down to the lobby to request that we transfer rooms since ours didn't seem to be cleaned very properly and the guest services person I talked to, after I told her our situation and conveyed that this was unnaceptable, didn't even apologize for this oversight (I've worked in the industry--rule #1: if you made a mistake, apologize apologize apologize!), but instead told me that the line was pretty long and that it may take a while for them to transfer us to another room, so could we (the guests that found a pair of womens shoes and a used coffee filter), come down to the lobby and wait in line to someone can transfer us to another room? I told her I'd call back later. We had been travelling back and forth from SD to LA and were exhausted. The last thing we wanted to do was hoof back downstairs, wait in line to find a cleaner room, then re-pack our luggage to move. Rule #2: don't make the guest clean up your mess. We just sucked it up, put socks on our feet and stayed in our room. To make things even more entertaining, we later called the lobby to see if there was any way to heat up some food which I thought was a pretty simple request. The first person I talked to wasn't sure so they transfered me to the restaurant, who then told me, after going downstairs with food in tow, that no they actually can't do that since they don't have a microwave but there was one located on the 3rd floor. We go back up to the 3rd floor, wander around looking for this microwave and run into a maintenance tech who was the ONLY person in that entire hotel that actually showed any sort of customer service. He called several people multiple times to try and locate this mysterious microwave and after 20 minutes of checking in empty rooms, he apologized and said the he just didn't know where it could be. We headed back to our hotel room, and I tried to lobby again just one last time to see if they could direct us to the microwave. Well...the good thing is they did have a microwave. The bad thing is there was only one in the entire hotel and no, we couldn't use it because we weren't part of the flight crew and hung up. Upon check out, the guest services guy didn't even have the proper bill (I had to remind him to add on our parking costs which I really should've just kept quiet about), nor did he ask us how our stay was...which is probably for the best because I sure would've given him an earful. Bottom line: awful service, poor cleaning service, go find another place. Stay anyplace but here.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a business traveler requires”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLucy98103
Reviews.Content: Stayed 01/27-29/10. Excellent service from hotel and catering staff. Bar service was a little slow--please postpone getting people the free snack mix when there are drinks to pour! Front desk and bell staff exceptionally professional. Good business service center. Extremely comfortable bed and nice amenities. Very quiet. As a frequent traveler, it was the two best nights sleep I've had in a year! Very convenient location for airport conference hotel with free shuttle service. In room WiFi was inconsistent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: primtime1414
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and I would say the Westin LAX is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. I would tell anyone to stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: Ken1971
Reviews.Content: I have recently arranged an extended stay package with Westin LAX while I am looking for a new place to buy. The hotel itself is nice, good location, and the a great value. However, what made this Westin special to me is its staff. More specifically the front desk manager Shavonna and her staff. Shavonna has been a great help with our needs and when you talk to her she actually makes you feel she cares! I would recommend this hotel to anybody who travels to LA and wants to stay near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Update to home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Jellybeandean
Reviews.Content: Wanted to give special thanks to Shavonna,Catherine, Angela and Stephanie. Shavonna sets up my room and the rest help fill in the rewards. This is also a thanks to the other staff members from Robert at the bell desk, Gaby in the bar area, Helena my coffee wonder. Walking down the hall one of the bell men said hello Mr. Garrett as did those at the front desk when I arrived. Had a meal at the bar and the service and quality of food was very good. Of course so is the wine selection. Westin and its other affiliations have been very good to me and also my wife Bunny when we travel. The Westin and W in Chicago and other places as well. Staff is the core of any great stay and the Westin Group does a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Mauimaddness
Reviews.Content: I flew overnight from Maui Hawaii to LA with my 12 year old son and we arrived at 5:00am. I called the hotel the day before leaving Maui and spoke with Daniela at the front desk and explained my unique situation. I asked to see if a room would be ready for us at 5am when we arrived. She was very accommodating and even thought they were sold-out the night before, Daniela made sure there was a room ready for us when we arrived. The hotel and staff of the Westin LAX are outstanding!! Gregg L.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing at the least”
Reviews.Author: caperelli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Westin in November 2009 this is not up to the usual standards of Westin. The carpets in the halls were frayed and dirty. The furniture in my room, including the mirror on the wall ,was scuffed and gouged. The room reaked of a uric acid smell and turning on the air conditioner presented with mildew smells. The noise on the street outside my room was audible. There was no place to eat and starbucks was a morning coffee cart. It was such a disturbing experience that I wrote to corporate headquarters a month ago and they assured me I would be contacted by the hotel. It has been over a month and I have heard nothing. That says it all. Please investigate other hotels in the area, there a plenty of nice ones, the Sheraton Gateway or the Renaissance for instance. I

Reviews.Title: “excellent vacation”
Reviews.Author: najo33
Reviews.Content: From arriving at the hotel the staff were very helpful and answered all my questions. The front dest and bell desk staff were helpful in every way. The rooms were nice and clean, very spacious with a wonderful view. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. I would also continue to stay at the hotel. I would like to thank Front Desk Manager Clifford Sunajo for going above and beyond my expectations in custom service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: LanishaT
Reviews.Content: My stay in the Weston Hotel was very comforting during a trying period with my family. My father passed away and I had family, and extended family looking for quality accommodates at an affordable rate. Shavonna Cadle, at the first desk, took such excellent care of me and my family. She made sure we had beautiful, clean rooms. She was even accommodating to provide a "state's room" for family and friends that still wanted to reminisce after the services. It really made the weekend easier to get through without having to worry about accommodation drama. I would definitely return after the upgrades are complete, and definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't mind the mess”
Reviews.Author: sinaasappelsap
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about staying here based on previous reviews, but overall I had a great experience. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The woman at the front desk preemptively apologized for the poor quality of the rooms, stating that they were undergoing renovations and if we came back next year the rooms would be much better. I've stayed at a dozen or so different Westins before, and the room we got was right on par with the others - and certainly not the worst. Also - I had my first sighting of the Westin Heavenly Crib. Pretty nice. Perhaps I was so pleased because I was able to lock in a lower ($120, I think?) rate - but if I needed to stay near LAX again I would not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Westin LAX is simply the BEST !!”
Reviews.Author: TahitianDreamsStudio
Reviews.Content: For the past 2 years, I have elected to stay at the Westin LAX for each and every visit into Los Angeles...which is very often. With the love and care I get from SPG Supervisor Roy Lawrence and from Manager Daniela Hiles, I have an "extended family" whom I love and trust. They've made my stays the most enjoyable. I've recommended the Westin LAX to all of my colleagues at my international business company. "from a most happy customer who will return again and again" John R Borja Sennheiser Elec. Corp. Systems Integration Division

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jollyjenks
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night before heading home to UK, Had a great Room, Clean comfortable Great Service and friendly One of the better AIrport Hotels I have stayed at - Well done & Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great for transit”
Reviews.Author: wendy1461
Reviews.Content: clean comfortable rooms with very attentive staff. Room service very prompt. Recommended for transit. Taxi ride to shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “The quality I had come to expect from the Westin is gone.”
Reviews.Author: Tech_Traveller00
Reviews.Content: I booked a terrace suite and looked forward to arriving since I was a frequent customer about 3 years ago and my experience was always great! Boy was I disappointed. The valet team has been changed and they are nonchalent and I finally had to ask them to come over to the car to give me a hand. I went inside and the service desk personnel were professional and courteous and so were the bellmen. I received my room key and went up and the room was clean and neat, the Heaven beds are truly heavenly and the complimentary amenities were very nice. It was at night that things went wrong. It was a cold night (for LA) and when I tried to turn on the heat in the bedroom, it didn't work. I called down, a guy came up, got the fan to work and said, it should warm up in a while. It didn't. Not only that, but when I called back he never returned. It was like an icicle. I called the front desk asked for a floor heater or just extra blankets, if they couldn't get it working, but they said they had neither and there was nothing they could do but send the guy back up. I feel asleep on the living room couch since it was warm in there and if he came, I didn't hear him. The next morning I was greeted with a cold shower because there was no hot water. I was told they were working on the boiler, but by 11:30 am still no hot water, so I took a cold shower and realized the Westin I had known was no more. I would have to think long and hard about spending money with the Westin LA anymore, and that's sad since I used to be a Gold member.

Reviews.Title: “Famous one in LAX”
Reviews.Author: MONK09
Reviews.Content: very well located well known great lobby good rooms

Reviews.Title: “Too close to airport”
Reviews.Author: bcgirl2005
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay at the Westin LAX on route to Mexico. When we booked our LAX airport hotel through Hotwire, we weren't too concerned about where we'd stay, we wanted a 4 star, close to the airport for our early flight out the next morning and that it should be clean and quiet. Well, we ended up with the Westin. It was clean and close to the airport, but definately NOT quiet. I'm not sure how it gets a 4 star rating with such a high noise level. It should be a 2 star. I could barely sleep the entire night as the flights were landing and taking off right out our window. I think I slept for 20 mins. at a time between landings and take offs. It was awful. I may as well have slept at the airport. It's too bad, because overall, it was a comfortable hotel, but if you need to sleep, it's not the place to stay. I would not stay here again and I would not recommend it due to the level of airport noise.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: traveler4k
Reviews.Content: Some VERY annoying things: 1. there is a long wait to get in line (I mean like 40 minutes)/. Secondly, our terrace suite was unavailable until 8PM! That was inexcusable, especially as it was just a one night stay. To compensate for the lengthy delay, the Westin gave us a $20 voucher for food at the restaurant, which was also pretty bad! The suite itself was lovely and I enjoyed the terrace overlooking the airport and seeing the planes land and take off. All in all it was mediocre and I know this will sound strange, but across the street they have a La Quinta Inn that is absolutely GREAT! The living room in the suite had many electrical problems such as lights not being functional and no air conditioning or heat. It did not work. I never used the living room and just the tiny bedroom instead. I would definitely save money and stay at the La Quinta (which I promise does not feel like a 3 star) or in the 4 star categories, just go to the Hilton, Renaissance, Sheraton or Radisson. This was the worst of the LAX 4 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel Convenience”
Reviews.Author: vcarina1097
Reviews.Content: This is a favorite when I'm traveling on business. The staff is always courteous, friendly and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal for the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Ken_per_se
Reviews.Content: Like other comments say, this is not the best Westin. The windows need better noise isolation, bathroom is dated, and wi-fi internet connection is slow for what you pay. However, It has shuttle bus servies from the airport, Thrifty car rental located next to the hotel (20 seconds walk), and it has small but heated pool and jacuzzi. I didnt notice the dirty carpet, and it seems in-room dinning priced as Westin average. Most of all, it usualy has a great deal. If you see the room rate, like $83 per night, its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Barely a Westin.”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious but threadbare and worn. Ugly colors. Just because its an airport hotel doesn't mean it has to be so yecchy. There was a biker convention staying at our hotel. So it was noisy. LAX hotels are generally shabby but this one is supposed to be a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Makeover needed”
Reviews.Author: Adventure Diva
Reviews.Content: Location is everything and that is what the Westin LAX Hotel offers. Rooms and staff's attitude need a makeover, unfortunately. The hotel served my purpose but I would not go back

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: kyscully
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the beginning and end of an Amtrak trip (the Coastal Starlight) to Seattle and back to LA. The staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were very comfortable and roomy. Out of a total of six nights there was only one time where the noise from planes taking off bothered me - (my husband slept right through it). They must have changed runways because the rest of our stay they were landing and not at full throttle when they passed near the hotel. The hotel was convenient for pickup by tour companies and there's a very inexpensive trolley (the Ocean Express) available through the hotels in that area that goes down to Manhattan Beach, with two more stops at upscale shopping centers and restaurants. It runs every half hour so you can stay as long as you like at each stop. The restaurant is a little pricey, but there's a Starbucks stand just off the lobby where you can get a quick breakfast and pastries. There's a Denny's within walking distance, also, plus a Taco Bell/Pizza Hut and a Subway.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves to LOSE a STAR!”
Reviews.Author: onesoul1life
Reviews.Content: Rooms are awful, front desk have attitude, definately DO NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately Needs Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: ManhattanMan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline for $69 per night, under the 4 star category. There is NO WAY that this is a four star hotel. It is more like a 2 1/2 star hotel. It wasn't a horrible experience; but it certainly doesn't live up to 4 stars. There was some mold visible on the bathroom ceiling. The velour curtains were very dusty and in need of a good cleaning. The hallways and rooms could definitely use new carpeting. As others have mentioned, the TV reception (not flat screen) wasn't great, although that wasn't a big deal to me. Staff wasn't overly friendly, and certainly could have been more welcoming upon check in. There was also an $18 a day charge for self-parking, which, in my opinion is far too much. I understand that there has to be a charge for parking, but $18 is too much. The fitness room is pretty nice. The store in the lobby is very overpriced. All in all, I wouldn't necessarily discourage others from going there, but I wouldn't encourage it either. 4 Star hotels must be MUCH better than the Westin Los Angeles Airport..

Reviews.Title: “Really poor”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: $12.95 for very slow internet. Rooms dated. TV an old relic. Beware of making toll free 1800 numbers. They hit you $2. Food horrendously overpriced. Give this hotel a BIG miss

Reviews.Title: “OMG!! the worst Westin ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lululalapaloza
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a mess!!! The worst Westin property ever!! For a large hotel with LAX location you would think Westin would get moving on the remodel that is SO past due. If I had been a business traveler, paying good money for this stay I would have been furious. As it was, I complained and they put us on the executive level, which was slightly and I do mean slightly better. Here are a few of the issues... Dated hallway needs paint everywhere, furniture in lobby and rooms old tattered, warn and DIRTY. Carpets filthy!! Rooms, dated, dirty, no flat screen TV's, bathroom tile dirty, old.. and this is not so much housekeeping; there is only so much you can do with run down rooms. The beds didn't even feel like "heavenly" beds.. either old or just old models. low to the floor. Furniture had water stains all over, both rooms. The only difference between the executive level and the first room we were given was the carpet was "a little" cleaner.. and not by much. The windows were so bad you could hardly see out of them! Amazingly the hotel looked busy with a few conventions in..SAD very SAD. If I had to stay there one more day I think we would have moved. Not enough bad things to add. DONOT pick this Westin until they remodel. Also, when I was at the desk to complain about our room and get moved..the clerk added he hears this all day long. Westin .. Get your act together! Were talking LAX here!!

Reviews.Title: “Older property, 7 minutes to LAX, adequate for layover.”
Reviews.Author: YYZAC
Reviews.Content: Just completed a stay at the Westin LAX. As I had a 10:30 p.m. flight out of LAX across the continent, used the hotel during the day only. For a Priceline rate of just under $65, plus taxes/fees, the price made this a worthwhile option. Check-in was quick and I appreciated the fact that I was only charged $9 for the use of the parking, with in/out priviliges, instead of the normal rate of $18 for overnight guests. The FOX & Thrifty rental car companies are directly next door to the hotel so this was a good hotel since I could walk directly to it after returning the car after dinner. I have stayed here before a few years ago prior to flying out to Hawaii. The property is well suited to the airport, but is not much like other Westin properties I have been to. The hotel is tired and worn around the edges. They are trying to fix it up by rennovating the restaurant in the lobby, but the rooms are in need of an update. Stayed in room 867, overlooking the runway. It was interesting to watch the planes land and take off, so plane spotters take note. As mentioned above, the room is in need of some T.L.C. at there were many unsightly marks on the carpet, furniture and walls. The marble counter top on the work desk actually moves back and forth, which I found out by accident. The dresser had a large patch of wood ripped off the front that was repaired by a brown crayon (as if we wouldn't know the difference!) The T.V. is an older style "tube" model, which is now surprising to see in hotels. The bathroom was a standard size, but nothing to fancy. Had the typical Westin bath products, including the leaf shaped "enima" soap. (who came up with this shape?, so awkward when cleaning those unmentionable areas: pointy leaf shaped soap!) Adequate shower pressure and hot water. What was nice about the room was the fact that there was a small section of the large windows that could be opened. The pool area is a small, concrete wall fenced in area. One good thing about this property is the guest laundry located in the pool area. There are only a couple of machines, but this is a nice feature that many hotels do not have. The shuttle service to the airport is about every 15 minutes. There is a real time GPS map just inside the main doors that show you the location of the shuttle as they make their rounds in the airport and back. Cute gimmick to keep you busy while you wait. There is not much in the area, but there are a couple of restaurants. For plane spotters, there is a place called "The Proud Bird", on Aviation Road, visible from the hotel. The restaurant has vintage planes on display and from the main dining room one can watch the planes land. They even have head phones beside the tables that are connected to LAX approach so that the communication between the cockpit and the tower can be heard. There is also a place called Chalet Edelweiss, located on Supulveda, about 5 minutes away. Great, authentic, Swiss restaurant. Internet $11.95/day, Parking $18/night. Overall, a good property and not bad for a layover or for just before an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for one day”
Reviews.Author: nicholasdamian
Reviews.Content: Westin LAX is perfect for a short stay, though you still need a rental car for your travel in LA. I was upgraded since I am a gold member and overall it's clean. There is a continental breakfast included but since there was convention in the hotel so all the bread, muffins were finished by the time I had my breakfast at 9 am on a Saturday. So I wish this could be improved. But overall, I couldn't complain, the parking space is convenient, we just had to pay USD18 per day for self parking. Location close to the hotel helps if you have an early flight but if you want to see LA, then it's better live in Pasadena area which is a nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Examineticstech
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through Priceline, at a amazing rate. I was just passing through the area, and needed a place to stay for the night. I was a bit apprehensive at first, when I looked down to see the room number that they had put me in was "666". I assure you the room didn't spawn Satan, or anything. In fact it was very nice. The bed was amazing, I wanted to take it with me. Everything in my room was very clean, and the air conditioning kept the room nice and cool. It even had a large over-sized chair to lay in. The bar downstairs was nice and spacious. It was a little expensive, but i got to grab a quick bite to eat and watch Monday night football. There is a parking fee, but being an airport hotel, not that many people are worried about that I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Enasni
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Westin LAX after a long day flying from Amsterdam to LA. The next day we had to catch an early flight to Honolulu and the Westin was a great place to check-in, have something to eat, get some sleep and checkin out again. It was a pretty short stay, but the beds were absolutely fabulous! I always have problems being in a strange bed for the first night, but at this place I slept like a baby... Shuttle service to and from LAX was pretty good. Every 15-20 minutes or so a shuttle leaves at the airport and and the hotel. After a 5 minute ride you are being dropped of at the hotel and after a 20 minutes ride you are at the airport. Great stay for just one night!

Reviews.Title: “Layover - Breaking up Flight Hours”
Reviews.Author: cshager
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way home after a cruise to the South Pacific. The hotel was clean and roomy. There are several fast food options in the area if you do not want to eat at the hotel. My only complaint was the hot tub. It was a good size, but just a slight bubble. It was even hard to determine if the jets were running. We booked through PL and only paid $55. This was an excellent price for a 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean but Out Dated”
Reviews.Author: CamHdz
Reviews.Content: Room was clean but you could tell that it needed to be refurbished. Smelled like mildew and stuffy. Bed was super comfortable. If you are just on a layover it should be fine. There are a few little restaurants close (walking distance). Taco Bell is right across the street and McDonald's & Subway are also super close. Denny's is up the street but you may not want to walk it. Overall ok but needs to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Alright for a short stay when going to or from the airport”
Reviews.Author: bXMi
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel at a good rate from Priceline and stayed there for a night after arriving at LAX in the evening. The most important thing for me is cleanliness and I had nothing to complain about on that subject. However the hotel felt very outdated and is in need of a major refurbishment. The room was large, clean, but not very stylish. The same goes for the bathroom. The bed was comfortable and probably the best thing about the whole stay. I would recommend this hotel if you can get a good rate and don't expect too much. I was welcomed by a friendly and attentive staff at the reception, but I don't have much basis to evaluate service since that was the only time I had the chance to meet any of the staff. Westin is located by the airport so you will probably know what to expect from the location. Nothing memorable. I picked up a rental car the next morning and headed straigt to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosiesgirl
Reviews.Content: I had concerns about this Westin based on some reviews here, but I as I am a fan of the chain I decided to give it a try. And I have to say, I don't understand the negative reviews. This is an airport hotel that more than gets the job done. The shuttle was efficient. The lobby is pleasant, the staff was very welcoming and helpful, the room spacious and pleasant. The real surprise was the restaurant. I have low expectations on airport hotel food and was very pleasantly surprised. While not the most exciting ambience around, it was pefectly fine. I requested a quieter table, and they accommodated. I cannot remember the waiters name, alas, but he was a classy professional who would not be out of place at the best of restaurants. I was able to break up a long trip with a relaxing drink, a good meal and a good nights rest. And one of those great moments that happen when you travel: while having a pre dinner drink by myself in the lobby, an orthodox Jewish wedding spilled out of a function room, as they appeared to be singing the bride and groom on their way. Delightful

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice, great management staff makes it much better!”
Reviews.Author: toboro
Reviews.Content: The management staff has been great during my stay here, they more than make up for the little problems with the hotel with their desire to help. Some of the rooms seem dated and need to be redone, I.E old tube telivisions. If it wasn't for the staff this hotel would be average. I might've looked into alternative lodging, but they make your stay as nice as can be.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Quality, But Be Ready For a Few Additional Charges.”
Reviews.Author: Naylor41
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that The Westin qualifies as a 4 star hotel, but be prepared to fork over an extra $40 per night to receive any such amenities. I would also recommend becoming a preferred member as it saves on the ridiculous parking charges. Despite the additional charges, the service is one of a kind. When having car trouble they were more than willing to help including finding a tow truck company if necessary. If you can get this hotel at a discounted rate at a place like Hotwire.com I would more than recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near Airport, serviced with Shuttle. Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Amanda51
Reviews.Content: Great location & staff helpful. Was a little more expensive than the other 4-5star hotels at LAX but we wanted a treat! Hotel is nice, starting to get a bit dated though. Disappointed with room service - they only had a limited menu the night we arrived & it had been a long day. Choice was Club Sandwich & Caeser Salad.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck at LAX on XMAS Eve”
Reviews.Author: MCohen
Reviews.Content: I was stuck at LAX on XMAS eve alone after trying to fly to Phoenix to see my family. Since I was SPG Gold and had a corporate rate I decided to stay at the hotel till my flight in the early morning. Also, I was very tired from traveling all day. The lobby was lovely to look at. The receptionist knew the hotel was empty and still gave me a normal room with no upgrade on XMAS eve. BAAA HUMBUG. The room was your usual Westin airport room. My father told my to order room service and he would pay. The food was like a microwave dinner. Obviously the staff was bitter working XMAS eve.

Reviews.Title: “I hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigmtnrulz
Reviews.Content: I got a pretty good deal on hotwire (4star choice) for $83 a nite, when the weekend before I chose a 3.5 star and got the Hilton across the street and was MUCH happier. . Though the rooms are in good condition, the beds are hard (despite the claim that they are heavenly). Honestly its just a bunch of down that strangles you in your sleep. The pool is ferocious, you wouldnt want to go in there. The rooms are NOISY, you can hear the airplanes and the street traffic and everyone in the hallway. The restaurant is so overpriced for 16.50 for a hamburger. Parking is 18 dollars a nite. Do yourself a favor, if you are using Hotwire, pick the 3.5 and get booked at the Hilton. We left early back to San Diego so that we would not have to spend another night in here. Not a comfortable 4 star by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Help an old lady”
Reviews.Author: kapohokine
Reviews.Content: The LAX Westin is my favorite LAX hotel, maybe my favorite airport hotel period. Shuttle serice from the airport, adjacent to the runways so I'm always a little excited about traveling, spacious, grand lobby area, bustling bar, and plentiful staff. But it's past it's prime and in need of a serious refurb. The staff is always very helpful, kind, and professional. But the rooms are starting to look dated, and everything is just plain old. I had two rooms one night and then one room on a subsequent night (flying into and out of LAX), and all the rooms were in a similar state. Carpets are worn and stained. Drapes hang as they have when they looked cool in the eighties, now they just look like a weird idea from the eighties. the windows don't do a good job of muffling noise, like more modern window designs do. The television is ancient with a terrible, snowy picture. The lamps were cobbled together in a way that i called them "Frankenlamps". And every corner on every piece of hanging artwork in every room I had was broken off or smashed. The air extractor in the bathroom was filthy, and the AC did not operate properly. The breakfast buffet is great, with plenty of choices including an array of fresh fruit. But the banquette we were seated at was stained and had a huge tear in it. The price, $99/night from the SPG website was very good value, but I am anxious for this hotel to get it's due, bring it back to it's luster!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in LAX-area”
Reviews.Author: Ronald_Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find a good affortable hotel in the LAX area. After last years disappointing experience we followed an advice of a friend of mine. After a long trip we need a quiet hotel to recover. The room was quiet, big enough for a short stay and hotel facilities were great (try the breakfast buffet). We decided to come back after our Hawaii trip an for our last night before returning home. In total we stayed for three days and it's sure will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Sunajo and his staff deserve kudos”
Reviews.Author: senseo
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if my review went through, since it didn't say. So, I'm writing another just in case. The hotel was bustling with military families and an elegant wedding wrapped in glittering jewels and limos when we arrived. It was more than a busy place...it was a zoo. Yet, despite the frenetic nature of the atmosphere, Mr. Sunajo the manager and all his staff at the desk took time to greet us and consider all of our needs from parking to dining. It set the tone of a lovely stay. We are most thankful. Thank you for the professionalism and care you gave to me and my parents.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected.”
Reviews.Author: 56Vendange
Reviews.Content: I am very happy I decided to stay at Westin LAX 1 night before taking a cross country flight to the east coast. The bed is exactly like they describe, HEAVENLY. the in room breakfast was of any 5 star hotel standard, Service is excellent, and the rooms are very nice and quite, you close the curtains properly, you would not even know if it's day or night, very good from travelers waiting for their flights. or arriving at odd hours. and the shuttle to and from LAX runs every 10 to 15 min. My only Complain: old TV. other than that No Complains. Recommend to anyone who has to connect a flight from or to LAX. Relax and recharge in style.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful....the staff is always on top of things!”
Reviews.Author: Bella063
Reviews.Content: Wonderful....the staff is always on top of things! great location, comfortable rooms

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable - it works.”
Reviews.Author: kiss_traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfectly nice room. Not the latest in furnishings (no flat panel tv, etc). But very comfortable. Very attentive staff. Self-parking was very easy, lot directly connected to hotel, quick in-out ($20/day).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel With a Surprise Ending”
Reviews.Author: billrose2
Reviews.Content: Husband and I got the LAX Westin on Hotwire, so got a great deal. We got in late evening and left 8am next morning. I had paid for the room with credit card through Hotwire, but upon arriving home and checking my charges on the internet, Westin had charged me $10.54 for the refreshment bar items. We hadn't consumed any items, but I had looked at the bottled water and showed my husband that it was $3.99, then replaced it. I called the billing department and learned that there was a sensor on the refreshment tray and since I had removed an item to look at it, there was an automatic charge put on our charge card. I asked if just moving the tray would set off the sensor as I often scoot desk items to put my laptop/purse/etc. on the desk and she said yes, it would. She said she would cancel that charge on our credit card. Also wireless internet is $11.95 I believe per day. Cheaper hotels offer it free. The whole incident didn't leave a good taste in my mouth.......otherwise it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: paulj106
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was excellent. Hotel was clean. Food was good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as most Westins, but OK for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: crittergal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire and got it for $62 a night. For that reason, I'm satisfied with my stay there. (I was there for three days.) However, it is definitely not as nice as many Westins I've visited. First, the good: the bed was very comfortable, the room was clean, the food was expensive but tasty and the staff was friendly. The location is so-so; there's little around the hotel (no real restaurants or shopping because it's near the airport) but for $3, you can take a trolley roundtrip to Manhattan Beach and it's absolutely lovely there. Restaurants, shop, clean beach. Trolley stops across the street from the hotel. Now, the negatives: the hotel shows a picture of a beautiful pool, and it is fairly nice, but there are FIVE reclining chairs around that pool. No kidding. It's July in sunny LA, and they have only five chairs at the pool. That was a problem for many people who didn't get one. I went out each day at 7 a.m. and staked a chair. The furniture was not high end like you expect at a Westin, and the TV didn't work well, but I wasn't there for the TV so that didn't bother me much. I would never make this a destination hotel for vacation, but it's fine for a layover or a place to stay before a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for staying after evening arrival at LAX”
Reviews.Author: stefanerics
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay one night at a hotel close to LAX as we arrived in the evening from Europe. The hotel was perfect for a no-nonsense no-problems one night stay before continuing south to San Diego. We booked through Hotwire and got a great deal. The hotel was actually slightly better than we thought based on some of the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest staff of any hotel I've every stayed”
Reviews.Author: thspsautc
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to LA I decided (by luck) to stay at the Westin by LA airport. It was easily the best hotel experience I've ever had. The hotel staff was incredibly helpful and knowledgeable, and frequently went out of their way to make sure my girlfriend and I were happy. The hotel manager there (I think his name was Cliff or Chris) was extremely nice and gave us perfect dinner suggestions. Also the place smells great - I stole a bunch of their lotions and shampoos. Great location too, two thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent with great proximity to LAX”
Reviews.Author: returnmetokaneohe
Reviews.Content: We checked-in in the late afternoon, and the registration staff were just adequately attentative. We had to ask every basic question, ie direction of the room, elevators, food recommendations etc, plus no porter assistance offered. We were tired and a few tips are always appreciated. Ultimately, a great place for our short stop-over, we booked on Hotwire and got a good rate. The room was clean, very comfortable, end of a quiet, upper floor. Heard some young people in the elevator say their wedding party was two floors below ours. Glad they were not on our floor, as they stated they planned on partying ALL night. We were looking for some sleep, on our way from Hawaii to Central America. Mattress was great, lots of hot water, and no-smoke smell in the room (thanks!). View was great, no noise, and the curtains closed so we could sleep. Wake-up call as a back-up was a plus as well. The shuttle to LAX was timely (every 30 minutes) and the driver was perfect at the negotiating morning traffic. As a tip, don't rely on the valets for shuttle tips. They tried to put us in a cab, stating that the shuttle had just left, would be back in half an hour and then another shuttle came in five minutes. Read some reviews stating the lobby was chabby, but it was adequate by our standards. The bar serves beverages and light meals until pretty late. We made the mistake of searching for food on foot, and ended up with fast food, yuck. Unless you're into Taco Bell or Carl's Jr, best to eat in.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you can get a good deal; Proximity to airport hi-point”
Reviews.Author: njskiiier
Reviews.Content: Checked in late at night--took free shuttle from lax to Wesin which worked out wonderfully. Room was nice. Check over your bills carefully as charges for food snacks from mini bar and phone calls both errors on final bill. They don't tell you but there are complementary hot and cold beverages and fruit for SPG members to the right of check in desk which closes at 10pm. Would not put much faith in concierge as they steered us to a rental car company that was an independent and not very convenient and not connected with any Airline partners, while a Thrifty was right next door. Error made on bill for 2nd night stay later on in the week which was a hassel to try and correct. Front desk personnell not very helpful when questions regarding Starwood points vs Airline miles were asked. Did not go the extra step to clarify or answer questions just told you to call the 800 number. But once they apply starwood points into your account you cannot undo this talking to SPG 800. There is a Starbucks cart w/muffins and juices etc so that you can grab a snack on your way out in the morning which was nice. Gift shop cute-- but personnel again not very pleasant /helpful. If you are looking for a place to stay prior to or immediately after a flight this will work great. Remember that if you are going to the airport to catch a flight out you will be the first pickup and there are 2 other hotels after Westin prior to reaching airport so plan accordingly. Likewise, you will be the first stop off when leaving airport. Fitness center -fairly large-very nice w/ several ellipticals and a few nice treadmills, balls, weights, bikes which was a nice bonus

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: County-Hunter
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter, my wife and myself enjoyed our 2 night stay here. I booked these rooms on Hotwire at a bargain price so the extra cost of parking/internet didn't bother me so much. Besides, that is to be expected at almost any 4-star hotel in the country. $18 per day for parking isn't so bad when you consider that it's $24 for the Hyatt at Logan in Boston or get this - $30 to park in the lot for a San Francisco Giant's game. I can't imagine what New York City hotels are charging for parking. And unlike a 4 star hotel in New Orleans that we stayed in last summer where the parking was 3 blocks away, the lot was right behind the hotel. Our room was nicely appointed although the lack of a flat screen TV was unforgivable in a 4 star hotel. Westin lived up to it's reputation by providing a mattress which was absolutely the best mattress that I have ever slept on in my entire life! It was truly awesome and I slept like a baby. There was some airplane noise but that was because the window was open. When I closed it and turned on the A/C, the noise practically vanished. Also, the dual shower heads in the shower that Westin is also known for provided for an excellent shower. One disapointment was the pool. The jets in the spa were broken and there was a some guy in there smoking on a cigarette. Not the kind of place I want to take my kids. Overall, we had a good stay and I would recommend this place if you can book it for a decent price on Hotwire/Priceline, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Avergaqe hotel”
Reviews.Author: TP19
Reviews.Content: I have been to many cities in the US and I've never had to pay $18 for parking, not sure if this is standard for LA as it was my first time there. If you have young kids don't let the open the fridge and touch any drinks in there, they have it wire so that if the drinks move you automatically get charge, again I've not seen this before. But overall, the hotel is nice.

Reviews.Title: “A night at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: sonri
Reviews.Content: This place sucks. EVERYTHING has a charge. I would have imagined for a 4 star hotel, the internet would be free. The business center was more expensive to use their internet services. That was the first thing that ticked me off. On top of that, I have to pay $18 each night for parking, which isn't so bad I guess, but I've stayed at way better 3 star hotels that had these services for free. As far as the room, it was elegant I guess. The carpets were all stained, even in the hallways. They had a refreshment center in the room, charging $3 for a can of soda, $6 for a beer. There was only one bar of soap, no other toiletries. I heard airplanes all night long, but that was expected for being close to an airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: maroro
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire and didn't know the name of this 4 star hotel. It was the Westin and for the $US69 rate was excellent value. Bed was excellent and the room very clean - perhaps a little dated but quite spacious. We were facing West Century Blvd and there was no noise. We watched the planes coming in. Earlier in June we were on another side and be warned, there is a Dog Hotel and early in the morning there was barking. We asked to be away from the dogs on our next stay. Another plus for this hotel is that there is a Subway 1 minute away and other fast food places very close. Not a lot else within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good value / great location”
Reviews.Author: texasag86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what it is. An average hotel, close to the airport. We thought the friendliness of the staff made it a little above average stay. It is a businees travel oriented hotel and ours were the only children I saw there. The pool area was nice and everyone treated us well, so it fit our needs just fine. The internet connection was slower than dial-up, so if I had been there on business it would have driven me crazy. Parking is expensive, so avoid it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: fotogirl
Reviews.Content: Initial dealing with the staff was very unpleasant. We had brought printed confirmation of 2 double beds and I called the day prior to confirm and they told me 2 double beds, however on checking in they wanted to give us 1 King. After stating we had 4 in our party they got the Manager to make the change. The man at the desk was very unfriendly. Then we parked in the garage and got lost in the elevators. We parked on 4 but the doors into the hotel are on 3. I think if you park on 2 or 4 or anything else you take the garage elevator to 3 or lobby to access hotel. If you know that you can try to park on 3 all the time and avoid one elevator ride because once you're in the hotel you walk and use the hotel elevators to get to your floor. Maybe this is more "secure" but the clerk should inform you of this. The one set of elevators was not working for our stay which made it take a good 20 minutes to get on an elevator at busy times. As far as the room, it was good and fairly spacious. It was very, very quiet and we overlooked their roof maybe. Beds comfy but on the softer side. We wanted to use the fridge for other things but it only seemed to keep their drinks cold, or was broken, the outside felt hot to the touch. I chose the Westin because I love their double showerheads, which we had for one night. We came in one night to find dirty foot marks on the bathroom floor and wondered where it came from. They had switched out our showerhead and we had a single! No more "heavenly shower" for us!! We were ok with it but don't boast offering it if you're gonna take it away. The location was ok, busy street, near the airport and freeway. We did go to Denny's since it's close. Also a Mcdonalds close. All the other staff seemed friendly, but I probably would not stay here again unless I got a steal of a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par with other Westin properties”
Reviews.Author: probity_mom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night at the tail end of a trip. We were greeted by a Valet (?) that had a fist full of keys demanding that we give him ours as well while we check in...no valet stub in return, just hand him the keys and go inside, which we did not do. The room needed upgrading...carpets old and smelly, chairs dirty, and furniture chipped and warped. The elevators were broken and took forever to use! The reservation was to include a cont breakfast, this was not provided. Our membership included a lounge providing coffee and fruit around the clock which was not provided. Parking was limited, expesive and cramped. Trying to think of something good to say: the dual shower head was a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisMaverick
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this Westin for over two years. What sets them apart is their staff. They are extremely customer service focused and they always go out of their way to give me VIP treatment. I have recommended this Westin to all of my colleagues and now they won't stay anywhere else. I look forward to staying here whenever I am in the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, first class staff”
Reviews.Author: WJMCC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the LAX Westin many times. The staff is responsive, knowledgeable and extremely guest friendly. The location is perfect and very convenient for downtown Los Angeles or Orange County. I have brought my family on some of the trips as well, and the location is convenient and the staff is very responsive in handling all of our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient - rooms a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: tarheeljd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin LAX several times. Very convenient to LAX - right off the 405. Decent hotel - no frills. Rooms need to be updated - new carpet and flat screens shoudl be first. Also, this seems to be the hotel of choice for the airline crews - usually a good sign as it relates to value.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was very, very nice!”
Reviews.Author: NowisthetimeSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin was very nice with absolutely no problems. We were happy with the rate and the accommodations were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for conference, banquet, etc.”
Reviews.Author: Maggies2009
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Westin LAX. I have used this hotel for several years for our annual conference and banquet and am never disappointed. The service, quality, support staff, food, and rooms are all top notch. They make it a point to know you and your staff and are eager to help in any way possible. The location is great for guests to our conference and banquet coming by air. We have tried other hotels, and find the Westin to be among the best of the best.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what some of the other reviewers are talking about!”
Reviews.Author: Westinhan
Reviews.Content: The Westin Los Angeles Airport is located near LAX. A free shuttle service will take you there first before going to the La Quinta and Holiday Inn right across the street. The ride takes about five minutes and runs 24 hours a day in 15 minute intervals. It is a small bus and the driver accepts, but does not expects tips. The hotel is on Century Boulevard in the direction of the airport. There are some fast food (Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, and McDonald's) across the street near the other hotels mentioned above as well as a Denny's nearby, but not much else. Fortunately, rental car companies are close (there is a Thrifty rental right next door). The hotel appears to have been a luxury hotel in the 80s and is well-kept. The lobby is very nice and the bar is upscale. Guests are middle-class or above, but not upper-class. Many international visitors and there was a conference for Korean American Amway and a semi-formal for some Japanese college kids. I would say on average the hotel is somewhat below the Westin average in quality, but not by much. I liked it just fine. The front desk staff were generally attractive and professional. And they were friendly enough. I experienced no problems whatsoever at this hotel, so perhaps they could turn ugly as other reviewers have commented. However, nothing close to what happened to others happened to me. I reserved an Executive Room located on the Starwood Preferred Guest floor and it was excellent. Very spacious and nice. The view was a city view consisting of only the empty lots and cheap apartments across the street. My colleague's room overlooked the main entrance and the Hilton and other hotels as well as the airport. I noticed the roof of the entranceway was dirty and had lots of pigeon droppings (the only unclean factor of this hotel). The TV was not a flat screen, but a large brownvision. The window stretched all across one side of the wall. The bathroom was a bit like 80s-style Los Angeles, but nice enough. All amenities were provided. And, of course, you can't beat the Heavenly Bed which is the signature mark of Westin hotels. I saw in a sales brochure for hotel items that was in the room that you can order the mattress and bedding set for about $3500. I was tempted to order this set. Once again, I want to commend Westin for the best bedding ever! I slept so incredibly well here. A beautiful sleeping experience! I did not order room service, but I met my friends at the bar and we had a great time. The bill came out to nearly $100 plus a $20 tip for the three of us. They could mix any drink, I imagine since I ordered Tom Collins all night and they didn't blink (many bartenders need to ask what that is and they don't know how to make it). The servers were good, but could have came by more often. At least they didn't bother us or pester us by keeping asking us if we wanted more drinks. The bar is definitely what you would imagine an upscale airport hotel bar would be. I felt very comfortable there. Self parking was $18 per day and $28 per day for valet parking. There was a large BMW and some kind of sports car parked outside the hotel, but the cars in the self parking lot were varied in class. The weather was not that great (shocking for Los Angeles), so I did not see the pool. But another guest told me it was nice. SUMMARY: The hotel is located about a 30 minute drive on the 405 freeway to Beverly Hills, West L.A., and West Hollywood. So that is inconvenient for going out and shopping, etc. But if you are looking for a hotel by LAX, I would recommend this place. I have not stayed at other airport hotels in the Los Angeles area, so I can't compare. But I really enjoyed staying here. Although the next time I would probably stay closer to where the bars and shops are located and where all my friends live, if I had to stay near the airport I would most definitely stay here again. It's hard for me to believe these other reviews that are so negative, but I did not stay in a Standard Room and perhaps they were unlucky with service or something. The rate for the room, which I got directly through the Starwood Preferred Guest site, was also unbeatable for Los Angeles. It was unrefundable though. Nevertheless, I think the overall value is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good for LAX layover”
Reviews.Author: librarian5
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a layover at LAX and was happy with my choice. A few days before I arrived, I emailed the hotel about a shuttle and someone responded within 48 hours with very good instructions on how to find the shuttle and how often it runs. I arrived early from the east coast and was hoping for early check-in but was told rooms weren't ready until 3 pm (the regular check-in time), so the bellhop stored my luggage and I had lunch in the restaurant. The food was pretty good although expensive, and the wait staff was friendly. We had a standard king room, which had enough room and was comfortable enough. I noticed a couple of small maintenance issues that needed to be addressed but nothing too bothersome. Despite being next to the airport (I had a view of it from my room), noise was never a problem. I had a room facing the highway rather than the runway, so that might have helped.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: Daryl'sadork
Reviews.Content: This place is nice. But unless you have sometime to enjoy it or get a real deal it's a bit much. The restaurant is very pricey for not so great food. I like the Denny's across the street much better. Watch the parking costs and if you do not have a car say so often. That said the pool is nice the hot tub nice rooms are plush beds are great the place is really quiet for a 24 hour airport stay and the staff is responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Westin & Do stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Alanslegal
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum Starwood Preferred Guest and stayed here for one night in April 2009. I'd highly recommend you to avoid this place where possible! Its cheap & nasty, the Platinum/Gold desk is pathetic, the rooms are worse and the executive lounge only offers hot water and tea. The only positive I can say with this hotel, is the express check-out and me dropping my room keys to have never return to this Westin LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice room, and great service!”
Reviews.Author: bellemd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, fast check in, very clean, nice room and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: rc33
Reviews.Content: Basically a typical airport hotel. Expected Westin standards however a lot to be desired. Service is ok, only the room service people seemed to be nice. Front desk was average. It seems the rooms need a major upgrade. Looks like the Westin products (bed, shower, etc) seem to be in place however the room itself seems old and tired. Have stayed in better airport hotels. There is a shuttle that goes form/to the airport. Probably better off to stay in Santa Monica, Hollywood or Beverly Hills as they are no that far away.

Reviews.Title: “Smart airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TommoPaignton
Reviews.Content: We read some reviews that were not too complimentary but as we were only there overnight, it didn't really worry us too much. After an efficient welcome we were very pleasantly surprised to find a large room waiting for us on the ninth floor. Granted, the bathroom was due an update but it was clean and huge. It was quiet, we did not hear a sound and slept well in the 2 double beds. As a tip for people passing through on vacation, cheap eats are available at quite a decent Dennys 2 minutes walk away and there is a trolleybus that carries you to Manhattan beach, which is about 3miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Overnight In or Out of LAX”
Reviews.Author: Mpls4
Reviews.Content: Got a cheap room rate through Hotwire. Smallish but decent pool and good hot tub. Excellent room service but expensive - cost more than the room but well worth it. Rooms aren't huge but Westin's beds and pillows are fantastic. Loud neighbors, thin walls. As other reviewers have said, it may not be a "real" Westin but it is a good airport hotel with some great amenities. Expensive parking but that is typical in big cities especially near airports. I skipped this and brought my rental car back early - Thrifty is literally right next door - and used the excellent free hotel shuttle to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Room!”
Reviews.Author: MMilne
Reviews.Content: Filthy room with wonderful bed. This building needs to be torn down, they have dressed it up but the walls tell another story. The carpet was dirty, furniture dusty, and being in this room made by skin crawl. The restaurant was good but expensive. Stayed overnight for a connecting flight. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “With little help from no friend”
Reviews.Author: ARII
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin LA Airport several times.. I was there for one overnight from 10th thru11th April. Upon my late arrival from El Paso, Texas, I appreciated being accommodated on the last floor as the hotel was literally crammed with youngsters.. The room was comfortable and so were the beds. Still, the noisy air conditioner did not work, which would have been a real problem in summertime . More, I was most disappointed with a reception clerk-named IVO- during check-in: he was unwelcoming, unsmiling and addressing me as if I were an idiot! This is uncommon enough to be mentioned especially in this hotel where reception staff is professional. The hotel remains recommendable, though ,despite the abovementioned dysfunctionings. Ariimoana FRENCH POLYNESIA

Reviews.Title: “Overall, okay experience, but hotel staff were passive-aggressive.”
Reviews.Author: tmwnn
Reviews.Content: I usually put out the "Do Not Disturb" sign, and at most hotels, it is honored. However, at the LAX Westin, I returned to my room to find housekeeping inside, with the sign still on the door. I know some hotels have a policy of cleaning once a week regardless of the guest's preference, but I was only staying 5 days. Two days later, I received a voicemail telling me that there was a message for me at the front desk. Fearing something had happened to one of my family members, I went immediately, only to find out that the message was that housekeeping could not clean my room because I had the "Do Not Disturb" sign up. I find this to be very passive-aggressive and rude. Additionally, my room key would not unlock the Starwood Preferred Guest business center, but a friend's key would (and he is not a SPG member). The in-room wireless internet was supposed to be free with my room, but nowhere in the room were instructions on how to connect. Evidently, you have to "pay" for 24-hours of access, and it will be deducted from your bill if you are in a room that has free Wi-Fi. Lastly, the airport shuttle company pulls into and out of the drive too fast for anyone waiting inside to get out to the shuttle. I know this is probably an independent contractor, but their impatience nearly made me miss my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: korokoro
Reviews.Content: I don't think the hotel deserves the bad rap it seems to get, although it is at best average for its class. The room was fine; quite large actually. The staff were fine. I resent paying for internet, but that's endemic with 4 star hotels. I got the place cheap via Hotwire, so it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take your chances”
Reviews.Author: ptfisher
Reviews.Content: The location and overall quality of the hotel were average or slightly above and the general staff were courtious and helpful. Or experience turned very sour when we found out that there was a youth dance convention being held at the hotel and 1500 kids of varying ages would be infesting the place. We have nothing against kids, however, we soon found out that the elevators were out of the question at certain times of the day and found ourselves toting our 1 1/2 year old and stroller up and down 10 flights of stairs to get back and forth to our room. From 5-7:30 that evening the lobby was filled with hundreds of people dining buffet style with tables taking up most of the walking space. Dinner that night consisted of enduring blaring music streaming from the lobby followed by wall thumping dance club style music next to our table. The pool was completely inaccessible due to volume of kids. The volume of people in the hotel at any one time actually seemed to create a substantial fire hazard. Contacting the front desk and night manager resulted in nothing and an email sent to the general manager requesting a refund has been unanswered - no response at all. We obviously reccommend that you check with this hotel to see if any conventions are at the hotel in advance of choosing to stay here. As a full paying customer, you will be disregarded if there is more money to be made by hosting a conference at your the expense. Don't take your chances is our recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping Secretly wants to see You Naked.”
Reviews.Author: lawyergirl07
Reviews.Content: I booked my room on Priceline the night before my friend and I arrived at LAX for a tattoo convention. I was super excited when I read that we had gotten the Westin from Bidding. Let me just start off with saying that the outside of the Westing LAX is lovely from the street, but when you pull up into the driveway to the front of the Hotel to the Valet, they just look at you. I waited a few minutes, got out of my car and checked in, leaving my friend in the passenger seat to arrange the car to be Valeted. When I came out 15 minutes later, she was still sitting in the car waiting for an attendant. I called over the bell captain to help us with our luggage, he proceeded to grab my light duffle bag, leaving my friend holding her two heavy bags. We made our way up to our room on the 4th floor, with a really cool view of the pool. I felt like I was right up in the water. I decided to change my clothes before dinner. Just as my shirt was coming off, one faint knock on the door and the door comes flying open to show a little housekeeper standing there. I freaked, and I am sure she did too. My friend was horrified. I immediately got on the phone and called the management, whom moved us to another room on a higher floor. The room on the 8th floor had a lovely view of Downtown Los Angeles, The Hollywood Sign and a large bullet hole in the window! We laughed it off as being in LA. We began talks as to where we were going to go for dinner as my Friend started changing her clothes...just as the door flug open with no knocking at all. My friend was completely naked. Angy, I rushed downstairs to have a chat with the Hotel Manager. He was very nice, however not very sympathetic. I made my way back to the room to find out that my friend had left her Tattoo Gloves in the previous room. I called down to the front desk and was told that a security person needed to let us in the room, and that they would call us later. The call never came. The next morning, I called the front desk to find out if my Friend's gloves. Nope. It was chalked up that the maid had stolen them. Again, no sympathy to the fact that my Friend needed her tattoo gloves and had to cancel an appointment to give a $2000 tattoo for a celebrity. Dont waste your time or money at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “NOT a four star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: adam4747
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline to get a good price on a hotel near the airport. We figured that by specifying a four star hotel we couldn't do too badly. We were wrong. The interiors are shabby. The rooms are very small. But worst of all is a very strong staff vs. guest mentality. We ordered room service and when it came, the soup had spilled over the sandwiches we had ordered. When we called room service to discuss this their attitude was "That couldn't have happened" rather than "we will fix it". Additionally, there is only one restaurant on premises which has a casual atmosphere but high prices (entrees were $25 to $45). Parking is $40+ per night. Unless you are on an expense account AND want to be treated poorly, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking outside, nasty inside”
Reviews.Author: jakestone
Reviews.Content: Staying at a Westin in MN recently, I decided to stay at this one while on business in LA. Looked goog in the lobby. However; getting to the room, it was old, and poorly cleaned. I think the people that check the quality of the cleaning jobs need glasses. Toothpaste caked on the counters in the bathroom. Other people's hairs in the tub. Poor quality workmanship in the remodeling. Carpeting dirty, workspace dirty (desktop), mirror streaked and dirty, grout on the tile in the tub surround was BLACK and dirty. I dont think they know what bleach is here. Anyhow, the room was once'd over for cleaning, it is like they used a broom to clean it, but no cleaning liquids, or anything. I would not recommend this place for a stay, unless they change their cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: A snowstorm on the east coast stranded us for a night in LA. We used cash and points for our one night stay here. It's hard to expect much from an airport hotel, and this version of an airport hotel doesn't do much to break the mold. The hallways smelled fairly strongly of jet fuel, though the rooms smelled neutral. The room was spacious enough, though it was not very clean. The robe hanging on the door had a large stain on the sleeve, which was off-putting to say the least. We did not take use any of the dining outlets or other facilities, save for the complimentary airport shuttle, which was reliable and runs pretty frequently. The bed was comfortable and water pressure in the shower strong, but other than that, there isn't much to recommend this property. On the flip side, I would imagine most people are using the hotel for short stays, and for that purpose, it serves it purpose well enough.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice for being so close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: puzzolente
Reviews.Content: There are nice Westins, and then there are Westins that feel a little worn and in need of a remodel (Dallas Galleria, anyone?). This is one of the good ones, with a nice, spacious lobby, good parking and the usual Starwood friendly and efficient front desk service. The ultimate compliment is that despite being all of a half mile from LAX in a less-than-fancy neighborhood, you immediately forget that the moment you step inside. It's no surprise that we saw flight crews all over the place. I was on the Starwood floor. Slow elevator service during my stay, but they had signs saying they're remodeling them. I believe you can tell a lot from the hallway, and this one felt clean and relatively up to date. The good-sized room was pretty much what you'd expect from a decent Westin, including the beige-y bathroom that always feels a little dingy even though it's clearly clean. Good bed, a robe (with a hole), decent products (although a single soap that you have to switch between sink and shower?), too-small old-school TV. Interesting vertical safe that would hold a laptop...if the door worked. $12 internet access is a joke in this day and age, and mini bar prices seemed unusually steep on a few items like bottled water. Good workout room if you're into elliptical, treadmill or bike. By no means a luxury hotel, but a great option if you want to be close to the airport without staying in a nasty "airport hotel."

Reviews.Title: “Bargain on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: fsujenn
Reviews.Content: After I booked this on Priceline for $82 for Friday I immediately went to Tripadvisor and got scared. No need for the fear in the end. The hotel was just fine. Yes, it is older. I felt sorry for some of the light fixtures. However, it is a great location in relevance to LAX and LA Airforce Base (which is wear I was). I love Westin beds, so that was a plus to see the familiar site. I can't tell you about the pool, but the staff was nice and helpful. Parking is $18 here, but that is basically the going rate around the airport. There are restaurants and fastfood within walking distance. If you wanted a small trek, you can get on the rail line and head into Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend for early flight”
Reviews.Author: AvonCTgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight here because of an early AM flight. Quick, efficient check-in. Room was clean, large and luxurious with the trademark Westin bed and a wonderfully comfortable armchair. Great in-room setup for coffee or tea. We returned our rental, walked back to the hotel and used the free shuttle to airport. Was worried about airplane noise being so close to the airport, but the place was very quiet. I would stay here again any time I had a very early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: imajeeplover
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why everyone disses this place. I needed a convenient, decent place to stay near LAX and The Westin totally fit the bill. Checkin in was fast and friendly, room was nice (although I will say the countertops in the room needed cleaning), very comfy bed. Of course you are going to hear planes landing, you are NEXT TO THE AIRPORT! I would definitely recommend, especially if you can get a sweet Hotwire price.

Reviews.Title: “NICE!! But, Don't touch the snacks!!”
Reviews.Author: bucknut06
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the last night of a weekend getaway to L.A. thru Hotwire. The Hotel is very nice and the staff is friendly.. Very close to Rental car returns which is what I wanted as we had an early flight.. Beds are comfy and it's kind of neat to watch the jets fly past your window on approach to LAX. Only problem I had was I noticed a $10 charge on my bill because I picked up a jar of cashews on the snack tray on the dresser.. Apparently there is a sensor underneath the snacks that automatically bills you if they are moved.. I thought that was a little shady of an upscale brand of hotel, but they removed the charge when I complained about it..

Reviews.Title: “Not a single good thing to say”
Reviews.Author: Janie C
Reviews.Content: I am used to great quality from Westins, but this particular Westin property brings shame to the entire brand. Awful!! Check-in and check-out was slow and rude. The room was not clean, lots of hair leftover from previous guest. Shower had no water pressure. There was so much dust that you could see it on every surface and throughout the air space. Elevators were supposedly being renovated, but they were shaky and nerve-racking. The lobby seemed okay, until I looked at the lights and there were shadows of dead moths in the light covers (really gross.)
