Don't even think about staying here unless you really have no other choices. I'm still cranky from staying at this site.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: MTNYC
Reviews.Content: Since I booked through Priceline I can't complain about the value but if I had paid full freight here I would be furious. I was checked in to a room that was already occupied without even an apology from the indifferent front desk staff. The room was adequate but plastic cups for drinking glasses at a 4 star hotel? The Embassy Suites I had just checked out of had nicer room amenities. Other reviewers have mentioned the airport noise (why don't they have better windows?), elevator delays and sky-high additional charges for parking and wi-fi so factor that in. Room service food was average quality and prices you'd expect at a high end hotel - maybe this place was high end at one time but no longer. With the number of hotels in the neighborhood there must be a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “found it fsntastic”
Reviews.Author: toffee8440
Reviews.Content: We were going to US from Australia to visit family and friends for the first time ever for Christmas so we were pretty pumped. We missed our connecting flight in LA due to a Qantas mechanical problem. We found ourselves stuck in LA for three days waiting for a connecting flight. Qantas ended up puting us up at the Westin. I was hoping it was not going to be a dive that we were stuck in for 3 days. In fact, we found all aspects of the service and rooms to be fantastic. The service at the desk was slow but accurate. The rooms were clean and spacious. The batroom was a little outdated but by no means bad. They allowed us to us a courtesy computer to deal with some issues relating to the delay. We had food vouchers for the restaurant and have to say the food was beautiful and meals came out quick. I don't think this was by any stretch a busy time for them so this would help. They even had a wii available for the three kids to play in the lobby some nights. The kids used the pool and spa even though they were not that flash, but the kids thought it was better than nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep inside LAX, its cleaner and better run than this hotel”
Reviews.Author: chamsachamsa
Reviews.Content: First off, THIS HOTEL IS UNDERGOING SOME MAINTENANCE AND IS NOT "INFORMING GUESTS AT TIME OF BOOKING". I learned this as I got stuck in one of the elevators with one of the bellmen and he told me that the hotel is not going to do a big "remodel" and instead is just going to fix things little by little over time, as of my stay they were replacing two of the elevators top to tail as they had not been touched since 1985 when the hotel was built. Think about having only 4 elevators for over 700 rooms.......PLAN ON THIS when trying to make your flight on time at LAX. I have had the disprivlege of having to attend past events at this hotel and recently I had to stay here for a conference. I am ASTOUNDED at the incredible ineptness and pure apathy that the staff at this hotel embraces. 9 months prior, I had joined 6 friends who were staying here for cocktails and dinner, to make a very long story way too short (becasue it deserves to be told as NO HOTEL should be allowed to treat "guests" like we were treated), and it was the absolute WORST experience I have ever had with so called food and lack of customer service. So much so was it appalling that 3 months later there was an article in a local paper that talked about how many times the BBB has recieved complaints on this hotel and their poor saniation record. Fast forward to February 2009......surely things must have changed in the 9 months since I had been here last, I had to endure a full week at this hotel for a conference. NOTHING has changed, NOTHING. If anything, the entire hotel has gotten worse. The staff could care less about treating guests with respect and actually doing their job: I asked the housekeeper to please wipe off the window when I checked in as there were greasy handprints all over it.....SHE HANDED ME THE BOTTLE OF DLEANER and told me that she had already cleaned the room and didn't see where it needed cleaning.....and this was on the "Starwood Preferred Guest Level". This is after the hotel had checked me into 2 rooms that were already occupied. If I were less than a gentlemen, I could have walked out of the room with all of the jewelry I saw on one of the counters. The water pressure is non-existant, the elevators are old and one should plan an extra ten minutes to get down to the lobby if you are on the 12th floor. But, its the staff overall, they could care less about anyone but themselves. And the dingy conditions in the hotel, the beds look as if they came from a men's shelter, they are little better than cots....whatever happened to the "Heavanly Bed". You smell jet fuel int he hallways constantly, and if you are on the south side of the hotel, you will hear nothing but jet engines all day and night as the hotel lies at the end of the runway where the 747s and 777s take off.....remember that flights to Asia out of LAX depart between midnight and 2:00 a.m.....and they use REALLY BIG jets to fly to Asia.....try sleeping through that even with earplugs. Finally, on checkout, the hotel had a charge of $120 for "bar charges" at the Lobby Bar. I inquired about this at the front desk and they said that I had charged drinks to my room. I told them I had not even been to the lobby bar during my stay...which was totally true as their was a big party in the bar every night and it was PACKED and I didn't feel like waiting for 20 minutes for a drink. So, I asked the agent what were the dates of the charges and she told me.....they were for days that I WAS NOT EVEN CHECKED IN AT THE HOTEL !!!! I am not really sure how this could happen, having managed a hotel in a prior career, but she showed me on the screen. I asked to see the signatures from the bar and for it to be matched with my signature card I signed at check-in. She said that would take 2 weeks to obtain....WHAT????? And in the meantime, I would need to pay for the charges and then they would refund them in the event I had not signed. I called the manager over again and the conference organizer at that point and had them resolve the problem.......update...the manager had gone back and looked at the security tapes and found out that it was one of the employees that had been sitting in the bar and charged their night of drinks to the room that I just happened to be in. I was offered only a round of free drinks the next time I was in town. I swear on my daughter's eyes that I am not making this up, this place is a JOKE and SHOULD BE DEMOLISHED. Bottom line, YOU ARE IN FOR A MISERABLE experience if you stay at this hotel !!!!!!!!! Go to other major hotels in the area, they are so much better and treat their guests just as that.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: soph7789
Reviews.Content: Checking in to the Westin LAX it was as i remembered, it was fast and pleasant. However when we got to our room it was worn with carpet stains and tired looking furniture. When we came back to our room after dinner our room key was no longer working. We called reception to ask them about it and they told us that we were not staying here and that they could not help us. When we went down to reception they said the same thing. After about 15 minutes they found us on the system and fixed our room key. I have stayed in this hotel once before and it has seriously deteriorated. Being a gold spg member i would usually choose a starwood hotel. However i will not be going back to the Westin LAX. A few weeks before we missed our flight out of LAX and the airline put us in the Hilton LAX, i would stay there but never the Westin again!

Reviews.Title: “charges, charges, charges”
Reviews.Author: MattAndEmilysTravels
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before, both times booking through priceline. I complained to priceline last time that I did not think this should be a 4 star hotel, but I was not suprised to get it again. As other reviewers have stated, the hotel is tired and worn. Wood furniture is dented and scratched up, chair in room had strange stains and burned on iron mark. Things I expect at a HoJo, not westin. Be prepared to be charged for everything besides sleeping. $10/day internet price ($7/15 min if you use thier lobby computers), meanwhile neighbor hotels offer free wi-fi. Parking $18/day. Don't want a USA Today, you have to call and 'refuse it' in order to not be charged (this is in fine print). Any hotel that nickels and dimes thier customers is deceptive in my book. I think this hotel does a disservice to the westin brand. We booked a king room (my husband and I are not small people), and were given 2 queens. They told us they had no kings, meanwhile the person next to us was being put into a king on his choice of floor?! What is that about?!? We called each night for 3 nights and they 'could not move us'. I think they have different policies for priceline customers...fyi... I do appreciate the friendly dog policy at all westin hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Some great people, and some average product”
Reviews.Author: andrewsydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because our Air Canada flight was late meaning we missed our connecting flight and needed to be in la for another 24 hours. Hence, we didn't pay - AC did - but these were our two major impressions nonetheless; the staff were mostly great. For example, we needed another bag for our journey and they had some abondened ones in luggage they were happy to give us if we needed them. Also, we were on a tight deadline with dinner the night we were leaving and the waitress happily rushed our order through for us, very smoothly and happily. Not so impressive was the check in - wwaayyy too slow and some confusing and unneccessary things done; and the rooms are tired, and could do with updating, especially the bathrooms. The beds are very comfortable, and space isn't a huge issue, but the bathrooms are dated, especially for a 4 star hotel. Overall, we had a good experience. The airport shuttle was fine. It is a far better option than the LAX Embassy Suites we stayed at last year.

Reviews.Title: “great for our purpose”
Reviews.Author: kekocowan
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for an overnight layover in LA on our way home from Europe. Got a great rate on this hotel through Priceline and we were very happy with our stay. Shuttle picked us up at the airport and took us to the hotel. Front staff was helpful and efficient and got us checked in quickly. Room was spacious, no smoking and with a king bed, and it felt luxurious and quiet. We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant, had a great squash soup and a sandwich. Then went and relaxed in the hot-tub which was perfect since we were exhausted from all the flying. We had a great night's sleep, the bed was extremely comfortable, and then took the shuttle back to the airport in the morning. We would absolutely choose this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Westin LAX is a comfortable and convenient find...”
Reviews.Author: BMP123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2008. Booked directly on the hotel's website, but searched for AAA rates and was able to get a deluxe room for $107 USD per night. What a great deal! Main reason for choosing this hotel was because we had rented a car from Enterprise a few blocks away earlier in the week, and you are able to drop off your car at the Westin - just by parking in the parkade and dropping your keys in a time stamped envelope and into a box at the conceierge. Very convenient! The check-in at the hotel was quick and service was great. The room was in great condition, for being an older hotel. The chaise lounger had seen better days, but no big deal. The sweet sleeper king bed was perfect! One word of advice: don't pick up - or even touch - the tray of snacks on the desk or anything in the fridge. All of the items are placed on a weighted sensors and you will be charged for those items whether you use them or not. Curiousity is not always a good idea. We ordered food from the lounge - I don't recommend it. :( The exercise room, sauna and pool facilities were fantastic. We used the express checkout and took the complimentary shuttle to the airport. Also very convenient. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for business travellers or those who only need stay for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Not my best hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Paycationer
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying I got a GREAT deal by going through a fantastic travel site (Net Trav)! If you want a great site to add to your list you already use to compare and save, just go to [--]. If you like what you see be sure to tell your friends-oh heck tell your enemies too! The hotel was just ok in my opinion. Everything did appear to be old and outdated and just kind of bland. The food was not very good and was quite pricey. I think what surprised me most was that a can of Pepsi (and I am a Coke drinker!) was six bucks?!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: painai
Reviews.Content: Flight changes by our airline meant that we needed to spend an overnight at the Westin. The many negaive reviews on this site made us fear the worst, but we ended up with a clean room, with decent porter service and a good breakfast included in the room rate. Probably the only negative was our check-in experience: a long wait even though it was almost 2 am. Otherwise, our stay was better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Outdated”
Reviews.Author: menzelm78
Reviews.Content: The service was good - no complaints! Beds were comfortable too and the shuttle service to LAX a bonus. The hotel itself is in dire need for a face lift unless they are trying to go for a 80's chic look.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fotoose
Reviews.Content: We were very well treated, had a very clean and comfortable room and lacked for nothing in the way of services. It was a weekend and the office facilities were uncrowded and available 24/7 with use of pass key. Loyalty club members can get upgrades easily, at least on weekends. I booked an internet rate at the Westin website and would do so again, even if it costs a few dollars more, (which it may or may not). Perhaps if the hotel does not have to pay a commission, it can be more liberal with room assignments or upgrades. I don't know. The hotel is near $3 r/t shuttle to Manhattan Beach which has very good restaurants, so you are not limited to hotel fare. An excellent buffet breakfast was served at the hotel, and they do not rush you out. The buffet might seem pricey but the quality of the offerings made it a good value. There is smoked salmon, but you kind of have to look for it on a shelf above other items. There is a Thrifty Car Rental across the street , and they matched the best rate of competitors obtained over the internet.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump! Fix This Place!”
Reviews.Author: FoodandWineGirls
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property many times over the last 10 years. Absolutely NOTHING has changed in 10 years. This place is busy around the clock and the rooms show it. It's dirty, the carpets are worn, the TV's are ANCIENT, the internet is WIRED and there are potential fire hazard electric plug strips throughout the room! DON'T STAY HERE- no matter what your rate is! Cups are PLASTIC. Soap is meager. Towels are far from "Heavenly", I requested 2 foam pillows and was given 2 more down pillows- thanks! I'll go out of my way to NOT spend a dime at this place. Get with the times, Westin! The rest of your properties are fairly nice. This one gives your entire chain a BAD NAME! It is Los Angeles, afterall. That's a MAJOR CITY in case you didn't notice. SPEND SOME MONEY AND REFURBISH THIS DUMP!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, but No”
Reviews.Author: rl2684
Reviews.Content: I thought the Westin name would not do me wrong, but for some reason we just didnt click. The property was outdated and the rug and wallpapers were ripping. the staff seemed enthusiastic, which helped, but the condition of the hotel calls for a renovation. I will probably stay in the city center next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel by any means”
Reviews.Author: suomynona
Reviews.Content: Booked my room the same day at a great rate. Apparently I was given the "Priceline" room. There were bodily fluids on the curtain. Phone cord was detached from the phone (nub that attaches to phone was broken.) I notified the Front Desk the next morning when I checked out so hopefully future guests in that room don't miss their wake-up calls. Bathroom floor was dirty. The room's carpet was tore up -- looked as though a large dog had dug it's claws into the carpet across the floor. My worst experience thus far with a Priceline purchase, mostly due to the fact that this is no where near a four star hotel. In summary, this hotel's star rating needs an adjustment.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected - Old & Out dated”
Reviews.Author: Sophdobe
Reviews.Content: Was not happy about the parking fee of $18 per day since most hotels in LA have free parking! The hotel delivers newspapers to you daily - but only at your own expense. The hotel puts this in a very small print in the key pouch they give you: "I request newspaper to be delivered to me daily, if I do not want this service - a $0.75 daily fee will be credit back to me on check out". I only saw this cuz I was too bored waiting for the very slow lift - I'm not a newspaper reader & I certainly do not want them to deliver newspaper to me at my expense , since I don't read them anyway! I called the front desk & asked them to cancel the daily delivery but upon check out, they didn't credit me the newspaper money. Okay, it's not a large amount of fee, but I think I deserve the right to choose whether I want newspaper delivered to me or not! Internet was another big problem. The hotel does not have Wifi - internet can only be connected using LAN line at a cost of $12.99/day and even though I've paid for my internet - the internet does not work for almost 6~8hrs due to their server was down. The same thing happened again the next day. So half of the time, I was paying for internet I can't use! When I called the reception to find out what's wrong with the internet, they just replied me "it's down" and hung up! I mean, if it was a free service, then I wouldn't have minded - but I think I should get somthing that actually works when I've paid for it already! Over all, the hotel is not as good as I expected - especially from a Westin hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Dated Property”
Reviews.Author: kristalynn25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights on the way to Hawaii and back for our Honeymoon. The good--Our first night there was perfect. My husband told the desk it was our honeymoon and they upgraded us to a suite and sent up champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. The room was a bit dated, but nice enough. There was a balcony, which was nice. It was a good start to our honeymoon! The bad--2 weeks later, we returned late after a delayed flight from Maui. To our dismay, the hotel had been overbooked and there were no rooms left. My husband and I had paid in full on priceline, yet our room was still given away. We were put in a hospitality suite with two cots...no bed...just 2 cots. It was very upsetting to spend the last night of our honeymoon cramped on a cot! The thing that made my husband and I most upset was that we paid for our room in full. Whether we arrived or not, we paid for a room. There is no reason it should have been given away. Overall, the property is tired and could use some updating. If you plan on arriving late, call the hotel and let them know that you will be arriving late!

Reviews.Title: “Being honest and frank,this was poor enough...”
Reviews.Author: Earthman83
Reviews.Content: Where to start... We had an early morning flight so chose this to kip down for the night. If we could do it again,We'd have went back to the RC at Marina del ray. In summary,we were on a high floor and despite being SPG platinum,we were given a box room,that just looked grubby and very very basic. There was a stale smell of smoke in the room also and the walls were marked and worn as was the corridoor en route to the room. The TV in the room was old had very bad reception. The shower was luke warm at best and the pressure was low-Not what you want when you are off to the airport for a long flight! Breakfast was so so. All in all-Choose somewhere else if you can.

Reviews.Title: “"4 star"? Try 2 star....”
Reviews.Author: wsudu
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am going to give an honest review here. I have stayed at Westins before and have been happy, so this wasn't new but not at LAX. My wife and I were doing a last minute vacation extension for 2 days here so we found this at Hotwire for $100 a night total....ok seems good. We were dressed nice but in shorts and polos which I seemed to get a lot of looks from the staff, but that's OK as I understand this is a business traveler hotel especially in the week. We checked in and got to the room and it had the most filthy bathroom counter and dresser top almost like lotion was spilled on both. There were small items on the floor like hair clips and bits of paper. The bathroom smelled like cigarette smoke from the shower curtain. We were thinking "Ok, not a big deal, but they could have tried harder." We then go to the pool, in which the pool chemicals we so off and strong that we had to get out sooner than we wanted. We have an in ground pool so we have a good idea. It was so bad that we both smell like chlorine 2 days afterwards even with 3 showers. This was by far the worst hotel pool that I have ever swam in. Last was the kicker and you must be aware of this before you stay. Our room was on the south east side. There is a business called the "LA Kennel Club" below on the street which is obviously a dog boarding kennel. The dogs were loudly audible 150 yards away from where our room was. They are put up at night around 9-9:30 but they are outside barking nice and loud early in the morning. I tried to get another room but none were available. Forget sleeping in if you want! The planes from LAX were a non issue for noise. Other than that, the hotel was nice and easy to get to LAX and other attractions. Of course parking is $18 per day. All of these items were told to the front desk person at check out and the operator. Both were not sincere with their apologies and no remedy was even remotely offered. My point is that we are in no way very picky people but even if you get a deal on this place, it still is not a deal. I wouldn't even be writing this review if it were the just the dirty room and the pool, but the dogs were way over the top. This was just not acceptable from a "4 star".

Reviews.Title: “Good for your first night in LA”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first night in LA before moving on to our resort. I checked octopus travel for prices on this hotel as I'd heard they were very cheap, they quoted roughly 100 dollars (65 pounds), I then took the quote and had Westin/Starwood match it -10% with their best price policy. As LAX was utter pandemonium at 8.30pm on a sunday night and customs/imigration had taken forever to get us through (2 hours) I took a taxi to the hotel to save further strain on my tired partner ($17.50) - I saw one airport shuttle go past, just as we got into our taxi - and we'd waited something like 20 minutes. I'd find out where the shuttle stops before trying to find it, LAX is bonkers at this time of the evening and week. Check-in was very quick and friendly, room was very good with a view of the airport and the noise that brings, bed was good, no HBO on the TV though which was annoying as we wanted to just cool down watching some telly before going to bed. The hotels next to the 5400 century blvd Thrifty outlet which is convinient if that particular franchise lacks a fair bit of customer service. We'd stay there again if the price was right, we paid a little more over the other hotels nearbyfor a hotel we knew we'd get as opposed to priceline or hotwire and for your first night with a tired partner it's nice to know.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Kelbean
Reviews.Content: Got an EXCELLENT deal off Hotwire..The Westin is an absolutely beautiful hotel!!! The conceirge (Sal) was extremely helpful in finding me transportation to and from the hotel--I recommend taking the Ocean Express Shuttle to Manhattan Beach if you have a few hrs. to kill (only $3 round trip)--and the location of the hotel is really easy to find--and that's coming from someone who has never been to LA before!! The room has everything you could imagine..the beds are a dream to sleep on and they offer lots of beauty supplies (there is a cost, however) if you are interested. The pool was beautiful and had plenty of chairs..even supplied towels for guests. They fitness center was well equipped with machines and TV's, too...All in all, the place is just fabulous..One negative might be the price to park--$18--but I didn't find that be unreasonable, given the price of the room I got--under $100!! I highly recommend this hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Second time around was an improvement.”
Reviews.Author: TravelForFunDeerPark
Reviews.Content: I have previously posted a negative review about this hotel. We had booked the room thru Priceline. I think we got a Priceline room at that time and it was less than desirable. However we booked this hotel thru hotwire and gave it a second chance. We had a better experience this time. No real complaints. However parking is expensive at $18 a night. Granted we only paid $58 a night not including the parking fee. Would not stay here at normal prices, however there are good deals to be had if you look hard enough. Beds are very comfy. If you drink the bottle of water provided in your room, it will cost you over five bucks. So if you can get a good deal on this hotel, give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Typical decent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKDunc
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for a stopover at LAX, the hotel runs a free shuttle to and from LAX. Room was ok, we didn't use any of the facilities at the hotel but i all looked ok. A few previous comments made reference to problems with the lifts, we didn't get stuck, but the lifts did feel a bit tempremental. We got reall lucky that our car rental company (Thrifty) was based right next door to the hotel, so if your looking to rent a car I'd recommend going ith these guys for convenience, also offered good rates.

Reviews.Title: “Loud & overpriced”
Reviews.Author: travelltester
Reviews.Content: First room we moved in had dirty bed-sheets & smelled like somebody had smoked in it. Extremely noisy, you are right next to the runway... Rooms have poor noise isolation - you hear your neighbour... You have to pay for parking (18$ self parking, 28 $ valet) expensive restaurant which is not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Dated, but not noisy (from the outside...)”
Reviews.Author: Goulz
Reviews.Content: Got the hotel for 90$US on Priceline. Arrived at 9PM after a flight from Montreal. Was greeted at check-in quickly. Then, Natal, our bellman, told us all about his native Brazil on our way to an Ambassador Suite, which was granted to us as a free upgrade upon our arrival. At first glance, the room was huge! A large desk, a separate bedroom and a nice king-sized bed. The only downer was that the A/C, although quite noisy, was not very powerful. As usual for a Westin, great shower (dual heads). Left early in the AM and did not use room service/restaurant. Internet connection was fast and reliable (wired).

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable if got through Hotwire/Priceline”
Reviews.Author: gsnichol
Reviews.Content: I needed a room for one night before taking a flight the next day and booked through Hotwire on the day of my stay. I got a room at the Westin for around $100 + taxes. This I felt was a reasonable price for the hotel. Hotels.com had the hotel listed at something like $225 and if I'd paid that I would have asked for my money back. The hotel is fine. The room (2 double beds) was clean and quiet, despite being essentially at the end of one of the runways, with plenty of Southwest jets landing. The bathroom looked like it dated from many years ago - it was clean, and the shower was fine etc., just the decor and tiing were out of keeping with the more stylish lobby. I had dinner and breakfast at the restaurant. Prices were reasonable for a captive airport audience. If you book through Hotwire or Priceline and get this hotel then ignore the negative reviews on here: your stay will be fine. However I wouldn't actively seek this hotel out again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Westin”
Reviews.Author: Patriot27
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night using points with the family before leaving the next morning for an early flight. Upon checking in we were given a room on the preferred starwood guest floor and received a "Westin Kids Club" bag with few things like a night light and a rubber ducky that the kids loved. The room was spacious but didn't have its featured Heavenly Bed series. We did have a view of the planes landing at LAX -- this kept the kids entertained for a while -- however you could hear the roar of the planes landing which made it hard to get the kids to sleep and a few times heard loud voices from the hallway. In the morning we took the shuttle to the airport but be aware that it stops at two other hotels before taking you to the terminal so be sure to plan for an additional 10 minutes. Overall the hotel is not on par with other Westin's we've stayed at but is a good place to stay for just one night to catch a flight.

Reviews.Title: “not an optimum stay”
Reviews.Author: samhillnz
Reviews.Content: we had an overnight stopover at lax so decided to stay at the westin. First of all its not a bad hotel however there were a few letdowns. we needed to catch a bus to santa monica and the conceirge told us that the buses ran every two hours and would take two hours to get there and tried to get us to use his "personal" limo service to take us there for $60 each way. i used to live in santa monica so i knew the bus came every 15 mins and the journey was about 30 mins so the conceirge who is employed by the hotel was deliberately trying to deceive us. secondly there is a sign up at the front of the hotel which says that there is a cancer risk staying at the hotel due to asbestos in the rooms. the sign is on the back of a pillar at the front of the hotel. apart from these issues the rooms were tidy and clean albeit a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin experience delivered.”
Reviews.Author: PickE
Reviews.Content: Second time at this property, though this time was 3 years later. Much improved service, prompt and friendly. Hotel rooms like nice, and of course the great bed. They even have a starbucks in the lobby. Overall, great stay. Gym and pool are kind of small.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for 1 night...”
Reviews.Author: globe-trotter-808
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night to start off our US Vacation. Arrived at LAX around 2PM and checked into the hotel around 3.30PM. Check-in was swift and we were in our room in no time. The room was clean and tidy and with a good view of the runway. However if you look closely you can see the hotel is rather used up and requires desperate renovations. Also the window in our room couldn't be closed, however it was fixed in no time. Self parking is available and costs USD 17 a day with in and out priviliges. As we were there just for one night it was ok and we could use the nights & points option from starwood and only payed USD 45 for the room and 2800 points. However for a longer stay I would recommend other hotels in LA in better areas.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: thearts
Reviews.Content: Unlike some found, we found that the service was excellent, the lobby area very modern and comfortable and the rooms modern and clean. Not a bad place to stay IF you can get a good price through Hotwire or Priceline for example as we did. 216.00 inc. taxes for two nights. The downside is (self) parking which costs 17.00 bucks per day; it's an airport hotel and I guess that's part of the deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at LAX”
Reviews.Author: Taniquan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the runways at LAX but the rooms overlooking them are extremely quiet. My check in took about 1minute and my room was huge with a chase lounger and a large picture window overlooking the runways. The downside of the hotel is that there is no free wifi and being next to LAX it is not in a neighborhood where you can go outside and walk anywhere. However the self-parking is only $17 day and provides for in and out privileges. Just ask for that when you check in. So if you want a good place to stay near LAX I would recommend the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, would recommed highly!!!”
Reviews.Author: loretta18
Reviews.Content: Near the LAX but surprisingly quiet. Booked through Hotwire and was shocked at the bad reviews (I guess people who are used to staying at 4 and 5 star places are more picky). Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Tasty food in the restaurant. Good strong drinks at the bar. A little spendy ($15 for a burger and fries) but it was the best burger I've had in a long time. Very clean. Beds were soft and extremely comfortable. 5 pillows! Shower had 2 heads and the shower bar was curved out so that it seemed like you had more room. The bathroom door was spring-loaded so that it would close on it's own (no walking into it accidentally at night). Outdoor, heated pool on the third floor. Also a jacuzzi. Nice looking exercise room. They had internet access that was $10 for all day (which I didn't use). Shame that the more expensive hotels don't have free internet :( Other than that though, everything was absolutely fabulous! They had onsite parking that you also had to pay for (don't remember the price, think it was $7 a day) which was convenient. In a safe area. I wouldn't walk past the 405 though. They had buses from the hotel to various areas and also a shuttle to/from LAX. Definitely staying there again if I get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: GiovanniFirenze
Reviews.Content: I am surprised of the bad review this property is getting, my girlfriend and I spent a night (June 12th) at this hotel. We booked it through Priceline for 70$ taxes included : an amazing value. At check in I asked for a room with a view of the runways, which I was told I would get, just to found out they put me in a room facing the highway. The room (2 queen beds) was really large and clean, the décor was modern. We ordered from room service and the food was good. We used the free shuttle to the airport which was good value, we really had to wait no more than 5 minutes. One of the best Westin I have stayed at. Maybe I was just lucky?

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: logicaldog
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the worst Westin in the world, from start to finish it was miserable, the staff were horrible and unresponsive and incompetent, the facility is dirty and needs renovation, there is not one nice thing I could say-I was surprised, stay away, vacation ruiner,

Reviews.Title: “No way a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Cinneide
Reviews.Content: Priceline.com allows for 3 choices in the 4 Star category for LAX, the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles, Renaissance Montura Hotel Los Angeles Airport and the The Westin Los Angeles Airport. We stayed at the Renaissance a couple of weeks ago, and its was very nice, and well worth its 4 Star category. We checked into The Westin Los Angeles Airport on July 28, 2008. After having to request a room change as the first one given was dirty, smelly and had a toilet that was running and not fully clean, we were given another room that while not dirty and as smelly, it was as tired and worn as any 3 / 2 Star room I have ever stayed in. The Westin Los Angeles Airport is in now way to be catorized as a 4 Star hotel - 3 Star at best. Priceline needs to reclassify this one out of its 4 Star list.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast service lousy”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter900
Reviews.Content: Westin is a great brand and usually does not disappoint, but the employees of the Los Angeles Airport Westin are not too motivated. Do not count on efficient service at thier lobby restaurant, and a very bland welcome at their SPG check-in counter. No will will ask if there is anything else you might need. And if you prefer whole milk for your cereal, you can forget complaining about that too.I am not returning to this hotel for a quite a while. For the moment Hilton will be my choice for the LAX area.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: readytotravel12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night and plan on staying again for about 14 days straight coming up. I am having surgery at UCLA and this hotel is perfect for all of my family members and a place for me to stay to recover after checkout. We got the room at a rate of $45.00 using cash/points through spg.com. Excellent price for this hotel. The restaurant has good food, a little expensive but well worth it with their healthy alternative menus. The bar and extra large sitting area is very nice to have a drink and just enjoy the atmosphere of the many people coming and going from the hotel. If you are a spg member a special area is reserved for you with fresh coffee, tea, apples, water, and free internet. Very nice, just present your card on checkin to the special checkin area for spg members. We got a room with a full view of the airplanes landing on the runway of LAX. No extra noise but beautiful view of these massive airlines coming in from all over the world. We have not checked out the area around airport but it is probably typical for airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “When Good Hotels Go Bad”
Reviews.Author: ElvisPWorldwide
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I've stayed at this hotel many times before and it was fine. On this trip, so many things went wrong I lost count. Cold coffee at breakfast. Room service forgot to put in my order and I waited almosy 1.5 hours (and then the order was wrong). Even though the room was pre-paid through hotwire, they charged my AMEX anyway. And the funny part: "ladies of the evening" out front and one or two at the bar. This is nothing new and part of having a hotel on Century Blvd. The first night, we awoke to a repeated banging in the hallway. I finally had enough, slipped out in the hallway and found a night maid stripping beds and slamming the doors against the security bar to keep them from latching. A few other guests stuck there heads out and yelled as well. But the real clincher was the fire alarms going off one floor below most of the next night. The hotel security would then make announcements through the P.A. with a speaker in the room---scared the h*^% out of us at 0200. And 0300. And 0600. The upside? It was cheap---like 70 bucks or something on Hotwire. And the staff are friendly, the beds very comfortable. But I'll probably go back to the Sheraton or Hilton at LAX. There comes a point where "cheap" only goes so far.....

Reviews.Title: “ReLAX at Westin LAX”
Reviews.Author: cindilouredhat
Reviews.Content: I wanted to book a nice hotel room for my birthday near family in the LA area, so we bid on Priceline and got this 4 star hotel room by the airport for a crazy $75 for a standard room. Standard meant we got the king sized Heavenly Bed for which Westin is known, which is by no means standard. Deluxe in every sense of the word! The room was nice, everything worked as it should and was spotlessly clean. There was this huge comfey easy chair where you could put your feet up and watch the planes take of and land through a huge window, in absolute silence. No airplane noise at all unless you chose to open a small ventilating panel in the window. No real need for that since the air conditioning worked perfectly. We were close to family and the freeway, knew LA pretty well, and we had our rental car which we were thrilled we could park ourselves or valet parking, our choice which was expensive, but not the worst we have seen. So we were able to visit and shop wherever we wanted without traveling too far. The entire hotel staff was polite beyond measure and very helpful. The lobby was gorgeous, and the entire place was immaculate. The pool was great fun. We were very very impressed. We got WAAAAAAAY more than our $75 worth!

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IAD777
Reviews.Content: Great service, nice bedrooms, good room service. This is a great option if you have to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Employees”
Reviews.Author: Claytonandrew
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very large with a lot of conventions taking place. . It is very close to LAX. The hotel is in need of a slight makeover. The rooms and hallways need new carpet and wallcovering to brighten it up.However the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable .The employees are very helpful and friendly . I did not enjoy the buffett lunch. I thought you could eat much cheaper with better food elsewhere.However the stay was not bad..

Reviews.Title: “Great if you love barking dogs”
Reviews.Author: BiztravelguyBoston
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't even come close to what one might expect from a Westin property. They have a shuttle from LAX which is apparently shared with a Holiday Inn and some other hotel. The shuttle made me wish I walked. Not a good start. The room itself was fine - until around 7:00 Sunday morning, when the adjacent dog kennel (?) apparently opens. This would be fine if you needed a 7 a.m. wakeup call - but that wasn't what I was looking for after a 1:00 a.m. check-in. The staff could not have cared less. This is allegedly a 4 star hotel - I've had better experiences at Motel 6. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the LAX options”
Reviews.Author: FlyguyAustin
Reviews.Content: There are several 3 star hotels within walking distance of the LAX terminals (Crowne Plaza, Hilton, Sheraton, Marriott). The Westin is the most expensive and probably not worth the extra cost. Ammenities are about the same, rooms a little bigger, and the internet the same price ($11 a day). Parking is more expensive too. The sound proofing is better than the others. I had a non-smoking room that was still "stinky" from the days when it was a smoking room. All of these airport " breath in, breath out" hotels are a little threadbare, and have stained carpets, cracked sinks, chipped door jams. The Westin offers a very nice, quiet room at a better price than you can get in most downtown LA hotels, so I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Westin LAX”
Reviews.Author: Kristy31
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I had a one night layover in LA so we were looking for a hotel near LAX with a courtesy shuttle. RECEPTION: Was great. Friendly staff and no problems with our reservation. Check out time is noon but late check out (up to 2 pm) is available upon request. STAFF: Very nice. Everyone we talked to was friendly, helpful and professional. ROOM: Very clean with modern furniture. Nice white linens on the bed and the comforter was white as well - always nice if you are concerned with cleanliness (white hids nothing!). Comfy chaise-lounge, nice desk/with chair and a king sized bed were all included in our standard room. Basic cable TV included with option to purchase internet access in your room (via the TV). BATHROOM: Very clean. Nice towels. Double shower head was fantastic. Hair dryer was decent. The only thing we noticed it didn't have was a fan - which was odd - so the mirrors fogged up when we showered. HOTEL RESTAURANT: Very good...prices are about $2 more per item for room service. We ate in the restaurant once for dinner and once for breakfast and throughly enjoyed both. We had great service at the restaurant and the food was also very good. A nice selection of items on the menu. HOTEL BAR: Nice bar area. Bar service until approx. 1 am (sometimes a bit later). You can also order food at the bar if the restaurant is closed or if you just want a change of atmosphere. The bartenders were friendly and we had excellent service. SHUTTLE: The airport shuttle runs 24/7. You don't need to call from the airport, simply go to one of the centre "Shuttle/Courtesy Pick Up" locations. The shuttles run loops through LAX and between the Westin. The hotel has a GPS in the shuttles so they can let you know how long it will be until one is back at the hotel ready to return to LAX. They come about every 10-15 minutes though. OTHER: There is also a pool and hot tub on the 3rd floor (outdoors) both were very nice and the area was very clean. There is a nice gym as well (also on the 3rd floor). Valet parking is available. Animals are welcome - there was a large German Shepard staying in one of the rooms while we were there. Overall, we very much enjoyed our stay at the Westin and would definitely stay there again when flying through LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith47
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights through Priceline to say over night on the way to and from Asia. This hotel is a little worn out and seems more like an older Sheraton than a Westin. The gym is good for a hotel and there is a nice pool the look out over the runway at LAX. The room was comfortable, but didn't seem furnished up to Westin's standards. The carpet was cheap looking. We had a problem with an elevator, where I couldn't get it to go the lobby the day I checked out. I met a couple of airline employees who told me the elevator had been a problem for six months. A hotel employee told me on my first visit they planned to renovate the elevators. I had the lunch buffet at the restaurant. It was not very good. Eat at the Marriot a few blocks toward LAX, or the fast food places across the street. Shuttle bus service was frequent and a short drive to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Would look somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: testudo99
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline for $70 a night, The only thing that made my stay great. The front desk was very nice and helpful. When my wife and I checked into the room we noticed that it wasn't even clean. There were shavings and hairs all over the bathroom. The snaks for purchase were not restocked and the bed was half made. We immediately called down and asked for another room. They did not hesitate and rushed a neew key to another room right away. Could have been a mistake, which appears it was. Cannot complain about customer service. The other room was clean but the overall cleanliness and apprearance of the rooms could use some work. But for a night at the hotel it isn't too bad. Shuttles run every 15 min to airport. We actually walked to the Marriot to eat b/c there really wasn't a selection at the Westin. ***Bottom Line: $70 made it worth it. But I would go somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “I like this place”
Reviews.Author: byuby5
Reviews.Content: I got this place bidding on Priceline. for $65. I like it the beds are great the location the staff. If you have something to do with the airport it is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms and Hallways”
Reviews.Author: thebestonlyplease
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say that the staff at the Westin LAX were excellent. Upon check-in, we were offered an upgrade from a standard room to an over-sized room (rm. 858), at no charge, simply because the person at the front desk thought we (a family of 5) would be more comfortable in a bigger room. The bellmen (during check-in and check-out) were both very helpful and friendly--the nicest bellmen I've ever encountered! HOWEVER, despite the fact that we were treated wonderfully, we would NOT stay there again. The Westin LAX is filthy once you pass the lobby and go up to the rooms. Stains were everywhere on the hallway carpet. There was dust on the furniture in our room and greasy fingerprint smudges everywhere. The worst part was the carpet in our room, though. Forget about the stains--I could probably deal with that. It was how dirty and sticky the carpet felt barefoot and even with socks on. I could feel my socks stick to the floor as I walked across the room. I had to wear shoes at all times. Simply speaking, the room was grimy. My family and I felt gross after staying there, and that's AFTER we all took showers the next morning. It's too bad because the customer service really was exceptional compared to so many other hotels, but it still couldn't make up for the filth we had to contend with.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huskies04
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in March 2008. The lobby is pretty nice. The service is pretty good. The room was pretty average. Certainly nothing great and kind of small. But for the price it isn't a bad deal. It is super close to the airport which is conveninent. Close to the rental car place as well. So if you are staying in Los Angeles, have a rental car and want to be close to the airport, the LAX Westin isn't a bad choice at all. But if you are looking for 5-star luxury, I'd stay much further away from the airport probably.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: bom2535
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 08 and this is already my 9th time or more at this very good airport hotel. First of all, this is the inexpensive airport hotel, so it should be compared on this basis. Good frequency shuttle service. Big, clean and nice lobby. Usually good check-in, and hassel free express check-out. **Plus side, relatively bigger guest room, and on the average I always have nice clean bed and room. (only once that they gave the undone room to me, and that was quickly resolved) Good enough bathroom, clean and quality soap. Free internet connection A little far comparing to the others but it's not significant Decent coffee shop, but can simply walking out, heading east Century Blv for one block and there is a very good LAX Cafe for a very traditional American breakfast. In all this is the hotel that always achieve their basic objectives, and sometime bettered that. No complaint and always stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LAX retreat”
Reviews.Author: cruiser1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in April 2008. As noted in previous review the White Tea fragrance that Westin uses in the public areas of the hotel is very pleasant and welcoming. The hotel was very clean and our room appreared fresh. The only odd problem we encountered was that one of the lifts had buttons that either would not work or one had to try several times to get the requested floor call button to come on. Loved the lounge chair in our room. I could relax and read or watch tv and enjoy seeing the jets land at the airport. Staff was professional and the shuttle bus was well done. All in all a very nice stay and I would return to this property any time I was in the area.

Reviews.Title: “great costumer service”
Reviews.Author: anniecopi
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a couple of days of vacation we spent in LA. We came in so tired, we just wanted a bed to sleep on. When we got in, the scent of the lobby was just beautifully delicious....then the girls in the counter were so nice, and helpful, we had already forgotten we were that tired!!! the room was beautifully furnished and the linens where perfectly white. we ate at the restaurant and absolutely looved the food, but overall we loved the way they treated us and made us feel as if we were old known friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Would have hated to pay rack rates for this property”
Reviews.Author: d956
Reviews.Content: Needed an LAX hotel on both ends of a week-long vacation in Cancun. Gave Priceline a try (4* rating) and received the first night for $60, plus taxes, and the second night for $65, plus taxes. For the following reasons, I'm thankful I didn't pay rack rates for this property (in excess of $185, plus taxes, per night). Although the public areas and the staff with whom we came into contact were fine, the rooms to which we were assigned were terribly worn and, frankly, dirty. Hallways on the fourth and seventh floors exhibited torn and stained carpets. And in each room the stained carpets continued, along with chipped furniture, mold in the shower/bath, dusty and fingerprinted furniture and desk top and dirty windows. The second room, on our return trip, was missing light bulbs in one of the lamps and the hairblower was so grimy that my wife held it wrapped in a towel as she used it, so as to avoid skin contact with it. Shuttle service to and from LAX was fine, as was the staff. Breakfast in the restaurant was also fine, as was the waiter. I know that we received a very good deal (in terms of the price we paid) through Priceline on this property but this hotel doesn't hold a candle to other 4* properties we've obtained through the years on Priceline. Had I paid rack rates for this hotel, I'd still be steaming. This Westin is in desperate need of a major overhaul/renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a sleeping room”
Reviews.Author: blkjck5697
Reviews.Content: We stayed here through a Priceline reservation at $82 plus taxes. We had no complaints whatsoever about the room we were assigned other than the fact we could hear some road noise, as our room faced Century Blvd. We were checked in very quickly, and given a very spacious room with a king sized bed. While the valet parking was very expensive ($26), the service that the valets provided was top notch. We called down just as we were leaving the room, and the car was already in front of the doors. The valets were actually cleaning our car windows as we approached. For what was essentially a sleep and go visit, things went very well, and would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: suzyhBoston
Reviews.Content: My cruise ship docked at 8am and my flight back to Boston did not leave until 10pm. I booked a room via prineline.com ($85).I thought the service of EVERYONE at this hotel was exceptional. NATAL the bellman was so pleasant and really cared that we made our flight on time. I travel a lot and this really stuck out for me- enough that I am going to write the Westin-. It does distingush them. The room was large and the bedding was soft and comfy. I like the simplicity of the artwork- clean and fresh. I read the other reviews and I do agree for a "Westin" the dings and dust should not be evident. However it is very nice and you should not hestitate to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Comfort at LAX”
Reviews.Author: jpetralia
Reviews.Content: The Westin at LAX is definitely the most comfortable hotel I've stayed in the LAX area. The rooms are very spacious, and full of all of the comfort that Westin is known for. The bed was deep and soft, with very nice pillows. There was also a nice lounge chair that could relax anybody after even the toughest day. I loved the one-cup coffee maker in the room, supplied with Starbucks coffee, and even genuine Starbucks paper cups! Very cool. I had dinner at the hotel bar, the food, while a little pricey for what you got, was excellent. I definitely recommend this hotel -- especially if you get a good rate (Priceline, $100!!)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: UKBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin during an overnight stopover in LA from UK to Hawaii. The shuttle bus arrived at the airport within 5 minutes and the driver was courteous and helpful. Drive to the hotel was quick, though the line at the hotel check in desk was long (4:00 in the afternoon). We were given a room on the Starwood Perferred Guest floor and it was large, clean and very comfortable. Safe in closet, coffee maker, ironing board and iron all were very helpful. Beds and pillows were of good quality and comfortable. Restaurant opened at 6:00am for breakfast, which allowed us to eat before early onward flight. Staff in restaurant were friendly considering the hour and the food was ok, though expensive. Check out was efficient, shuttle bus was waiting and trip back to the airport was 10 minutes. Booked room through priceline.com for $80 and we consider this exceptionally good value for a clean, comfortable and convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndyGirl00
Reviews.Content: Great location close to airport. Frequent and convienent airport shuttle. Comfortable queen size beds. Clean rooms. Great nighttime views from upper floors. Safe in closet. Seperate floor for Preferred Members. Helpful staff. Tip: Parking is $17/day, but you can rent a car next door from Thrifty or Fox. Also, if you rent from Enterprise at the airport, their night return is the Westin. It's just too bad you can't rent them there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mikenkat
Reviews.Content: If you are think as I was that this Westin has the same standards as others, You an I are mistaken. We were put on the 10th Floor "Executive Level". First the roomservice for the last patron was still outside the door. Inside is worse Brown stains on the Comforters, Dirty watermarks on the desk. Bathroom looks as if it hasn't been renovated since 1970. And the carpet was as dirty as a cheap motel would be. What Happened to the Heavenly Bed, it wasnt in this Westin. I have stayed at the Hilton down the street, what a difference, Go there instead!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: Jbollig
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Westin LAX, both times I had an early flight out of LAX and this was a great place to stay in order to get out early. The rooms are extremely comfortable and clean. The service was excellent. I did use Priceline both times I stayed here, so for the price, this was a great deal. Since this was only a one night stay, we did not need any additional services for which the Westin charges handsomely! For our needs, this was an excellent choice and value. I will continue to choose this hotel if available.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need a face lift!”
Reviews.Author: HikaruDragon
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughters and I spent $79 plus tax through Hotwire, and I'm glad we didn't pay more. The overall presentation is four star, but the room we stayed in was three star at best. The wallpaper was peeling, carpet needed shampooing, furniture was nicked & scratched and so was the paint. Unfortunately, housekeeping didn't do a very good job either. There was a ticket stub on the floor from the previous occupant, as well as a used coffee pod in the coffee machine. The iron cord hadn't been re-coiled. As mentioned before, there are dining options within walking distance, so we ate in the hotel "casual" dining restaurant, Charisma. Dinner entrees were very pricey for "casual" dining--$20-$44. Other items on the menu were less expensive. I had the Tuscan pizza which came w/arugula & artichoke salad for $17.50 and was large enough to share. Valet parking was $23/day; self-park $17/day with in & out privileges. The staff were very personable and helpful. They were the best part of the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: aussiegirlallie
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for 1 night before our flight back to Australia. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful, the room was very clean, the beds were extremely comfortable, the shower nozzle was wonderful, Starbucks in the lobby was a nice touch. We didn't eat within the hotel so I can't comment on the quality of the food but there was quite a few fast food options within easy walking distance.We booked through Hotwire and got a great deal. Would definitely reccommend this hotel and would stay here again. Oh and the courtesy shuttle to and from LAX was an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but need work”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: Our last stay at the Westin was a normal room on the 12 floor near the Executive lounge that offers free internet,coffee and tea. You can access the Lounge with your room key. Since they did not have a suite they gave us free breakfast as a platinum member. Our previous stay was a suite with a separate room for the bedroom. Both rooms have the same decor and I would expect a larger bathroom in the suite. The Westin needs an upgrade. There dinning area is nice, but nothing to write home about. I wish they had a hotel in the PV area or south bay. Reservation desk was friendly. Arriving at the hotel they do seem like they have something better to do then assist you with luggage or greeting you. The separate check-in area for card members is nice when the main reservation desk is busy and it seem to be extremely busy when we are there.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but could do with a refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: MikeCAdelaide
Reviews.Content: The hotel's lobby area is looking very old and run down. I would suggest that the hotel lobby area requires a major upgrade. There is a Starbuck's Cafe located in the hotel lobby, however the hours of operation for the cafe is very limited. The standard double double rooms, have 2 x queen size beds. Both the beds are the new Westin Heavanly Dog Bed. These are one of the most comfortable beds that i have ever slept in. The decor of the rooms are modern and clean. The bathroom area has a shower over the bathtub. Also there is a electronic safe provided inside the closet in every room.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: lneath
Reviews.Content: My first room's AC cover fell off the wall as the bellman brought in my luggage and also noticed a lack of cleanliness. He decided I should immediately be moved. The second room was fine, if not a bit worn. It was clean enough and had a great bed with nice amenities. As this was a business trip it was a perfect place. There isn't any reason to choose the area unless for business or flying. The conference rooms were well tended to and the lobby area was well done. An average to a bit worn Westin, but certainly worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Underwhelmed at Westin LAX”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasMike
Reviews.Content: Westin, Los Angeles Airport. We expected just a little more. Beautiful lobby, with separate area for Starwood Gold + members. Nice sized room was clean and functional. Room had a slightly musty odor. We booked directly with the SPG website, and paid appx $ 119.00. Lively cocktail lounge populated by business types. We enjoyed a few drinks and snacks. Not much within walking distance, but we noticed a Taco Bell across the street. Enjoyed an hour in the small pool. Frequent shuttle service to LAX. We've previously stayed at the newly remodeled Sheraton LAX- and found it to be much nicer overall.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug2476
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel early November 2007. The check-in was fairly quick. Beautiful lobby. We also requested a crib for our 11 month old son at the desk and by the time we got to our room, the crib was already there. The room was ok - the bathroom really needed some updating. The room had no fridge, just a bar fridge. Beds are nice and very comfortable. There was Internet in the room, but we were surprised to find out that we had to pay to use it $10 per day considering that you can get it for free at a cheaper hotel. Also it's $50 per day to park our vehicle at the hotel's parkade. One morning we drove to a place near by to get some breakfast, and when we got back 45 min later we found a sign at the parkade that it was full! So the $50 per day doesn't guarantee that you will find a parking spot if you leave. The view from the room was poor - the parkade and industrial area. I also noticed that the hotel is situated in a very poor area. The houses are very shabby, the whole district is quite scary and unsafe - we saw people sleeping on the street at ngiht (9 pm), garbage, smell of urine. We were not very impressed with the hotel's restaurant either. The service was non existant. The food was average and quite pricy. Also you can't open a windon in the room if you want some fresh air. Overall we were not very impressed. It was my first time I stayed at a Westin hotel and I was expecting something more high end. I stayed at much nicer hotels (Best Western type) for a better price.

Reviews.Title: “It is a very good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: iwishiwasonvacation
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on and off during the last 13 years. I have stayed here when it was a Doubletree and a Westin. The rooms are fairly comfortable, what you really need after a long flight over the Pacific. If you want a view, please stay elsewhere as this is surrounded by Englewood, not Beverly Hills like some of the reviewers probably want. Los Angeles is a car city, so just use this hotel as a base and drive out to the shopping malls or the sights you want to see. There should be a car rental attendant in the lobby, it was once Avis, but not Enterprise. So I suggest that you rent a car from them as this reduces your trouble of driving it back to the lot. The best thing is, you have a base to stay if you have an early morning connection to central US. Stay here, it is fairly decent.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...just needed water”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: I can kind of empathize with the previous reviewer, but I will be a tad nicer...I too, arrived on 10/14 and found the hotel's water to be MIA. I was unable to take a shower the next day and was kind of upset for that. They did comp me my 2 days of parking ($17 each day) and internet access. Other than that, the stay was fine. Here are some more details... Room: I got a room on the 4th floor. It was surprisingly large compared to a friend who stayed down the street at the Hilton. The King bed was lovely and very comfortable. I loved the sheets, comforter, and pillow. The room was surprisingly cold and I had to adjust the vent. I liked their Starbucks coffee and cups. The room had a fridge, but I couldn't figure out how to turn it on. The shower was great, it had 2 showerheads and delivered great water pressure (once water returned). Restaurant/Bar: I did have dinner one night in the bar and it was so-so. They had a thing called "Unwind" and were offering Martini's for $5. I didn't participate so can elaborate much on it. Service: I thought it was ok. Once I complained about the water situation, they were quick to offer up some comps. Front desk people seemed a tad lost... All in all, it was decent hotel to stay (if you need one close to LAX) and had comfortable beds. Danny

Reviews.Title: “Even with a priceline price we paid way too much for this place”
Reviews.Author: michaelbyrns
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel October 14th,2007 for 2 long nights. There were so many bad things, that they overshadow anything good. First we arrived to learn that there would be no water in the hotel from 10PM until 6AM the next day, but they would compensate us by giving us two bottles of water and encouraging us to fill up the bath for future use. They did in the end comp us 1 night of free internet and a breakfast. The next morning the water did not come on until after 8 and it was brown, and had black bits of stuff in it. We did not feel comfortable drinking it after that. The free buffet breakfast that they normally charge almost $20 for was really not worth having, even the danish tasted odd. The AC in the room was not working, and never did, even after a multiple of phone calls that were never answered. The temperature in the room at night never went below around 74 even though I had it set to the low 60s. I opened the window in disgust at 2AM and even that did not bring the temperature lower than 72 which is obviously what they allow in AC! They offer this very fancy very thick bedding that was more suited to an igloo than to this sweatbox room. The room and hotel is as dated as others have written And then there was the infernal barking, and more barking. We were 7 floors up, and the noise was unbearable during the day. When we could not stand any more of it, I called and was more sharp, and at last they took the dogs inside. We booked through Priceline unfortunately, as I would have left this hotel after one night and gone elsewhere. I told them so at the front desk and they comped another day of internet and breakfast. I do not suggest you stay here, unless you have a dog. Even at Priceline rates, this hotel is overpriced and undervalued.

Reviews.Title: “No More - Not at this Westin Wannabe!”
Reviews.Author: MDJDenver
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for many years for business and the last stay was my LAST! Upon check-in they informed me my bed choice wasn't available....well, no surpise there as it happens every week.....they are usually helpful in finding me at least a room on the club level....and they did this time.....the last room down the hall....after walking past 10 open rooms with various exhibits and conferences going on (the piano wizard looked so interesting) I entered the room....OMG....it hadn't been updated since the hotel opened.....old brass fixtures which were so weathered they were green.....the sink and vanity was a gross one piece seashell shaped thing in pink marble and the room had very ornate gold fixtures and detailed dental crown molding....where in the heck was I?? Certainly not at a Westin!!! It reminded me of a tour to the Liberace house in Vegas (had to go there for a biz event, not by choice). My expectations of the Westin LAX are not high - I know what to expect but this was a shock! I immediately went back down to the Gold/Plat SPG desk and asked for another room.....kudos to the team for trying and after 15 minutes they offered me a new room....again on the club level, two queen beds....the second room smelled like cat urine and over looked a dog kennel....what a pleasure to go to sleep and wake to the sound of barking dogs. According to the SPG desk, this was the best they had for an "elite" SPG guest as they just had too many conference attendees. The conferences were not restricted to conference rooms, they were going on in the rooms up and down every hall....it was uncomfortable walking to and from my room.....creepy actually since you felt like you had to watch over your shoulder as you entered your room at night! It was a long 4 nights......my last 4 nights at the Westin LAX. The hotel is in dire need of an update and some employee monitoring. While the first room they gave me is not typical of the other rooms in the hotel, they haven't been updated in some time either. I know as I was staying there weekly in 2000 when they updated them to their present decor. Rarely do I get a room where the "Heavenly Bath" is actually heavenly....the second shower head never works, water pressure is not consistant, tiles are chipped, grout is moldy and the carpet is worn and stained. Housekeeping is hit or miss...sometimes they leave bottled water and coffee, sometimes they clean the bathroom and leave new towels, sometimes they vacumn, sometimes they empty the trash.....you get the picture. I can handle one night here and there but not weekly and not for extended stays. Don't expect great service for dinner or the lobby lounge (unless you are lucky to have Gabi wait on you...she is fabulous and goes the exttra mile for her guests). The other waiters and bartenders look at you like you are from outer space...not sure why you are there..well gee....I want to get a bite or something to drink...they will walk by the table multiple times until you are forced to stand at the bar to order. Frankly the only reason I haven't switched before now is Gabi's service...but that isn't enough after this last visit! You can't walk around the hotel area at night....Century Blvd. is a haven for adult shops and XXXX men's clubs....it is simply not safe to be off the hotel grounds at night....especially if you are a solo female. If ur looking for a cheap place to crash before heading to LAX, then try it...if you don't expect much other than a 2-3 star, you won't be too upset. I am off to LA this week again and staying at the Marriott Manhattan Beach. The area is safe and surrounded by shops, markets and many places to dine....within walking distance of the hotel yet still very close to LAX. I am hoping it proves to be in better condition and they actually care about their elite guest members who get that status by being loyal to a brand /property by choosing it over others regardless of price!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about except proxmity to LAX”
Reviews.Author: scl44
Reviews.Content: We were slightly disappointed with the Westin LAX. We have been pleased with the Westin chain as providing luxurious accommodation, but this hotel is average at best. The two highlights are the proximity to LAX - the shuttles come early and often - and a beautiful lobby and bar area. The rooms are your standard hotel fare, but the bathrooms are in need of a visit from Extreme Makeover - Bathroom Edition. Much like the facade of the hotel, nothing in the bathrooms has changed since the Rolling Stones embarked on their first tour. But, the Westin is not alone in the area, as the surrounding hotels also show nostalgia for yesteryear. We should not complain, though - the priceline rate was excellent, and the location made the early wake-up call for a flight out of LAX much more tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SixAlpha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin LAX for two nights because we needed something close to the airport. Their free airport shuttle worked great for us, and we could walk right next door to Thrifty to pick up our rental car, therefore not having to pay for parking! Despite the hotel being busy with conventions we received great service from the front desk, the bellmen and shuttle drivers, and we received our wake-up call exactly when we requested it. We had two rooms, one on the eighth floor, one on the eleventh - both rooms faced the street. We could hear airplanes, but not loud enough to lose sleep over. Then again, I love airplanes so I could sit there and watch them land for hours! I briefly heard the dogs barking that other people have mentioned, but only faintly. The room itself was typical Westin with all of the standard amenities, although with two (very comfortable!) Queen beds I thought the room was a bit small. Functionally everything in the room worked great. Cosmetically the room was very clean, although the door to the minibar cabinet didn't open properly because it was only hanging on by one hinge. I also noticed one electrical outlet that was starting to come loose from the wall. Everything in the bathroom was great and all of the plumbing worked fine. Breakfast at Westin hotels is normally expensive, so we hit one of the fast food places down the street - an easy walk. Century Blvd. is busy, but the Westin has a stop light with a crosswalk so you can easily and safely cross the street. The swimming pool looked very clean, and we used the hot tub which was also clean and seemed to work fine. Never made use of the workout room. Overall, this was a very convenient airport hotel. If given the choice, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nasty restaurant/old yucky room/never again!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSweetie
Reviews.Content: I cant believe this hotel is consider a 4 star!.. I would say more like 2.5. Lets's see... The restaurant downstairs has terrible AND very expensive food, the room was old, dirty carpet, view of a roof, the pool and spa water looked like it had not been clean in forever, the bubbles in the spa DID NOT work! but I must say the concierge mexican guys were AWESOME! very friendly, helpfull and totally went out of their way to help me out. I forgot to mention, the hotel charged me an extra $212 for god knows what ( my bank will take erase the charges) but still very inconvinient to deal with. Basically, I will never stay here again and would not recommend to anyone, unless u must stay near airport. Otherwise spend the money and stay in Santa Monica or Manhattan Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: amysa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night enroute to San Diego, booked through priceline (92/night +tax). Huge savings, considering the room was going for more than 200 the night we stayed there. The good and the bad: GOOD - the hotel was close to the airport, shuttle arrived few minutes after we arrived at bus waiting area. Westin does not have an airport phone service (where you can call for pick up from the airport), we just went directly to waiting area to see how long pickup will take (3mins). Check in was a breeze, we booked through priceline and our reservation was quickly located. Room preference (king sized bed) was noted. There is an on-site mini-mart to purchase necessities (water!), Restaurant was alright, clam chowder not too bad. Lobby impressive. Bed alright, but personally prefer the marriott beds better. In-room coffee maker great, iron provided, in-room safety deposit. Room internet fast but with flat rate charge. BAD - The room was NOT CLEANED PROPERLY prior to our arrival. There were chips scattered in the room cabinet along with 2 opened bags of chips that were left behind by the previous occupants. Goodness knows how long theyve been kept there, sure to attract BUGS. However, we did not see any bugs in the roomduring our stay. Amenities were basic - shampoo, soap, lotion. Expected more from a FOUR STAR hotel. There was a huge chaise lounge in the room, did not look clean at all, with suede cover askewed and a greenish moss color. Local calls are charged 7.25 first minute! We asked concierge for nearby restaurants, and we were informed there wasnt any nearby. We tried to go to Santa Monica for dinner and asked concierge re transportation. No cabs, they said, and offered to take us there for $40.00 EACH WAY. We just decided to eat at the hotel restaurant, only to see PIZZA HUT AND TACO BELL across the road from the hotel restaurant! We were already seated and did not relish crossing the highway, so we just stayed put and enjoyed our meal. Overall, will not come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: ace678
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel, where we stayed for 5 nights on Priceline at a good price. Priceline gives it 4 stars and I would definitely agree. It is a quality establishment and our room was quite good. Only drawbacks were burned out buttons in the elevators, one broken lamp in our room and the $17 daily parking fee. Also make sure they clearly explain the procedure for getting in and out of the parking garage as its somewhat complex and unusual. Overall staying here was a pleasant experience and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catherine19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the westin for 1 night at the start of our holiday and i night at the end as it was so close to the airport. We took a taxi to the hotel (minimum charge of $20) but there is a free hotel shuttle, which we used on the return journey. They stop at the hotel every 20 mins. The hotel lobby was spacious with a pleasant atmosphere. Staff on the front desk were friendly and polite. They gave us complimentary breakfast vouchers even though we paid for room only.
