Our room on the first night was on floor 5 and we could hear no airport noise. The other night we had a room on floor 11 and we could hear and see the planes taking off. This didn't bother us though, after all it is a airport hotel. Both rooms were spacious and clean. The bed was amazing and so were the pillows! Bathrooms had lovely toiletries, soft towels and a robe. We ordered room service one night, it arrived quickly and was really good value. The breakfast buffet was good and there were other breakfast options too. Overall: A great airport hotel, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: Antikis
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and 12 year old son stayed one night at the Westin at LAX. We arrived early in the evening after a looong flight from Europe and had a very early flight the next morning so needed a place to crash. It took a little bit long before the shuttle picked us up (45 min, and not the max 20 min. as promised). Check inn went smoothly and the room was quite large , 2 double beds. THESE BEDS...... they wrote about "Heavenly" beds! Well, i know what they mean now! It was amazing, firm but soft and the blanket was a dream. Try the heavenly Westin beds!

Reviews.Title: “Is this a Westin?”
Reviews.Author: ShaunMc
Reviews.Content: maybe i was expecting a bit more from a Westin but i did not expect the shabby condition of the room. Wet carpet, musty smell, missing tiles in the shower, dirty filthy room glad i used points and not cash. Only saving grace was the bellman who put us in touch with an excellent driver otherwise very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad... not a "Westin"”
Reviews.Author: HaveWallyWillTravel
Reviews.Content: The Westin LAX was definitely an airport hotel. The hotel has recently gone smoke free but the lobby still does have a smoke smell lingering in it. The rooms were big, yet a little dark and musty smelling. (At least mine was). I would not say this was a bad hotel, and if you book on priceline you’re getting what you pay for (a clean, safe place to sleep…. not quite “Westin” quality). Had I paid 200-300/night for this hotel I would have been disappointed. Great location, and reasonable parking for the LAX area… $17/night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful. Wish I Could Have Stayed Longer”
Reviews.Author: BHL
Reviews.Content: I used Hotwire for the first time and ended up at the Westin for $95 for one night. I needed a hotel close to home as I was moving out but not flying out unti the next day. Hotwire rated it as a 3.5 star property, but I feel comfortable giving it four. My check-in was smooth and easy, and my room on the 8th floor was large, spotless, and extremely comfortable. After a long day of packing and dealing with movers in a rapidly emptying condo, the well-appointed room was a godsend. I had a king-sized "heavenly" bed that was aptly named. The bathroom was full of fluffy, oversized towels and complimentary toiletries. The desk/table workstation was oversized and more than adequate. My only complaints were the $17 parking fee, and the fact that when I called the help line they couldn't tell me how much it cost for internet access at the business center. Otherwise, I was more than pleased. Because I was only there one night I didn't use any of the amenities beyond buying a newspaper at the gift shop, but just based on my room and my experience with the staff, I would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for stop-overs and short trips. Great business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: asianphilosopher
Reviews.Content: I did not choose this hotel by choice "per se". Using Priceline, you are obligated to stay at the hotel they select if you "bid your own price". DATE OF STAY: - December 26, 2006 PRICE: - Our price was very good ($93 USD including all taxes, $75 pre-tax/fees). CONCIERGE: - Very helpful and friendly. I arrived at the hotel around noon and was able to check-in right away. The concierge agreed to watch over my car in the main entrance area so that I could freshen up for about 30 minutes. Service was friendly and they made the specific effort to remember my name so they could greet me courteously upon my return. FRONT DESK: - Very helpful and friendly. They were able to check me into a room despite my early arrival. FIRST IMPRESSIONS: - Lobby was very modern and contemporary. Reminded me of a high-end office complex foyer/lobby. There was a café in the lobby area where you could surf the internet for a $15 fee. - Elevators were clean and modern. HOTEL ROOM: - Clean, spaciously and well-equipped. - Free Starbucks coffee packs available with the in-suite coffee maker. - Decent toiletries. - Television with pay-per-view capability PARKING: - You could opt for valet or self-parking. I chose to self-park. The parkade is adjacent to the hotel and connected to the lobby. It was well-lit. FACILITIES: - I did not explore the hotel swimming pool. My hotel room overlooked the pool and the LAX airport in the distance. Aircraft noise was not a concern. OVERALL: - I would stay here again for the convenient location and high calibre of facilities. If you want a romantic hotel, this is not it. This is an ideal business hotel for the busy traveller who wants good service and no nonsense. Booking over Priceline yielded very good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Westin @ LAX PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: GhatTravels
Reviews.Content: Overview: It is very close to the LAX airport. The hotel provides a free shuttle from and to the airport or you can take a cab for $10.00. Hotel: This hotel meets the high expectations of a Westin Property. I was stuck in LAX on my way back from New York and we had to stay the night in LA in order to catch the next flight the following morning. American Airlines gave me a list of hotels that I could stay at with the distressed passenger rate. Hilton was at the top choice until I saw a shuttle that read Westin LAX. I immediately called the Westin Central reservations number I had in my Palm Treo and asked to speak with the front desk at the Westin LAX. First I asked them if they had availability, they did, and he quoted me the rate of $129. Normally this would have been fine. But the fact that it was 12am and I had to leave in 6 hours to catch my flight I decided to explain my situation and told him that AA gave me a distressed passenger rate at Hilton for $89.99. He had asked me to hold and few moments later I was asked how long I would be there in because they were offering $85 for the night! Westin I tell you! Im sure they had a lot of rooms available, regardless, its the service that I appreciate! I took the first shuttle over. I was greeted with a smile at the front desk and within 10 minutes I was on the Starwood preferred floor in my room under the warm duvet. After I freshened up I went downstairs to the lobby bar for a late night snack. Surprisingly they were still severing food. We ate a pizza and called it a night. The short nights sleep was amazing, a heavy duvet and the air conditioning on full blast. In the morning I helped my self to the Starbucks coffee I brewed in the room's coffee maker and I was off to catch my flight. I am happy I stayed at the Westin, it was beautiful, well kept, the rooms were big, and the staff was amazing. Area: We didnt have time to wonder around the area. But on my cab ride back to the airport I did notice that we right next to the other big name hotel chains, a few fast food restaurants, some adult entertainment venues (LA! LOL), and 5 minutes to the curb side check in for American Airlines. Notes: Stay here if you need a quick stop over at LAX. Always ask the front desk for special rates they may have for the night especially if your only there for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “No way a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Traveller110
Reviews.Content: as most other reviewers got a good price on this hotel on priceline. But the hotel was far from 4 star. You are charged for everything, including parking. No supplies in the room are replinished. The breakfast starts very late, esp. for a airport hotel. And the waiters are adamant about tipping them. The rooms very fine. Location is good, and the shuttle to the airport helped me to get rid of my rental car before time and save $15 for parking at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRinck
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel blindly through a 79 dollar rate on Hotwire and were very pleased with the hotel. We only stayed there one night before an early morning flight out of LAX. We were very happy with the room, the shower, and the bed. Westin pretty much has the Heavenly Beds and the Heavenly Showers down pat. We took the free shuttle to the airport and were not stuck waiting so we were very happy with that, too. For an airport hotel it gave us exactly what we needed. I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yanira
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ the Westin Hotel from June 9-14, and it was a great experience. All the staff members are extremely friendly and pleasant. They were always willing to help, the Restaurant (Charisma) was also great. The food excellent, no complaints at all (I went for breakfast and lunch every day). Rooms very clean, confortable bed and very close to LAX airport. I definitely go back again. I've been in very nice and expensive hotels all over the States, but I have to say that Westin has the best staff ever!!! Keep up the good work! Yanira, Connecticut

Reviews.Title: “An Easy Choice”
Reviews.Author: lindzlou99
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel close to the airport and found a great deal. After staying in another area hotel, we were thrilled with the Westin! Beds were great and shower AMAZING! In an area where a girl may not feel safe, this hotel put me at ease. It was also next door to two car rental places. I only wished they had wireless internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Forced to Stay Overnight in LA, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulNori
Reviews.Content: I was forced to stay over in LA because I missed my connecting flights. Continental had gave me a voucher to stay in Westin LAX. Complimentary shuttle service from the airport is 24/7 every 15 minutes. The check in staff was very professional and nice; And the room was great. Comfortable bed. Just what I expected from a Westin property. Fine dining restaurant in hotel was typically pricey but good service. it cost me $27 (that included tip) for tomato bisque soup and a crab cake appetizer.

Reviews.Title: “What's with the bad reviews?? This was pretty nice....”
Reviews.Author: NODAK1979
Reviews.Content: I paid 65 dollars for this room on a Priceline bid, and it was definitely worth that and more. I saw the negative reviews on this site before I stayed, and I got a bit nervous....but soon I found out there wasn't really any need to be. The positives: - Bed was awesome. - Location was pretty good. - Shower was the best I've had in a hotel. - Lobby was ornate, and it felt 4 star. - Housekeeping did a good job. The negatives?? Well...I can't think of one really. If you're a scared tourist who doesn't like any area that doesn't remind you of the Cleavers, then don't go east on Century Blvd and end up in Inglewood. Personally, it didn't bother us..we ate breakfast there each of our 3 mornings in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: Arriving from Asia after a long flight, I was looking for some needed sleep in the Westin Heavenly Bed. The free shuttle bus pick me up from the airport, it is shared with several other hotels around the area but the Westin is the first drop-off point from the airport. The lobby is a nice open space and quite busy at the time when I arrived. There was a long line at the check-in counter and as I was ready to line up, an employee came around and ask if there is any SPG Gold and Platinum members. There is a special check-in counters for these members on the right that I did not see. It was good to know that I was upgraded to a deluxe room, not sure what that is as I only want a room to rest before my transcontinental flight next morning. The room was a good size and look remarkably like the Westin Horton Plaza in San Diego. The Heavenly Bed is of course as great as usual. The bathroom is stock with the usual Heavenly Bath products that always a good choice in waking me up after a night of rest. The location of the Westin is pretty drab, there are nothing within a walking distance in terms of nice restaurant. So I just stopped by the McDonald and get something to eat. There was no one manning the front-desk the next morning around 5:30AM but the doorman was there to help me and a few other guess to either get a cab or the free shuttle to the airport. With a price of $120/night that I got, this is a pretty good for an airport hotel as good as this.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location to airport”
Reviews.Author: luvabargain
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel at the end of April. The airport shuttle runs every 20 minutes and drops off to a few other hotels, but it's not a bad wait. The hotel is big and has a nice large lobby with all kinds of amenities like a coffee bar, gift shop, restaurant, etc. The restaurant was pricey and we opted not to use it. We actually crossed the busy street at the crosswalk and walked down several blocks to the Denny's. There were some other fast food places so that is an option if you don't mind walking a bit. We did get asked for money and politely declined. The hotel itself was all right. It is a bit tired and could use some updating, especially in the hallways and rooms. Ours was very clean and comfortable, so we had no complaints, but I would say it is a 3 star, not 4 star quality. We used the pool and hot tub area, the kids enjoyed it and we enjoyed the large hot tub. We also took advantage of the weight room, they have an excellent weight room with everything. We didn't have any noise issues while in our room. If I were to pay full rate I would say it wasn't worth it, but for the great priceline rate I got, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel value - but ....”
Reviews.Author: prettybaker
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate from Priceline. Arrived at airport and waited no more than 5 minutes for the shuttle. Check in went fast and easy. Room was great. Never even heard the planes land or take off. Had a nice dinner at the hotel restaurant. BUT - when checked out the hotel charged $2.00 for every phone call made via my pre-paid card. I find this ridiculous, since some of the calls never even made it through. No other hotel I have ever stayed in (not even other Westin hotels) has ever charged for such a thing....

Reviews.Title: “I Would Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: CFNOBIS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before leaving for Florida. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a Terrace Suite. This was because I am a Starwood Prefered Gold member. I also paid for the room with points, so it did not cost me anything. I did have to pay to park my vehicle here during our five day trip. However, it was only $15 a day which is the going rate. This staff was very accomidating. The location was excellant. We took the shuttle to and from the hotel. The hotel does appear to be a little dated but for the price and location, I couldn't complain. When we returned from our trip, we ate at the resturant at the hotel. A bit pricey but the food was good. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: wilson17
Reviews.Content: Aging hotel on Century Blvd very convenient to airport and freeway. Service was friendly and the lobby was nice. A Starwood Gold upgraded room was spacious with a good view, but was too long without renovation. The climate control was only crudely adjustable (fan speed and warmer/cooler adjustment, no temp reading or setting). The bathroom was small with an old shower and no ventilation. I had to prop open the bathroom door to get rid of the steam after a shower. The bed was not firm. The casual restaurant had good service and wines by the glass, but the food was really mediocre. Overall not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: lycheefruit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a layover. We had to wait a long time at the airport for the van to pick us up at the airport, but eventually it came, and the Westin was the first drop-off. Check in was ok and quick, and a bellman took our bags to our room for us. We stayed in a suite that was a corner room near the top of the building. We faced the runway and were on the back of the hotel. The suite had a little terrace with some seating, which was pretty nice, but there wasn't much to look at except some planes landing. The room was pretty clean, but the funiture was a bit frayed (a hole here and there, stains, etc.). The desk area was expansive, but there was no wireless and the internet was about $10 a day. The room did have a lot of windows, which was nice. The bathroom was the standard heavenly bath, but probably hasn't been refurbished in awhile. The bedroom was the same, but the bed was comfortable. I like that the heavenly bed is completely washable. We ate room service, and the food was standard room service prices and quality. Not that great, a bit pricey, but decent. The lobby was large, and there was a ton of conventions/weddings going on. There seemed to be a standard group of travellers eating alone or reading the paper. The biggest minus for me was that behind the hotel was a dog kennel. All night long we could hear dogs barking, especially in the early morning. We did not have our windows open, and we were near the top floor. It was pretty bad. Also, there was a wedding in the courtyard, and we could hear the music pretty late. I guess if you are willing to stand the plane noise, the rest doesn't matter, but for us, the planes were the least bothersome of the three. Also, the bellman took a long time to get our bags upon departure, and the shuttle came infrequently enough that we could not wait for it, so we had to take a cab anyway, which was kind of pricey. Basically, it was a typical Westin (heavenly bed/bath), with adequate service, but it was a bit dated and loud at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice room, pricey extras.”
Reviews.Author: MissAmandaMay
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Westin LAX (have been here for the past 3 days) and thought I might share my thoughts. Having booked through Priceline, I was expecting the typical "you booked through a discount service" treatment that some front desk staffers tend to give (you know, treating you like you're a second-class citizen, giving you the worst room etc) but was pleasantly surprised. The valets were friendly and helped with my luggage (granted, I'm a young, moderately attractive female, which can help in such situations) and as we walked through the expansive lobby the front desk staffers smiled and even waved at my 4 year old son. We checked in easily and were told our luggage would be brought up to our room. The lobby has a lovely fountain with seating and a lounge/bar which looked nice (being alone with a 4 year old I never had cause to use it) We arrived at our room - number 504 - and I held my breath, not sure what I'd find. Entering the room, I was very happy with what I saw - A very good sized room with two queen beds (lots of pillows - usually a good sign) and the far wall was floor to ceiling windows with a view of, well, it's LAX so there are no "fantastic" views possible, but it was facing the courtyard and street. My son thought this was amazing. One little thing; A pet peeve of mine is that windows in massive hotels don't usually open, which means no fresh air for the duration. I know it's for safety, but....Anyway, this room had a small slit window built into the floor to ceiling windows that you could open to get some fresh air. Great! The room itself wasn't spectacular, but it was perfectly nice. Comfy beds with nice, clean plush duvets, an oversized armchair, a large desk and tv stand with an empty fridge for your drinks etc, clean bathroom with constant hot water (a must for me...I like it scalding hot) and great water pressure. Also, the room itself was very spacious for a standard two queen room. No feeling cramped with my sons toys spread everywhere and 3 large suitcases. Most hotels have "better" floors and "better" rooms, so (as is obvious by the varying and conflicting reviews about this hotel) I can't speak for the other rooms in the hotel, but ours was really very nice. No complaints. I DO, however, have a few complaints about the "extras". Yes, this is where hotels really get you. So when getting that great deal on Priceline etc, note this: Valet parkinig costs $24/night! Ouch. It's still pricey for self-park at $15/night. There is internet access in the rooms, but it's $10/day or $5/30 minutes. Ouch again! In room movies are always nice for that late night boredom, but be prepared to spend $14 for one. And finally, there's room service. Wow. The food was decent, and of course they are going to over-charge (all hotels do) but salads are $17-$20, and a burger $17. Don't waste your money. If not for the pricey extras, I'd have given it 5 stars. All in all a good place to stay when near the airport. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: mcr1998
Reviews.Content: Overall the Westin LAX is a typical airport hotel, nothing remarkably bad or good. If you're going to be in LA I would suggest something with a little more flavor. The service was very friendly but the building is starting to wear and could use an upgrade. The wood furniture in my room was particularly worn. Although I had a suite it had no actual table which made room service a bit awkward. During the day there is a dog kennel adjacent to the property. I was very nervous at first as the dogs were a bit loud...but apparently it's more of a doggy day care because by 6:00 they were gone and I was able to sleep very comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern, quiet”
Reviews.Author: AspiringPlanner
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights for a long weekend with my wife. Being an airport hotel, we were worried about the noise. It turned out not to be a problem. The room was clean. The decor in the room was modern. Wall paper peeling a bit in a couple places in the bathroom. Bed was comfy. Sheets were clean. Parking costs money, but that seems par for the course in LA. Fitness room has good, new equipment. Great value - we got it as part of a last minute deal site.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: DaRileyFamily
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Hilton LAX and they did not get our resevation so we spent 30 minutes trying to get a resevation somewhere, then we found the Westin who kindly let us stay there for a night and then the next day we could catch a flight back home to Australia. The Westin was extremly good for an example the room was clean when we arrived and the beds where comfy it just felt like home. I recommend a stay at the Westin LAX if you have a flight then next day or if you just want somewhere where everyone is kind and a place where you can have a decent stay. Returning from the Ritz Carlton in the UK the Westin felt like a place where you could recover from somewhere that was just un free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: iHeartTravel08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for 4 nights over Thanksgiving weekend. I shared a room with 3 other people and still had plenty of space. Although we had an airport view, the rest of the room was great. The beds were big and comfortable. The television was a decent size, and the desk was large (we saved lots of space by using it). The bathroom was bigger than normal, and we always had clean towels. I only had 2 complaints. The pool was closed during our entire stay due to remodeling, and the gift shop was overpriced, like normal. The location was very convenient to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night...”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirlatl
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here on a layover between Atlanta and Tahiti. The rooms are fine--on the small side, but with the great Westin Heavenly beds. Very small bathrooms and a lack of water pressure, but that was not a huge deal for one night. No problems with airport noise at all. We had dinner at the bar downstairs--it offers the standard bar fare, just dressed up a bit. Our meals were somewhat overpriced and not particularly good--not sure how a restaurant can screw up pizza, but it is apparently possible :) Service can a bit surly. Check-out was fine, but the young guy who checked us in at the Starwood preferred desk was plain rude (basically could barely be bothered to speak to us, blatantly ignored a question we asked, etc.). Bar service was semi-polite, though very slow. My advice would be to stay at the Sheraton Gateway instead (we had tried to get in there, but they were all booked). We had a much better night's stay there a few months prior.

Reviews.Title: “Over the hill Westin”
Reviews.Author: slowpitch
Reviews.Content: Property is very tired and needs repair.. My room 835 was not only very beat-up but the bathroom was dirty, no fan, toilet seat un-hinged and door needed replacement.. Carpets shabby and faded. TV had only basic cable.. I'v been in better Super 8's. I know the 4* rating is for the amenities but I can't imagine anyone paying full rack for this dump. I'm a thinking even my rate was high for this place.. I now see why so many bids are won at the Westin... On a positive note, Office staff were nice, the bed was confortable and the free shuttle is 24/7 which I used a couple of times so I didn't have to pay to park my rental.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda' Ehhh...But can't beat the LAX convenience”
Reviews.Author: LeanaD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is looking kind of blah, but it's clean and the location can't be beat if you have an early flight out of LAX. No point risking the LA traffic to make a flight in time! Also, there's an Enterprise booth, which comes in handy if you want to just leave your car there and catch the complementary shuttle to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Details were a disaster”
Reviews.Author: Mrs.Brown.95
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for the Westin LAX. Some things about the hotel were very nice. For example, the towels are fluffy, the shower has two shower heads, the furnishings were sleek, there was a very comfortable chaise lounge in the room. The bed was comfortable as well. The room service was average (nothing to complain about, nothing to rave about) in terms of menu, delivery, presentation, value and taste. But there were so many problems with this hotel that I eventually was laughing every time I found a new one. My room was not well cleaned before I got there. There was garbage in one of the dresser drawers, someone else’s toiletries under the bathroom counter on the floor, and a dirty cup in the bathroom. The internet did not work, even though I spent 20 minutes on the phone with tech support trying to get it to function properly. There was a light in the room with no lightbulb in it. Once I got a lightbulb, the lamp worked until I tried to turn it off. But the lamp was broken and wouldn't turn off, so I crawled around on the floor behind the bed to unplug it. The TV did not work properly: I could not access the pay per view movies and the reception on the tv made it only borderline watchable. There were random tangled cords and plugs in the corners of the room, some plugged in, some not. It looked like an electronics junkyard. I’m sure they would have changed my room had I asked, but by the time I unpacked, settled in and realized all the problems with the room, moving was out of the question. Other details that were ignored in the hotel: when I tried to purchase a bottle of water from the vending machine, the one on my floor wasn’t working. I literally had to go to five different floors to find a working machine. The gym had several pieces of broken equipment and no clean headsets for the televisions. When I checked out, I let them know very nicely about all of these problems. I got a simple "I'm sorry about that" without any offer for compensation of any kind. In a world class hotel, I'd expect a credit towards a future visit, or something beyond a dismissive "sorry" from their front desk. As a hotel that calls itself “world class”, this Westin totally misses the mark.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best ... at LAX”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way to Hawaii. The hotel offered a park/fly package which was excellent value - one night's stay, and seven nights parking. By shopping around we found this for a bargain $135 plus tax. The room had a great view across the airport and was perfectly adequate for our needs. It had Westin's Heavenly beds (very comfortable) and the Westin Heavenly Shower. The shuttle to LAX runs every 20 minutes, and takes under 10 minutes into the airport. If you miss it though, get the Thrifty car rental shuttle - it's right next door to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Okay I suppose”
Reviews.Author: andym430
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in July after arriving from the UK having been travelling all day. The location was very convenient, within minutes of the airport car rental garage. We thought that the parking was expensive (don’t they get their money from the room!), although it does seem to be a good price compared to other places in the area. The room was okay (can’t say better than that) and likewise the pool – not very picturesque being surrounded by concrete walls. Perhaps we were put off by being hot and very tired, and finding a large woodlice on the bed when we arrived! But apart from this, for one night it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, perfect price”
Reviews.Author: Lucas5915
Reviews.Content: We arrived really late and tired on Saturday-evening at 2030hrs in the hotellobby with the quick bus (from LAX only 10 minits). Check in was really quick and comfortable. They had a big party in the lobby, but we were too tired to attend. I was a bit afraid that the noise would carry through the whole hotel, but as soon as we were in the elevators, we could not hear a thing from the (loud) music! Within 3 minits we were in our room. The room was very clean and spacious. We fell asleep immediately in the nice and soft beds, without having any trouble from the nearby airport or the music in the lobby. The next morning I noticed that we had no robes end the safe wasn't working. Because I wanted to have some more information about the parking in the hotel, I walked to the guest-service. I first explained about the robes, they immediately took care of that. Within a few minits my grilfriend had a roommaid at the door, bringing us 2 nice robes and the apologies that they were not there. The safe problem was taken care of by giving me the possibility to put the passports and tickets in a safe-deposit at frontdesk. No extra charges for that. Guest service took all the time to explain about the parking ($15 a day, which is a normal price in LAX area I understand), and the entree of the parking garage was directly at the lobby, so it was easy in and out in the hotel/parking. Friendly Raul was very helpfull to al my questions. He even gave me a map and pointed me out what the perfect route was to do some sightseeing on our own. We followed his intructions, and had a great time in LA! The pre-booking price for a room was only $75 via our travel-agent, and that really was a bargain. Internet in the rooms was not free, but the lobby and the restaurant area had a perfect wifi-connection. And the lobby was so spacious that you could easily find a nice and perfect spot for some internet-activities. So if you are looking for a good, clean, spacious hotelroom, Westin LAX is a right choice!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, better than some reviews”
Reviews.Author: scalderon
Reviews.Content: drawbacks: Yes it is close to LAX but it is still pretty loud Carpeting needs cleaning or replaced Towels not up to Westin standards i.e. small, various sizes etc The good news: BIG rooms comfortable beds (no bedbugs, I checked) also I called prior to coming; they said Orkin had cured the problem staff very friendly and helpful food was excellent overall while not up to Westin standards, still nice for the $79 Priceline price I paid

Reviews.Title: “Really good stay...”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: Quick overnight before an LAX-NRT flight. I'm SPG Gold, and the separate SPG Gold/Plat check-in area wowed me... no line to check in, free Starbucks and newspapers in the morning, and free internet access and printer. Finally... perks for my travel that mean something. Restaurant was acceptable, they happily changed sauces for me on a dish. Bellstand guys were helpful with a couple of minor queries. Gift shop, though, cost them points in my book: four 24cent stamps for $1.49??? I know they outsource these operations, but you can't just abdicate your responsibility- pls fix this. Have stayed at multiple LAX hotels, and this ranks next to the Renaissance Montura for overall niceness. (BTW: Had read the other reviews... my 10th floor room was clean and fresh, no bed bugs!)

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: DallasGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin LAX after returning from a 10-day trip to the Far East. We just needed a hotel near the airport before catching our flight home the next morning, so booked this one on Priceline for about $100. I guess the best way to describe the hotel is "bland." The lobby area is nice, and the rooms have the great Westin "heavenly" beds and bath, but that's about it. They seemed very drab and a bit aged. As airport hotels go, it wasn't too bad, though (but room service sure seemed expensive after our cheap experiences in Asia). We just needed a place to bed down for the night, so we could have saved some cash and stayed at the La Quinta or Holiday Inn. So the hotel is somewhat in-between. If you want a luxurious stay, this isn't the place -- you'd probably be better off at the Sheraton or Hilton, and as a value hotel, it's definitely not that either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoiseBeachBum
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience at this hotel. We got a great deal and had a nice room with a big king bed that was soooo comfy. Room was very clean and I thought seemed updated. I do have a couple gripes though, which I think are typical for LA in general. We had to pay $15/day for parking, and $10/day if you want high-speed internet. Again, probably typical but something to expect. Also...it's RIGHT by the airport so some of the planes are really loud...but we were used to it after the first night and slept through it no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: travellator
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I stayed on a different floor, in a recently renovated room than others, because my stay at the Westin was surprisingly pleasant despite reading the other reviews prior to my arrival. The lobby of this hotel is quite nice, and service at check-in was cordial and efficient. We got a great price on Priceline and was able to get a 2-queen, non-smoking room without problem. Our room didn't have the greatest view (overlooking the pool), but it was large enough for my three family members and I. The beds were extremely comfortable, clean and without bedbugs! A lot of reviewers rave about the Westin's dual shower head and quite honestly, I don't see what the big deal is. If anything, that was the one thing that left me with a question mark during my stay. The shower worked without any problems, but I don't see what makes it so special. The exercise room is a pretty nice set up, with more than enough machines that each have their own personal tvs. There are free weights, mats and other exercise equipment also available in the room. All things considered, it was a great stay for me and my family. I honestly do not see what others have issue with, but perhaps I was fortunate enough not to come across any problems during my stay. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: Velvalee
Reviews.Content: It's the Westin, alright, with Heavenly Beds & Showers, decent sized rooms and all the comforts you expect with Westin. But we had spent the previous 3 nights of our vacation at the Westin Bonaventure downtown and there's no comparison. This version is toned down and very business-like, which is probably appropriate to its location, but for a tourist hotel, the Bonaventure has much more to offer. The price was right ($54/night on priceline), and parking is only $15/night here, compared to $25 downtown. But there is nothing fun or charming in the immediate area except fast food and gas stations--and the airport, of course, conveniently nearby. The rooms are good sized, but very standard. No frills, and the views are downright Dickensian in their grimness. The pool is small and plain--they do have nice teak loungers with cushions, but the cushions are not attached to the chairs and keep sliding off the end...also, the pool area is surrounded by concrete walls and it can get very hot out there. We never could get a drink in the lobby lounge area, although the bar was going at all hours...I didn't really like how it is sort of open to the lobby area ,and is very noisy. Staff was courteous, but not particularly warm. This was true downtown as well. Overall, if you are going to use this hotel as a place to sleep and then be out all day doing your thing, this hotel is clean, comfy, and familiar for the price. But for a couple bucks more a night and an extra $10/day in parking fees, the Westin Bonaventure is much more of a vacationer's hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They really do have bed bugs....”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerUAL
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed at the Westin LAX from July 28th-30th, 2006. I must say that the hotel's exterior and lobby were beautiful. We booked an Executive room with 2 double beds and paid $104/night. We were given a room on the 10th floor (room 1019). I read one review about the bed bugs, but since there was only 1 review about it, I figured maybe it was just that person. My boyfriend came over one night, and kept complaining that he felt like he was getting bit. Then the next morning me, him, and my cousin had these red bumps all over our arms and legs and we were itching like crazy. I have two more complaints and then I'm done. Parking was $15/day and I knew to expect that, but I didn't expect when my boyfriend came over to visit that he would have to pay that also. Finally, I was charged $15 for a movie that I didn't watch, didn't order, and wasn't in my room to see. If you decide to stay here, make sure that you check the mattress, sheets, and pillows for these little red bugs. And check your receipt to make sure that didn't charge you for something you didn't order.

Reviews.Title: “needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: relayer
Reviews.Content: Priceline really needs to downgrade this hotel. I can't believe they consider this hotel a 4-star. It is a 3-star at best. It is old and tired looking, both on the outside and inside. I'm glad it was only $65, because it wasn't worth paying more. The room had many faults including a burnt lampshade, paint missing on the bathroon door, and a dent in the wall. In the hallway, many of the hotel room doors had wood chipping away at the bottom, and the walls were in need of renovation. We were disappointed thinking this was going to be a legit 4-star hotel. A couple positives: the fitness center was very nice and the staff was helpful. We walked up to the Sheraton to have dinner at Shulas and it looked much nicer than the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff and location, but rooms a bit grimy”
Reviews.Author: sanibelcaptiva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Los Angeles Airport last weekend, for one night. I got the best rate directly with the Westin web page, an executive level room for $144. I also had to pay $15 for parking, which didn't bother me too much, as this is LA. The location is great, and the Westin has a very pleasant lobby. There is tons of activity and people everywhere. The staff were all as nice as they can be. But alas, the halls and rooms just seem older and a little dirty. Hard to explain--the beds and linens were fine, it just seemed the carpets, furniture and surface areas were not clean or were old and worn out. The doors seem kind of flimsy and don't fit really tight in the frame. Other than that, the rooms are OK. The hotel seemed safe and secure. Westin has their new fragrance promotion. In the lobby they have these sticks stuck into some scented oils. Pretty strong. I think it's too much, especially if a person is prone to allergies. When I entered my room, it was so perfumey--and housekeeping had opened a window--perhaps to air it out. The hotel was fine if you need to be near the airport. I was glad to just pay $144 per night, but if I had to pay a penny more I would have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Staff ok, hotel needs updating, not to Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: smcg720
Reviews.Content: The staff was fine, though the waiters in the restaurant were just ok; not rude, but not particularly responsive. I asked for hot sauce when my food was delivered, and got it 5 minutes later after the waiter sat more people, took 2 more orders, talked to another waiter, then grabbed the bottle from another table. I could have done that while my eggs were still warm. Food was also not to the level I expect from a Westin. It wasn't bad, just not as good as I think Westin can be (this was more mid level hotel food.) The shuttle service is horrible. While the drivers are nice & helpful, the route is so long that you are waiting a long time. It took me 30 minutes to get from the airport to the Hotel (it's only about 2 miles) You need to plan at least 30 minutes to get back as well since the shuttle also stops as the Holiday Inn & LaQuinta. Not a good first impression to the hotel. The best part of the room was the bed. It looked great. Sheets were a little scratchy, not as soft as I've had in other Westins. Carpeting was badly stained, one closet door was not fully on its track, the in-room safe was closed/locked, the veneer edge of the dresser was broken in a section, the carafe for the coffee was missing its lid, the lights on the alarm clock indicating that the alarm has been set weren't working so I didn't know if it would go off, was getting a lot of noise from the airport...not major problems, (except the carpet which really was disgusting, and the alarm clock which could cause you to miss a flight), but lots of little things that added up to an experience that is not to Westin standards. Good things--the bed looked great, great bath robe, nice towels, soap, Starbucks coffee in room to be brewed, real cream for the coffee (this makes up for the carpet.) Besides the carpet, the place was clean. Loved their treadmills in the exercise room--Lifefitness with attached tvs, much sturdier than I've seen elsewhere. Parking is $15 night/$20 valet. There is a Thrifty car rental right next door, which is convenient, but very busy (30 minutes in line to get a car but that's a different review.) The ARCO gas station at the corner of Century & La Cienega doesn't take credit cards, does seem to sell a lot of booze. Overall, the place is ok, the staff was fine, but if they don't start repairing the rooms, I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!!!!! Room 615”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin at LAX on June 25th 2006, Room 615. I was flying out the next morning to Puerto Vallarta. In the middle of the night I started itching terribly. I could not sleep and finally got up and looked at my legs and midriff in the bathroom. I had bites all over me! I called the front desk and the management came promptly and then called hotel security. We deduced that it must be bed bugs and they took pictures of all the bites. They offered to comp my room service, and that's it! I can't believe that no one from that company has called to extend their apologies, ask questions or offer to credit me my room fee either. To date I was scratching so much that I still have a few marks on my leg above my knee. Stay there at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe worth it at $40”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Slow check in, not enough staff. Costs $15 for self parking each day so add that on your bill if you're driving. Don't know whats up with the young bucks hanging out in the lobbey with the mandatory baseball hats and shirts hanging out. Don't know if they're pimping or servicing. Dudes aren't staying in the rooms from what I can tell, just hanging out at da Westin. Non-smoking room smelt of smoke. Just unpacked and have to air out my clothes as they smell of smoke. Room and furnishing nice enough, bed nice enough, and cleaning o.k. Not good sound proofing. Could hear doors opening and closing all night and any conversation in the passageway could easily be heard in the room.

Reviews.Title: “the best ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: mystic8984
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the westin for 6 days, after reading all the reviews on here I was a bit nervous before we got there. It was amazing!!! Granted the list price is 375 a night for two people which would be awful but we got a really good deal. The beds were as hevenly as they say, the service was awsome and timely. Good food, great people. Internet access. They had starbucks coffee in my room every day. I would recommend it to anyone who gets a good price there

Reviews.Title: “The price was right”
Reviews.Author: FlyStayEat
Reviews.Content: I got this room for $50 using Priceline and it was only for one night, so I didn't put too much thought into the room. We arrived before check-in time after an extremely long 14 hour flight, but the reception person told us there were no rooms available yet. I was so tired and upset and I wondered if we didn't book through Priceline - would a room be available? We did end up getting our room 2 hours early and fell right to sleep. The bed is very nice and comfortable and the chaise in the room is nice too. The carpeting looked worn and ours had a few stains in it. I also noticed some stains in the corridor's carpeting. The bathroom is a little worn - just fine, but not new. The bathroom's door is a big ugly metal door that was dirty and stained. The area the hotel is in is only so-so, so I definately wouldn't recommend the hotel for vacationers to LA - only to those who need a place near the airport to stay. The lobby is nice. We did eat in the restaurant, which was just fine, if not a bit pricey for sandwiches. Didn't use the pool - don't even know where it was.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Westin standards and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Michigander94
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LAX Westin in April, 2006 for one night in a club level room. I have stayed at numerous Westin hotels (and other SPG brands) and this did not live up to the high standard. It was somewhat the worse for wear and staff was less friendly and helpful than expected. An attempt to order roomservice dinner (really overpriced, as usual) resulted in the staff member warning me that there will be a long wait. So I went across the street for Taco Bell (and saved $30). Overall, there are better options at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Leisure_Traveler045
Reviews.Content: In summary - Heavenly Bed was just that - heavenly! Heavenly Bath was nothing special, IMO - nice showerhead, though. Sink was cracked. Noise - muffled sounds of airplanes, not a problem, did not keep me awake at all. I did not hear my neighbors at all. Parking - very convenient, but $15 per day on top of room rates. Easy in/out. Location - close driving distance to most coastal areas, so fine if you don't mind driving to your destinations. Food - OK, typical hotel fare, nothing special. Breakfast buffet was a bit cold. Value - excellent if you get a good price - I paid less than $100 per night and thought that was outstanding value, but at rack rates would not be a great option.

Reviews.Title: “10 minutes to LAX”
Reviews.Author: Graciecc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here the night before flying out of LAX. Booked through Priceline with a bid of $56. That alone makes it a good place. One benefit is that the after hours drop-off for Enterprise is at the Westin, so if you rent from them, you can leave the car in the Westin garage, drop off the keys and you're all set. We just slept and showered here, so I don't have too much to report. We slept well, did not hear noise from planes or the street below (we were on the 4th floor). The shower head was wonderful. The shuttle made a couple of stops, but had us to the terminal in 10 minutes. If LAX weren't so inconvenient to LA's attractions, we would have stayed here for our entire visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but be cautious with luggage...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The westin LAX was a nice place, but beware of the small problems that can add up to a big inconvience when they all add up. First off, I had to wait forever for the shuttle to get me from LAX. It finally came, then it went right past me, even when I flagged it down!! The second time I succeeded in catching the shuttle, but it was really difficult to get the driver to stop for me. He looked confused. I was clearly in the hotel shuttle area so I am not sure what the problem was. Then I arrived at the hotel and checked in ( I was staying with my mother and a family friend),and they had to wait over three hours for our luggage to be brought to the room. they called the front desk several times. The second time they called, they assured them they would have it sent up with the bellhop right away. After waiting over an hour again, they said that the luggage had been waiting to be claimed and no one knew whose luggage it was! "It's a good thing you called" they said. And then when our friend tried to take a shower, the drain was completely plugged, so she called the front desk again. Of course, once again they promised to send someone up right away-and again no one showed up. When they finally did show up to fix it, they didn't even do a good job. I took a shower later and it was still completely plugged. I had to shower in a discusting pool of water at my feet the whole time, racing as fast as I could to get out of the shower before the water level got so high I had to turn it off to prevent overflowing. our friend also made a comment about having to race the drain at such a nice hotel. But they did provide a free pass for breakfast to compensate and that was nice. Our friend was departing to australia and needed to weigh her luggage, and we were told that they had a luggage scale at the concierge desk. Only one problem- there was no concierge! We waited at least 15 minutes before we had to go and get someone ourselves. I know they were really short on staff but honestly. There were people manning the counter at some "preffered" area not doing anything. They knew where the scale was and could have helped us with it but they didn't. But at least they gave us free parking for the inconvience when we checked out. But on the upside, the beds were great and the rooms and lobby were very clean and beautiful. I think they just need more staff maybe?

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: GtownHoya
Reviews.Content: I got a deal through the hotel's web site for $124 including tax, a great deal for a Westin. We just got into LAX from a long overseas trip, so we wanted something close to the airport (we were leaving the next day), comfy and quiet. We got all of that. There aren't many restaurants within walking distance, but there are some fast food places and there's also a restaurant in the hotel. (didn't try that) The pool was closed for renovation even though it said it would be open by time we got there. You could use the pool at the close by Sheraton, but we slept instead. The concierge was very helpful planning our one night in LA. Check was the express kind, so very easy. Definitely will stay here again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: wahp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first night in LA and were very impressed. The hotel is just minutes from LA airport but we didn't hear any noise from the planes although we did hear the traffic which continued all night. Room great, fantastic bed, very clean and welcoming. Parking was $15 per day (self park) Would definitely recommend this hotel. Our booking was made via priceline ($50 plus tax)

Reviews.Title: “What's up with the bad reviews?”
Reviews.Author: JD3
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at the Westin. Check-in was quick and easy. When we got to our room, there was a basket of fresh fruit and bottled water. Everything in the room was in good condition except for the carpet, which had some staining. We did not hear any noise from airplanes. I will agree that the breakfast is not good, especially for what they charge. Either go out, or get coffee and a muffin from the Starbucks located in the lobby.The pool area was being renovated while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Walked away satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Antar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin LAX on March 8th. I'll state upfront that I paid an airline rate of $79, as opposed to the advertised price of $209 -- and that did have a major effect on my overall review of the hotel. We had an easy and pleasant check-in -- all elevators were in working order and arrived promptly. I think I waited 30 seconds for one only once. Our room was clean (bedding, bathroom etc.), but the bedside table was a bit dusty. I could live with that (knowing in advance as to what others experienced, and again, given the price I was paying). The hotel is older and it shows. I definitely have stayed in worse places, but I wouldn't put this hotel on par with the prototypical Westin. Take this into consideration if you're going to bite the bullet and stay here. I was told about the free wireless in the lobby, which I made regular use of. They have a lounge area with plenty of comfortable chairs where you can set up your laptop. The waiters from the ajoining restaurant will come over and take orders from you for anything you want. The Westin Heavenly beds are extremely comfortable and these ones are no exception. I had a great night's sleep. No loud and obnoxious cleaning staff in the hallways, and the arrival of early flights didn't affect my sleep whatsoever. All in all, I walked away satisfied. There are a lot of negative reviews on this hotel, and I was nervous about staying here -- I had some idea of what to expect (not the typical Westin-type quality). I would have given the hotel a poor review if my room was dirty, or if I had received bad service. But I didn't. I can understand why so many people are upset: I would be too, if I paid as much as they did. I probably would have been less generous with my comments if I paid full price.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: wj777
Reviews.Content: We just had one night after a trip from Hawaii. I chose it bacause of the highly touted Heavenly Bed. I thought the rooms were pretty nice however ours smelled of stale smoke. For a smoke free hotel I would have thought the staff would notice. I did have housekeeping spray a deodorizer, with some success. The bed and shower were very nice. I found the lobby and especially lobby bar to be very stark and uninviting. We had a hamburger at the bar and I have to say it was certainly not worth the $12.50 it costs. Overdone and basically overpriced. Also, there was a charge for internet, though by sitting next to the window I could get a strong wireless signal from outside.I would chose one of ther other hotels at the airport next time.

Reviews.Title: “THE worse service by any staff”
Reviews.Author: anniecakes
Reviews.Content: The rooms were what was expected of airport hotel - standard, dull, and barely clean. But what was expected was some decent, not great, service from the dining staff. Paid $20 for breakfast buffet and got the worse dining service of my life. I don't expect the staff to be on their hands and knees serving the customers but I don't expect to get cursed at either. Total lack of service and humanity. The mustached chef in the dining room (I wish I had gotten his name!!) followed me around the buffet bar redoing, reorganizing everything that I touched or got near. And then said some nasty thing when I left the cereal box in heap of boxes that was piling up on the bar. I was so dumbfounded by his total lack of respect and common decency. Westin should focus more on training their staff on being a decent human being first. The front desk wasn't that helpful either but compare to the dining experience, can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommeded”
Reviews.Author: pviverito
Reviews.Content: While on a business trip convention I found the Westin In and their general response to our on line questions terrible. While it should be noted that eventually they did correct some of oiur lodging needs. The estin Chain does not answer e-mail questions. Instead you get a response that tells you to go to another e-mail address. They do not respond when you do send e-mail directly to the hotel. When there I asked for a room with a terrace so I could smoke. They said they had none when they did indeed have some rooms with terraces. Caused countless trips outside to areas that were filthy with bird droppings. The cleaning staff had been cut by 20 percent and towels were not changed. We had to chase cleaning staff to get towels. I would not recommend staying at a Westin Hotel. Their policy is a renewal stay for guests. I renew and relax by smoking and relaxing. Who are they to tell me how to renew or relax. I want to do both based on my needs not their need to social engineer my life style.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, contrary to other reviews”
Reviews.Author: DenL42
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying at the Westin LAX after reading all the horrible reviews, but it turned out to be great. The majority of the people on this site must be used to staying at the Ritz or the Burj al Arab. This is the fourth Westin I've stayed in, and it was just as nice as the other three. The lobby was pretty and spacious, and there was no line to check in. As SPG members, we had access to the 12th floor lounge, where there was free, high-quality bottled water. That probably saved us $20 over the course of four days. There was also free internet access in the lounge. Of course the Heavenly Bed is awesome, as is the Heavenly Shower. As one reviewer noted, it took some time for the water in the sink to come out cold, but it eventually happened - no big deal. And yes, the noise from the jets overhead is loud, but what do you expect when you stay directly in the flight path of one of the world's busiest airports? I actually found the sound comforting, and enjoyed watching the planes come in. Maid service was exceptional; cleanliness was perfect. Parking, yes, it's $15 a night. Normally I wouldn't expect this from an airport hotel, but considering Century Boulevard is about as packed as the Las Vegas Strip with high-rise hotels, it makes sense. You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, I found dried coffee splashed in the bathroom sink. I then realized that only hot water came out of the faucet. I went to get ice to make the hot water drinkable, but I noticed that the ice bucket was half filled with the ice melt of the previous guest. I went to the front desk, and they promised to send the "engineer" to my room. An hour later, he still has not arrived.

Reviews.Title: “On the runway”
Reviews.Author: Bob045
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to the runway and the sound proofing is terrible. Unable to fall asleep because of the constant roar of departing jets, I called around 12:30 AM and was told that the noise would stop between 1 and 1:30 AM and start up again at 5 AM. At 7 AM I was awoken by the construction going on at the pool area under my window.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Great for Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: rothrob
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveller (business and pleasure) I've had my share of ups and downs. My first experience at the Westin LAX was positive enough to merit a second stay. It is true that the hotel is dated in appearance, but it has been some time since ANY new hotels were built in the LAX area. The lobby is large, the lobby bar is pretty run of the mill, and the lobby restaurant is serviceable, if a little overpriced. There is a separate check in/out desk for SPG members offering snacks and beverages while you wait. My room was nice, the furnishings acceptable, the work area spacious and the Heavenly bed very comfortable. It won't show up in Conde Nast anytime soon, but I did get a great nights sleep. I could've done without the second shower head in the Heavenly bath, as it was obviously not intended to be there. Overall, the room and hotel were clean, the service was mostly adequate and sometimes excellent (including early check in.) If you want a convenient, reasonably priced place for a good nights sleep, then this is it. If you are looking for movie star service, stay in Hollywood or Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Not a true Westin, but ok for value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at probably 3 Westin's and this is by far the worst one. I was surprised to find that towels were dirty and the floor was not wiped clean. i think this hotel should be a Four Point. For what you pay for it, it is ok. The hotel lobby was pretty and decent, and the rooms look ok with exception to cleaniness. i think overall, they should fire the housekeeping staff, because the bathroom wasn't clean and they didn't supply you shampoos, which makes you start to question whether the sheets were clean. We had to pay for hotel parking, which was about $14/ night. I recommend spending a little more to stay at the Sheraton Gatway LAX, I had a much better experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin after booking on Priceline for $64. We stayed one night. The location was convenient and the lobby is decent but the service is terrible. We were treated like dirt because we had a priceline reservation. The room we got did not have a working phone, no mini bar, no amenities in the bathroom. I called for towels three times and never received any. The cleaning crew woke us up at 5:30 am with loud shouting down the hall and carts banging against the wall. On the plus side, the beds and pillows were very comfortable and the self parking was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst experiences at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: aviators99
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights that I wish I could have back. We are Starwood Platinum Preferred(r) guests, so one would think that the treatment would be better. Spoke with in-house manager after making the reservations, to make sure she would block off two adjoining rooms (we are traveling with our small children). She blocked off two specific rooms and told me they were nice. Upon arrival, we checked in at the "Platinum and Gold desk", and they promptly told me that they only had a reservation for 1 room. I had to dig out my confirmation numbers and found them, and then it became obvious that they had given the blocked-off rooms away. Eventually they had 2 other rooms for us, but when we got there they were not connecting. I called down to the Platinum and Gold desk and the guy said "Sorry, we don't have any other rooms." He didn't offer any alternatives or anything! I guess he was going to leave me paying for 2 rooms I couldn't use, or force my wife and me to sleep in different rooms... Eventually, I got him to give me his manager who did eventually find us two connecting rooms. That first night continued to be disasterous, as the two rooms he gave us were right outside of the service elevator exit, and the staff was bursting through the doors all night, with the doors banging loudly. They were also laughing and yelling the entire night. Speaking of elevators, only 2 of the 6 guest elevators were "working", and one of them would get stuck on floor 9 about 1 of 3 times using it (had to walk up to floor 12 every time it happened). This elevator situation is a common theme at this property, as we've stayed here 3 times since June (the other problems were not quite as bad). So I would say the average wait time for an elevator was around 25 minutes....I'm *not* exaggerating. The management did change our rooms again after the first night, and the 3rd set of rooms were not outside the service elevator door. But it wasn't until we were in bed that we realized the air conditioning was not working. The kids were already asleep, so we could not call maintenance so we sweated through the night. The next morning I called the manager and she promised to send maintenance up to fix it. 8 hours later, when we returned, it still wasn't working. I called the front desk and they sent someone up right away, and it took him 30 seconds to open a valve that someone must have closed. The maintenance guy told us that it was the first time he was called about it, so the manager obviously never called in the morning. That evening, we ordered room service, and after a long wait, it arrived with the wrong flavor of ice cream. We called down, and they said they would take care of it. 60 minutes later (again, not an exaggeration), no sign of anything. We called again, and they answered with an apology (before even saying hello), and said they were sending up the ice cream right away, "on the house." Not sure what that means, because it was supposed to come with dessert anyway and we already paid for it. 40 minutes later (not an exaggeration), the phone rang, and they informed us that they did not have that flavor of ice cream. The next morning, we were awoken at 7am by screaming, laughing housekeepers right outside the door. I've been staying at Starwood hotels exclusively since 1988. I've seen a steady decrease in quality, but this was the topper.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Entry..small pool”
Reviews.Author: teisterschoice
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and average in size. The noise is appearant but not over the top. You can hear the planes till about 11pm and then strat up again about 7/8am. The pool is ok, not as beautiful as one might expect give the luxurious entry to the hotel. I highly reccoment the room service, nice omlettes and someone who payed attention at culinary school.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're getting a Great deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got a room here for $65 a night on Priceline, and that's the only reason I wasn't soo dissapointed. The beds are nice, Westin style, but: -got mini-fridge key, and no mini-fridge -no fan in bathroom -lighting was bad in bathroom -bulb missing from a lamp in room -stains on ceiling (blue silly string!!) -poorly ventilated room -very noisy AC -amenities missing, only shampoo provided -got charged for local calls But it seems that all the hotels around LAX are pretty dumpy, so I'm still glad I stayed at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: STAY HERE! I booked a reservation at another hotel in the area and later changed my mind and decided to book at the Westin. I read the other reviews regarding the Westin and decided to give it a try. I must say that I am very glad I did. I am not one for super fancy hotels, but I like clean, comfortable places that have a few extra amenities. The Westin has earned my repeat business in the future. The "Heavenly" products including bed and bath were truly an extra touch. Comfortable beds, clean bathrooms, and excellent service made my stay here amazing. The health club has real health club quality equipment including LifeFitness treadmills, cross-trainers and weight equipment. It was clean and well maintained. The service from the staff was excellent including the housekeeping and the front desk staff. Parking was easy and the airport shuttle was convenient. It is located near a few fast food restaurants, however there are not many other entertainment spots in the area. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone....I will return in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Great (with a discounted rate)!!”
Reviews.Author: Bianca_b
Reviews.Content: We were in LA during the week for a memorial service. We stayed at the Westin for two nights. The Westin LAX is a large hotel with an enormous lobby. There were several meeting rooms and a lot of energy - lots of people coming and going. Everything was very nice about it - but it was dated in that early eighties sort of way. The floors with the rooms had long, confusing hallways - kind of reminded me of a murder mystery the first few times I attempted to find our room. We were a little disappointed with our first room, it was stuffy with no air circulation and an irritating moldy smell. We called the front desk and asked if we could change rooms - they were very accommodating and the manager even explained that the hotel was "dated" - not as an apology, but as a matter of fact. Our second room was fine, dated, but fine - nice bed - a unique view of the airport runway and parking deck. It was very spacious. It certainly wasn't entirely up to the standard of Westin, nothing incredible - but okay. We purchased our room at a discounted rate through Priceline - the Westin LAX is nothing that I would pay full price for - but certainly would be my first choice at a discounted rate through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne55
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here on the last Saturday in August. We checked in fairly late (around 11pm) and checked out early (8:30am) to catch our flight home, so we didn’t really have a chance to look around much. Parking was a bit overpriced ($15), but the location is great if you’re flying out of LAX the next day. Our room was very nice and for the price ($70 on Hotwire), it couldn’t be beat. Details: Our 8th floor room was spacious and clean with beautiful modern furnishings. The cushy chaise lounge chair was lovely and the king sized bed was to die for! We slept SO soundly on the soft mattress, snuggled between luxurious sheets and soft warm blankets. (Maybe we were just tired from the long day, but I don’t remember hearing a single noise from outside or next door, as others have complained about.) The bathroom was also super clean and modern, with a double shower head to make for a wonderful showering experience! The lobby was very pretty. Parking structure was fine. Front desk clerk at check-in was like a robot, but not rude. Check-out was fast and easy. I’d highly recommend this hotel to anyone flying in or out of L.A. if you find a good rate (might not be worth $200 though).

Reviews.Title: “Suuucked, even with the two free nights comped”
Reviews.Author: nosescott
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work and play and use this site for both writing and reading reviews. I've seen a steady decline of SPG properties and this was no exception. My GF flew in for work and decided to stay there for the beds (as usual with the Heavenly Beds). She pays for her travel for work so she was looking for a deal. We found it online but had issues with the SPG Best Rate promise (I won't go into the long, hellish details of all the screw ups, just mention them). Then, when she checked in, they had to call me to verify random minutia about me and my SPG account. Once in, the internet didn't work. New room. Wrong layout (2 double beds). Then, she opted to stay two extra days and we booked online. No worries there so far. While there, the Best Rate promise and the issue of her checking in and them calling me wasn't resolved so I flew out from Phoenix to do a face to face. NO ONE returned our calls until i was leaving the next day. I did speak with someone in corporate and we seemed to have fixed most of the screw ups (but why didn't someone from the property call the room?) So, I get on the plane and my GF has to switch rooms (why? no one ever told us that with a new rezzy we needed to move not simply stay in the room). I get a frantic call that I need to fax over my credit card and DL to the property (despite them knowing I was in, speaking to corporate and the front desk manager) when they already had the card on file for the four days she was there. I was on a TV commercial shoot and had to rush all over to get this done. Then, the room issues popped up again. Wrong room, wrong rates, it was all one big Ef Up. Ultimately, the comped the last two nights which saved her over $200 but that was not the point. Freebees don't fix the customer service issues, they simply band-aid the grievance. Never once did they admit any fault in any clerical missteps, nor did ANYONE (aside from the last day) in management contact us to fix this. We had more help from the great bellman and valet guys (I think it helped that the GF is pretty even for LA women). Westin and SPG better get on the ball and start polish the turd the call the SPG Brand or else they'll be just another bad corporate brand in this parity category. meaning, no one will give a crap about them and it'll be like a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable when you get a huge discount deal”
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonian
Reviews.Content: The reason I'm labelling this hotel "average" is because I got a $70 deal on hotwire and because the staff, unlike many LA Airport officials, treated me like a human being. The idea of paying the rackrate would have been absolutely ridiculous. It's an ok place for an overnight stay -- and, against my expectations, the shuttle was prompt and efficient, the receptionist (I think she was German and her name was Daniella -- give her a pay rise, Westin!) was welcoming, friendly and professional. The room was dowdy and the lounger was saggy, but the bed was comfortable and clean; the bathroom was a bit mouldy and at first only boiling hot water managed to come out of the taps but upon letting it run for a few minutes it got cold. When I rang up to report this problem, the reply was efficient, helpful and again, yes, friendly. The pool area was very uninviting -- in the afternoon a crowd was hanging out and making it pretty clear that this was their space. When I went for a swim early in the morning the pool area hadn't been cleaned up, discarded towels everywhere, and, much worse, glasses just sitting on the side of the pool -- very dangerous. When I left in the morning the shuttle was again on time and efficient. Didn't use the restaurant. Room service was ok and friendly. My wake up call came on time. Considering the overall lousy quality of LAX hotels I would probably stay there again if I got a similar deal -- this could have been a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: langtry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (08/09) before our long-haul early morning flight home - it turned out to be one LONG night for me! The room was nice enough and the beds clean and comfortable - can't complain about the bathroom either and there was a small decked area with a hot-tub which we didn't use. We ate dinner in the restaurant downstairs, food very nice - bit pricey but nice, however, the service was terrible. The waiters seemed old and slow, he forgot to bring the drinks we had ordered and I noticed a guest at a nearby table sending his meal back because it was incorrect - we thought it was quite funny and just had a laugh about it because it was so un-typical of the service we had gotten used to in the U.S But the worst was yet to come! Our room was located on the same floor as the health-suite and obviously akin to it separated by very thin walls. We went to bed at about 9.30pm as we had to get up early to catch the flight and had 2 kids under 8yrs old to organise but I felt like I never slept a wink. We could hear people pounding on the treadmills until 2am and it was so loud I felt they must be in the same room, there was a bit of a lull for a few hours and then it stared up again before 5am. During the 'lull' from the noisy gym the corridors outside our room (which was on the corner of the intersection and near the lifts) filled up with loud, noisy people who sounded like they were returning from an interesting evening at the bar or some party. Cigarette smoke filitered into our room from the corridors outside and I heard a full-scale jokey conversation about how - 'you shouldn't be smoking up here'. By this stage I was frustrated, tired and thinking about how I was going to survive the 13hr plane journey home without having slept the night before. I think I managed short intervals of 15-20mins sleep somewhere in that nightmare night. My only consulation was that I got the room for $88 on hotwire (I thought an airport hotel is an airport hotel -can't be that bad) but to be honest would have rather paid more and got some sleep! Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Bed - Hellish hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmavendiva
Reviews.Content: The last stay was my second stay at this property due to an early morning flight. The first stay, 9 months earlier should have been the last. That first time there were three conventions at the hotel (which is quite large). I had worked a 14 hour day prior to leaving on a 7AM flight. I was awakened at about 4AM by 20 howling teenagers in the process of affixing sanitary products and toilet paper to the door of an adjacent room. By the time I contacted security and was thoroughly awake (and upset, tired and grouchy) I just packed it in and went to the airport earlier than planned. Stupidly I booked a second stay there in March, again a very early flight, but I had enough Starwood points to make it worth taking a second chance. Upon check in I inquired about conventions etc. and specifically asked to be placed away from an elevator and on a high floor on the quieter side of the building. I then found out that the hotel was hosting a few hundred (at least, maybe more) tap dancing teenagers in a massive dance student competition. Then I saw them (they were everywhere and this was about 10:30 at night)....Fortunately I told my tale of previous woe to the desk clerk and I was accomodated with a room in the 'Starwood Preferred' part of the building....told that only kids with parents were in that part of the hotel. Needless to say, there seemed to be a crowd in the next room enjoying themselves well into the night. The rooms which once might have had some promise, are tired and show a lot of wear. Things are broken or partially broken or missing parts...like the coffee maker, and I didn't feel that things were fresh, pristine, clean. Stains on furniture and carpet should just not be something a hotel guest at any price level should need to deal with. The bathrooms are kind of scummy and worn, as well. Given Westins advertising as an upscale property, this one does not live up to expectations.
