Reviews.Title: “It did the job”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We flew into LA from London, arriving late and had just one whole day in LA, leaving early the following day so an airport hotel was perfect for our needs. I was a little dubious following some of the reviews on this site but the hotel did the job - it was an airport hotel, clean, comfortable (particularly the beds) and exactly what we'd paid for. Yes, we heard the dogs in the kennels and if you listened you heard the odd aircraft but in no way did these keep us awake. The most disturbance came from other guests who were a bit noisy on walking past the room. The breakfast buffet was good and the waiter at breakfast was incredibly helpful. I would definitely stay here again. If you're a light sleeper and you don't want to be disturbed by noise then I suggest you don't book an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value -- if you get deeply discounted rates ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed near the airport on a recent weekend trip to Los Angeles because LAX was convenient to my West LA destination and because I got a deeply discounted rate using an online service. The hotel was clean, comfortable, and relatively quiet for an airport hotel. The staff were helpful and attentive. As expected, the restaurant was extremely overpriced and mediocre at best. Especially if you get a discounted rate, I recommend this hotel if you must stay at or near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever!”
Reviews.Author: anniecakes
Reviews.Content: Considering how highly Westin regards itself as a luxury hotel chain, I was highly and terribly horrified and insulted by their service. Mainly the chef/server at their restaurant. I paid outragous amount to eat breakfast there to have a chef curse at me. The buffet breakfast had a cereal stand with boxes of small cereals. After emptying out content into a bowl, there was no garbage can nearby so I left the box where everyone else seemed to have left it. All of certain, the chef comes right next to me, snatches up the box with such force that it was very insulting. And if that wasn't enough he murmured something quite nasty while walking away. He then follows me around reorganizing everything that I touched. I'm a considerate individual who rarely has any run-ins with anyone. If the chef had a bad start in the morning, he shouldn't have let it out on the customers. You would except some kind of quality service and quality staff working at places like Westin. I have stayed a countless hotels, and this was the worse service ever!

Reviews.Title: “The Westin is as heavenly as their beds.”
Reviews.Author: corky2112
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had been travelling without sleep for 48 hours so were prime candidates for being disgruntled guests. However, the check-in was swift and all our requests catered for in a pleasant manner. The front desk employees continued to go beyond the call of duty whenever we needed help. The room was on the 10th floor with twin queen sized beds and immaculately clean and crisp white bedlinen. The hotel is conveniently located to hire car outlets and is close to the airport but is so quiet. I would not hesitate to recommend this establishment to other guests and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Let-Down for Westin”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie808
Reviews.Content: Compared to other Westins, this one is lacking. The room was just okay, nothing to write home about. The Heavenly bed was not bad for a hotel bed, but don't count on it to give you a good nights sleep if your room is facing the airport runway. This is the only time I would ever request a room facing the main thoroughfare. We are pretty heavy sleepers, so it wasn't too much of an issue, but I can see how others may be irate. The maid hadn't serviced our room on the first day by 5PM, so we just told her not to do it because we wanted access to the room at that time. There is Wi Fi access in the hotel lobby, which is nice. The pool is just okay...I wouldn't spend too much time there because the crowd looked pretty scary. Room service was quick but mediocre and expensive. The hotel restaurant isn't the greatest either...plan on eating out of the hotel if possible. The free airport shuttle is a nice touch, though. For a one or two night stay, it'll do, but for anything longer, try something better than the Westin LAX.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment, not like other Westin Hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the fourth time staying in this hotel, rooms were stuffy, staff is not present at the front desk at check in, unacceptable for a Westin. I won't go back. The first room I checked into (after waiting 45 mins trying to check in) had a broken air conditioner, it was almost 90 outside and just as hot inside. Stains present on furniture in "recently remodeled" rooms and smells of stale cigarettes. I can't compare any other Westin hotel to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stopover Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin LAX after a flight from NZ. I had to catch a morning flight to NYC the next day so it seemed a good option because of the price and free shuttle. As I exited the airport the shuttle happened to be waiting so I got lucky and was able to head directly to the hotel. Very clean and airy lobby. I was checked in quickly and efficently. The room was clean and had a view of the airport runways. Heavenly bed was great. Lots of amennities, towels, etc. Only two drawbacks were early morning flights that were departing directly over the hotel. Woke me up a few times, but I was the one that requested the room on the airport side because I love planes. Not the fault of the hotel. The second problem was when I discovered I left my toothbrush in NZ. Took a few calls before brush and paste were brought to my room. Staff apologized so no worries. Overall, a great hotel to stay at if catching a flight at LAX. A bit far from attractions so I wouldn't recommend it if staying in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in April of 2005. Hotel was nice and clean...but nothing special. But I had no compaint since I only paid about $65.00 per night through hotwire. They do charge you $15.00 per day parking fee, if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel for 90 us 4 people...is the best deal in town.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel at the Airport?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you call the Westin, they claim to be the best hotel at the airport. Well, that much is true. I have stayed at almost every Los Angeles Airport Hotel. The Westin does have them all beat with the Heavenly Bed. I got in really late from a flight and I didn't feel like driving. I stopped in and they had a new desk for their Gold and Platinum members. There was no line and they treated me like I was a celebrity. I even got an upgrade to a room with a great city view. I am not sure if I was really tired or if it really was just the best sleep of my life. I was out early in the morning, but before I left I received my favorite newspaper.

Reviews.Title: “Very so-so”
Reviews.Author: lalimama
Reviews.Content: The hotel is sprawling and lacks character. In addition, although we requested a non-smoking room with double beds, apparently that got translated into a smoking king. (We were able to transfer to a smoking double). If you're not used to smoking rooms, the particles in the air are really distracting and by the end of it, you sound like a two-packer yourself. Toiletries, everything mediocre. I had a much better experience at the Crowne Plaza LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: AuntJuJu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin LAX on February 12th before our flight the next morning. This was the worst Westin I have ever seen. The room was filthy. There was a big orange stain on the duvet cover on their "Heavenly Bed". It wasn't heavenly at all. The room was very dusty with stains on the table top. The bathroom was pretty gross with other people's hairs (from all parts of the body) on the floor, tub and counter top. I can't even begin to describe the smell in the room either. Let's just say, we checked out very very early eventhough our flight was not till noon.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I personally loved my room, one of the nicer hotels I've stayed at. However, the room you get very much depends on how you book it. Since I was traveling on business, I booked my reservation through our corporate travel agent and paid $150 a night -- got a room in the 8th floor, with nice Heavenly bath products, dual showerhead, furniture, a bathrobe, and starbucks coffee in the room. My sister, who was staying for the same weekend, booked through Hotwire and got a discount rate of $75. She was stuck in a smoking room on the 4th floor (though requested non-smoking) that smelled pretty bad, worse bath products (generic conditioning shampoo only), single showerhead, and generic coffee. Is it worth it to pay more for a better room? In my case, I think so (mostly 'cause my company's paying for it ;) ). If you find yourself being assigned to fifth floor or below, try to request one of the upper floors if they have it.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude staff, no help from manager”
Reviews.Author: newyorkanya
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was perfectly nice looking and the food in the restaurant was good but our visit was plagued by a series of mishaps. We waited for the shuttle bus from the airport for 45 minutes and when we called the hotel they said we should just wait--didn't offer to check on the bus or anything. Then we were put in a room with no towels in the bathroom and a lamp that didn't work. The worst came after I left my purse in the restaurant overnight. At 6am, I called downstairs and they said they couldn't find it. I went down and found it myself under the table where we had sat the night before. My wallet was there and credit cards also but about $300 was missing. I waited ages for the security guard and when I told him what happened he said it must have been a hotel guest, could not have been staff. When I pointed out that we were the last dinner guests out that night so that in fact cleaning staff would have had more of a chance than a guest to dive under the table and find my purse he refused to investigate and told me I should call LAPD myself. We had a flight to catch and when my husband began to argue with him, he told us to leave the premises and that if we didn't, he would call the police. I immediately faxed and emailed a letter to the hotel's general manager and received an acknowledgement but have not had any other response, let alone an apology or explanation--that was two months ago.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: casey0995
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel. We stayed there recently, one night Jan 6th and one night Jan 20th. What I don't understand though is the different levels of rooms. For example, the first night, we got a room on the 3rd floor and my brother and wife got a room on the 6th floor. Their room had dual showerheads and nice heavenly bath soaps while our room had a single showerhead and Virginia's Garden soaps. We paid the same price. The second time we stayed, we were given a room on the 4th floor and my brother a room on the 7th floor. We both asked for upper rooms with run way views (we both love to watch the planes) and non-smoking. After seeing that our room did not have a runway view, we requested a room change and then was given a room that had a view of a big palm tree on the 5th floor. We changed rooms again, and got a smoking room 4th floor... one more change and finally had a room on the 7th floor with a runway view, just like my brother was given right away. In the rooms on the 7th floor, we had Starbuck's coffee which the lower rooms did not have, also extra pillows on the bed. The hotel was nice, but don't understand why we had a run around to get the room we wanted when we both paid the same price and the reservation was together. It was noisy when the planes took off in a certain direction, but since I love watching them, I didn't mind at all.

Reviews.Title: “Ho-Hum”
Reviews.Author: 1JetSetGal1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin the night before our early morning flight. We were supposedly upgraded to a corner room because of our SPG gold status. We arrived at the room and it was very bland, and there was only one robe in the room. Our corner room seemed to give us a terrible echo of all the planes coming in. We will check out the Four Points by Sherarton next time.

Reviews.Title: “Less than average for this standard”
Reviews.Author: Clod13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Nov 8-20, on business. Location was perfect for my company, it's less than perfect if you stay on leisure. But it's not the location I challenge. It's the attitude, the missing service. I'm a Silver Starwood Preferred Guest and that's were they accommodated me, the SPG level. Don't get excited about it. Everything is only average. Especially room services. Bathroom amenities like shampoo, conditioner were only replaced/refilled every 2nd day. I only got body wash the last day, thankfully I had good old-fashioned soap. I was only given a bathrobe after 3 days. Used glasses were left dirty or only replaced after several days. The complimentary bottle of water some days wasn't replaced. I had to call 3 times to get a flickering bathroom light repared. Similar "little" things happened to me in the restaurant (got the wrong wine), at check-out (never received a copy of my restaurant bill they promised to fax me), the coffee cart (I was once allowed to charge to my room, then never again - so never again did I buy coffee), the concierge (who was very nice but had no idea about price ranges in nearby restaurants). By the way, the noise inside the hotel is worse than the one outside, from the airport. The doors close with a noisy bang which is a lot more annoying than the planes. And it's a very busy hotel, so doors bang often! It's a nice enough hotel which could be much more if someone there cared for the guest. Service is not 4* standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but if you don't ask you don't get”
Reviews.Author: rocketmanHonolulu_HI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Nov. 15-18 and were quite happy. But you've got to ask to be put in a quiet area or you might get a room in the back where there are barking dogs from the nearby residential area. (Happened to us on one stay and we avoided it this time.) Not known for it's food--we're room service junkies--it's adequate but don't order the chicken pesto sandwich whatever you do! We love the heavenly beds and the heavenly showers. We don't make phone calls on hotel phones, ever (reference the fellow from the UK who had the huge bill). And we're there just to sleep. With a rental car it's 5 minutes to Marina Del Ray, 15 min. to Santa Monica, 20 minutes to Beverly Hills, and a few minutes more to Hollywood. It's one of the best airport hotels we know of and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special -- and don't make any phone calls!!”
Reviews.Author: leebob
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in October, for a conference that was being held at the same location (plus, a few extra days on top to explore the city -- since it was my first visit). We had a reasonable greeting by the front desk, and really wanted to stay in a smoking room (which, their website had informed us, was fully booked) -- they were able to accomodate the switch with no problems. The lobby is big, and visually appealing. Corporate casuals are lurking all over the place (it's used as a conference hotel primarily, it seems), and the lobby offers a friendly greeting -- although, it's nothing special. When we got into the room, I was let down. This hotel has a 4-star rating, yet the room is as bland as most 3 stars. Nothing special. Small TV. Dataports (no wireless), a couple of telephones. Poor bathroom with no real air venting... turn the shower on for more than a couple of minutes, and the room turns into a suana -- a pain in the rear when you're sharing your room with a business colleague and can't escape naked into the main room to continue getting dressed! It was clear the room hadn't been fully cleaned upon our first entrance. There was a spare bed folded in the corner, and no toiletries in the room. When I called the desk, they took over an hour to send up someone to give us a few towels and shampoo (although, the cleaners were somewhat friendly when talking to them in the halls). The bed was very comfortable, if you like soft beds. I got some good sleep, which is rare. Overall, the room was very bland and boring. Nothing special at all, and nothing that could distinguish it from a million other hotels. I didn't like spending a lot of time in the room, it really felt like I wanted to get out everytime I was in there. The conceirge was moderately helpful, although took 20 minutes to find a certain location of the city. The location is terribly poor for anything other than conferencing... a cab to Hollywood/downtown will cost $50-60 one-way, easily. The food... abysmal. I thought I was paying $13 for a chicken sandwich (according to their menu). After tax and a ridiculous service fee, and being charged for a salad when it was listed as being apart of the meal, I paid $27... more than double. And the taste? Awful. McDonalds serve better, for $4. The breakfast buffet was probably the best thing -- but $18 for a mediocre choice pushed it OTT (like most of the charges in this hotel). The buffet lunch was very poor -- limited choice @ $25 per plate. Yikes. When I wanted to extend my stay, they gave us conference rates for the additional days, which was nice -- meaning, we got a $30-40 discount per night... very welcomed. But that was soon overshadowed when I received the hotel bill on the final day. I had made several calls to the UK... WOW... $283 for 11 minutes on the phone!!! This, I found to be absolutely ridiculous. I called my girlfriend for 58 seconds on the first night -- that "goodnight" call cost me $47. When I questioned the desk, they told me it was due to AT&T rates... pure BS.. I've called from other hotels and it has been NOTHING like this... $47 for a ONE MINUTE call to the UK??? It's never cheap calling from a hotel, but this was overboard. It's 3 cents a minute with a calling card. I expected maybe a few dollars a minute... not nearly fifty bucks! Overall, if you're going for a conference, it's not a bad hotel. Certainly not worthy of a 4 star rating, though. And if you're going to explore LA or vacation to the city -- forget about it. The location is terrible, unless you want to be right near the airport, and going anywhere in the city will cost you at least $50 each way... there's nothing nearby of interest. I would only re-visit this hotel if forced (i.e. if another conference was being held here that I needed to go to). The prices were outrageous, the rooms were sub-standard for a hotel in this class, and the service was medicore at best -- I expected more!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Snuff - smelly in fact”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room smelled strongly of cigarette smell despite being on a non-smoking floor. In all fairness the bed was nice if you like smushy beds. The showerhead was good. However...the toilet flushed by itself all night long. Parking was $14 - calls using my calling card were $2 each. The hot tub was broken and had boards nailed over it. The pool wasn't very clean. The mini bar was empty. There was only one bath sized towel in my room. The next day when I checked out and complained I was comp'ed the parking, but the desk clerk was not particularly nice - he apologized, but it lacked any sincerity. I agreed with what other guests said about the overall quality of the hotel - definitely not 4 stars - I was disappointed because I had been looking forward to staying at my first Westin. Lauren J. Santa Cruz, CA

Reviews.Title: “I love the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: california_grl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin in September for the first night of our honeymoon. If you have to stay at the LAX airport, consider the Westin! This hotel is really luxurious and such a great value for the price. The beds are so comfortable, you will sleep like a king (or queen). The food we had delivered for our special honeymoon room service was great! Usually I have had bad luck with room service pizza, but their pizza was excellent! They also had champagne and chocolate-dipped strawberries delivered to our room (you have to set that up in advance). We even happened to stay there on the one night of the year when the air was crystal clear and enjoyed a beautiful, golden sunset over the LA skyline. (But don't count on that!)

HotelInfo.Name: The Westin Los Angeles Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 5400 W. Century Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90045
